Subject: three PT forms came back locked after failover, and could not activate
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Testing test run 5574

preconditions
* the system is loaded with 100 authorities (mostly PTs).

Steps (my workstation is ws10cn)
* Create each of the authority forms PT, WT, TOP, XTOP, RTCP-P and RTCP-R 
* STOPSOS both COM servers
* Remove RML file for TOP authority form from COM servers 
* INITSOS both COM servers, when both COM servers in PC complete state.
* Open Forms Summary on Chief and RTC workstation 

Expected
* The Form Summaries listed all authority forms 
* TOP form listed as not locked.

Actual
* The Form Summaries listed all authority forms 
* TOP form listed as not locked, but forms 40, 87 & 94 are locked



messages

@Oct  3 16:40:04 rtc1ocs csbridge: [ID 932016 user.info] REFServer: Corrupted form detected: AuthorityNumber=40; formId=40; checksum : FAILED; storedCheckSum=71427995587038235989753047421624684369; currentCheckSum=209873628870267793921440531487037626758
Oct  3 16:40:05 rtc1ocs csbridge: [ID 900100 user.info] REFServer: Corrupted form detected: AuthorityNumber=87; formId=87; checksum : FAILED; storedCheckSum=3183500540225018163176226552292198433; currentCheckSum=18581016363226328961434701931587006680
Oct  3 16:40:05 rtc1ocs csbridge: [ID 304950 user.info] REFServer: Corrupted form detected: AuthorityNumber=94; formId=95; checksum : FAILED; storedCheckSum=213842669789772317352757336382022700223; currentCheckSum=34526236703885855828790098090913119472@

Subject: TGI config not deselecting filter selection
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1. open TGI config page and click the 'Change Defaults' button
2. under the Display Elements section, in the Train Type row,  uncheck the checkbox labeled 'All, and
and in the newly enabled ComboBox labeled 'Limit Trains to' and select 'A series and 'B series'.
3. click on Submit (returns you to TGI config page)
4. from TGI config page click 'Change Defaults' again
5. re-check the the 'All' checkbox and submit the form
6. click the 'Change Defaults' button again and uncheck the 'All' check box

Expected:
the 'Limit Trains to: comboBox is enabled with no entries selected

Actual:
The previous filter selections of 'A series' and 'B series' are selected, and only one can be deselected;

test case 289 step 46 said to uncheck the check box and resubmit, and the GO, A and B series trains should no longer be displayed; but I couldn't deselect the A trains without making another selection.

also, step 44 and 45 results say that GO trains are no longer displayed, but there are no prior steps to make the TGI show GO trains.

Subject: Addressee Field on TLD not highlighted as Selected
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Make sure to check whether this is really supposed to happen before changing any code...

Steps:

1. Complete 2 TOPs on the same track such that the addressee field below the track shows the addressee of the first TOP with a border around it.
2. initiate a 3rd TOP by clicking the TOP toolbar button, then the addressee field from step 1.

Expected: the addressee field is displayed as selected(see test case 33 step 20

Actual: no change to the addressee field is visible.

the status line on the TLD does indicate the addressee that was "picked up"

Subject: No Close Button on dialog used for addressee selection
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Make sure the system isn't really doing the right thing before changing code(test book might be mistaken)

Steps:
1. complete 2 TOPs on same track so that the addressee field displays with a border indicating there is more than one addressee authorized to be there.
2. initiate a 3rd TOP by clicking the TOP toolbar button and selecting the addressee field from the prior step, selecting limits, and executing...

Expected: 
a. an addressee chooser dialog opens
b. the chooser dialog has a close button
c. (per step 36 of test case 33) when the close button is pressed, the "form closes and the limits are no longer selected"

Actual:
a. a dialog opens listing the authorities associated with the addressees
b. the dialog has an OK button and Cancel button
c. clicking the Cancel button closes the chooser dialog and de-selects the limits
d. clicking the OK button closes the dialog and raises the TOP form with the addressee field pre-populated(limits remain selected for control)

Subject: Addressee Selection of Mismatched Authority Type not displaying error on TLD status line
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Make sure it is not the test case that needs correcting before any code is changed...

Steps:

1. Complete an RTCProtection or WT on a track.
2. initiate a TOP by clicking on the TLD toolbar TOP button and then click the addressee field under the track from step 1 above.

*Expected: (according to test case 33 steps 39 and 41):*
the TLD displays a status line message saying that the field is not valid for addressee selection

*Actual:*
the TLD status line has message "you picked up...." with the addressee of the form created at step on
on execute, we get a popup saying "the form is not of the expected type"

*SideNote:*
If we select a PT addressee from the TLD, we immediately get a status line message saying "Combination of selections is not allowed"
Finally, CN may be OK with the popup, but the text of the message currently used will probably be confusing to the dispatcher.

Subject: Test case 440 step 6 result incorrect
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description: the test case result says form should be in Issued state after ValidateLimits(before any Transmit is done)

Subject: Proposed English PT form overlapping Existing PT transmitted in French does not fail ValidateLimits
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Part 1----------
This was observed when running test case 88 - a bilingual test case
Steps:
1. Create a PT id selectable from the TLD by completing a PT to some train 111.
2. Initiate a PT in French-Preferred bilingual territory to train 222;
3. Validate limits.
4. Add a P/A restriction - pre-selecting train 111 from the TLD as restriction's addressee(P/A is added to protect 111 'Working')...
5. Complete the PT to 222.
6. Initiate a second PT to train 111 overlapping PT 222
7. Validate limits

Expected(according to the test):
Validation fails

Actual:
Validation passes and a P/A protecting train 222 is added to the form

Part II------------
ADDITIONAL INFO:
This test case right now appears to be saying that we should not allow a PT form to be issued if it would have to ProtectAgainst a work crew that was issued a form in a different language than that of the proposed PT. I don't recall any discussion/requirement to reject the PT in such a case; I think it needs to be clarified with CN unless something is found in the question-log or meeting minutes; also, this particular case has the forms in Bilingual territory, and it should be clarified whether it should be handled the same way for all permutations of one or both forms being in English-only or French-only areas, english over french, french over english, etc)

---------------------------------------------------------------------
I don't think we anything like it implemented in the current code(might be able to add a rule for it based on the forms' language attribute)...
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Part III----------
There are other issues with the test case language that should be addressed....
the test step implies that the existing PT form should have a P/A for the proposed PT; this is not possible(can't add a restriction for another train 'Proceeding', only 'Working')

Also, since the customer is going to be running the tests I think the opening notes should state that it would be best to use 2 workstations(one french and one english), or the steps should be reorganized so that the tester won't need to switch between english and french user logins.

Part IV-------------
UPDATE: there is a scanned test run that includes customer comments to the effect that the validation should fail because of the protect against being issued to another proceed train, not because of the language; so I think the question now is whether the current code is OK - and just the test case needs updating - or the test case needs updating to say the P/A is for a WT for the same train as the proposed PT, and the code changed to fail the validation.

Subject: Sort order for P/A restrictions for WT's
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1. complete a WT form to some train X with whole mile entries for start and end limits.
2. complete a second WT to some train Y over the exact same limits as the first.
3. initiate a 3rd WT form to train Z

Expected: it depends on whether we need to heed the test case comment, or the test case results, or current CTC behavior.
1. the test case comment says first P/A should be for the oldest WT
2. the test case result implies the first P/A should be for the newest WT(train Y)
3. the CTC system shows the oldest WT first

Actual:
The first P/A shown on the form is for the newest WT

Either way, the test case needs to be updated

Subject: No Validation is required when Superseding an RTCP and modifying the reason.

steps

expected

actual

Author: Jim Kelliher

THE SIDING WHERE I ATTEMPTED THE TEST HAS A "No TOP" bit set on it...PLEASE DISREGARD THIS BUG...(but test case should warn not to try it where info #85 is set)....jim


test step 76 in case 181 says it should be...

2. initiate a TOP with end limit point in same siding
3. enter an addressee and validate limits

actual:

Subject: Remove auth cleanout from the release
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Log onto the system
* Look in the prj directory

*Expected:*
* The auth-cleanout.sh script does not exist in the prj directory
* The auth-cleanout.sh script does not exist anywhere else on the machine

*Actual:*
* The auth-cleanout.sh script is in the prj directory

*NOTES:*
* Make sure this does not affect the nightly build
* Make sure that what ever procedures CN has that include the auth-cleanout.sh script are corrected to offer the same auth cleanout functionallity (tech manual, all release notes ect)
* It would be nice if the auth cleanout script was on build 1 so we could net to bld 1 and use it (might have to modify it)


If we are going to make prj a safe place that does not indiscriminately wipe out data the following scripts should also be removed:
* delete-authority-rml-files.sh
* clear-mnesia-tables.sh
* add-ocscache-node.sh
* connect-to-clojure.sh
* contents of erl_scripts
* db_install
* heapmigrator
* setup-ocscache.sh

What other folders do we need to worry about?
* Should remove the RDBCREATE scripts from param_scripts as well as the CREATEDB and EMPTY_DB_SCRIPTS scripts
* Should remove dbr and dbu from the machines

Subject: Transmit button disabled for WT overlapping Restrictive RTCProtection
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Make sure the system is really doing the wrong thing before changing any code...

Steps:

1. place an RTCP-Restrivive
2. initiate a WT overlapping the RTCP-R
3. validate limits
4. click the Ok button on the message box popup

Expected(according to test case 184 result 18): Transmit button is enabled

Actual: Transmit button remains disabled

I think the system is probably doing the right thing, and the test case result needs correcting.

Subject: No query dialog for WT overlapping WT
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Make sure the system is really doing the wrong thing before changing any code...

Steps:
1. Complete a WT form.
2. initiate a 2nd WT form that overlaps the first
3. ValidateLimits

Expected(according to test case 184 step 46): a query dialog is displayed

Actual: no query dialog is displayed(the P/A is added to the form with no intervening popup)

I think the system is doing the right thing and the test case needs to be corrected; it's doing what CTC does in same case, but on the other hand I think at one point they said they wanted additional query's for OCS(at least in some cases

Subject: French keyboard turns to english
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Pre-condition - system locale set to french.  Keyboard is set to french. 
When system reboots - keyboard is working in french.  

1. Keyboard cable (usb) - unplug for few seconds.
2. Plugged usb cable back in.

Expected: keyboard keeps typing in french with french characters. 
Actual: it does not type in french anymore, only english characters,  until next reboot.

Subject: Selecting the archival option on Playback goes to a web page with error
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Steps
* select the Playback link
* when the configuration page opens select the archival option.

expected
* the page should appear without errors.

actual

Subject: No TGI graph for SWANTON sub
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1. created restrictive RTC protection by selecting track at SWANTON and completing form
2. from TGI config page, select SWAN as sub an submit
3. check the TGI box to include RTC protections.

Expected:

When the TGI opens it should include vertical lines for the sub's switches and known points and their names along the graph's x-axis

When the RTC protections checkbox is checked, there should be a rectangle drawn in the graph to represent the existing  RTCP-R.

Actual:

the TGI opens with blank graph area; no vertical lines, no x-axis labels;
the rectangle for the RTCP-R is not drawn

the TLD shows only one known point at SWANTON; the Tracklines webap shows the sherbrook view when SWAN is selected as subdivision and shows the RTCP-R correctly; it may be that the switch at other end is ROUSES sub, and there should have been another known point in the database

Subject: Null Pointer exception thrown by REF server on new PC COM after failover
Author: Bharati Bhalerao
Description:
Steps:
1. Both COMs were up. 
2. Endprog jmsgate on PC COM. This results in a failover closing all the open forms.
3. After failover, REF server on new PC COM threw null pointer exception for ClientContext being null while processing Authorization updates.
This resulted in another failover after the second COM became SB complete.
 
This was identified during the test of Bug #12219.

Subject: Can not add two same foreman names to WT PA
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:
1. Start creating work train. Choose limits, execute and validate. 
2. Add restriction 1 to foreman "xxxxx"  - choose any name, and validate. 
3. Add restriction 2 to same foreman name, then click validate. 

Expected: 2nd PA box created for same name. 
PA boxes are not combined (Two PA boxes created for the same foreman id).

Actual: rejected.   querry "cannot have two protect against for the same foreman".  

Note:  requirements say that in case of PT same situation should be rejected, but it does not specify this rule for WT.

Subject: OS report - train fulfilled even if unchecked
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:
1. Create PT train. 
2. OS report close to the end for roll up, or at the end to fulfill. 
3. When OS report is open, in track release/fulfill field - uncheck the train for fulfill. 
Expected - Tracks stops flashing yellow. 
Actual: tracks still flash yellow. 
4. Complete OS report. 
Expected: PT train is still on the track, without change. 
Actual: PT train is rolled up, or fulfilled.

Subject: RTCP limits rejected when start/end on STK track, or when limits span over CTC track.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Setup:

From the Trackline toolbar select the RTCP button, Select a Known Point within OCS as start limit and an STK as the end limit.

or:
From the Trackline toolbar select the RTCP button, Select an STK within OCS as start limit and a Knonw Point as the end limit.

also:
From the Trackline toolbar select the RTCP button, Select start limit and end limits that span over a CTC track.

Expected result:  limits should be sucessfuly validated and RTCP placed with choosen limits. 

Actual result:  limits rejected for all above cases.

Subject: Train record comments do not keep french characters
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Pre-condition: system is configured to enter french language characters. 

Setup:
1. Create a train, or use existing trains if there are any. 
2. Open Train summary. 
3. Choose a train and click on Train record. 
4. In Train record form - click on New Comment
5. Enter comment with french specific characters. 
6. Click save
7. Close comments window. 

Expected: comments are displayed in french language. 
Actual: french characters are converted to english characters and symbols such as '@, %, #'.

Subject: In Train Graph - clicking on the train dot does not show authority information
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Test Steps (24-25). 
24. On the Trackline compete a PT that enters and leaves the the subdivision displays on the Train Graph. Refresh (Press the F5 Key) the Train Graph.
25. Click on the Train Dot.
26. OS Report to rollup the PT from the previous step. Refresh (Press the F5 Key) the Train Graph.
27. Click on the Train Dot.
28. OS Report to fulfill the PT from the previous step. Refresh (Press the F5 Key) the Train Graph.
29. 25. Click on the Train Dot.


Or:
1. On Track line display:  create and complete a PT train. 
2. From Web Graph -  Train Graph window, the dot shows up for the created train. 
3. Click (or double click) on the dot.  
  

Expected:  info should show up about the PT.  
Actual: nothing happening when clicking on dot. 

4. OS report to roll up the PT in the middle of its limits or so. 
5. A new dot show up on train graph, where PT was OSd. 
6. Click on dot. 

Expected: A authority report is displayed. This report includes the PT authority information.
Actual: only train ID and date/time is showing up when hovering over the dot. nothing happens when I click on the dot. 

(note:  when clicking on the line - the PT report does come up). 

7. OS report to fullfill the PT. 
8. Click on dot. 

Expected: A authority report is displayed. This report includes the PT authority information.
Actual: only train ID and date/time is showing up when hovering over the dot. nothing happens when I click on the dot.

Subject: Technician System summary does not log Territory transfer acceptance.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Test case: 139.  5.23.3016 12:30pm.  WS12CN, WS14CN, WS15CN. 

Steps: 
1. From one workstation login as RTC.  (or do Change RTC).
2. Territory transfer report shows up. 
3. From 2nd workstation login as technician and open system summary. Sys SUM.
4. On 1st WS scroll down the TTR and click OK. 

Expected result: System summary on Technician WS should display message that this Territory transfer report was checked by this user.
Actual result: Log message does not show up.

Subject: Viewing HBD point causes Fail Over.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps taken:
Map used:  Mont-Joli Sub
It has few HBD icons with numbers under it (grey color).
I tried HBD 158.25, HBD 126.13, 96.21, 15.9 By stations St-Simon, Mile 107, Mile 13.5

1. Click View button
2. Choose one of HBD signs
3. Execute.

Actual result:  Fail over.
Expected result: REF shows a popup message stating that there are no valid forms in selection

Note:
When choosing Info and clicking on any HBD icon,   General summary log "Device info execute entry", but information window does not pop up. 
*This is as in CTC*

Subject: Edit Train form Dimension Loads type selection button causes status line error message on form

Description:

Subject: Created form comes back locked after coldstart and failover

*Actual:*

Subject: Train Form does not come up after a hang up on Trackline redraw/refresh
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
steps
* run the robot automatic load test

actual
* eventually the train form fails to display causing the test to fail

expected
* the train form should display.


The robot automatic test run on a single display. So when robot creates forms they overlap the trackline, and eventually when the forms close or are completed the trackline takes about 2 seconds to redraw/refresh. (see below)

!image2.JPG!

The Robot script waits for the image to display. Once Robot sees the image it continues and attempts to create a new train selecting the function, the parking spot then executing. In this case after trackline lags in redraw/refresh then system fails to open the Train form.
A second manual attempt will normally open the Train form.

Subject: TGI "72 hour in past" partial data message popup displayed erroneously
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:

1. open TGI config page
2. specify time period starting from 71 hours and 59 minutes from the displayed end time
3. click on submit button

Expected:
the TGI opens with the graph scaled according to the configured time period; no message box warning about incomplete data buipops up

Actual:
message box pops up saying "Part of the selected time period is not in the past 72 hours, graph data may not be available for complete time period."

NOTE: message box didn't stop popping up until time start time was within 71 hours in the past.

Subject: TGI zoom failed to work on tight area
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:

1. create 1 PT to train 222 from known pt at mile 0.1 SOREL sub to known pt 10.4 BOUCHERVILLE
2. create a 2nd PT to train 444 on same limits
3. create a 3rd PT to train 666 on same limits
4. wait 5 minutes or so and OS report train 222 at mile 5
5. wait 5 minutes and OS report train 444 at mile 2
6. wait 5 minutes and OS report train 222 at mile 8, train 444 at mile 5, and train 666 at mile 2
7. wait 5 minutes and OS report train 444 at BOUCHERVILLE (fulfill), train 444 at mile 8, train 666 at LONGUE known point

8. Open TGI config page and select the SORE subdivision
9. with the mouse draw the box around the area where the 3 trains are indicated and release the mouse button

Expected:
the TGI zooms in on the area and the tracking lines for the trains are more defined and separated

Actual:
the zoomed in area no longer displays the trains.

The only way I could zoom in on the 3 trains to evaluate the correctness of the auth reports was to go back to the config page and select a shorter time span.

Subject: Cannot OS report proceed train at 3:00 on daylight savings day
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps to clean system and change the system time* * Change date to March 12 01:30 2017 on all box # /home/s/sys/trd/ImOraCleanTrainRecord # cdm; STOPSOS # cd prj # clear-mnesia-tables.sh # rm ?r /home/auth/* # su (need to enter root password) # cd /home/s/sadm/inst/SUN4s2/bs_scripts # ./IU999OccInstall install (for NTP only use localhost) @ Do you want to do (y/n)[y]: Do you have NTP server IP [y]: Enter NTP server IP [XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX]: 127.127.1.0 no answer from 127.127.1.0 Cannot ping this 127.127.1.0 ip, do you want continue? [y]: Do you have more NTP server IP [y]: n@ 9. "Ctrl+c out of the script" 10. date 0312013017 11. su ? spsy 12. cdm; INITSOS *Steps to create bug* * Complete a PT on CAPI2/CVLD/N1TK/TRA (completed time 01:44) * OS report mile 28 at 01:45 * wait for the DST spring forward to 03:00 * OS report mile 30 at 03:00 *Expected:* * This is a valid time to OS report the Proceed Train *Actual:* * The OS report for rejects this time. NOTE: * Instead of re-configuring the system to disable the ntp you could just disable ntp using the following commands: * disable: 

# svcadm disable ntp
* Enable: 

# svcadm enable ntp
=========================================================================================== CAUSE: code error - logic to convert HHmm time string into data string was unable to handle daylight savings time phase changes because of calls to Calendar methods(which also fall well short of correctly handling). ============================================================================================= RESOLUTION: fixed indirectly by changes made for bug #13371 (see resolution there for more info. Briefly, DateValidatingJText widget was changed to hold a timeZone, and pass it on to DateUtils.java logic to convert HHmm time string, which was changed to return a java Date based on the input timeZone - which is now assigned from OsReportBox based on the OS location being reported(i.e. the location out in the field).

Subject: /orac partition reaches 100% capacity on oracle installed systems (especially master for database activation)
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
at least one cleanup script to manage oracle trace/audit files is not doing its job (dump_clean.sh)

Expected:

the /orac partition does not reach 90% or higher as checked with 'df -k' command

Actual:

the /orac partition reaches 91 and 100 %

Note: the oracle 11.2 install appears to be writing trace audit files to directories under a root /diag folder (likely the oracle default) instead of where the script currently expects them to be; the default folders for trace/audit files changed for oracle 11, but there is a parameter that controls it that could be set during RDBCREATE(not sure if it is incorrect there, not set at all, or what, but it's probably preferrable at this point to adapt the scripts to work rather than change the parameter and redo RDBCREATE's)

==============================================================================
CAUSE: code and configuration error: 
1. the WATCHORACLE script used by other spectrum installations that have oracle 11 was never brought into the CN_RTC_OCS branch; the old WATCHORACLE did not include the cleanup_new_oracle() function that uses an oracle utility(ADRCI) to cleanup the trace/audit files of a configurable age. 
2. furthermore, the oracle audit_file_dest, diagnostic_dest, core_dump_dest parameters were incorrectly to the constant TRACE_PN, which RDBCREATE assigns as ../dbs/tracefiles/<SID> - i.e. a different root for each SID; this caused the ADR base value used in the cleanup routine to default to the folder for the last SID to be runup(in this case web1).

RESOLUTION:
1. brought over the WATCHORACLE script from the mephisto 4.7 spectrum
2. updated the init.ora_11_20 scripts for each SID by setting the values of parameters audit_file_dest=ADUIT_PN, diagnostic_dest=DIAG_PN, and core_dump_dest=DIAG_PN - as they are for the 4.7 version on mephisto; this enables the new WATCHORACLE script to successfully find and remove the old files for each SID.

OPEN QUESTION: the existing dump_clean.sh script compresses the trace files it is able find - which is far fewer than oracle 11 produces - in most cases over 7 days old...and then deletes any compressed files that appear to be more than 14 days old; I was not able to determine from clearQuest/clearCase why this script was added(beyond Rich Gotz's bringing it in as part of the change to replace some of the oracle replication with DBMS copy jobs(cleartQuest #8432), IMHO its need is especially suspect when the existing WATCHORACLE script was set to simply remove files older than 5 days. It might have been installed as a band-aid of sorts in reaction to WATCHORACLE failing to do the right thing. The need for the dump_clean.sh script's compress/saveFor2weeks is a question for CN.
 

UPDATE: WATCHORACLE changed to no longer do any sqlplus queries; last one attempted was to determine the audit file folder, and caused the script to itermittently hang within the sqlplus block; the script now just uses a hard coded path....the entire code block including the test for oracle sid was removed after the oracle sid test itself was observed causing trouble...at least in part this was caused by the /usr/local/env/.profile script containing export commands/variables not properly prepared for when the script is executed as root(e.g. the variable must be declared and set and exported separately)

Subject: MSP CN_OCS Test System not transferring SVG files to webserver
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
The SVG file representation of TrackLineDisplays  - on which the Playback and Tracklines web applications depend on to work - are not being copied to the webserver on the test system.

Steps:

1. On the primary ADM server(not the spare), endprog and restart the svgexp program while tailing the /home/logs/svgexp_xxx.log file.

2. Confirm that a call is made to the ../bin/ftpsvg script is logged to the svgexp_xxx.log file
> e.g. '15-11-2016 12:53:02 0 CSVGEXP::ftpsvg() ftpsvg sync done'

3. find the latest /home/logs/ftpsvg* log file

Expected:

1. The ftpsvg log file records the file transfers made to the web server
2. The <webserver>:/user/local/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/svgd folder reflects the SVG content that is on the primary ADM at /home/svgd

Actual:

1. the ftpsvg log file shows that it was unable to transfer the files
> e.g. Transmit failed, no connection found-- ALL DONE -- Tue Nov 15 12:53:02 2016
2. the required SVG files are not present on the webserver in /user/local/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/svgd/*

====================================================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration/script code error - the new webserver created for the T7 based test system is named web1cnt7; the ftpsvg script
determines the webserver(s) it needs to copy SVG files by piping the result of 'mcq hosts' call into a grep "^web[0-9][a-z][a-z]*$"
command; the name web1cnt7 fails to match, no web servers are returned, and no ftp is even attempted.

RESOULUTION: made the webserver search less restrictive by changing the grep expression to grep "^web*"

Subject: Control System Bridge Exception on receipt of Train Performance Update
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Control System Bridge Throws an exception and triggers failover when the SRS Simulator is used to send a train summary update with a schedule deviation. Steps: 0. do a 'tailf | grep csbridge' 1. fire up the SRS simulator(see wiki if you dont know how) 2. enter option 2 3. enter values as prompted for parameters 1 thru 11 (can mostly use '1's) 4. enter a '1' for parameter 12 5. enter a 'L' for parameter 13 6 enter 1's for the remaining parameters Expected: no exception stack shows up in the tail output Actual: the following stack trace is output: 
ID 342736 user.notice]  1011 Softbus  Service 440 Req 48 SubReq 10 AckCl 3 AckFl 0 Obj 718   46:18.73
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn ImTrdI: [ID 888339 user.notice]  1014 Softbus  UID 0 X 0 CNT 1 Sec 0   46:18.73
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn ImTrdI: [ID 787940 user.notice]  1014 Softbus  TID LLL Exp 1 TRID 1000001 SRS LLLLLLLL ENG 1    Dir 0 Held 0 Perf 1 LEN 0 Occ 0 AUTH 0   46:18.73
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn ImTrdI: [ID 117383 user.notice]  1015 Softbus  QLoc ta/*0/*0/*0/*0 Cloc ta/*0/*0/*0/*0 PLoc ta/*0/*0/*0/*0   46:18.73
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 345154 user.info] FATAL [JmsGateMessagingInterface] Exception occured during message handling of message
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 839477 user.info] java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Did not find interface ocs.us.core.processimage.IProcessImageItem with id -1
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 824232 user.info] 	at ocs.us.core.model.AbstractProcessModelCatalog.getById(AbstractProcessModelCatalog.java:157) ~[Core.jar:?]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 953325 user.info] 	at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.VicosConversionUtils.convert(VicosConversionUtils.java:1974) ~[csbridge.jar:?]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 423089 user.info] 	at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.TrainRecordInterface.telegramReceived(TrainRecordInterface.java:95) ~[csbridge.jar:?]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 368166 user.info] 	at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jmsgate.JmsGateMessagingInterface.handleMessage(JmsGateMessagingInterface.java:111) ~[csbridge.jar:?]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 113597 user.info] 	at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jmsgate.JmsGateMessagingInterface.onMessage(JmsGateMessagingInterface.java:80) [csbridge.jar:?]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 330077 user.info] 	at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doInvokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:543) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 750368 user.info] 	at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.invokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:482) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
Sep 16 12:46:18 rel1cn csbridge: [ID 836406 user.info] 	at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doExecuteListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:451) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
=========================================================================== CAUSE: code error - train record interface doesn't send a valid location TA when sending performance updates(just leaves it alone, which results in /*0/*0/*0/*0 being sent); control system bridge can't convert it to an itemId, and later tries to lookup INVALID_ITEMID(-1) from the processImage as part of getting the train direction(call was added for recent bug fix to correct direction issue). RESOLUTION: changed VicosConversionUtils routine that converts message to java TrainUpdateMessage to check for INVALID_ITEM_ID and not try to use it to get direction.

Subject: Host files are not in the same places on the workstation and spectrum machines.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
The solaris machines link /etc/hosts to /etc/inet/hosts
The redhat workstations link /etc/inet/hosts to /etc/hosts

This discrepancy makes a whole mess of problems when niss distributes the /etc/inet/hosts file to all of the machines in the cluster.

*Steps:*
* Run the workstation open firewall script

*Expected:*
* The /etc/hosts file is linked to /etc/inet/hosts

*Actual:*
* The /etc/inet/hosts file is linked to the /etc/hosts file

*Expected:*
* When the uninstall option is used on the firewall script the host file stuffs is put back to the way it was before the firewall install

Subject: New train or Edit train when clicking on fields is placing cursor in wrong position
Author: cn customer
Description:
*Setup:*
* Open the New Train or Edit Trains
* Click into one of the fields (from the Loads field downward)

*Expected:*
* The courser shows up in the farthest right position
* The field is editable

*Actual:*
* The courser shows up at the mouse click position in the field.
* The field is not editable unless the user clears out all spaces between the courser and the furthest right position in the field.

==========================================================
CAUSE: oracle forms 6 mouse behavior different
under solaris 10 (unknown); problem somehow related to how system handles
oracle text cursor positioning directives for fields whose justification
property is set to 'End'

RESOLUTION: added WHEN-MOUSE-UP trigger that checks for numeric field types
with justification set to 'End' and calls CLEAR_ITEM to reset the fields
properties(and then restore text value, if any).

Subject: Jwdog core dumps

> chmod +x /usr/java/bin/jps
*Steps:* * Start up the system *Expected:* * jwdog can handle this odd jps output. *Actual:* * jwdog core dumps *Restore jps:*

Subject: The system should not allow more than one BSD from the same domain
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* On a workstation open up an x-connect or xt-chooser
* Open up a second xt-chooser

*Expected:*
* The system does not let the second xt-chooser window come up

*Actual:*
* Both xt-choosers come up
* They can both be used to start their own BSDs.

=============================================================
Cause: code error; code not updated to handle x-connect request
on 2nd MMI before processing of a connection request made by
the same workstation for a first MMI is completed.

Resolution: changed ACOP's XTCompConn() function that processes
workstation connections to test CARIGHT relation record for 
workstation's xid for prior assigment of MMI, and to abort
the connection if assigned MMI is different than the MMIid
in the 2nd connection request; the womanSPEC process on the second
MMI is then notified of ACOP's aborting the connection and the 2nd
BSD is never raised.

Subject: When selecting a train in the train list TM does not check territory for the right item
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps:

* Place enough PTs on a track so that the train id stack has the box
* Do a move train for one of the trains in the boxed id to a different territory
* Remove territory control for the territory where the train was moved to
* Do a move train for the same train in the boxed id, but move it to a still controlled parking spot

Expected:

* The train is moved to the new parking spot

Actual:

* The train doesn't get moved
* The general summary has a failed message for the parking spot you no longer control (Note: You won't see the gensum message until you take that territory back)

Note: The bug is caused by the fact that on receiving ack message from TM Client we are do the territory check on the train's current location and not the actual destination parking spot. This problem exists in Move Train (parking spot -> parking spot), Move Train (Form Id field -> parking spot), and Remove Train.  If you find a new scenario that causes the problem add it to the bug so the testers can run that case as well.

*Scenario for Move Train (parking spot -> parking spot):*
* Place enough PTs on a track so that the train id stack has the box in a territory (A). _(Note: you can use the first step of the above scenario)_
* Create a PT using the trainId displayed in the stack in a different territory (B).
* Move the train by selecting the addressee of new PT into a parking spot A that is in the same territory where train id stack was created. _(territory A)_
* OS the new PT created in territory B such that it is rolled up. _(This action indicate that the train's new position is in territory B)_
* Remove territory control for the territory B where the new PT was created.
* Now move the same train from parking spot A to the parking spot B. _(both parking spots are in territory A that is still under control)_

Expected: The move operation is successful.

*Scenario for Remove Train:*
+Prerequisite+ : Steps of "Move Train" scenario.

* Once the train is in parking spot B, take the control back of territory B.
* OS the PT created in territory B such that it is now fulfilled.
* Remove territory control for the territory B where the PT was fulfilled.
* Now remove the same train from parking spot B that is still under control.

Expected: The remove operation is successful. _(Train will still stay in the system cause there are active PTs for it but it should be removed from that parking spot)_

Subject: /home/logs folder on redhat workstations not writable to non-root users
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
expected:
scripts executed by users spsy/spus, etc. can create and write files in /home/logs to record their progress and what they do(example openbox/autostart, vicos_connect, etc)

actual:
only root can write to /home/logs

Subject: ftpsvg does not copy the necessary resources for TrackLines web app after initial installation
Author: Nicholas Tolrud
Description:
Steps:
# Add a new web box to an existing system.
# Restart the adm or directly run ftpsvg sync.

Expected:
* The web box receives the necessary resources for every web app.

Actual:
* The web box is missing resources for the TrackLines web app.

Look into changing the where the app looks for resources and/or fixing ftpsvg to always copy the same files.

problem stems from the following 2 current facts of life:
1. Tracklines expects the latest/current svg files that correspond to the current TLD's to be in the "top-level" ../tomcat/ROOT/svgd/Online folder(i.e. it is too lazy to figure out which of the possible ../Online/dbkey_nnnn folders contain the latest svg files).
2. the files are only sent to that top-level folder when there is a new dbkey number.

the files get copied to the top level ../Online folder on the web server when there is a new dbkey number; this is done by svgexp calling the ftpsvg script with the key number as a parameter, when svgexp sees there is a new dbkey(first time it runs, or data activation)...if there's no new dbkey number svgexp calls ftpsvg with the 'sync' parameter, which only "syncs" the svg files in /home/svgd/dbkey_n to the webserver ../Online/dbkey_n folder.

more NOTEs:

there are 2 ways to fix this; either : 
> change WEBTracklines to figure out which dbkey_nnn folder(s) to load the svg files from
> change the ftpsvg script to collect the latest svg files by scanning /home/svgd/dbkey* folders on the ADM(e.g. add all the svg files from the highest dbkey folder, scan the next highest and add any svg files that have not yet been added, repeating until the lowest number dbkey folder has been scanned)

==========================================================================
CAUSE: code error - RTCII program and script not made to handle case where
webserver is added after ADM server is runup at least once; in this case
when svgexp is restarted or ftpsvg is called from command line without a
dbkey number argument, the ftpsvg script defaults to opt_sync option that
before this change was only syncing the dbkey_xxx folders on the webserver.

RESOLUTION: added syncLatestTLDViewSvgs() sub routine to ftpsvg script to
send svg files for the latest TLD views to webserver when ftpsvg called
without a dbkey version number.

FYI - decided against making WEBTracklines "smart" enough because it would
involve comparing timestamps with db_journal oracle table entries, and possibly
needing to pull the files in the correct order from multiple folders; given that
plus known issues with playback not working when journal entries not found it
seemed simpler to keep current scheme and force the folder used by Tracklines
to be synced. It might be nice to have them put into a "latestTLDView" folder
instead of being dumped into the top-level root directory for the dbkey_nnnn's;
CTC system doesn't do that.

UPDATE - when installed on sdm1ocs, the new method only processed the latest dbkey
folder from sdm1ocs:/home/svgd; this folder contained only svg files for the test
development system, and as a result the tracklines display failed when selecting
other views(which were in older dbkey versions) an updated version(r174162) of
the ftpsvg script was checked in 04-14-16 - jim

Subject: Form operations should not be allowed with no view authorization
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Take away the AuthRead authorization using passman for a dispatcher user
* Using that dispatcher user attempt to perform form operations (Create, Cancel, View, Modify, Supersede, Supersede Oth)

*Expected:*
* The action is not allowed

*Actual:*
* The action is allowed

NOTE:
* This applies to all user classes.

======================================================================================
CAUSE: code/config error

RESOLUTION: changed the way we map authorizations from passman to java apps to allow us to require more than one vicos/passman authorization when defining authorizations/rights checked by the java applications.

PS - because of how CTC now works, also included OS report and the AuthInfo function(right click on ID field in TLD to get list of authorities)... also changed SwitchReport workflow to test for authorization(it never checked; unlike OS report there is no corresponding function in CTC)

Subject: OS report doesn't fulfill both PTs in the same direction
Author: Alex Plotkin
Description:
1 Create two PT forms for the same train
  PT1 OCST1/OLIV/SW1/SWI - OCST1/NANC/STN/KnownPnt -(completion time 11:35)-
  PT2 OCST1/MABE/STN/KnownPnt - OCST1/LAUR/ESW/SWI -(completion time 12:36)-

2 OS report on OCST1/LAUR/ESW/SWI -enter time 12:37-
  
expected result:
OS report should fulfill PT1 and PT2

current result: 
OS report fulfill only PT2

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
CAUSE: code error; problem was originally reported as being due to timezone difference between the location of the 2 forms, but it was not related to timezones; what happened was the "trailing" pt1 form was disqualified as rollup/fullfill candidate because it was erroneously flagged as being worked on (in other words, in progress or being modified, superceded, etc)...this was because of an incorrect test in an if statement that is supposed to prevent the form's disqualification if the form being worked on was in fact the form whose item was selected for OS report...

when a PT form is initiated or selected, STK/Rule105 tracks which "touch" the form limits are required to be PROTECTED; for both the leading and trailing forms, this included the rule105 track between Mabel and Nancy; when the OS report was initiated, that Rule105 track was set to PROTECTED because the leading form was selected; when the trailing candidate was being checked to see if it was being worked on, the rule determined that only one of its required items for protection was already PROTECTED - the 105 track; and then flagged the trailing form as being worked on because the PROTECTED item was not part of the leading form's limits.

RESOLUTION: changed if-check to check the leading form's protected items instead of form items; this prevents the trailing form from incorrectly being flagged as being worked-on.

Subject: New train / edit train not allowing tabbing through the form
Author: cn customer
Description:
CTC Train forms allow tabbing from field to field the OCS version of the forms is not doing this.

---------------------------
CAUSE: config error/funky old oracle forms not ready for newer xkb "features"

RESOLUTION:

Created a new keymapping that is automatically loaded by script at user login.

created .xkb file(s) to disable NumLock key and modifier and map all the numeric keypad number keys to always send numbers(instead of doing page-up, etc when num loc is off); multiple files are needed due to differences between redhat and ubuntu installs, and also for use with french keyboard.

created ../WORKSTATION/user/local/bin/xkbReset.sh to be called from openbox autostart script, to run in the .xkb file based on operating system and language.

Note: a simpler script to execute only xmodmap commands to do the same thing were tried but found to interfere with Alt-F1 overview selection(might be worth trying again from within the autostart, but xkb documentation and the Xmodmap files on the redhat installs advise against this, but as things now stand  this solution is working and I've burned up too much time already)

for more information, see:
https://redmine/projects/cn-rtc2-ocs/wiki/Workstation_Keyboard

Subject: Possible Memory Leak
Author: Will Martin
Description: The following picture was taken at the CN site after the CN team had been placing and removing forms. It looks like there are still some views and presenters in memory. This looks suspicious. We have also confirmed on our side that we have seen views and presenters with garbage collection nodes (nodes that will prevent the view/presenter from getting cleaned up even though the view had been destroyed). This should be looked into to see if we are missing some deregistration/dereferencing somewhere.

Subject: Creating a restriction PA allows editing of Addressee field when part of limits and also creating restriction does not allow selecting of Addressee Id
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*steps (scenario 1)*
* Open a PT/WT in Created state, validate, press the Add Rest. button
* Select a Train ID and limits then execute.
* When the form is populated with the PA info attempt to modify the Addressee field

*expected*
* The Addressee field cannot be modified.

*actual*
* The Addressee field can be modified.

*steps (scenario 2)*
* Open a PT/WT in Created state, validate, press the Add Rest. button
* Select a Addressee ID and limits then execute.

*expected*
* The form is populated with the PA info.

*actual*
* The form is not populated with PA info, the section does not exist.


NOTE - also see that changing the type of addressee from train to foreman and vice versa does not update the working/proceeding field value.

CAUSE: 
scenario 1: code error - unlike form itself the restriction object did not have a flag indicating whether the addreess was prepopulated with a value selected from the trackline.

scenario 2 : config error - map setup of allowable operations in spring file for WT did not include the option for adding restriction; this caused a "no access right" error and prevented the restriction from being added to the form.

RESOLUTION:
scenario 1: added flag indicating whether the addreess was prepopulated with a value selected from the trackline(gets set true by workflow action handler); added test of flag in AbstractTrainFormPresenter to set the GUI form field to not be editable.

Subject: Via instructions generated from KP are using B1 name rather than B1 text.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*precondition* 
* B1 text should be modified to be different than the B1 name on AUTOS and PLANETS

*steps*
* On view "OCS Test 3" where there is dual-track select authority route through either KPs (AUTOS/BUICK/STN OR PLANETS/NEPTUNE/STN) and execute.

*Actual*
* The form displays with via instructions using B1 name.

*Expected*
* The form displays with via instructions using B1 text.

+*Scenario2:*+
*Steps*
1. Change the B1Name of AUTOS/PLANETS subdivisions so that it will be different from the b1text using SDM editor.
2. Perform data activation for the change.
3. Undo the data activation.

*Actual*
On performing steps 2 & 3, exception occurs in TM server for the ItemRelation. See the attachment for more details.

*Expected*
On performing steps 2 & 3, no exception occurs. Data activation and undo are successful.

Subject: French Technician BSD buttons have English labels / triggers English instead of French TrainSummary form
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:

1. Using passman, create a new technician user that has French language(or change existing tech user).
2. Login as the french technician
3. Open the train summary.
4. from a shell window, do 'psg f60'

Expected;
1. The BSD window title bar displays French language text.
2. The BSD buttons are labeled in French.
3. The Train Summary form buttons are labeled in French.
4. the 'psg f60' command shows f60runm module=tech_fr

Actual:
1. The BSD window title bar displays French language text.
2. The BSD buttons are labeled in English.
3. The Train Summary form buttons are labeled in English.
4. the 'psg f60' command shows f60runm module=tech

Note: ALL of the button labels look wrong, but the FormSummary BSD button does raise the french form summary.

Subject: Technician System Summary messages of "forms failed integrity check"
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
log files attached, also in bld1cn /tmp

Preconditions:

* A system with two COMs is needed

Steps:

* Shutdown both COMs
* Clear Mnesia cache
* Start both COMs (Wait for them to go (PC/SB) complete)
* Complete an authority
* Restart Passive COM (Wait for it to go SB complete)

Expected:

* We get no messages in the technician summary about the form integrity failing

Actual:

* We get the following message 'Form <Form Number> of type <Form Type> failed an integrity check



NOTE:
The internal trigger for the integrity monitor in REF is also running on both the passive and the active. This integrity monitor should only be running on the active COM.

Subject: Playback becomes inoperable after initial forward play
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
1. Initiate a playback session for a time period during which there are no authorities in the system(from the playback config form, select a sub and screen where there are no forms, enter the time period and click the Submit button)

Actual:
a. the PlaybackControl window opens, and its status line says "Playback Data Loaded", click on the play button.
b. The playback clock does not start ticking, and no feedback is given to the user;
c. clicking the play button again pops up the "No data for selected time period message to appear.

Expected:
The system should display the "No data available for selected time period" popup message upon submission of the playback configuration form. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CAUSE: part configuration error and part code errors:

1. SQL query for authority events was missing parentheses around subvision exclusion clause; this caused bogus result-set as well as making oracle appear to incorrectly continue the query instead of short-cutting out(this same query came from the ages-old RTC2 playback and is still wrong in there).
2. the Message.properties file containing resource strings used by playback was missing entries on the web3ocs server.
3. a console() trace log message call for the console() funtion that does not exist in old javascript was merged in from the non-plugin version; problem only surfaced when trying to load data for multiple time segments where first segment contained no events to be played back(was difficult to find because the IE 11 debugger went ahead and included the routine, so not only did the debug/inspect-element tool not flag it as an error but it also made playback work fine with the same code as long as I was in the debugger)

RESOLUTION: 

1. change to wrap clause in parentheses initially made Playback correctly give the "no data for time period message", but on subsequent attempts playback would not progress past the time configuration window(not even to open the debugger), which turned out to be caused by Playback not being able to find the resource string for the ConfigurePlayback window title bar(no idea why it worked initially).

2. the Messages.properties file(s) appeared checked in to two different folders in SVN, which caused updates to it to not be installed to where playback picks them up; solution to this was to delete the copy from the ../Playback/WEB-INF/classes folder, rebuild and redeploy... this solved issue number 2 above that was found during retesting...

3. removed the console() trace calls from the SVG-plugin version of playback

Subject: Forms on switches are inoperable.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:

Place a proceed train from switch (3)OCST (3)CLEV (6)SW3 (703)SWI to (3)OCST (2)BOBV (6)SW1 (703)SWI
Place a TOP from (3)OCST (3)CLEV (6)SW3 (703)SWI to (3)OCST (2)BOBV (6)SW1 (703)SWI
(from right side of Clever switch to left side, or from left to right). 

Expected result: When forms are placed - they are not visible on the map,  but can be operated from Form summary.  

Actual result: When forms are placed - they are not visible on the map,  and they are not operable from form summary.  

==================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error? When filtering out forms whose items are not included in the list of visible items on current TLD's, form summary was filtering out forms which had no process image items from limits highlighted on the TLD.

RESOLUTION: changed filtering of forms based on visible items ids to test against form's protected items instead of tld-highlighted items(replaced getTldHighlightedItems() call in SummaryTableModel.java with call to getItemsProtect() ). To make this work for both movement authority and rtc-protection forms, changed AbstractLimitsForm and BlockLimit getItemsToProtect() method to include the returned items from new FormUtils getOccupiableLimitItemIds() when the usual method to get tld-highlighted and stk-protected items returns an empty set; the new FormUtils method returns all tracks and switches that are in the form's process image value items;  this allows the form to be flagged as found to include items on current TLD displays, and thus to not be filtered out from the FormSummary.

Finally, please be aware that the above change means that a form with only an STK-protect item visible on an overview - if that is ever possible- will now be included on the FormSummary(such a form would have been filtered out before); this was OK'd by Will.

FYI - about the note about not being able to select from the TLD: per will this part is functioning as expected/written in requirements/question log, etc...

Subject: TOP form is rejected when placed over 2 opposing PTs
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:
1. Place 1st PT  from point A to B.  
2. Place 2nd PT from point C to B. 
3. Place TOP from A to C. 

Expected result:  TOP form should be validated successfully, and create 2 follow behind boxes, one for each PT. 

Actual result: TOP validation is rejected.
(Note:  when two PTs are going opposite directions - from 1 point, outwards from each other - validation is successful.
Example:  1st PT from B to A, 2nd PT from B to C, TOP from A to C)

======================================================================
CAUSE/RESOLUTION: FUNCTIONS AS DESIGNED

reproducing the scenario the system gives the reasons for the TOP being rejected
as being due to the limits of the TOP extending beyond the end limit of each PT.

in the scenario described, the TOP would be rejected for overlapping PT-1 even if PT-2 was not there(because PT-1 ends at B and TOP goes all the way to C); similarly, the TOP would be rejected for overlapping PT-2 even if PT-1 was not there(because TOP includes A, but the PT-2 ends at B).

the the noted case of the PT's going away from each other, the TOP does not extend beyond the end limit of either PT, so is allowed.

to see 2 follow behinds for PT's seemingly headed toward each other:
> create PT-1 from C to A
> create PT-2 from A to C (should get an After restriction for PT-1)
> create TOP from A to C (should get FollowBehind restrictions for both PT-1 and Pt2)

Subject: keyboard reset script jams workstation if run with numlock key on
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1. restart workstation by doing 'openbox --exit'
2. when the login screen opens, press the NumLock key; verify that the numlock led is on.
3 login as spsy

expected behavior:

1. the workstation is logged in(the BSD should appear, but whether or not it does doesn't matter for this bug)
2. right mouse opens the menu for selecting xterm, xconnect, etc
3. can open xterm

actual behavior:

right mouse click does nothing (cannot open xterm)


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
notes:

a numlockx binary is installed in /usr/bin on ws07cn and ocs1; also xkbReset.sh changed on those boxes to call it with 'off' parameter(at least the first try of it worked).

the one that I grabbed is this one:

numlockx-1.1-1.el6.rf.x86_64.rpm

from:
ftp://rpmfind.net/linux/dag/redhat/el6/en/x86_64/dag/RPMS/numlockx-1.1-1.el6.rf.x86_64.rpm

the rpm is on vocs06 in /media/sf_vmshare...


finally:
setleds -D didn't work because its applied only to the terminal where it's run.

xset led did not work because the default xkb map apparently has AllowExplicit turned off.

Subject: Failover when UI Responses handled again after a failover
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps: * Create train in system * Create unacknowledged form leading out of train's parking spot, into new parking spot * Clear trains from oracle * Restart system so that TM 'forgets' about train * Complete PT ** Received UIResponse 'COMPLETE_READ' ** Received UIResponse 'COMPLETE_REPEAT' ** Received UIResponse 'DONE' ** On 'DONE', this completes the form, and send TM a message to move the train, the train did not exist (other issue). TM failed ** Failover occurred 
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at ocs.us.tm.controller.TrainManager.moveTrain(TrainManager.java:113)
        at ocs.us.tm.controller.ClientCommunicator.handleAutoMoveTrainMessage(ClientCommunicator.java:542)
        at ocs.us.tm.controller.ClientCommunicator.handleMessage(ClientCommunicator.java:140)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleIOCSMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:210)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:122)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.OcsMessageListener.onMessage(OcsMessageListener.java:58)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doInvokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:543)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.invokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:482)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doExecuteListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:451)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.executeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:423)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.processMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:290)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$2.onMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:266)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQMessageConsumer.dispatch(ActiveMQMessageConsumer.java:1394)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.dispatch(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:131)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.iterate(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:202)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
* SB Comm goes PC ** On go active REF started by handling UIResponse 'COMPLETE_READ', instead of skipping because we already handled the message ** During the handling of UIResponse 'COMPLETE_READ' we encounter exception because the form is no longer open, does not have a workflow instance, and tries to access it and fails ** Failover occurred 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No workflow instance id in the container with key: 3517
        at ocs.us.ref.workflow.WorkflowInstanceContainer.getInstanceByID(WorkflowInstanceContainer.java:64)
        at ocs.us.ref.workflow.InternalWorkflowProcessor.continueWorkflow(InternalWorkflowProcessor.java:198)
        at ocs.us.ref.workflow.WorkflowProcessor.continueWorkflow(WorkflowProcessor.java:213)
        at ocs.us.ref.uimngt.UiManager.receiveUiResponse(UiManager.java:270)
        at ocs.us.ref.communicator.ClientInterface.handleMessage(ClientInterface.java:188)
        at ocs.us.core.lifecycle.CommonLifecycleManager.processMissedMessages(CommonLifecycleManager.java:548)
        at ocs.us.core.lifecycle.CommonLifecycleManager.handleStateChangeMessage(CommonLifecycleManager.java:521)
        at ocs.us.core.lifecycle.CommonLifecycleManager.handleMessage(CommonLifecycleManager.java:234)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleIOCSMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:210)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:122)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.OcsMessageListener.onMessage(OcsMessageListener.java:58)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doInvokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:543)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.invokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:482)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doExecuteListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:451)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.executeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:423)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.processMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:290)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$2.onMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:266)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQMessageConsumer.dispatch(ActiveMQMessageConsumer.java:1394)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.dispatch(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:131)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.iterate(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:202)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Note: Though we shouldn't get a MoveTrain() on a non-existent train from REF in cases where we don't erase the train, we should still check so that TM does not failover needlessly ---------------------------------------------------- CURRENT FINDINGS: 1. unable to reproduce the second failover - i.e. REF's vomitting on the UIResponse associated with non-existent workflow; in general that scenarion is going to be covered by another bug # 11991 2.in trying to reproduce bug, saw another problem: 
   2016-02-07 13:00:31,794 FATAL [CommonJmsListener] Exception occured during message handling of message            
       AbstractInitServiceMessage     [applicationName=REFServer, becomeActive=true]
       java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException:
           Can not set boolean field  ocs.us.ref.uimngt.UiManager.notReady to null value
	at ocs.us.core.cache.OcsCacheManager.updateAllFromCache(OcsCacheManager.java:286) ~[Core.jar:?]
	at ocs.us.core.lifecycle.CommonLifecycleManager.handleStateChangeMessage(CommonLifecycleManager.java:501)[Core.jar:?]
       java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 
           Can not set boolean field ocs.us.ref.uimngt.UiManager.notReady to null value
	at ocs.us.core.cache.OcsCacheManager.updateAllFromCache(OcsCacheManager.java:286) ~[Core.jar:?]
It was determined that the ocs cache must have been cleared at some point leaving the test system in an invalid state; this much can be reproduced by clearing the cache from the SB COM...there''ll probably be a bug written to say not to allow it anymore(if it is determined we must make the system prevent such foolishness...in CTC could always go into spectrum and dbu init relations). 3. The TrainCatalog(s) in the java apps still have the trains - until the COMs are cold-started - i.e. the java world does not know the trains have been trashed until after a cold start when an train form attempts to move the train( you can trash the trains in oracle, restart the ADM, failover from one COM to another, etc, and the TrainCatalog will still contain the trains it knew about) 4. We are awaiting answers from CN on whether we should explode when form tries to move train; if not we could check for train's existence in catalog before trying to move the train in MoveTrainToAdjacentOcsParkingSpot... 5. Cancelling a train form works even if train is no longer there(action handler checks for train in catalog beforehand). 6. Where action handlers do check for train in catalog, they log to ref.log when not found; CN would really want to know when the trains got trashed; how we do that is also part of questions to CN.

Subject: TOP foreman name is not case sensitive
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
According to new request from customer, foreman name should not be case sensitive. 

Steps to check:
1. Place TOP on track with foreman name 'user1'. 
2. Place TOP on top of user1 (to overlap)  and name the foreman 'USER1'.

Expected: Conflict box should not show up after form validation. 
Actual: Conflict box comes up. 

=======================================================================
Cause: missed requirement

Resolution: changed logic which matches on addressee to convert to upper-case before matching. Applied same scheme for all addressee matching for all movement authority forms(TOP, PT, WT).

================================================================
NOTE FROM JIM:
The CTC system does not ignore case when checking for need to generate the conflict box. For example:
1. Complete a TOP-1 from A to C to foreman Jones;
2. Complete a TOP-2 from E to F to foreman JONES;
3. Initiate a TOP-3 by pre-selecting the addressee for TOP-2(JONES) from the trackline display and selecting limits overlapping TOP-1(to Jones) from B to D.

TOP-3 opens with the conflicting with Jones box A

finally, it turns out that like equalIgnoreCase(), the java toUpperCase()
string method does what we want without needing to pass a locale argument;
there is a unit test added to TopOverlappingLimitTrimmerTest.java that 
confirms this behavior.
===============================================================

Subject: Stuck display on workstation
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Resources/Info*
* Xid=83
* formNumber=731
* workflowId=3701
* general time = 08:49:16,657 on rtc1ocs 

* The PC com was rtc1ocs, the mmi was mmi4ocs. 
* COM logs: nasmtk:/CNOCS/Backups/Logs/Logs_080616.tar.gz
* MMI4 logs can be found at: nasmtk:/CNOCS/Backups/Logs/MMI4Logs_08_06_16.tar.gz

*Setup*
* It looks like the user started a top 
* Brought it to unacked state
* Did not click on any of the fields on the complete box
* Attempted to open another form
* Acknowledged that a form was already opened
* Aborted the opened TOP
* Said Yes "I transmitted the complete time"
** (At this point we believe the form was closed but did not go away on the workstation UI)
** (I believe this is when Alex P got involved.)
* The user attempted to cancel the unacked form and could not
* The user tried to complete the unacked form
* Then the form was re-opened so it was showing twice on the screen (once dead once alive)
* Then the form was completed but the dead form did not go away
* The workstation was disconnected and reconnected to rectify the situation.

*Note*
We believe after looking at the log files that this was a problem with X11. We can see where the form was closed on the ref server, we can see where the form was closed on the REF client on the MMI.

Subject: SVG Exporter has problems
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps:*
* On a running ADM/SDM or All machine
* STOPSOS the machine
* look for core files in the sys directory
** ls -lrt | grep core
** cd /home/s/sys

*Expected:*
* There are no new core files

*Actual:*
* There is a new core file from SVGEXP for instance:
** coreE_adm1cn_svgexp.25643

*Steps:*
* INITSOS the ADM/SDM/All machine
* tail -f the /var/adm/messages file

*Expected:*
* svgexp comes up without an issue

*Actual:*
* There is a -6 error in the tailf output that looks as follows:
** Nov  4 12:41:31 all6cn svgexp: [ID 622252 user.error]  3202 svgexp   modifyAddrRequirement, iFlag: -6   41:31.21

NOTE:
This may be a side effect of the SUN10 upgrade. Lets timebox this bug until we are sure that this is a new problem.

Subject: Last track of subdivision is OCS and there is a parking spot associated with it the id is not being moved into the parking spot
Author: cn customer
Description:
Testing Sussex Sub:

Noticed that when I issued a PT from siding west switch at Moosehorn to Mile 83.5 Sussex Sub.
Once I completed the form the train id did not move into the parking spot associated with this track.
There is no Subdivision track here as OCS ends at the last known point.

Subject: Validation passes on a PT/WT that goes through a reverse switch that is part of a WT that has cancelled its warning
Author: Nicholas Tolrud
Description:
*Steps:*
# Create a WT over a reversed switch.
** The WT should have a warning for this switch
** The WT should not have a permission for this switch.
# Change the switch into normal position with a Switch report.
# Modify the WT and cancel the switch's warning
# Start a PT or WT that takes the switch reverse
# Validate the form

*Expected:*
* The validation fails since the WT no longer has a warning on the switch.

*Actual:*
* The validation passes.

Subject: Train Summary does not reflect location of OS Reports
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Create a proceed train over some limits 
* Os report said proceed train to a mileage

*Expected:*
* The train summary should show the mileage that the train was OSed on. This location field should show the same information as the location field on the OS report section of the train record.

*Actual:*
* The train summary is only showing the B2 on the train summary
* Train record is correctly showing the mileage in the location field of the OS report table. 

======================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - PL/SQL code had test for 'AUM' as source of OS-info
instead of 'REF' included in section which replaces mileage entry if present.

RESOLUTION: replaced 'AUM' with 'REF' in english train summary form POST-QUERY trigger(the
french form already had the correction!?!)

Subject: PT finds alternate routes when traveling down main
Author: Will Martin
Description:
PT going past a number of main tracks with sidings before being selected into a siding location is adding the Via instruction for the siding location in error.

*Setup:*
* Place a proceed train over the main by passing many sidings
* End on a siding

*Expected*
* We only get an instruction for the take siding at

*Actual*
* We are getting extra via instructions

Subject: New User Class cannot be added.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Step : From Basic Signalling Display (BSD), click on the ?User Accounts? button.
Result : The main form of the Managing User Accounts display opens, greyed out. 
Result : The display requests User Accounts password.
Step : Enter an invalid User Accounts password.       
Result : The system displays a message that the password is incorrect.
Step : Enter the correct User Accounts password. 
Result : The main form of the Managing User Accounts display finishes opening. 
Step : Select any line in the User Class window.
Result : The selected row is highlighted.
Step : Click the ?New? button.
Result : A new entry appears, with all text boxes empty.
Step : Type the Class name (one word) in ?User/Class Name? Text box.  Example: ?testC1?.
Result : The entered Class Name is displayed in the "User/Class Name" field. 
Step : Select "Class Definition" check box.
Result : The check box is now checked.
Step : Click the "Access Rights"  button. 
Result : A new form with a list of Access Rights opens.
Step : Select Access Rights from the list. 
Result : The selections are shown with check marks in the pop-up window.
Step : Click the "Close" button.
Result : The "Access Rights" form closes.
Step : Select "OPERATOR" from the "DMS Level" drop-down menu.
Result : The DMS Level successfully selected.
Step : Insert Initials to the Initials test box. (2-3 characters long, no spaces).
Result : Initials successfully entered.
Step : Type comments into the Alias text box. 
Result : The comment successfully entered (free text).
Step : Click on the "Store" button.
*Actual Result*: A Warning dialog pops up "This User Number is already being used." and the new class is not added.
*Expected Result* : The new class is created and added to the User/Class list at the top of the form.

Subject: OS report shows up train that is not supposed to be in the list.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Step 7:  checking for "PTs completed with same Train ID and same subdivision but not topologically reachable."

Open an OS Report Rollup dialog by
- Select an end side of completed PT.

(Used Detroit siding tracks for test). 

Expected result: The OS Report Rollup dialog only shows the PT that is topological reachable in the Track Release and Fulfilled field.

Actual result:
Os report shows all PTs in subdivision. 

See attached pictures. 
When doing OS report on top right switch, it shows up both PTs, even though they are not topologically reachable.

Subject: French characters are not supported on the OCS system
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Using the English keyboard enter french characters into a java form (Like TOP addressee)

*Expected:*
* The character shows up on the form

*Actual:*
* A question mark shows up on the form

*Setup:*
* Open the SDM
* Create a job
* Connect to the job
* Using SCATA edit a b1, b2, b3, or element
* Enter a french characters into the SDM for one of the texts (both with the English or the french keyboard)
