*Expected:*
* The edited fields continue to show the french characters that were entered
* These changes should be able to be activated

*Actual:*
* The data is being butchered and the french characters are replaced by other characters

Subject: Jms gate hangs
Author: Will Martin
Description:
JMS gate hangs sometimes when it processes messages. We believe this has caused 2 failovers already generating the following output. * Failover 1: 
java.lang.RuntimeException: Operation ef4b6fd2-6325-426b-abf6-7e705e40d0fa timed out.
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jmsgate.JmsGateRpcListener.waitFor(JmsGateRpcListener.java:174)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jmsgate.JmsGateMcsInterface.callRpcOperation(JmsGateMcsInterface.java:243)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jmsgate.JmsGateMcsInterface.getNormalizedState(JmsGateMcsInterface.java:197)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.McsInterface.isMyStateActive(McsInterface.java:94)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.BufferedMessageInterface.handleMessage(BufferedMessageInterface.java:50)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleIOCSMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:210)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:122)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.jms.CsbJmsListener.handleMessage(CsbJmsListener.java:96)
        at ocs.us.core.jms.OcsMessageListener.onMessage(OcsMessageListener.java:58)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doInvokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:543)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.invokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:482)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doExecuteListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:451)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.executeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:423)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.processMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:290)
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$2.onMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:266)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQMessageConsumer.dispatch(ActiveMQMessageConsumer.java:1394)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.dispatch(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:131)
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.iterate(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:202)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133)
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
* Failover 2: For some reason REF,TM,AD, and WM sent LifeCheckAckMessages to CSB but CSB never received them. This caused CSB to never send the life sign to JWDOG and then eventually JWDOG was declared dead. We have added logging and started to reduce the number of times jms gate accesses different functions/memory.

Subject: Toolbar buttons are not staying depressed once a track or train are selected
Author: cn customer
Description:
In CTC the toolbar stays depressed until the execute (right click)
In OCS as soon as you left click on an element like a train id or a track element it is deselected.

*Setup:*
* Logged into a system with tracklines opened.
* Click on a button on the trackline
* Click on a valid first selection for the selected operation on the trackline

*Expected:*
* The button on the TLD stays depressed

*Actual*
* The button on the TLD does not stay depressed

=========================================================================
CAUSE: code error: womanX was calling TlResetToolbar() after processing
of each received r_CIA_REF_Lock message.

RESOLUTION: changed doCIA() function in file tracklinesel.c to not call
TlResetToolbar() after processing r_CIA_REF_Lock message.

Subject: Protect Against PA field is not generated when superseding to overlap limits of other PT or WT
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:
Case 1.
1. Place WT1 from A to B.   
2. Place WT2 from B to C.
3. Select the Supersede function to increase the limits of the WT1 to overlap WT2 and execute.

Expected: Validation passes and the form is updated with a PA.
Actual: Validation passes, but PA is not generated. 

Case 2. (Same but with PTs).
1. Place PT1 from A to B.   
2. Place PT2 from B to C.
3. Select the Supersede function to increase the limits of the PT1 to overlap PT2 and execute.

Expected: Validation passes and the form is updated with a PA.
Actual: Validation passes, but PA is not generated.

Subject: Workstations sharing territory do not see the views on callup list .
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*preconditions*
* no overview screens have an open trackline.

*Steps*
* using bq on the PC COM go into detearea and modify limits (I used the track and switches in DARLING) to be controlled by 3 tec areas (I used 351, 80, 81). Then do a force_data_activation.
* workstation 1 had already control of the devices because it had control or 351.
* workstation 2 has control of tec area 80.
* workstation 3 has control of tec area 81.
* Press the F1 key on each workstation, the quick callup list should include their own view and the view that is shared by the 3 workstations.

*Actual*
* workstation 2 and 3 do not list the shared territory view.

*Expected*
* Quick callup list should include their own view and the view that is shared by the 3 workstations.

*Steps cont.*
* from workstation 1 Place a form in Completed State in the shared territory. 
* from each workstation view the Authority summary and press the All Auth button and the Completed authority should be listed.
* from workstation 2 and 3 select the authority from the summary then the Call Up button. 


*Actual*
* The callup list does not display the view to the shared territory.

*expected*
* The callup list should include the view to the shared territory.

Subject: PT into a siding is removing the train id in the siding if the authority is fulfilled.
Author: cn customer
Description:
When a PT is issued into a siding the system places a "fake" occupancy and Id on the siding.
We had asked for that in order to retain the location of the train in the siding when the authority is fulfilled.

If the train is meeting two or more trains we have to fulfill his authority before we can issue him his after clearance. If the train id is removed on the fulfill there is no easy method to restore this id back to the trackline and the train id is required to issue an authority. Also we do not want to "lose" the train in the siding and forget about them.

It should work like so. Train authority into siding fulfilled. The display keeps the Id and occupancy in the siding. When authority is issued out of the siding for the train then this occupancy and id is removed.
Otherwise the RTC can do a remove train to remove this id in the siding if it is no longer required.

*Actual:*
* The workstation that was disconnected could not create station notes
* The station notes complained about station notes already being opened on channel 6

Subject: Rule failures do not show items in French
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Log into the system as a French user
* Make one of the following rules fail

** Os Report Fulfill Reject:
*** Check for element in limits with form to fulfill is protected by another client

** Generic Initial Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Create, Transmit, Supercede - Check for element in limits with form already protected by someone

** Os Report Create Failed:
*** Check for element in limits with form already protected by someone

** Proceed train create failures:
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for rule105 track
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for CTCMain track
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for CTCSiding track
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for CTC Switch
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for OCS Siding
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for permissions with crossovers outside form limits
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Crossover switches both have permission
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not end on the second switch of a reversed switch pair
*** FilterCheck - Transmit - Check that we do not have a switch permission where an overlapping WT does not have a warning
*** FilterCheck - Transmit - Check for a reversed switch in our limits we do not have a warning on
*** FilterCheck - Create, Validate - Check if user controls start item territory

** Check Proceed Train Create Query:
*** FilterCheck - Validate - Check that we do not have a switch permission where an overlapping WT does not have a warning

** Proceed Train Modify Failed:
*** FilterCheck - PtTransmit - Check for newly cancelled switch warnings that now are in reverse

** Os Report Rollup Reject:
*** Check for element in limits with form to rollup protected by another client

** RTCP Create Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Create, AddLimit - Check for element in limits with form already protected by someone
*** FilterCheck - LimitVal - Check for limits going starting in 105 and ending in OCS or vice versa
*** FilterCheck - LimitVal - Check if we span an ocs siding
*** FilterCheck - LimitVal - Check if we span ctc
*** FilterCheck - Create, Validate - Check if user controls start item territory

** Switch Report Create Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Create - Check for Overlapping Train Authority With Reverse Switch Permission

** Top Create Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for rule105 track
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for No Top track
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for OCSSiding track in middle of limits
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for CTC in limits
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check that we do not end on the second switch of a reversed switch pair
*** FilterCheck - Create, Validate - Check if user controls start item territory

** Top Supercede Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for rule105 track
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for No Top track
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for OCSSiding track in middle of limits
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for CTC in limits
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check that we do not end on the second switch of a reversed switch pair
*** FilterCheck - Supercede, Validate - Check if user controls start item territory

** Work Train Create Failed:
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for rule105 track
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for CTC in limits
*** FilterCheck - Validate, Transmit - Check for OCS Siding
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check for permissions with crossovers outside form limits
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Crossover switches both have permission
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not end on the second switch of a reversed switch pair
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not take a switch reverse that has an overlapping WT without a warning
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not take a switch reverse that has an overlapping PT without a warning
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not have a switch permission where an overlapping PT does not have a warning
*** FilterCheck - Transmit, Validate - Check that we do not have a switch permission where an overlapping WT does not have a warning
*** FilterCheck - Transmit - Check for a reversed switch in our limits we do not have a warning on

** Work Train Modify Failed:
*** FilterCheck - WtTransmit - Check for newly cancelled switch warnings that now are in reverse



* Look at the error message

*Expected:*
* The whole message is in French

*Actual:*
* The item text is in English

Subject: Webgraph - Archival Playback does not work.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:

1. Open IE11 browser and go to 
http://192.168.222.37/cnOcsWebApps.html
(Web graph link)

Subject: Non contiguous limits shall not combine
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show that:
*Worktrain over Worktrain*
* When a work train is placed over 2 or more contiguous work trains for the same train the limits are combined. (existing functionality before story completion)
* When a work train is placed over 2 or more non contiguous work trains for the same train the limits are not combined.
* When a work train is placed over 2 or more contiguous work trains for different trains the limits are not combined. (existing functionality before story completion)

*Top over Top*
* When a top is placed over 2 or more contiguous tops for the same foremen the limits are combined. (existing functionality before story completion)
* When a top is placed over 2 or more non contiguous tops for the same foremen the limits are not combined.
* When a top is placed over 2 or more contiguous tops for different foremen the limits are not combined. (existing functionality before story completion)

Subject: Traingraph should use log4j
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Traingraph was changed recently to provide more logging information about the SQL queries traingraph executes (as part bug fix for #12288 )...the problem encountered in doing this is that the newer log4j2 that we use for our java apps cannot be used with Tomcat 5.0.xxx, and using System.out.println() adds  much noise to the tomcat/logs/catalina.out file; so, within JSP files that query oracle, we changed System.out to write to tgi.<filename_jsp.log> files in /home/logs.

we currently are writing to separate files so we don't have to append and watch the output from each jsp page get improperly and incomprehensively interleaved into the logfile; also, by not appending we don't have to be concerned with the files growing forever, though this does mean that we only get logs of the last page invocations.

Steps:

1. initiate a TGI session
2. do ls -lrt in /home/logs on the webserver

Actual:
1. There are several tgi.*.log files present (e.g. tgi.DataUpdate_jsp.log, tgi.TgSelectData_jsp.log, etc)
2. The tgi.* files are overwritten each time a new TGI session is launched.

Expected:

1. there should be one traingraph.log file in /home/logs
2. the traingraph.log file is recycled as our other java apps via log4j config file

Note:
supposedly what should just work is:
1. download apache log4j and commons jar files that are old enough to work with tomcat B.C.
2. add a log4j.properties (or xml) file to Traingraph/WEB-INF/classes setup to recycle the file
3. ensure the log4j files are deployed to the webserver along with the rest of Traingraph, into Traingraph/WEB-INF/lib
4. remove the sys-out redirects added for #12286 and replace with log4j setup constructs
5. change System.out.println()'s to LOG.debug (or whatever level is proper for the message)

ER, ACTUALLY(regarding item 1 in the above note)...WEBPlayback's WBPDao.java class writes log messages to /home/logs/Webplayback.log) [which means this guy must already have a log4j that works, but one folder has v1.8 and another has v1..jar ]

Subject: database fails to mount
Author: Will Martin
Description:
On runup of the ADM when dum was synchronizing the adms, the synchronization of Tearpkg failed due to a -33 error. This -33 error is caused by a relation not being mounted. The purpose of this bug is to check the SYP1 page size on the customer side to see if we are getting close to the limits of this page. Please attach the current current limit as well as the usage if possible and bump up the page size if necessary. 

Jun 30 10:51:31 sdm2ocdv dum   : [ID 785502 user.info]     3 ZERA            146                         51:26.04
Jun 30 10:51:31 sdm2ocdv dum   : [ID 945163 user.error]  3013 DBCack          -33          0              51:26.37
Jun 30 10:51:31 sdm2ocdv dum   : [ID 804368 user.error]  3014 TEARPKG        daba          0   sdm1       51:26.37
Jun 30 10:51:31 sdm2ocdv mcs   : [ID 783979 user.error] dum: abort spare update of ticket 1, AP1: flag= -1   51:28.17
Upon further review. It looks like the procedure DoSigOtherComState() in acop.p is writing to these relations on the spare adm (TEARPKG, PKGVIEW, CARIGHT) before dum gets a chance to copy them. We believe this causes these errors. This DoSigOtherComState() should not trigger when the Other Com State change is the spare coming up. Both Will or Peter V. can help if more information is needed.

Subject: webXXX data management/maintenance scripts not functioning correctly
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
The cron jobs and scripts that manage the cleanup and offloading of oracle data between the web1, web2, and web3 oracle SIDS are not working as expected(as observed on the OCS2 test system with web2ocs as the web server).

Expected:

* the webpbddel script should remove data from web1 on the hot/primary ADM server which is older than 3 days(should be executed from CleanRecData script setup as nightly cron job)
* the webpbddel script should also do to the svg files on the spare ADM the same as it does on the primary ADM (in other words, remove from the spare what it removes from the primary)
* the webpbddel script should remove data from web2 on the WEBSERVER which is older than 3 days(should be executed from CleanRecData script setup as nightly cron job)
* the webpbexp script should export data which is older than 30 days from web3 on the WEBSERVER to a file which can be re-mported later by the webpbimp script

Actual:
* the CleanRecData script is not installed with the executable bit ON; when it is chmod +x'd and run, it works so far as cleaning up the web1 SID, but it does nothing with the SVG files on the spare(which makes the SVG file sets out of sync between the primary and spare ADMs)
* quick SQL query revealed MEDI event records older than 3 days on both the web1 and web2 sids
* another quick check showed that the web3 sid was not running, which means the webpbexp script cannot do its job
* unable to check webpbimp because of the above

Subject: [HOLD] Train graph will get confused if same form number is used within 5 hours
Author: Will Martin
Description:
When we place and cancel many forms in the system, if the form number rolls over within five hours (this can be achieved when reduce the number of form numbers that are available to REFs pool of form numbers) TGI will not find the correct authority. When we click on the authority to bring up the authority view, the wrong authority view will be displayed. 

Sean says that the easiest thing to do is to bump the time stamps, up to gmt in a way, by the difference of the system time and gmt on the authority table. This would require changes to java and train graph as well as any other systems we have or CN has to read the authority archive tables.

Author: Alex Plotkin
Description:
Note: The list below is not really accurate for instance relations like detearea and teartext are full of dummy records that have not be used. but atleast its a start.

Requirement SRS.699 The system contain 20% spear capacity per Vicos relation. This number is based on the database entries needed for SAT

-CVAUT ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-CVCYCPAR ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-

-CVINDICA ENTRIES=13 records=12  used 92 %-
-CVSPOPRO ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-DBSTATUS ENTRIES=2 records=2  used 100 %-
-DMSCOORD ENTRIES=4 records=4  used 100 %-
-DTCOWO ENTRIES=201 records=192  used 96 %-
-FKTEXT ENTRIES=250 records=223  used 89 %-
-GSIMPARA ENTRIES=30 records=24  used 80 %-
-KIM ENTRIES=192 records=192  used 192 %-
-LIDIHL ENTRIES=70 records=57  used 81 %-
-LIDIRELA ENTRIES=12003 records=12003  used 100 %-
-LIDIRELB ENTRIES=36018 records=36018  used 100 %-
-LIDIRELC ENTRIES=9009 records=9009  used 100 %-
-LIDIRELD ENTRIES=6834 records=6834  used 100 %-
-LIDIRELE ENTRIES=32004 records=32004  used 100 %-
-LIDISP ENTRIES=71 records=71  used 100 %-
-LOCKTA ENTRIES=13 records=12  used 92 %-
-LOGTEXT ENTRIES=90 records=80  used 88 %-
-LTLFPARA ENTRIES=3 records=3  used 100 %-
-MAKEY ENTRIES=400 records=338  used 84 %-
-MECLNAME ENTRIES=16 records=15  used 93 %-
-MELIVDAT ENTRIES=71 records=60  used 84 %-
-MTLFPARA ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-MVACTISA ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-MVCYCLUS ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-MVHYST ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-MVINFO ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-NX ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-NXPRE ENTRIES=256 records=195  used 97 %-
-ORDNAME ENTRIES=70 records=65  used 92 %-
-PKGVIEW ENTRIES=127 records=127  used 100 %-
-PMIO ENTRIES=12 records=12  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELA ENTRIES=2406 records=2406  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELB ENTRIES=2211 records=2211  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELC ENTRIES=1616 records=1616  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELD ENTRIES=19208 records=19208  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELE ENTRIES=19649 records=19649  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELF ENTRIES=3131 records=3131  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELG ENTRIES=2211 records=2211  used 100 %-
-PRDIRELH ENTRIES=10002 records=10002  used 100 %-
-PRDISP ENTRIES=101 records=101  used 101 %-
-PRINTDAT ENTRIES=11 records=10  used 90 %-
-PRINTLIN ENTRIES=4411 records=4411  used 100 %-
-PRLIVDAT ENTRIES=158 records=88  used 88 %-
-PROIND ENTRIES=72 records=72  used 100 %-
-REGKOF ENTRIES=784 records=784  used 100 %-
-RELUSAGE ENTRIES=1000 records=840  used 84 %-
-SANWTXT ENTRIES=512 records=317  used 62 %-
-SIMDAY ENTRIES=4368 records=4368  used 100 %-
-SLFGLOB ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-STLFPARA ENTRIES=9 records=9  used 100 %-
-TANOKU ENTRIES=48 records=48  used 100 %-
-TCDDCDVM ENTRIES=1 records=1  used 100 %-
-TEARPKG ENTRIES=300 records=300  used 100 %-
-TEARTEXT ENTRIES=1000 records=1000  used 100 %-
-TIMEFORM ENTRIES=20 records=19  used 95 %-
-TOOLDATA ENTRIES=10 records=9  used 90 %-
-TOOLNAME ENTRIES=100 records=88  used 88 %-
-VADETAI ENTRIES=700 records=654  used 93 %-
-VADETAM ENTRIES=570 records=564  used 98 %-
-VAREDES ENTRIES=60 records=60  used 100 %-

=====================================================================================================================================
Resolution:
The analysis showed that none of the listed relations need to be resized to address the requirement of "growing capacity" for the life system of 20%.
Reasons for this finding are manifold:
  1. Some of the relations are part of the base platform functionality supporting Energy Market applications and are not used for CN OCS, at all (e.g. measured value / counter value configuration).
  2. Some relations describe static system configuration aspects. These relations have been configured for CN OCS and will never change throughout the lifetime of this system.
  3. Some of the relations are of a specific meta-structure that ALWAYS shows 100% fill level, even if the relation is completely empty.
  4. Some relations are padded with "spare records" and provide ample space (i.e. more than 50% spare capacity) for additional growth if necessary.
Only one relation, SANWTXT, was modified. SANWTXT contained outdated records. The relation was re-initialized and refilled with actual project data. It now shows a spare capacity of 38%.
Analyzing the database further it showed that those relations that constitute the "process image" (e.g. tracks, switches, and similar devices) have enough capacity to cover roughly 4x the currently modeled territory.
=====================================================================================================================================

Subject: DST - OS reporting does not function after daylight savings spring forward
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*Steps to clean system and change the system time* * Change date to March 12 01:30 2017 on all box # /home/s/sys/trd/ImOraCleanTrainRecord # cdm; STOPSOS # cd prj # clear-mnesia-tables.sh # rm ?r /home/auth/* # su (need to enter root password) # cd /home/s/sadm/inst/SUN4s2/bs_scripts # ./IU999OccInstall install (for NTP only use localhost) @ Do you want to do (y/n)[y]: Do you have NTP server IP [y]: Enter NTP server IP [XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX]: 127.127.1.0 no answer from 127.127.1.0 Cannot ping this 127.127.1.0 ip, do you want continue? [y]: Do you have more NTP server IP [y]: n@ 9. "Ctrl+c out of the script" 10. date 0312013017 11. su ? spsy 12. cdm; INITSOS *Steps to create bug* * Complete a PT on CAPI2/CVLD/N1TK/TRA (completed time 01:44) * OS report mile 28 at 01:45 * wait for the DST spring forward to 03:00 * OS report mile 30 at 01:44 - should be rejected * OS report mile 30 at 01:45 - should be rejected * OS report mile 30 at 01:46 - this is ok * OS report mile 30 at 01:59 - this is ok * OS report mile 30 at 02:46 *Expected* * The OS time should be allowed. *Actual* * The OS time is rejected, status messages says "Entered Year does not match its date format" NOTE: * Instead of re-configuring the system to disable the ntp you could just disable ntp using the following commands: * disable: 

# svcadm disable ntp
* Enable: 

# svcadm enable ntp
=========================================================================================== CAUSE: code error - logic to convert HHmm time string into data string was unable to handle daylight savings time phase changes because of calls to Calendar methods(which also fall well short of correctly handling). ============================================================================================= RESOLUTION: DateValidatingJText widget was changed to hold a timeZone, and pass it on to DateUtils.java logic to convert HHmm time string, which was changed to return a java Date based on the input timeZone - which is now assigned from OsReportBox based on the OS location being reported(i.e. the location out in the field). Changed OsTimeValidationAugmenter readDateFromFields method to convert entered date and time fields into Date representation basked on input timeZone/daylight savings status, and to flag as invalid times within the 2 o'clock hour on spring forward. NOTE: the dateTime handling should really be refactored, but I didn't think it would make much sense to do that without first updating to Java 8, which has purportedly finally fixed the shortcomings of having to use Date and Calendar.

Subject: Spectrum can detect lan status change
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* There are two new static infos for LAN A and LAN B
* When a lan goes down its respective info is turned on
* When a lan comes back its respective info is turned back off


* If a machine cannot be pinged both lans are marked as dead
* Coma will use the static infos to determine the lan status
* This can all be achieved through a script running on the coms
** The script can be started on Initsos
** The script can be stopped on Stopsos
** The script can rsh into all machines in the cluster and check the lan status of each machine

Subject: RTCP supersede is not allowed if start item is not in controlled territory

*expected*
* the supersede form to display.

=============================================================================================================
CAUSE: rule error

RESOLUTION: added isSuperseding condition to rule in checkRtcpCreateFail.drl that checks for controlled start item, so that it does not fail if proposed RTCP is superseding (there is a superseding rule that executes afterward that will catch if no items are controlled); added isSuperseding flag to ProposedFormAdaptor and function to detect in FactFinder. (added tests are in ExecuteRulesOnRtcpLimitsActionHandlerTest.java)

Subject: Max number of forms limit not updated to config file value
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Scenario:

Precondition: a fresh install distributed system (or at least one where all authorities have been cleaned out)

Steps:

1. Startup system and wait for COMs to become hot with each other (PC complete and SB complete).
2. BEFORE creating any forms, failover the COMs.
3. AFTER the failover, repeatedly create any type of authority form (RTCProtections the easiest to do quickly).

Expected:

System allows creation of up to MaximumAuthorityNumber value as defined in the ref.properties file

Actual:

Once the number of forms in the system reached 50 - the MaximumAuthorityNumber default value as defined in the REF spring file -  the system throws NoAvailableFormNumberException with message "the system has run out of available form numbers" when attempting to create a new form.

Explanation:

The machine that becomes the PC COM is taking the max authority number value from SequentialAuthorityNumberGenerator cached in Mnesia; this object is initialized with values configured in spring but under this scenario is never updated with the configuration file value because:
> the writing of the max auth number value out to mnesia would normally have been triggered by form creation(since no forms were created before the failover, no  update was triggered.
> the configuration file is not re-read by the new PC COM after failover.

Subject: PT not showing up in track release section of OS report over a subdivision boundary
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
*Steps*

* Create PT from west switch of Darling to Hotmail station
* Create a second PT from Hotmail station to Google station
* Create an OS report at Google station on the second PT
* Enter an OS time that is after the complete date of both PTs

*Expected*
* Both PTs should be in the candidate list

*Actual*

* Only the second PT is in the candidate list

Note: A message in the ref.log file states the PT 1 is ahead of the OS location; this is not true. We are speculating it has something to do with going from a subdivision of increasing mileages to a subdivision with decreasing mileages

====================================================================================================
CAUSES:
1. code error: the rule that checks if PT is out ahead of the OS'd location was flagging the first PT as having
limits with increasing mileages and erroneously disqualifying the first as rollup candidate.
2. configuration error: the COMPANY subdivision mileages in at least one place are incorrect: the M2TK track (immediately to the user's left of the KnownPoint at HOTMAIL) has E_S mile 7700/W_N mile 7674, but the WSW switch
(immediately to left of M2TK) has mileage of 7823; for all devices within the same sub, mileages should be either increasing or decreasing from each device to the next when traversed in the same direction. (It looks like the west switch mileage might have been mixed up with that for the east switch)

RESOLUTION: changed aforementioned rule to take subdivision into consideration when checking
for increasing/decreasing selection, by using only devices from the first PT that are in
same sub as the OS reported item. 

Also, The mileages for the switches were corrected using SDM on db1cn (not pushed) and bld1cn.

Subject: Switches on sidings/tracks showing incorrectly in Web Trackline
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Test case 290.   5:30 pm. 

Steps:
1. Open web trackline.  Choose subdivision and click submit. 
I tested in MontJoli sub, but almost all of them are showing up incorrectly. 

Expected: tracks show sidings and switches. 
Actual :  sidings and switches are showing up incorrectly, - has some line sticking out of sidings, 
and some siding have holes in them. 

This problem seems to be fixed with database changes. This should be rejected. If there are other problems with webtracklines' display, we should issue a new bug.

This bug was not fixed with any database changes. This bug was fixed on the FAT system by failing over the adms and possibly clearing out the tables.

================================================================================================================
UNABLE TO REPRODUCE: the original problem was likely indirectly "fixed" when an update to the SVG files was triggered - either by database update(or backout of bad CN update), or separate bug fix to the ftpsvg script.

the web2ocs webserver was hooked up as the web-server for the development distributed system (adm1cn, adm2ocs2 , etc), and 2 other issues were observed (and a new bug created and resolved for one of them).

1. the ftpsvg script could not handle the name of the new T7 web-server(see bug #13411)
2. the /home/svgd directory was found missing from the spare ADM on the test system; this will cause the svgexp to be unable to create the svgd file; the directory is created during init_spectrum, which we investigated; re-ran init_spectrum on the spare dev system adm with the other ADM STOPSOS'd and it created the directory as expected. Looking at the init_spectrum script, it appears the only way it should fail is if the SpecHost is borked, which could be before-spectrum thing, but in any case it looks like either an install issue or perhaps the folder was simply deleted by mistake at some point.

Subject: Web Trackline showing xxxXXXXXXxxx everywhere on each map.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
**Test case 290. 5 pm. Web functions. Steps: 1. click on web trackline. 2. choose a subdivision. (I used Mont Joli, but any other subdivision are showing up the same). 3. choose date, check Authorities checkmark, and click submit. 4. Web trackline screen opens and it has xxxXXXXXxxx everywhere. Expected - xxxXXXXxxx is not showing up on the screen. Note: Authorities are showing up correctly. If choose date range more then 5 days back - xxxXXXXXxxx is not showing up. *================================================================================== CAUSE:* web database maintenance scripts not being installed to /home/s/sys, and also not executing automatically when installed; this causes the SID to near it's capacity and data inserts to eventually start failing; events that occurred thereafter were not recorded; thus there was not snapshot data for the time selected and the tracklines ID fields could not be properly initialized. There is a disconnect here between how our test system webserver box is updated as compared to how CN's test system webserver is done, and also between CN's test system webserver and their production system webserver. * On our development/test systems the web server installs apparently used the Grafik configuration, which means that the web maintenance scripts are not included in any subsequent UPDASOS. * the CleanRecData script run from the cron calls the webpbdel script(that was missing) with a -f argument, which tells the script to only take care of svg files and not do anything with the oracle table data. * CN's test and production system webservers do not use UPDASOS; therefore the install instructions will need to be updated(see resolution section). * CN's production system webserver has a differerent crontab entry that doesn't even call the CleanRecData script; instead it calls a script named doDumpArchive that manages the web2 svg files and database tablespace by calling the webpbbexp script with sensible start/end-date and export-filename arguments (the export script also removes the records from the tables); this doDumpArchive script is already present in /home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- *RESOLUTION:* Be aware that this bug was written to report the same problem on all web application trackline displays(both WEBPlayback and WEBTracklines use the same svg representations - when checking WEBTracklines, there is no option to enter a date/time). for our webserver's (web2ocs and web3ocs) * re-ran init_spectrum and selected WEB at the 'Enter Spectrum configuration file' prompt( i.e. config_WEB); then did UPDASOS, to copy the following files into the/home/s/sys: >webpbddel >webpbdexp >webpbdimp * (the UPDASOS currently also copies webarch and webexp, but these are spectrum programs that do not need to be on the webserver...) * Ensure that that web3 SID is up and - as root - run the /home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX/doDumpArchive script to: ** copy existing svg files to a backup folder in /tmp/WebDataBackup_* ** collect old records from tables and export them to file(compressed) under /home/db_archive/<4-digit-year>/<3-letter-month-abbrev>/ (e.g /home/db_archive/2016/OCT/23/23OCT16-04:00-08:00.Z) * Ensure that the following line(s) is added to the webserver's crontab: 
# Create playback archives only if web type server on WEB
30 23 * * * [ "`uname -n|cut -c1-3`" = "web" ] && [ -x /home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX/doDumpArchive ] && /bin/su - spsy -c "/home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX/doDumpArchive" 2>&1
This crontab line should replace the line which calls CleanRecData. *FOR CN's WEBSERVER:* We need to make sure that steps are included with the installation instructions for webservers, i.e.: To ensure that the web2 oracle sid does not become full and unable to record new events: * the webpb* scripts must be copied from the ADM's(or build machine's) /home/s/src/code/tsbase/svg/webexp folder to the webserver's /home/s/sys fold * the crontab line which calls CleanRecData script must be replaced with the follwing line in the webserver's crontab: 
# Create playback archives only if web type server on WEB
30 23 * * * [ "`uname -n|cut -c1-3`" = "web" ] && [ -x /home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX/doDumpArchive ] && /bin/su - spsy -c "/home/s/GLOB/bin/SPUX/doDumpArchive" 2>&1
FINALLY, please beware that when I tried to run webpddimp to re-import the exported tables into the web3, it appeared that ALL of the HIS*_EVENTS records went into the SS*EVENT tables instead of being loaded into HIS*_EVENTS; I did not try to address this problem at this point in time, since there is another bug assigned to CN_CUSTOMER dealing with the maintenance scripts not working correctly...in other words, the above resolution will take care of this particular bug, but no more; also beware that the webpbdexp script currently logs progress to file under /tmp/WebDataBackup_nnnn, but removes the logs on exit(this should've been done differently - it would be nice to have at least the logs for the prior execution)

Subject: Train forms should not be created if addressee could not be created
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Notes:*
* If the database is not configured correctly the system will currently allow the user to create and issue a form that does not have a valid addressee. We do not want to allow this form to be issued.

*Setup:*
* Create a parking spot as described in database bug #13269
* Put a train into this parking spot
* Use this parking spot to create a work train or a proceed train

*Expected:*
* The form never comes up
* There is an error dialog that comes up stating "Could not find train"

*Actual:*
* The form comes up with no addressee
* There is no error

Subject: TLD views not initializing for Playback - duplicate - see 12551 resolution
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1. Execute some operations that affect the TLD on the system(e.g. complete some forms); then wait for about 5 minutes.
2. Select the playback option from the CN OCS WebApplications page, and then from the Playback Config page, select the subdivsion where operations were performed in step 1 above.

Expected:
playback opens with the items on its trackline views initialized according to the snapshot taken closest to the playback start time.

Actual: playbacks trackline views are not initialized(have XXXXX in all ID fields).

Explanation: the ../GLOB/bin/CleanRecData script that is supposed to be run on the ADM and WEB boxes is not installed with the executable permission turned on; this caused the SSMEDI_EVENTS table(and possibly others) to fill to the point where its index's could not be extended, which in turn caused the snapshot() stored procedure to fail - leaving no snapshots for the attempted playback period from which to initialize the TLD views.

UPDATE - see resolution for duplicate bug 12551... it was more invlovled than the above explanation

Subject: French Issues
Author: cn customer
Description:
1. Train Record comments from OS report form are displayed in ALL CAPS and the accented characters are not displaying with accents
* The add comment through train record is in ALL CAPS, can the OS report be left that way? - Comments are in all caps as in CTC

2. Siding East Switch "at" Fred in French is displaying "et" and should be "à"

3. On a protect against PT over PT (same direction) "Avancer" should be "Avançant"

4. Switch report form issues (see picture)
rapporte que l'aig 
et cadenassé et ce l`emplacement de l`aiguillage

5. Mileage prompt at bottom of switch report screen
`Le destinataire doit .....

6. Display message line
?Aucune instruction définie pour autres interventions
?Aucune Action définie pour cette selection.

7. Pop-up: Log-off not allowed. Authority Form is open for editing!
Fermeture de session interdite, trasfert de territoire en
Fermeture de session interdite, formulaire en cours d`émission
- Solution: put this string back to what it was in CTC

8. Pop-up cutting off message: Territory assigne to console - log of prohibited
Territoire affecté à cette console, fermeture de session i;
Territoire affecté à cette console, fermeture de session interdite.

9. Station Notes screen not the same as the CTC version.

10. Emergency Transfer screen. Not the same as the CTC version

11. Territory Transfer screen not the same as CTC

12. General Summary screen should be `sommaire general

13. TOP form. button Continuer should be Compléter

14. When removing a train from a siding where there is no train.Au
 Aucun trin dans la s (funny characters) lection should be `selection.

Note: Search the language files for '©' character. These cases need to be corrected.

==========================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration errors

RESOLUTIONS: 

1. at least one of the mmi workstation installs did not include the correct version of the Profile_0150.spectrum_oracle script; the incorrect version had the setting of the NLS_LANG environment variable commented out; the oracle forms require NLS_LANG=AMERICAN_AMERICA.WE8ISO8859P1 to correctly process accented characters, otherwise oracle erroneously attempts to convert them and fails in doing so( this can be checked by doing 'env | grep NLS' from a shell on each mmi). The earliest svn revision with the correct setting is r174198, as checked in for issue #11945...I did not change the OS report to capitalize all input.

per attached corrections doc...

2, 3, 4, 5, and 13 in REFFormLabels_fr_CA.properties, changed Form.Pt.ProtectAgainstType.PT and Form.Wt.ProtectAgainstType.PT values from Avancer to Avancant;

6, corrected message text in di_usertext.j

7, 8 - it appears that the usertext relation was not correctly initialized; problems did not occur on all8cn after running in change needed for territory transfer report; on test system usertext relation contained truncated strings; suggest we make sure relation is updated with curent *.j file content.

9, 10, 11, 12 - was informed by Sean that Rhona will be doing the changes that require changing database thru SDM tool.


13. in REFFormLabels_fr_CA.properties, changed Button.CompleteLabel value from Continuer to Compléter;

14. in TMClientLabels_fr_CA.properties, replaced all 'Ã©' character pairs with é(also replaced the 'Ã' at end of word deja with à).

also:

in REFFormLabels_fr_CA.properties changed Form.State.COMPLETED value from Complété à to Complété.

replaced 'Sommaire de inverser position des aiguillages' with 'Sommaire des aiguillages en position renversée' in di_usertext.j'; running in the dot-j file for this(and #6 above) change apparently corrects the problems with message strings being truncated(see items 7 and 8 above)...one such case in the attached document is incorrect in that it states that the french message shown should correspond to the english message output when trying to logoff while there is a form open(the example given occurs when trying to logoff while a TerritoryTransferReport is open; in either case the messages are same as for CTC now)

Subject: Parking Spot Editor/Table must contain subdivision numbers
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Current Functionality:*
* The parking spot editor currently has drop downs for B1Name for the current and next subdivision fields. 
* These B1Names are then stored in the database. 
* When a train approach message comes in the B1Name is converted to B1Number and compared to the current and next subdivision numbers provided in the message


*Desired Functionality:*
* The parking spot editor should have fields for subdivision numbers for the current and next subdivision fields.
** These fields will not be validated for subdivision validity.
** These fields should validate their input as numbers 
* These numbers should then be stored in the database. 
* When a train approach message comes in the numbers in the database should be compared to the current and next subdivision numbers provided in the message

Subject: Protect against boxes showing both static text regardlss if a "working or Proceeding restrction
Author: cn customer
Description:
System Gen Restriction or added restriction static text (Between/From and And/To) should be specific to the "working or Proceeding" If Restiction is working only show Between / and text. If Restriction is Proceeding only show From / To text.

RTC's must read all static text and they feel this may be confusing to the field.


This applies to work trains and proceed trains in both the automatic protect against and manual protect against case.

==================================================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration error (the From-To and Between-And resource strings were combined); also code error: since the
resource strings were not separated there was no code to supported switching from the labels used when protecting Working entities vs Proceeding.

RESOLUTION: retained the combined resource strings for use in naming the start and endlimt fields' label components; added separate bi-lingual resource strings for From, Between, To, And; changed ProtectAgainstBox.java code to update the label component text values with the new resource strings when the type of overlapping limit is set.

Subject: auth-cleanout.sh is broken
Author: Will Martin
Description:
* On a system that is configured to be update mode 0
* Run the auth-cleanout.sh script located in prj

*Expected:*
* The auth-cleanout script clears mnesia on both coms and both adms

*Actual:*
* The auth-cleanout script only clears mnesia on the primary adm that the release was installed on.

*Reason:*
* The script calls a clear_mnesia_tables.sh script which is located in the ocs.us code directory. This directory is not on any of the other servers.

=========================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - the culprit script called by the cleanout script is in a source code
folder that is present only on development machines...the script holds obvious dangers for the production
system, and since the test system reflects the production system the folder containing the source code for the script is absent on the test system.

RESOLUTION: changed the cleanout script to directly call the clear_mnesia_tables.erl script that is
in /home/s/sadm/scripts/erl_scripts instead of calling it indirectly through the clear_mnesia_tables.sh
script in the source code folder that is not present on test and production systems.


RESOLUTION:

Subject: CDLS (OTAU) logs are not displaying the french accented characters
Author: cn customer
Description:
CDLS logging french accents not displaying correctly


==================================================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration error and code error; system locale "sometimes" set LC_CTYPE to en_US.UTF-8; this was especially evident on mmi boxes where the latest Profile_0150.spectrum_oracle script had not been installed... many "external" readers expect ISO-8859-1, causing character conversion problems not only for CDLS, but for oracle forms as well.

RESOLUTION: replaced earlier correction that passed of hard-coded ISO-8859-1 charset parameter with call to new CharSetUtil getSystemDefaultCharset() method, which returns the default character set assigned at VM startup based on system locale(and also outputs to app log a warning message that locale may not be set correctly if result is not ISO-8859-1). earlier resolution for bug #13258 says to ensure the locale configuration is setup correctly by the install(we should do more to clean this part up though, i.e. to make sure we have canadian parameters are used consistently instead of mixing some US/America with some CA)

Subject: RTCP listing original forms limits in overlap box on supersede
Author: cn customer
Description:
RTCP1 with multiple limits non contiguous.
Supersede RTCP1 over an existing RTCP2 and it is listing all of the original RTCP1 in the overlap including limits that are not in the overlap. It should only list RTCP2 it is overlapping

*Setup:*
* Place a restrictive RTCP (RTCP1) over 2 separate limits
* Initiate a restrictive RTCP (RTCP2) over some limits
* Add a limit to RTCP2 that overlaps RTCP1
* Press validate limits

*Expected:*
* There is a warning for the limit in RTCP2 that overlaps RTCP1

*Actual:*
* There is a warning for each limit on the RTCP2 form. stating that each limit overlaps RTPC1

*Steps:*
* Finish placing RTCP2 (now has 2 limits)
* Supercede RTCP1
* Add a limit to the RTCP1 which overlaps RTCP2

*Expected:*
* There should be 2 overlapping limits therefore two warnings

*Actual:*
* There are 3 warnings. Making it look like the RTCP2 is overlapping RTCP1 over all 3 limits

Subject: OS fulfill a PT that has clearances in and out of a siding leaves ID in the siding
Author: cn customer
Description:
PT into Siding puts train id on siding which is correct. Then issue a PT for same train out of siding (Id remains on the siding. When the PT is fulfilled the train id is left in the siding even though the train has an existing PT leaving this siding. It should only leave the PT id in the siding if their only PT authority is being fulfilled. If they have another PT authority leaving the siding when the PT into the siding is fulfilled the ID should be removed.

*Setup:*
* Place a Proceed train into a siding
* Place a second proceed train for the above train out of the siding
* Os report the second proceed train so both proceed trains are rolled up fullfilled

*Actual:*
* The proceed train id stays in the siding

*Expected:*
* There are 3 possible cases
** If there will be a proceed train or work train after the os report for the train (either there were actually 3 forms and 2 were fulfilled, or the second proceed train was rolled up but not fulfilled
*** The system should remove the proceed train id from the siding
** If the train is showing up in the parking spot
*** The system should remove the proceed train id from the siding
** Both proceed trains are fulfilled, the train is not in a parking spots and there are no other forms for the train (proceed train or work train)
*** The system should leave the proceed train ids in the sidings

Subject: TOP or RTCP only on siding is added the station text to the track field
Author: cn customer
Description:
_Scenario 1_

*Steps*

* Place TOP in siding only

*Expected*

* The On track filed in the limits box should read 'Siding'

*Actual*

* The On track filed in the limits box reads 'Siding <B2 Text>'

_Scenario 2_

*Steps*

* Place RTCP in siding only

*Expected*

* The On track filed in the limits box should read 'Siding'

*Actual*

* The On track filed in the limits box reads 'Siding <B2 Text>'

_Testing Comments_

If I select limits for an RTCP or a TOP just in the siding the limits field should just read ?siding? instead they are reading as ?Siding Watson?. 
 
The only time the siding should have the station name added is if the TOP limits also extend out of the siding onto the main track.  eg. Siding Watson and Main. In CTC this was to clarify to the foreman his limits of authority when a TOP was combined that encompassed both siding(s) and main tracks.

Subject: SPUS logon not bringing mouse to authority form and bringing it in focus and to the front
Author: cn customer
Description:
In CTC the SPUS logon -locks the window so that when an authority form is open it is locked to that display.
It also- it automatically moves the mouse icon to the first field of the form (that may be a authority function though?).

Note: Use the CTC system as a reference point on where the mouse and focus should be


From clarification log:
* When an REF form has focus (report or authority) on the ocs system it should not loose focus when the mouse moves off of the form or onto another screen until another window is clicked on or the form is closed.
* The spsy and spus users will both have the same window focus behavior
* When an REF form is opened the mouse moves to the first field that the user must interact with.
* When the form is in edit mode the mouse moves to the first editable field
* When the form is in read-repeat mode the mouse moves to the first read-repeat field
* When the form is in view mode the mouse does not move when the form opens

Subject: RTCP overlap box on validate over other forms not show you the information but only the form number
Author: cn customer
Description:
RTCP blocking over all other forms is only showing the form number and should tell you Form type and addressee.

*Setup:*
* Place all types of forms in the track line XTOP, TOP, PT, WT, RTCP
* Try to place an RTCP over each form type

*Expected:*
* There is a query dialog on validate limits that informs the user that the RTCP form overlaps the overlapped form
* The message includes the Form Type, Form Number and Addressee/Reason

*Actual:*
* There is a query dialog on validate limits that informs the user that the RTCP form overlaps the overlapped form
* The message includes the Form Type, Form Number

Subject: French Keyboard with caps lock will not allow number selection
Author: cn customer
Description:
French keyboard with caps lock on will not enter the numbers into the form using the numbers at the top of the keyboard (not number pad). We will check function in CTC as well.

Keyboard is IBM French keyboard


*Setup:*
* On a workstation with a french keyboard
* Turn on the caps lock
* Try to use the line of numbers along the top of the keyboard

*Expected:*
* The user can type numbers

*Actual:*
* The computer behavies like the user is holding shift and cannot type numbers anywhere using the numbers at the top of the keyboard.

==================================================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration error - the xkb mapping for french canadian multi-lingual keyboard default behavior is to
make caps-lock key act like shift-lock, applying to all keys instead of only to alphabetic.

RESOLUTION: in the redhatCNOCS_FRENCH.xkb file, changed type for keys <AE01> thru <AE12> from EIGHT_LEVEL_SEMIALPHABETIC to EIGHT_LEVEL

Subject: Switch Report Location field cutting off when text is getting bigger and bolder in transmit
Author: cn customer
Description:
Testing St Jean Sub and I was normalling switches when I noticed it. See attached pictures.

The text in the location is not displaying when it gets bigger and bolder on transmit.

===============================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - the ValidatingJTextPane for location field was being created with no columns argument,
which caused the field length to be truncated at default value of 20; also, the SwitchReportBox was not created
so that it would be wide enough to display the entire location field value when the string became too wide(either by font change or by combination of variable width characters in the field)

RESOLUTION: changed SwitchReportBox to use new MAX_CHARS_SWITCH_REPORT_LOCATION_FIELD constant of 48 when creating the location field; changed SwitchReportView to pass box with of 450dlu to to its base class constructor.Also shortened the length of the jgoodies column for the "reporting" field (this to keep the form from becoming even wider than it has).

Note: the Switch Report for is now considerable wider than it was; the new values used that govern the form's width were based on being able to visibly show up to 18 'W' characters in the "reporting" field, and up to 46 'W' characters in the location field(plus 1 or 2 additional numeric chars); in real practice the location field probably won't need to be so wide; but I wouldn't shorten the addresse/reported-by field any more than was done here, because CN has at various times floated proposals to lengthen fields containing personnel names.

Subject: PT authority generated with out addressee field
Author: cn customer
Description:
Dave was performing a cold start. 
He then told me I was okay to continue testing. I am not sure what state the Coms and Adms were at this time.

I xconneted on ws2 and MMI uw2.
At 1102:43 - I selected a PT authority and the tracking id' on the parking spot at Montjoli. I had 777 and 555 in there with 777 on the top with a box around it. Then I selected limits from M180 to Isle Verte Sw2 and executed.
Instead of getting the overlap box to select my ID. The PT form opened and the addressee was empty.
I typed in the field but not proceed any further than that before aborting and starting over.

When I did the same selection at 1103:17 I received the overlap box and the addressee was populated based off my selection.

Subject: Log directory on workstation does not have the correct permissions
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Install or reinstall a workstation

*Expected:*
* The /home/logs directory has 777 permissions

*Actual:*
* The /home/logs directory cannot be written to by anyone except the root user

=============================================================================
CAUSE: install_users.sh script setting access rights to 664; include.sh not resetting log folder rights to 1777 unless it had to recreate it.

RESOLUTION: changed install_users.sh to set permissions to 777; changed include.sh to reset log folder permission to 1777 if it already existed before the install.

(also added wiki for install/test of such changes on development redhat box ws07cn)

Subject: Os report tool tip does not show in the correct language
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps:*
* Create a PT in a bilingual area with French preferred setting .
* Initiate an OS report. 

*Actual:*
* Enter an invalid time (in past or in the future) & the tool tip / status line message on the form appears in English.
* On incomplete time entry, it switches back to French.

*Expected:*
* All tool tips/status line messages for the French Preferred OS report form should appear in French at all times.

================================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - the UI utility method  user to throw validation exception when date rule validation failed did not take or use a language parameter when looking up the resource string to use for the status line message.

RESOLUTION:changed UiValidationUtils.java method to throw ValidationException to take a language parameter(changed callers accordingly); changed OsReportTimeValidationAugmenter constructor to take Language parameter and pass along to rule runner;

Subject: Exception is thrown while trying to write to TMTLOC
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
*Preconditions*

* System with at least one ADM (PC complete) and two COMs(PC/SB complete)

*Steps*

* Create train
* Create PT form with the new train
* Shutdown all ADMs
* Cancel the PT
* INITSOS PC COM (System should failover)
* Bring up an ADM
* Wait until previous PC COM becomes SB complete and the ADM goes PC complete
* Tail the csbridge log file on the SB COM
* Create new train

*Expected*

* No exception is thrown

*Actual*

* Exception is thrown and printed in csbridge log file on the SB COM


*Impact*

This causes oracle to not receive any TRD updates.

*Development Note*
The issue has been investigated and it is happening because the sender node name is set before the failover and the new PC COM does not overwrite it

Also the writing/deleting to/from TMTLOC should happen only once. Will happen twice if ADMs are down when the message is originally sent (Talk to Sean if you have more questions)

Subject: The train summary shows RE
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This bug will be more for development than testing. Somehow on the test system at CN the train summary showed a train as RE instead of SP/PK or something sensable. We do not know what actions were taken so this will be more of a hunt through code than anything else.

A picture of this behavior is attached. Rhona did mention the following:

When I try open a Train record for this train the entire Train Record is empty as well although the Train Summary displays information

The bug can be reproduced by these steps:

*Steps*

* Create new train
* Create PT form with the train that does not lead into a new parking spot
** The train should no longer be parked/have 'PK' by it on the Train Summary
* Create a comment on the train the exceeds 80 characters
* Cancel the PT Form
** The train should be suspended/have 'SP' by it on the Train Summary
* Retire the train

*Expected*

* The train should be removed from the Train Summary

*Actual*

* The train is not removed
* Train is marked as 'RE'

Subject: supersede over superseded form error message has no form number

Steps 12 and 13

this should work the same for tops, wts, and pts

3 overlapping forms
Superseded number 1
Completed number 2
Unacknowledged number 3


click supced button and select limits over these forms
execute 

current result : POP up listed 3 forms (with form id) last doesn't list form number in message

expected result: POP up listed 3 forms (with form number) form number is shown in all messages 


NOTE:
This seems weird, however it is needed in case you try to do something over a single superseded form. In this case you would not get the form numbers in the front of each error message and would need the form number in the message. This also may affect more than just supersede.

Subject: Workstation form lock up
Author: cn customer
Description:
*Steps*

Subject: New train is not logging in the GE summary or NLS logs
Author: cn customer
Description:
*Setup:*
* Place a new train on the trackline

*Expected:*
* The new train is logged to the GE logs (General Summary) as follows
** S2GE 16:05:20   09.30.16 16:05:19  EDSON     WESTJCT   PARK2     New train 303   SRS M3035130        Dir E L 8,01 W 17,6  WP  uw21

*Actual:*
* The new train is not logged to the GE logs (General Summary)

=========================================================================
CAUSE: code error:  on CTC-RTC2, the tmt process code was extracting both the length and weight from the train consist description and logging the create; in OCS, no java side log code or logic to do similar extraction of tonage from the consist description existed(the only gensum logging was by TM client operations(move, etc) which was well after the fact of the train create).

RESOLUTION: changed TM to log the train create to vicos; this involved several changes...
 * instead of parsing out the tonage value from the consist description string, added it as argument to the messages in the path from the oracle form up to TM(since it was discovered that we had done that earlier for train length).
* also added xid as argument in messages(because it was not there for TM to use as sendLogToVicos() method argument)
* corrected the CTC behavior of logging only first 4 chars of length and weight(including comma's); OCS logs complete values(e.g. W 12,345 instead of CTC's W 12,3)
* created multi-line sanwtxt entry for TM use(similar to REF's general summary entry with all '~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~'
* create bilingual NewTrain resource strings with needed arguments in TMClientProperties files

Subject: PT rejected prior to selecting switches
Author: cn customer
Description:
PT into siding rejected before it can be modifed over a WT without a switch warning. 
Work train from (Mont-Joli) Mile 103.5 to Sayabec without warning on switches. Create a PT from Mile 103.5 into the siding at Padoue. On validate it is rejected and does not present the RTC with the option to remove the switch permission that was automatically added by the system. 

Options: In this case the system could not add the auto permission or can give the RTC a chance to remove it.

*Setup:*
* Normal switches to take normal (as opposed to into siding)
* Place work train over the normal of the switches
* Place a proceed train over the reverse of the switch into the siding
* Validate limits

*Expected:*
* The system generates the permission on the switch into the siding
* The system provides a warning stating that permission cannot be given on the switch
* The system allows the user to remove the permission
* If the user does not remove the permission on the form the user can still press the transmit button on the form (this is not a hard failure on validate limits)
* The system will system abort the form if it is transmitted with the warning (The switch permission is a hard failure on transmit)

*Actual:*
* The system fails hard on the first validate limits and never populates the restrictions. This means that the user cannot remove the switch permission

Subject: Multiple Wk Stn to one MMI - change RTC closes Train functions
Author: cn customer
Description:
When 2 workstations connected to same MMI. Both have train summary open, or new train from or the train record. On the other workstation they select Change RTC and then abort the change RTC The train form on their workstation and the train form on the other workstation both close.


When 2 workstations connected to same MMI. Both have train summary open, or new train from or the train record. On the other workstation they select Change RTC and complete the transfer the train form on the other workstation closes.


*Setup:*
* Log into one MMI with two workstations
* Open up some train forms (new train, edit train, train sumary, train record) on one of the workstations
* Open a change RTC dialog on the other workstation

*Expected:*
* A completed Change RTC operation closes all train forms on the workstation.
* Any Change RTC activities do not affect other workstations

*Actual:*
* A completed Change RTC operation closes all trian forms on the workstation.
* Changing RTC or aborting the Change RTC closes all of the train forms.

*NOTE:*
* It looks like woman is actually killing all train forms on the MMI

Subject: Ws unable to connect causes all WS on that MMI to lockup and then fail
Author: cn customer
Description:
WS6- reported that workstation locked up. He had just finished issuing RTCP-R form and it showed as yellow after he placed his form. He could then not perform any actions on his ws. Then Ws4 also reported being locked up locked up - both are connected to MMI4. All other WS were okay and continued working. 

Then all affected WS went to a blue screen. 

Events at the time were rebooting workstation ws9 after it was switched from SPSY to SPUS. WS is also connected to MMI4. Alex says that the logs from MMI4 were showing failed xconnect errors for that time. 

WS9 was able to connect after the failure he was the original workstation that was switched. WS6 and 4 were changed to SPUS and rebooted because there is no logoff available on SPSY.

Based on the logging and what we have seen in the past it is Siemens belief that there were pingable machines in the spectrum domain, or the global domain, that spsy did not have access rights to. Woman will hang while it attempts to RCP files to all of the machines in the cluster with a CID. If the machine cannot be written to woman will hang until the rcp command times out. At this point it will move on to the next computer in the cluster. If there are many computers that are not writable, woman will eventually hang long enough to think all of its daughters are timed out.

*Steps*
* Add a CID to some of the development machines in the host file
* Attempt to connect to an MMI with a valid workstation

*Expected:*
* The workstation logs in

*Actual:*
* The workstation hangs for around a minout then logs in

Subject: Failover causes by modify of same authority
Author: cn customer
Description:
1322-29 - failover. RTC modify from trackline and then without closing form modified same form from summary. Caused system to failover and locked the form.

*Setup:*
* Create WT form
* Modify and [select] the addressee of the newly create WT from
* Execute
* Select the same WT form from the authority summary
* Select Modif button.
* Error message should appear saying `Only one form open at a time
* Select ok
* Then abort the open WT form

*Expected:*
* The work train form aborts without any ill side effects

*Actual:*
* Kaboom Java exception

=========================================================================
CAUSE: code error - the path taken by the second workflow(the workflow that triggers "only one form at a time" message) was removing the form backup created by the initial modify(the first workflow, which is still pending); when the first workflow is aborted, we normally rollback the form to its previous state using the form backup; the rollback routine threw an exception because there was no longer a backup from which to restore.

RESOLUTION: to prevent removal of the form backup when the "one form at a time" situation occurs, moved the workflow logic that handles form selected from the authority summary into the selection workflow; the Modify, Cancel, and OS Report workflows are affected...Cancel could have caused the same issue; OS Report needed to be done because the change to the selection workflow broke it(needed to be made consistent with the others)


There is probably something wrong with the way the setup is written in the bug report; I was not able to select the form from the summary until it was completed, and was not able to change its addressee after starting a Modify from the TLD(if I did supersede I could change it, but then I couldn't select either the old or the new form from the summary again. It is more likely that they:
> completed a WT
> started a Modify from TLD
> started a Modify from FormSummary

Subject: TOP got follow behind for first train into block
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps 1. complete a PT for a train AAA from some known point A to another known point C (either using mileages or at a place where there is also a known point B in between, such as at SHERBROOKE from ACTON VALE to MILE 74.5); 2. complete a 2nd PT for some train BBB from B to C; 3. initiate a TOP from A to C 
                                         BBB>
|A|                    |B|               AAA> |C|
 |----------|-----------|----------|-----------|
  }---------------PT 1 to AAA ---------------->
                        }--- PT 2 to BBB ----->
  <----- TOP 3 to ????? ---------------------->
4. from TOP form, enter an addressee and click Validate Limits Expected: probably should reject the TOP, or at least the limits validation(not sure how this was to be handled originally) Actual: Limits validation passes and TOP form gets FollowBehind box for train AAA. This means that the TOP addressee has been told he can enter the limits behind train AAA as soon as sees that AAA has gone by him; if the foreperson happens to jump onto the track after seeing AAA go by at a location in between B and C, he could be hit by train BBB.

        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$2.onMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:266) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQMessageConsumer.dispatch(ActiveMQMessageConsumer.java:1394) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]

        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145) [?:1.7.0_111]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615) [?:1.7.0_111]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.7.0_111]
It looks like WM determines what clients to time out on the timer thread and then passes these xId's back to the main thread to remove them. This explains in the logs where wm is being flooded by authorization messages and xId's are being added, removed, added, removed. Instead a message should be sent to the main thread to run a clean up client method that will determine what clients to remove and remove them (that way the client removal calculation is on the same thread as the client alive messages.) The current behavior makes the system attempt to run up then immediately fail over when all of the workstations connect. This can also cause the system to ping pong back and forth on a failover.

Subject: Com failover from coma
Author: Will Martin
Description:
_Obsolete Begin_

*Info/Resources:*
* Core File: /CNOCS/Backups/Logs/coreE_rtc1ocs_coma.23243
* Com Logs: /CNOCS/Backups/Logs/Logs_080616.tar.gz
* Time:13:17

*Steps:*
* User is a dispatcher controlling territory on a workstation
* User performs a change RTC
* User goes to COMA on a technician workstation
* User finds ttr lock on COMA display for users desk and deletes it
* Coma drops a core file
* System fails over
* Core file is created

_Obsolete End_

_Scenario 1_

*Steps*

* Open two CoMa displays
* Transfer a territory so a TTR lock shows up on the CoMa displays
* Select the lock on both displays
* On both displays, select 'Yes' to the delete this lock question

*Expected*

* The lock is deleted

*Actual*

* CoMa core dumps

_Scenario 2_

*Steps*

* Open two CoMa displays
* Transfer a territory so a TTR lock shows up on the CoMa displays
* Transfer a second territory so there are two TTR locks on the CoMa displays
* Select the same lock on both displays
* On both displays, select 'Yes' to the delete this lock question

*Expected*

* The lock is deleted

*Actual*

* CoMa core dumps

Description:
*Setup:*

* Select device in form limits
* Execute

*Expected:*

*Actual:*

Subject: TOP over multiple PT where they are overlapping in part only list the firs train and not the trailing train in the FB box
Author: cn customer
Description:
TOP over multiple PT with different limits but only displaying the first PT id (unsafe condition) Instead should reject and list trains overlapping so that the RTC can resolve it.

PT1 from A to D
PT2 from C to D
TOP from B to D only lists PT1 in the follow behind which creates the potential for the foreman to get between trains.

*Setup:*
* Place PT1 from A to D
* Place PT2 from C to D
* Place TOP from B to D

!text4516.png!

*Expected:*
* REF rejects the TOP being placed
* There is a validation message that lists all overlapping proceed trains.

*Actual:*
* REF accepts the TOP and creates a follow behind for PT1

Subject: XTOP over TOP is allowed. Also XTOP over XTOP.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Validation passes if addressee is the same.

steps
* Completed TOP with foreman Will.
* Create a XTOP with foreman Will.
* Validate the XTOP

expected
* validation should fail because XTOP should be prevented from being issued over a TOP per SRS.169

actual
* validation passes because addressees are the same so the form does not create a conflict.

steps continued
* Completed XTOP with foreman Will.
* Create a XTOP with foreman Will.
* Validate the XTOP

expected
* validation should fail because XTOP should be prevented from being issued over a XTOP per SRS.170

actual
* just like the previous scenario validation passes because addressees are the same so the form does not create a conflict.

Subject: RTCP touching another RTCP is generating overlap pop-up
Author: cn customer
Description:
RTCP are selected and limits modified to touching Whole Miles of another RTCP. When validate selected prompted on RTCP that is touching. It is the same scenario for touching at a location.


*Setup:*
* Place RTCP 1 over some limits to a milage
* Start placing RTCP 2 over some limits up to the milage of RTCP 1
* Click on Validate Limits

*Expected:*
* The RTCP 2 does not take into account RTCP 1

*Actual:*
* There is a validation warning about RTCP 1 (which is only touching)


*Assumption:*
* The note about "It is the same scenario for touching at a location" Means that the system should behave the same as when the forms touch at a location. Not that the system has the same bug when forms touch at a location

Subject: PT with overlapping PA's for two different foreman allows the overlapping TOP's to be placed.
Author: cn customer
Description:
Created a PT and added two restrictions against Foreman 1 and Foreman 2. The Added PA limits were overlapping.
Then attempted to issue both foremen their TOP's and the system allowed the overlapping TOP's to be issued.

If the opposite is created. 2 overlapping TOP's and then PT selected it would reject because of the overlap.


*Setup:*
* Create a Proceed train
* Create a manual protect against for Foreman 1
* The system requires a validate limits
* Create a manual protect against for Foreman 2 that overlaps Foreman 1s protect against

*Expected:*
* The system provides a failure message stating that the proceed train cannot overlap the overlapping tops.
* The form cannot be transmitted until the protect against are no longer overlapping, either by removing a protect against or by shortening the protect againsts.

*Actual:*
* The system allows the form to validate
* The form can be transmitted
