One of the authorities was removed from mnesia. The machine was then failed over. Upon reloading the authorities there was a terrible explosion. When this explosion ensued the machine stopped running up. The result is a machine that is supposed to be running up is stuck in limbo for ever waiting for jwdog to acknowledge its runup goal. =============================================================================================================== CAUSE: peso sync'd during failover, causing removal of a .tmp XML file for a form just written during the loadAuthoritiesAtFailover() execution before the .tmp file could be moved/renamed as .rml file for the form. RESOLUTION: changed REF BusinessLogicManager to wait for a configurable amount of time before loading forms, to allow peso's "last" sync on the former PC-complete box to complete; added a configurable parameter for the delay value; also added made the lastSync callback function in peso cancel the sync timer.

Subject: REF Exploded while running checksum on forms
Author: Will Martin
Description:
While running some tests on the Test system the following stack trace was produced. 

2016-08-11 10:20:02,520 DEBUG [REFDiagnostics] handleMessage() received REFDiagnosticRequestMessage
2016-08-11 10:20:02,684 DEBUG [REFDiagnostics] ### checksumReport() : AuthorityNumber=344; formId=410; checksum : PASSED; storedCheckSum=49769805639387750507366029499325100398; currentCheckSum=49769805639387750507366029499325100398

2016-08-11 10:20:02,685 FATAL [CommonJmsListener] Exception occured during message handling of message REFDiagnosticRequestMessage [messageId=8e2d9817-8702-4bfd-9814-03948f526fd9, conversationId=8e2d9817-8702-4bfd-9814-03948f526fd9, senderNodeName=rtc1ocs, replyToDestinationName=REFServerTopic]
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at ocs.us.ref.extutils.REFDiagnostics.checksumReport(REFDiagnostics.java:262) ~[refserver.jar:?]
        at ocs.us.ref.extutils.REFDiagnostics.diagnose(REFDiagnostics.java:184) ~[refserver.jar:?]
        at ocs.us.ref.extutils.REFDiagnostics.handleMessage(REFDiagnostics.java:123) ~[refserver.jar:?]
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleIOCSMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:210) ~[Core.jar:?]
        at ocs.us.core.jms.CommonJmsListener.handleMessage(CommonJmsListener.java:122) [Core.jar:?]
        at ocs.us.core.jms.OcsMessageListener.onMessage(OcsMessageListener.java:58) [Core.jar:?]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doInvokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:543) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.invokeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:482) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.doExecuteListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:451) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.executeListener(AbstractMessageListenerContainer.java:423) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.processMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:290) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer$2.onMessage(SimpleMessageListenerContainer.java:266) [spring.jar:2.5.6.SEC01]
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQMessageConsumer.dispatch(ActiveMQMessageConsumer.java:1394) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.dispatch(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:131) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at org.apache.activemq.ActiveMQSessionExecutor.iterate(ActiveMQSessionExecutor.java:202) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:133) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:48) [activemq-all-5.11.2.jar:5.11.2]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145) [?:1.7.0_51]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615) [?:1.7.0_51]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744) [?:1.7.0_51]
======================================================================================================= CAUSE: the cron job that periodically triggers REFDiagnostic's checksum verification of forms in mnesia invoked the checks as the system was switching over, which caused the REFDiagnosticsMnesiaContainer to insert a null into its copy of the FormsContainer/PersistencyProvider; the diagnostics later exploded trying to dereference the null entry to get its checksum. RESOLUTION: added null checks to the REFDiagnosticsMnesiaContainer initialization method that reads the mnesia cache, to prevent insertion of null values into its collections, and to write a log message to the ref.log file when it encounters such nulls. NOTE: the ref.log files which might have told us more about what happened were not saved and were long gone by the time we looked at this bug.

Subject: Exception dialog is raised when opening the train summary as Chief or Technician
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
steps
* Create a new train (location is in Mont-Joli sub at parking spot mile 103.5).
* Create a ProceedTrain form for the new train (from (11)MONT/(4)ISLE/(1)MT/(701)TRA to (11)MONT/(12)MONT/(1)MT/(701)TRA) .
* OS report the train (east switch on Isle-Verte station).
* Transfer all of your territory so that the system automatically logs you off...
* log in as Chief
* click on the Train Summary button

expected
* the train summary form displays

actual
* an unhandled exception pops up
* the train summary form displays

========================================================================================
CAUSE: code/config error: the max length field value for the LOCATION text field in
oracle forms used for the chief and tech summaries was set to 10 instead of the 12 char
max defined in the trd.fmt(which is the one used in the dispatcher's summary); this 
caused the chief and tech summary exceptions when a train was OS at a known pt where
the OS mileage value included more than 2 char's left of the decimal point(likely also
because of padding done in trd-interface);

RESOLUTION: changed the aforementioned max length  property in the oracle forms involved
to 12(this also included the msd.fmt file used in the dispatcher summary, which didn't
blow up but was inconsistently set to 11)

Subject: Train Summary should indicate the direction of a train
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:

** If the train is headed East it will show Gray

* The direction is calculated based on where the train currently is in the system.
** Os Location
** First form creation direction
** Parking spot direction

Subject: Authority Summary buttons become disabled when other workstation cancel an authority.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Precondition:
* Two Workstations
* Workstations need at least 2 monitors, 1 for overview screen

Steps:
* from workstation 1, open an overview screen using the quick callup and complete an authority
* open the authority summary. Select the authority and the function buttons (Print, Modify, Cancel, View) are enabled
* from workstation 2, complete an authority and then cancel the authority

Actual:
* when the authority in cancelled from workstation 2, on workstation 1 on the authority summary the authority remains selected but the function buttons (Print, Modify, Cancel, View) are disabled

Expected:
* on workstation 1 the authority summary should remain unchanged. The authority should remain selected and the buttons should remain enabled.

=======================================================================================================
CASUE: code error - the FormSummaryPresenter was clearing the current form selection and resetting 
the button states to default(no selection) on every form removal.

RESOLUTION: changed the FormSummaryPresenter removeSummaryDisplayFormEntries() and removeSummaryDisplayEntry() methods to not update button states unless the form being removed matches the currently selected form on the summary(former method is used for TOP/WT/PT, latter for RTCProtection forms); also changed updateSummaryDisplayEntry() and setSummaryDisplayEntriesForForm() to do same thing for TOP/RTCP updates...at signoff will found case where this didn't work if cancelling RTCP over two users' terrotory(e.g. on test topology from Bob to Clever and either user can cancel); so also changed FormSummaryView.java to restore selection in removeSummaryDisplayFormEntries()...

REOPEN RESOLUTION: when updates to form are received, the table within the form is refreshed; the selection is briefly turned off deep down in the table model logic, and restored by display entry update logic within the FormSummaryView changes; made for bug #11792 causes the selection to be toggled again when the FormSummaryView tries to restore the selection.

Subject: Alarm goes off on non emergnecy 532 territory transfer
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:* * Two workstations are logged in * Each work station controls territory * From one work station open the 532 territory transfer dialog * click on the edit (hamer) button * Do *NOT* click on the emergency transfer button * Attempt to take a territory controlled by the other workstation *Expected:* * A red check mark appears * Nothing else really happens *Actual:* * A red check mark appears * All the alarms go off on all the workstations * The console log shows the following: 

Jul  8 16:17:40 rel1cn acop  : [ID 836769 user.info] * 333 TadToDb          51        116        333
Jul  8 16:17:40 rel1cn acop  : [ID 209991 user.info] *  13 SbChange         51        116        666

Subject: Write authority data in XML and Index file
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Show That:
* When an authority is created, an XML version of the authority is created and added to the index file.

* When an authority is removed(cold start/cancel/fulfill/supersede):
** the XML version of the authority is removed from the active directory.
** The authority is written to the inactive authority directory
** The authority is removed from the index file.

* When an authority is updated:
** the XML version of the authority is replaced with the new XML version whenever the authority is updated in the Forms Container.
** the index file should reflect the changes to the authority.
*** This applies to active/inactive/pending state changes.
* When an authority number is used, the next authority number in the index file is updated.

Subject: forms allow whole mile that is outside of range allowed.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*steps*
* select authority function
* select POP/COLA/STN/KNOWNPOINT as start limit
* select POP/PEPI/WSW/SWI as end limit, and execute
* fill out the addressee field in necessary, select the start limit field
* the status line should show a range 4-15, type 15 and validate
* the form validates, now select the start limit field again.

*actual*
* status line shows whole mile 16 as valid.
* the start limit field allows the entry of a whole mile.

*expected*
* the start limit field should not allow the entry of a whole mile.

*steps cont*
* validate the form and you can again enter a whole mile in the start limit field.
 
========================================================================
CAUSE: code error: the limitMileageSameAsAdjacentKpOrSwitchMileage() method in FormUtisl.java was incorrectly skipping over cases and returning false when item for which it was trying to match up with entered mileage was at very start(or end) of process image value item list.

RESOLUTION: corrected the endpoint cases in the method

Subject: XTOP is stuck in Unacknowledged Cancel
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
stability test
ws11cn
mmi4ocs

*Steps*
* Complete an XTOP
* Open the XTOP in cancel mode
* click the transmit, then click the fields to read
* once the repeat button is enabled, Failover the PC COM

*actual*
* the form closes
* the limits remain blocked
* the authority summary displays the form in unack cancel state

*Expected*
* the form closes
* the limits remain blocked
* the form should go back to completed state.

NOTE: After the form was in this state it was removed using authutil -d. This utility did not clean up the blocking on the trackline which it should have.

==============================================================================
Cause: code error - due to the related bug being fixed, the scenario as described in the variance could not be reproduced unless forced from the debugger...what was happeing is that when REF threw an exception and the standby became PC complete,
the REF on the formerly PC-complete box continued to work - in other words the standby became the primary right away, but before the old primary ran down REF continued to write to amnesia; the new primary then failed, and after the second failover REF restored the form to what was written to mnesia, which included updates that it wrote while it was going down(i.e. while it was no longer running on the primary).

Resolution : make control system bridge process the McSbOrderInf telegram from the spectrum MCS process, and then send the shutdown command to the java applications immediately on receipt of this message having an COMSTATE request and NotConnected state. 

TO TESTERS:
the bug that originally caused the failover has been fixed, so you cannot use the scenario(s) to #12509 to test this one. What you can do to trigger a failover is kill a critical process - for example dbsrv. The system should then failover, and there should be messages in the csbridge.log file saying that it sent a shutdown to each of the java applications. Also make sure that you have the latest imagebus_xxx files installed(IMAGESOS if needed).

--------------------------
Regarding the NOTE above about clean-up-tool.sh -d behavior:
-the -d option will only remove flashing and blocking if the form is in created or issued state and there is a GUI form open for the authority; this is the behavior as implemented for story 10745. In the other cases the user currently needs to use the cleanup tool on the individual device ta's(or -a to refresh ALL the blocking based on the current authority set). All that said, we should file a separate bug if we need to do more.

Subject: Failover during data activation causes new PC to not become fully PC

Subject: FAILOVER when validating a PT over a WT
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
mm2ocs
ws09cn

-*steps*-
-* normalize switches: DARLING/WSW, HOTM/SW1, HOTM/WSW, HOTM/ESW and EBAY/SW1-
-* Complete a WT from Berlin KP to Darling West Switch-
-* Create PT from Darling West Switch to Berlin KP-
-* Validate-

-*actual*-
-* system failover (time: Fri May 13 17:19:31 2016)-

-*Expected*-
-* the form to validate.-

*note*
* This was reproduced on development system 

This is the full set of scenarios to test for this bug

*Setup:*

Create 2 trains: 11111 and 22222

The following scenario should be executed for the following:

Auth1: PT Auth2: PT
Auth1: PT Auth2: WT (Validation should fail but only because of the lack of Manual Protect Against)

*Scenario 1:*

* Switch Report Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Harry to normal
* Execute Auth1 with train 11111 from George Station to Ingo Station
* Give give West Switch only a permission and give the East switch only a warning
* Complete Auth1.
* Modify Auth1 by cancelling the warning on East Switch at Harry
* Execute Auth2 with train 22222 from Ingo Station to Harry Siding
* Validate

*Expected:*

* Validation should fail two rules
** Auth2 takes a switch reverse but is overlapping a Auth1 that has no warning for that switch
** Auth2 has a switch permission but is overlapping a Auth1 that has no warning for that switch

*Actual:*

* Validation passes

The following scenario should be executed for the following:

Auth1: PT Auth2: PT
Auth1: PT Auth2: WT

*Scenario 2:*

* Switch Report Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Berlin Junction to normal
* Execute Auth1 from Berlin Station to Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Remove Permission from Switch 1 at Berlin Junction
* Add permissions to Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Complete Auth1
* Execute Auth2 from Berlin Station to Apple Station
* Validate authority

*Expected:*

* Validation should fail two rules
** Auth2 takes a Switch 1 at Berlin Junction reverse but is overlapping a Auth1 that has no warning for that switch
** Auth2 has a switch permission for Switch 1 at Berlin Junction but is overlapping a Auth1 that has no warning for that switch

*Actual:*

* We get a 6001 message/failover/Java Exception

*Scenario 3:*

* Switch Report Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Berlin Junction to normal
* Execute PT from Berlin Station to Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Remove Permission from Switch 1 at Berlin Junction
* Add permissions to Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Complete PT
* Execute Switch Report at Switch 1 at Berlin Junction

*Expected:*

* Validation should fail because one cannot move a switch into reverse when the overlapping PT has no warning

*Actual:*

* We get a 6001 message/failover/Java Exception

*Scenario 4:*

* Switch Report Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Berlin Junction to normal
* Execute PT from Berlin Station to Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Remove Permission from Switch 1 at Berlin Junction
* Add permissions to Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Facebook and Switch 1 at Hotmail
* Complete PT
* Execute Switch Report at Siding Switch West at Facebooks

*Expected:*

* Validation should fail because one cannot move a switch into normal when the overlapping PT has a permission on a reversed switch

*Actual:*

* We get a 6001 message/failover/Java Exception

*Scenario 5:*

* Switch Report Siding East Switch and Siding West Switch at Harry to normal
* Execute PT with train 11111 from George Station to Ingo Station
* Give give West Switch only a permission and give the East switch only a warning
* Complete PT.
* Modify PT by cancelling the warning on East Switch at Harry
* Execute Switch Report at East Switch at Harry

*Expected:*

* Rules fail because Overlapping PT has no warning for East Switch at Harry

*Actual:*

* Rules pass

*Scenario 6:*

* Switch Report East Siding Switch at Firewall and East Siding Switch at Harry to normal
* Switch Report West Siding Switch at Harry to reverse
* Execute PT from East Siding Switch at Firewall to Ingo Station
* Add Switch Permission to East Siding Switch at Firewall
* Add Switch Warning to East Siding Switch at Harry
* Complete PT
* Execute Modify on PT
* Uncheck warning for East Siding Switch at Harry
* Transmit

*Expected:*

* Rules on Transmit passes

*Actual:*

* Rules fail saying that West Siding Switch at Harry is reversed cannot cancel

Subject: Editing the Tracking ID does not update on the Trackline.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*steps*
* Create a new train on a parking spot from the trackline.
* Open Train Summary and view this train. Open the Edit train form for the train.
* Modify the Tracking ID and save the change.

*excepted*
* The trackline train ID should be updated with the new tracking id.

*actual*
* The trackline train ID is not updated.

=====================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error; the SendTmtRename() program called on edit_trd form save was not sending a CSB friendly
messsage to our java apps.

RESOLUTION: changed the SEND_CHANGES() PL/SQL code to instead call SendTmtUpdate(), which formats and sends a softbus message to JMSGATE->CSB->TM->ads that updates all but the train performance data.

REOPEN RESOLUTION: removed test that guarded against null values for lead-engine id/engine number from code block in send_changes() routine dealing with updated tracking id(and added handling of the null values prior to sending update)

=======================================================================
UPDATE 08-15-16 - jim K...
-I was still not able to reproduce this on any system. I tried several locations on both the development topology area and the "real" OCS locations. If there is someplace that it is known to happen it needs to be noted here so we can investigate, because in that case it would indicate a problem with the database.-

So, upon further review with Will we could reproduce the problem at in the OCS W.1 development test-topology, when connected to mmi1ocs; further investigation revealed that the SendTmtUpd program was not present in the /home/s/sys/trd folder on mmi1ocs, but was there on mmi3ocs - which was the mmi I was connected to when I could not reproduce the problem. Alex P then found that it was installed on mmi3ocs as result of an update mode configuration error, and that we will need to add the SentTmtUpd executable to the GrafikUpdateObj block configuration to ensure its installation on the mmi's...(still not 100% sure this is the entire solution, particularly because the problem did not always occur at all locations for workstations connected to the problem mmi's).

Subject: OS Report screen stuck behind display
Author: cn customer
Description:
Steps:
* Workstation set up with only two displays. BSD on monitor 1 and overview on Monitor 2.
* Existing PT authority.
* Selected OS report, PT and a KP within the limits.
* OS Report form opened on the second working screen but where I also had my display opened.
* I accidently clicked on the overview display which caused the OS report screen to go in behind. I am assuming because the display is locked it will not allow me to close it or select the OS report to bring it back to the front. I tried Alt-tab but it would not let me select the OS report screen either. So workstation locked up and no method to fix this. It is possible that the RTC will have a display open on the second working screen also so this is not good.

Expected:
* The OS report form should return back to the front of the display after a period of time. 

Actual:
* The OS report is stuck behind and there is no method to get it back.

Subject: Lists on java dialogs should not require any modifier keys to deselect items
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Currently on CTC the user can select/deselect things out of all lists and tables by clicking on the row in the table (no keyboard modifier keys have to be pressed for deselect). This applies to all java dialogs. When this bug is worked on, please provide a list of affected dialogs on the bug.


*Setup:*
* Open a display that has a java list or java table
* Select an item from the list
* Click on the selected item without holding any keys down

*Expected:*
* The table row is deselected.

*Actual:*
* The table row is not deselected.

*List of Scenarios*
* Authority Summary Table
* Authority Summary Options Tables (Authority Type Filter table, Subdivision filter table, and Addressee/Reason filter table)
* REF Train selection Dialog (e.g. when selecting a train from a parking spot for PT creation)
* TM train dialog (e.g. when selecting a train from a parking spot for Train Move)
* Form list dialog (e.g. when selecting a TOP foreman for cancellation)
* Train and Form List dialog (e.g. when selection a pt train field that has both a PT Id and a Siding Fulfilled Id)
* Quick Callup view group selection dialog
* Rtcp limits table

Subject: New Train form - errors
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps: 
1. click on new train button,  select any parking space, new train form opens. 
2. in form - fill in train id. 
3. try filling in lower 4 fields (Hazmat cars, HAL cars, Dimensional loads, speed restricted cars). 

Expected: numbers are stored and no errors come up. 

Actual: 
1. When entering any number into those fields , the error message shows up at bottom of the form:
"FRM-40815: Variable GLOBAL.SHORTEST_TRACK_LENGTH does not exist".  
2. When clicking on Dimensional loads, entering number (5) then choosing any value from drop down list - same message shows up in error pop-up.  
3. When Dimensional has nothing entered in its field and any value is choosen from drop-down list, then in lower bottom corner - status message says "FRM-41058: No such property for Get_Item_Property."

Subject: Switch Report Reporting field allows special characters (ex. !@#$%^&*()) to be entered and transmitted.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
This bug is placeholder that requires someone to enter speciacharictorsrs like ampersands, semi colons, quotes, back-tics etc. and ensure that these special characters do not cause any problems with archiving/tgi/playback In CTC there is a list of characters that are not allowed on the forms because they caused problems. The purpose of this bug is to determine what these characters are and either ban them from our java forms, or ensure they do not harm the system (This includes tracklines, archiving, playback, TLD ect). After the course of action has been determined write up the steps to make this a testable bug. ------------------------------------ * CTC illegal characters: 
${}*~^@`#%&[]|\\<>\t"
*Steps:* # Start a TOP/PT/WT/RTCP/Switch Report form # Try to enter/copy illegal characters into its fields *Expected:* * The illegal characters should be rejected *Actual:* * The illegal characters are allowed

Subject: When java apps receive shutdown signal the clients are not properly
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps: * Initiate TOP form * Leave form open in create/issued/unacknowledged state * Send an endprog to jmsgate 
 > endprog jmsgate
** The system will failover at this point since jmsgate was killed Expected: * The form is closed * The devices are no longer locked for selection * The devices are no longer highlighted * Any blocking has been removed if the form is before unacknowledged state * The form has been removed from the system if the form is before unacknowledged state * All query dialogs are closed when ref is shutdown Actual: * The form is closed NOTE: * This seems weird, but this is correct because any endprog signal that is given to jmsgate is forwarded to all java applications so they all go into shutdown state.

Subject: Oracle Redundancy on ADM/Spare
Author: Peter Vajko
Description:
Oracle was upgraded from 9i to 11g but the orared (responsible for keeping the Oracle databases on the spare synchronized) and RDBCREATE infrastructure was not.
Although RDBCREATE works in with the Oracle 9 specific configuration, orared needs a lot of 11g specific changes to work.

To fix this, we'll be cherry picking the 11g specific changes from 4.7 to RDBCREATE/orared.

Subject: Chief and Technician Train Summary Forms Not Displaying Train Entries
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:
1.Create a new train.
2.Create a ProceedTrain form for the new train.
3.OS report the train.
4.Transfer all of your territory so that the system automatically logs you off...
5. Login in as chief and/or technician
6. Open the TrainSummary form.

Expected:
The TrainSummary form contains an entry for your new train(any any others), and has the correct OS Report mileage in its Location field.

Actual:
No train entries on the form.
=======================================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - ImInterface.pc-cep SQL statements to populate oracle tables which are later used to
construct oracle views of train data were missing clauses to include OCS block_type; this caused only a very small subset of the tech areas to be included for the chief and technician summaries and effectively filtered out all of the trains which should have been included on the summary.

RESOLUTION: added *OCS clauses to the trd interface SQL statements everywhere where it had only been checking for CTC block type.

NOTE: the changes will likely affect other functionality besides the train summary, but if so it should be in a good way(i.e. by fixing stuff that had no chance of working before)

REOPEN RESOUTION: applied changes made for bug #12307 to the chief and tech train summary oracle forms(english and french); this involved changing some if-test conditions to check for 'REF' instead 'AUM'. (probably should have reopened 12307)

Subject: Train summary Highlighting of changed fields.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Test run step 1.
Edit a train record by By using srssim tool:
Steps taken:  just follow 'send train summary message' instructions, entered 1 digit for each field (cargo, cars, speed, loads, locomotives).
 
Expected result: The Train Record Summary line is highlighted in blue.

Actual result: Not highlighted blue.  Tried 4 times, only 1 time it was highlighted. Other times - information for that train summary was not displayed at all. But When train record is opened from train summary - all information received from SRS updates was in the train record. Nothing was highlighted. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 2 and 6: View the Train Record Summary for a train record highlighted across each column field in blue,
-	Place the focus (black outline) on any highlighted field of the train record and select the ?Train Record? function button.
Steps taken:  following 'send train summary message' instructions, entered 1 digit for each field (cargo, cars, speed, loads, locomotives).

Expected result: The System opens the train record displaying the SRS update as the most recent entry and highlights in blue the information that DOES NOT match the previous manual entry by the RTC.

Actual result:  only lead engine initial is highlighted blue.  all other field are regular color.  the updated information line is on top.
Tried 4 times, only 1 times. Updated information for that train, on train summary page was not displayed at all. But When train record is opened from train summary - all information received from SRS updates was in the train record. Nothing was highlighted. I was unable to accept or reject the SRS update. Newest received information was on the top line.  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step: 3. Select the ?Reject? SRS Update function button on the train record

Expected result: The system keeps the entire update that was rejected but moves it to the second spot and retains the information that was manually entered by the RTC on the train record as primary

Actual result: all srs updated information received was moved to second line, but data was not saved,  all fields were reset to 0.   Info that was previously manually entered by rtc - stayed as it was before.

Subject: Cutting and restoring lone PC COM network causes mnesia to fail
Author: Nicholas Tolrud
Description:
*Steps:* # Have a lone PC COM or all box running PC Complete. # Cut its network ** For an LDOM, refer to [[root:LDOM_Information#Disconnecting a virtual LAN]] ** For a physical machine, pull the ethernet cable # Wait about 13 seconds (at least net_ticktime * 1.25) # Restore its network ** For an LDOM, connect from the LDOM server through telnet and run 
# svcadm restart svc:/network/physical
** For a physical machine, plug the ethernet cable back in *Expected:* * Mnesia continues working after reconnecting. ** The system seems healthy the /var/adm/messages log is not full of stack traces *Actual:* * Mnesia drops its client nodes and the java applications are not longer able to use it. ** The system starts logging error messages to the /var/adm/messages file stating that it "cannot flush changes to cache" ** Stack traces are written to the /var/adm/messages file

Subject: Alarms on OCS should sound like CTC
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Create an alarm on the OCS system

*Expected:*
* The alarm sounds like in CTC

*Actual:*
* The alarm sounds like a weird, over pressurized bouncing ball

*Note:*
The current CTC alarm sound is saved as a binary (mapped to a String16 field) in the tone relation in bq.

==================================================================================
CAUSE: configuration error; ../param/ui_supply/config/gong file had message class 1 (which is what the WDAlert used for our testing is set to) configured to ring gong #2; the  ../param/tsbase/ocs.us/config/wm.properties file had the sounds mapped from gong number n to gong1, gong2, etc. and the gong2 file was the bounce sound, instead of the expected siren sound used by the CTC system.

RESOLUTION: brought the siren sound file over from the Bathurst St system; renamed the gong1, gong2, etc sound files according to the sounds they produce; changed the wm.properties file to map both gong #1 and #2 to the siren sound file.

Found by looking at CTC version of gong config that they had message class 1 apparently used for SYSTEM messages and mapped to "no gong at all"; still need to determine configuration of other alarms/message classes, so mapped the other sound files tentatively...wm.properties now looks like this:

Sound.9-1-1=siren
Sound.9-1-2=siren
Sound.9-1-3=poppedCork
Sound.9-1-4=bouncedPayment
Sound.9-1-5=oldcarHorn
Sound.9-1-6=rattlingCowbell
Sound.9-1-7=mudBubbles
Sound.9-1-8=glassTap

the gong config for message classes now looks like this:

/* \/ Parameters   -------------------------------------------------  */
  Key3               1    2    3    4
  Volume            70   70   60   60
  Period             2    2    4    5

/*    Message classes >                                               */
/*          1   2   3   4                                             */
/* \/      -----------------------------------------------------------*/
/* Gong steps                                                         */
cGong_App   1   2   3   0
cGong_Dis   0   0   0   0


NOTE: the TONE relation is apparently no longer used for purposes of playing the gong sound - at least on the workstations...(may no longer be needed at all, but did not try to remove it); the sample field values that are in the tone relation on the CTC test system are not valid(all 0xFF's).

Subject: OS report on unacknowledged form
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Setup:

1. Place 1 PT on track. Complete it. 
2. Place 2nd PT on same track, with same Train ID.   Make is unacknowledged. 
3. Open an OS Report on this track with 2 same train IDs. 
4. Form selection dialog pops up, with 1 ID greyed out. 
Expected: when choosing greyed out ID - system should give error message. 
Actual: OS report opens for rollup/fulfill of greyd out train id. 
5. Enter time and location for OS report. 

Expected: The OS Report Rollup dialog only shows the completed PT in the Track Release and Fulfilled field.
Actual: rollup dialog shows both completed and unacknowledged PT 

NOTE: also working same way if trying to supercede unacknowledged train. validation passes without errors.
Also working on WT and TOP, as long as 1 of overlapping authorities is unacknowledged. It can be chosen for supercede and validated.  

=========================================================================================
CAUSE: code error - for the OS Report problem, the workflow handler to filter away ineligible forms skipped the selected form because its number was not included in the workflow's display stack entries; the supersede problem was caused by the same handler ONLY considering display stack entries: in the cases of cancel and supersede(at least) the id of the selected form is the same as that which is assigned to the workflow, but is not added to the displayStackEntries as part of handling of the dialog response - and so was skipped over instead of being filtered out when form was not completed.

RESOLUTION: to fix the OS Report problem, changed ClientInterface.java's handling of FormListQueryResponseMessage to insert into the workflow's display stack entries the number of the form selected on the form chooser dialog(aka in ctc as overlapBox)  this is needed because the id of the OS Report form itself is assigned to the workflow(never the same as the PT form selected from the chooser).
To fix the bad supersede behavior, changed FilterInvalidSelectionHandler.java to collect the id's of all forms involved - i.e. both the formId associated with the current workflow AND forms added to the displayStackEntries - then filter out any that were marked as having failed rule checks. This causes the selected form to be thrown out if not completed, and the workflow to fail due to lack of eligible form. Also changed the NotCompletedFormFailsRule class to cache the failed form to allow an overridden of the getRuleFailMessage() method to retrieve its form type and number to provide a meaningful popup message.

Subject: Mnesia scripts should check user before running

*Expected:*

*Actual:*

*Additional Scope*
* The clear mnesia table script should ask the user if all COM machines are Stopped before clearing the mnesia cache

Subject: Mnesia should block until synchronized
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps:

* Java flushes to the Mnesia cache

Excepted:

* On a flush to the cache the Erlang code that writes into Mnesia waits until the two instances of the Mnesia database are synchronized
* The database write() uses a 'Sticky' lock

Actual:

* On a flush to the cache the Erlang code that writes into Mnesia does not wait until the two instances of the Mnesia database are synchronized
* The database write() does not use a 'Sticky' lock

Note: This should probably be signed off using a code review by Peter Z. because he would be an outside opinion and would know Erlang/Mnesia well enough to sign it off.

Subject: Web Train Graph is not showing any authorities or trains.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Setup:  
1. Place some authorities on tracks in some subdivision. 
(I used MONT-JOLI SUB), all  tracks on all stations from mile 187 to mile 2.5.  
2. Open web train graph, choose your subdivision and time. 

Expected: Train graph should show authorities and trains on the tracks in subdivision. 
Actual: Nothing shows up in train graph.  In lower left corner there is a message: "Error(DB): null"

===================================================================================================
CAUSE : code error (+db error?) : there was no timezone assigned to one or more of the B2NAMES involved, and the TGI code expected it to ALWAYS be the case that the timezone for each B2/CP was retrieved and placed in a map, and blew up with an exception when it the lookup on the map for the B2 later failed.

RESOLUTION: changed logic in DataUpdate.jsp to use the timezone assigned to the B1/Subdivision if none assigned to B2/CP; also changed the JSP files which perform oracle database queries to log the queries to make it easier to see what is going wrong the next time(currently there are 4 separate /home/logs/tgi.*jsp.log files...these files are overwritten on each invocation of the jsp(so they won't grow beyond belief) - there is be a separate bug written to consolidate into one traingraph.log using log4j(see bug #11292).

Subject: The System should support station switches
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* There is a way to identify a station switch in the database
* This switch shows up as a station (showing B2 Text)
** In the limits of a form
** In the limits of protect/agansts
** In the meet locations (afters)
** Instructions fields
** OS report

* This switch shows up as a show mile switch (showing Mileage and B1 Text)
** In a switch report
** In the switch warnings
** In the switch permissions

* This applies to CDLS, Printing, Authority Summary, Archiving, and REF forms.

NOTE:
* We can do one of the following:
** Change show mile static info to support 3 modes (no show mile, station switch, and show mile switch)
** Add a second static info called show station
*** If both show mile and show station are set the show station info wins.

Subject: Can move switch into reverse with no warning
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This bug applies to both proceed tran and work train.

*Setup:*
* Place a PT/WT that ends on a reverse switch
** The form should have a warning on the switch
** The form should not have a permission on the switch

* Switch report the end switch into normal
* Modify the PT/WT and cancel the warning

* Perform a switch report on the end switch

*Expected:*
* The switch report rejects and will not report a switch into reverse with no warnings

*Actual:*
* The switch report flips the switch into reverse

Subject: Whole miles are not comapired correctly on OS Report
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Place a train in the system
* Place a proceed train from (7) OCST (13) LAUR (1) ESW (703) SWI to (7) OCST (18) OLIV (2) SW1 (703) SWI
** Enter mileage into the limits of the proceed train so the train goes from mile 43 to mile 19
* Os report the train at mile 20

*Expected:*
* The form is considered for rollup

*Actual:*
* The form is considered for fulfill

NOTE:
* This seems regardless of direction.

Subject: When passive Erlang/Mnesia dies the active Erlang/Mnesia stops working
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Preconditions:

* Have a system with two COMs

Steps:

* Run both COMs Up to PC/SB complete
* Disconnect both LANs on the SB COM (Note: If the two COMs are on the same physical machine you need to pull the LANs by dropping their virtual LAN (see:[[root:LDOM_Information#Disconnecting a virtual LAN]]))

Expected:

* The Active Erlang/Mnesia recognizes that the passive has left its cluster and keeps working properly

Actual:

* The Active Erlang/Mnesia thinks the passive is still in its cluster and is unable to flush changes, eventually the flush fails and causes an emergency message, which results in a failover

Subject: After cold startup previously on time trains are now late
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps:

* Create new train and place PT with that train
** The id field of the PT should be 'Green' indicating that it is on time
* Shutdown all Comm Servers
* Start both Comm Servers up and wait for (PC/SB) complete

Expected:

* The train id still shows 'Green' indicating on time

Actual:

* The train id is 'Red' indicating that it is late

Subject: Manual transfer report does not work
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Pre-condition.  
User logged in as RTC, some authorities exist. 

Steps:
1. On BSD click on Territory transfer button. 
2. On Territory Transfer form click on "Manual TTR" button to get manual transfer report. 

Expected:  Transfer report windows pops up with current information. 
Actual:  Can not click on the button. Nothing happens when button is clicked on.

Subject: Switch colouring does not update when switch normalled with blocking on it
Author: cn customer
Description:
Setup:
* Initial switches are reversed.
* Issue an RTCP or PT that would include the switch in the display (as an end limit of the form).
* The blocking on the switch is displayed over the reverse leg of the switch.
* Perform a switch report on the switch and normal it.

Expected:
* The coloring of the form should follow the topology on end limits

Actual:
* Coloring remains on the reverse leg and is also now displayed on the normal leg.

NOTE:
* If a new RTCP or Pt authority that has the switch as a limit is issued the switch coloring is removed from the reverse leg of the switch but remains on the normal.

If it is going to update the coloring on the switch it should do it on the normal switch report.

Subject: Can give permission on switch overlapping form with no warning.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This bug applies to WT/WT, PT/PT, WT/PT and PT/WT. "/"=overlapping

*Setup:*
* Place a PT/WT that ends on a reverse switch
** The form should have a warning on the switch
** The form should not have a permission on the switch
* Switch report the end switch into normal

* Modify the PT/WT and cancel the warning
* Place another PT/WT over the form and give a warning and permission on the switch
* Try to validate or transmit the form

*Expected:*
* The form should not pass with the warning and permission

*Actual:*
* The form passes and flips the switch into reverse

Subject: Switches reported normal at the end of Pt forms result in coloring on both branches.
Author: Nicholas Tolrud
Description:
Steps:

# Create a PT form that ends on a reversed switch.
# Create a switch report to move the switch normal.

Expected:

* The switch is shown colored in the current direction of the switch.

Actual:

* The switch is shown colored on both the normal and reverse branches.

Subject: There is a COMA softbus overflow that makes the COMA interface inoperable.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*Steps*
* login as system Admin
* from the admin bsd click on the CoMa button

*Expected*
* The CoMa interface comes up and functions work

*Actual*
* The Coma interface comes up and all the text blacked out. After some time (few minutes) the text appears, but the functions do not work

Subject: TOP/XTOP form allows uses WT addressee to fill form when selecting from overlap dialog. Selecting a TOP addressee to make a WT form causes a FAILOFVER
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*steps (1)*
* create a 3 form overlap, start with RTCP, then TOP then WT.
* select the TOP function then select the addressee field below the overlap track section and execute.
* a overlap section dialog appears then select the WT from the list and then the Ok button.

*actual*
* the top form comes up and the Addressee field is populated with the WT addressee.

*expected*
* a query dialog "The form is not of the expected type" , Ok button.

*steps (2)*
* select the WT function then select the addressee field below the overlap track section and execute.
* a overlap section dialog appears then select the TOP from the list and then the Ok button.

*actual*
* COM FAILOVER

*expected*
* a query dialog "The form is not of the expected type" , Ok button.

Subject: Lan status in coma does not work using LDOMS
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:* * Open up coma * Look at the lan setup *Expected:* * Coma shows what lans are up and what lans are down * When a lan cable is disconnected the lan ok/nok is updated *Actual:* * Coma always shows that lan1 is ok and lan2 is not ok NOTE: * The following command can be used to monitor the lans as root on LDOMS 

dladm show-dev | egrep -v "vsw|usbecm"| grep -w up
* THe following command can be used to monitor the lans as roto on linux 

/usr/sbin/ip link | grep -v team0: | grep "state UP" |awk '{print $2 " " $10 " " $11}'

Subject: Repeat phase of forms should not allow tabbing.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This applies to all forms with a full read-repeate cycle. (PT/WT/TOP/XTOP)

*Setup:*
* Create a form, bring it to transmit
* The form allows the user to tab through all of the read fields.

*Expected:*
* The user cannot tab through the repeat fields

*Actual:*
* The user can tab through the repeat fields

*Steps:*
* Press the complete button to bring up the complete section of the form
* The form allows the user to tab through the read section of the complete box

*Expected:*
* When repeating the form the user cannot tab through the fields

*Actual:*
* When repeating the form the user can tab through the fields

NOTE:
* This applies to create, modify, supersede, and cancel of these forms as well.

Subject: On cold startup ADS inefficiently calculates the display and goes PC Complete before it's done
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Preconditions:

* The box has ~600 authorities
* The box is in a shutdown state

Steps:

* Bring up the machine

Expected:

* The display for ADS is calculated in a reasonable amount of time
* The box does not go PC Complete until the display is done calculating

Actual:

* The ADS display calculation takes so long that it causes jwdog to have an mcs timeout
* The box goes PC Complete before the display is finished calculating

Note: Enforcing the display calculation to be done before the box goes PC Complete will fix the jwdog mcs timeout; however, right now we rerun calculation per for added on startup where we should make it more of a batch operation

Subject: SRS.1045 - is not followed
Author: cn customer
Description:
when going through testbook 317 I found problem to report right away.
Testbook is incorrect as well.

Teststep is for a wt authority add a switch permission. The warning is added automatically.
That is good. Then step 23 has them removing the switch warning and selecting OK.
Then you can transmit the WT authority with the permission and without the warning.
The whole purpose of this requirement was so that it would be issued with both.
You should either disallow the deselection of the warning or disable Transmit or OK if the conditions are not meet. I would prefer the disallow of the deselection.

* The proceed train should still allow switch warnings and switch permissions to be toggled independently of each other (Do not touch proceed train functionality)
* The work train should do what it is currently doing (when the user adds a permission a warning is automatically added)
* In addition:
** *Setup:*
*** When the work train is opened along the normal branch of a switch (the switch is also in normal)
** *Expected*
*** The user cannot toggle the warning on and off while the permission is on
*** The user can toggle the warning on and off while the permission is off
*** The user can toggle the permission on and off and the warning gets toggled on and off automatically
** *Actual*
*** The user can toggle the warning on and off while the permission is on
*** The user can toggle the warning on and off while the permission is off
*** The user can toggle the permission on and off and the warning gets toggled on and off automatically

Subject: TOP/XTOP form comes up with no Addressee field after selecting RTCP label in limit selection.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*steps*
* create a 3 form overlap, start with RTCP, then TOP then WT.
* select the TOP function then select the addressee field below the overlap track section and execute.
* a overlap section dialog appears then select the RTCP from the list and then the Ok button.

*actual*
* the form opens up and the addressee field is not there.

*expected*
* a query dialog "The form  is not of the expected type" , Ok button.

Subject: Should drop new train message when ADM is down
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* On a dist system
* When the ADM is down and the COMMs are up
* Click on the new train button
* Click on a parking spot on the trackline
* Execute
* Bring up the ADM

*Expected:*
* The new train dialog does not come up when the ADM comes up
* When the action fails because the ADM is down, there should be a popup notifying the user that the ADM is down

*Actual:*
* The user is never notified of why their train form never came up

Subject: Supersede of an authority the flashing on the display is incorrect for the old limits.
Author: cn customer
Description:
When you supersede an authority the old limits are flashing incorrectly between orange and black.
That is disconcerting seeing the track disappear between each flash.

Sean and I were able to come up with a solution that works for CN.
Instead of the orange flashing we changed the orange figure (22) in the figure group (CN_TraIn and CN_SwiIn?) to not flash but to stay solid instead.

This is what should be correcting in the figure groups.

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Create and complete a TOP from HARRY 
{(3)OCST     (8)HARR     (2)M1TK     (701)TRA}
to Mile 65.3
{(3)OCST     (11)JESS2    (11)SG656    (756)KnownPnt}

2. Supercede TOP by selecting limits from HARRY 
{(3)OCST     (8)HARR     (2)M1TK     (701)TRA}
to GEORGE
{(3)OCST     (7)GEOR     (5)STN      (756)KnownPnt}

3. When the form comes up, 
*Actual :* On TLD, the non-overlapping part of the completed TOP flashes orange. This makes the track disappear between each flash.
*Expected :* On TLD, the non overlapping part is displayed in solid orange and does not flash.

*Resolution:* Change the flashing orange color group to solid orange (22) in the color group (CN_TraIn and CN_SwiIn?)

Subject: The train display stacks and the addressee display stack disappear after failover
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Preconditions:

* Need a system with two COMMs and they need to be (PC/SB) complete

Steps:

* Add a PT authority and a TOP authority this should cause two ids to show up on the trackline
* Fail the system over to the SB COMM

Expected:

* The ids should remain on the trackline (It is okay if they go away and come back a couple seconds later)

Actual:

* The ids disappear and never come back

Subject: Switch Only Form Limits Not Locked-out("protected") During Create/Cancel/Modify
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
Steps:

pre-conditions: using developement topology, user A controls OCS W(OCS Test 1); user B controls OCS E(OCS Test 2)
1. from the OCS Test 1 TLD, user A initiates TOP from BOB SW1 to Clever SW3
2. from the OCS Test 2 TLD, user B requests TOP from HOTMAIL N2TK to Clever SW3

expected:
user B's gets rejected with "one or more devices are locked" message

actual:

user B gets TOP form

CAUSE: requirement/code error ; info 19 not set for form items when no tld highlighted or stk protect items found for form limits;this same bug also applied to RtcProtection forms.

RESOLUTION: changed AbstractLimitsForm and BlockLimit getItemsToProtect() method to add the returned items from new FormUtils getOccupiableLimitItemIds() when the usual method to get tld-highlighted and stk-protected items returns an empty set; the new FormUtils method returns all tracks and switches that are in the form's process image value items.

Note: also fixed together with this bug was an issue that caused the Overview Callup dialog to contain no entries to choose from, due to similar problem with logic depending on the tld-highlighted form items; for that, ControlSystemInterface.java was changed to call getProtectedItems() instead when constructing the REFFormCallUpMessage.

Subject: [Change Request] Trains should continue to occupy siding after fulfill
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* When a proceed train is routed into the siding
* The proceed train can be fulfilled
* The proceed train form goes away
* The red coloring stays on the track line
* The train id stays on the siding
* The train does not get suspended
* The location in TR will show the OS location as before
* If the proceed train id is selected as part of a limits selection, the train is used for the limit (applies to both forms/reports and protect against)
** The new limits will use the train to construct a new addressee. It will not try to use the addressee of the old form.
* Default action will show train information like parking spots
* If the fulfilled proceed train id is selected as part of a move train the train can be moved off of the siding into a parking spot
** Any fulfilled proceed train ids for the same train are removed
** If the train is already in a parking spot it should be moved like normal
* If the proceed train id is selected as part of a remove train, the train is removed from the siding. All of the old train removal rules apply.
** For instance if the train is nowhere else on the track line, the train is suspended.
** If the train is somewhere else on the track line it is removed from the siding but not suspended
** If there are multiple fulfilled proceed trains in the siding for the same train that is being removed, all are removed
* When the proceed train id is selected as part of a create for a proceed train or work train, the train is removed from all sidings at the end of the create (just like parking spot handling)
* If the train id is selected as part of any other form operation (modify, view, cancel, supersede, etc) the operation is rejected
* On train edit where the parking spot is changed we remove any fulfilled proceed trains in sidings for that train
* Sidings with fulfilled proceed trains are correctly repopulated after a manual ads refresh (clean-up-tool.sh -a)
* Fulfilled proceed trains are not removed after a cold startup or a fail over
* The data to populate the sidings (eg cold startup, failover ...) is heap migratable
* If a siding has a modification/removal which contains a fulfilled proceed train in data activation, the data activation fails 


NOTE:
* The train should be allowed to be on both a siding track and a parking spot.

Subject: Web Playback - authority report not showing up French characters correctly
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:

1. In track line create PT or WT or RTCP and in instruction write something in french with french characters. 
Something like this "à l'éducation. L'éducation doit être La dernière réduction d'impôt  être extrêmement phénomène d?El Niño apparaît. En été" 
2. In WebGraph  playback, in the windows with list of completed/cancelled authorities, in the authority messages select one of the authority form numbers that was Completed/Cancelled in French.

Expected: Fields that were filled in french should be shown in french. (For example RTCP reason, or TP/WT instructions). 
Actual: all french specific characters - shows up as upside down question marks.

Subject: View Changes are not Online Activatable in OCS.US
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Place a form in a view (For instance April to Bob is in OCS Test 1)
* Ensure that the form does not show up on the overview screens
* On the FSD, click on the All Auth button
* Select the form
* click on the call up button
* Note the views that are available
* Close the call up display
* Using the SDM change the view to not include the items that the forms are on
* Perform the data activation
** This includes a forced data activation script /home/s/prj/force_data_activation
* Press the call up button again

*Actual:*
* The view that was removed shows up in the call up list

*Expected:*
* The view that was removed does not show up in the call up list

Subject: RTC initials/name can be changed when cancelling RTCP.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Steps:
1. Place RTCP (P or R) on the track. 
2. Attemp to cancel RTCP (From Track display or Form Summary). 
3. Scroll down to line "Removed at:" and "RTC initials" field. Click in RTC initials and modify it. 

Expected result: RTC Initials should be pre-filled by system with RTC initials, which can not be modified. 
Actual result: RTC Initials can be modified.

Subject: Forms with instructions that are too long should be rejected.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
PT from a siding and into the next siding is adding both switches to the instructions field. This is also cutting off the Take siding instruction which possibly means the instruction field is too small?

When a route goes over a topology that provides multiple possible routes, instructions are generated for the switches taken revers. This in conjunction with the take siding at instruction generates instructions that are too long. 

Expected:
These forms should be rejected

Actual:
These forms are not rejected and the instructions field is cutting off the instructions.


NOTE:
The rule looks like it is checking for the instructions text to be less than 200 chars. However, the instructions can only be up to 75 chars.

NOTE:
This should also handle change language.

Subject: Web server installation error
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
1. When Playback deployed 
Directory /home/s/src/code/tsbase/webapps/WEBPlayback/utils missing directory classes

Should be /home/s/src/code/tsbase/webapps/WEBPlayback/utils/classes

2. After deployed on web server /usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/cn_rtc2.css is a soft link to 
/home/s/src/param/web/cn_rtc2.css

/usr/local/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/cn_rtc2.css - should be physical file

Subject: Limits that are both mileages are showing the Subdivision name twice
Author: cn customer
Description:
Testing databases - La Tuque Sub

Selected limits from Switch 6.69 to Switch 38.65.
When the form opened it displayed both mileages correctly but each on had the subdivision name.
When both limits are mileages the Subdivision name is only to be displayed on the last limit. (SRS.261)


Currently doing this:
Proceed from Mile 6.69 La Tuque Sub
to Mile 38.65 La Tuque Sub

Should be:
Proceed from Mile 6.69
to Mile 38.65 La Tuque Sub

RLB

Author: cn customer
Description: When you select the track, known point or switch (after selecting your toolbar button) the reaction of the flashing yellow is too slow. It is slow enough for the brain to process that you think you missed the selection and start tracking back to select it again before it flashes yellow.

ImOraBackup -u prime -p prime -a backup -s emp1 -d /home/DBbackup -x -z
*Expected:* * the script runs through in about 5 min. *Actual:* * The script does a du -k on the root directory to find the size of 'oracle' which takes hours and has nothing to do with the size of oracle

Subject: Limit selection for PT allows whole mile as train selection

Description:

Have 1 PT on a track, that has a whole mile next to a train ID.

Expected result:  limits should be rejected. 

Actual result:  form opens, and allows to enter manual train ID, and then complete the form, causing the fail over.

NOTE:

Subject: RTCP form loosees selection

Description:
*Setup:*
* Create an RTCP form
* Select the RTCP form on the Authority Summary
* Start cancelling/Superseding ect the RTCP form

*Expected:*

*Actual:*

Subject: Multiple trains in Parking spots is tricking the train forms
Author: cn customer
Description:
When I had multiple trains in a parking spot (train id with box around it) and created a PT form the system did not generate a list box for me to select the train I needed. Instead it opened the PT form with a blank addressee. I was then able to enter any data in the addressee field and issue the PT form.

In CTC TMT generates the selection box for these authority cases.
The behavior should be that after the selection a list box opens and the form remains closed. 
User selects train in list box and OK on the window.
Now the form opens with the addressee filled in with the train id selected.

Subject: All Auth button on the Authority Summary does not reset the filters
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* When there are no overview screens opened
* Place some forms in the system
* Click on the options button
* Set a filter on the Authority Summary
* Click on the All Auth Button

*Actual:*
* The forms appear that match the filter
* Click on the All Auth button again
* Open up the options dialog if it was closed
* The filter still exists

*Expected:*
* All forms that are in or partially in the users control territory are shown
* Click on the All Auth button again
* Open up the options dialog if it was closed
* The filter has been removed

Subject: JWDog cannot find activeMQ on process check
Author: Will Martin
Description:

* INITSOS the machine

* The machine goes PC complete.
* On first JWDog process check the machine finds all processes.

*Actual:*
* The machine goes PC complete
* On first JWDog process check Active MQ is not found. The machine tries to fail over.

* On another work station create/cancel/modify etc. a form that goes into the first workstations territory

*Expected:*

*Actual:*

Subject: Form Summary Quick Callup List is Wrong
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*Steps:*
1.Create/Complete authority (WT1) on COMP/APPL/N4TK/TRA, and authority (WT2) on /COMP/DOWN/N1TK/TRA.
2.F1 to Quick Callup and select "Bob to Hotmail : BOB"
3.Open Authority Summary

*Expected*:Created authority from step 1 is not displayed.
*Actual*:Created authority from step 1 is not displayed.

4.In the Authority Summary select the "All Auth" button.

*Expected*: Created authority from step 1 is displayed in greyed letters.
*Actual*: Created authority from step 1 is displayed in greyed letters.

5.Select the authority WT1.
6.Select the Authority Summary "Call Up" button.

*Expected*: The Call Up should list only views that show the authority.
*Actual*: the Call Up list shows views that do not show the authority.

7.Select the authority WT2.
8.Select the Authority Summary "Call Up" button.

*Expected*: The Call Up should list only views that show the authority.
*Actual*: the Call Up list shows views that show the authority.

Subject: Dialogs should not be able to be minimized
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Setup:*
* Place multiple forms in the system on a display stack so the display stack has a border around it
* Select view and the stack entry with the border
* execute
* The form selection dialog comes up

*Expected:*
* The dialog cannot be minimized

*Actual:*

Subject: DB Activation allowed when track under RTCP removed
Author: cn customer
Description:
I had an RTCP-P authority 1132 on the Sorel Sub between Mile 16 and Mile 19.6 in the Subdivision Track (105).

I had decided to remove the extra subdivision track (as we had two) in the nim M01960 NWT track.
I imported, transferred and activated the job to remove this track without failing activation.

When I went to cancel the authority the system had a failover at 1617-Jan 4.
Then when it went hot it failed over again. This time it went hot but the authority Ids would not show up on the display even with a new authority.

I had to cold start the system to get it to recover properly.

The proper response is that the system should reject the activation with the authority on the track.

Subject: OS Report should not be in the time zone of the Proceed train form
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps:*
* Place a proceed train form that starts in one timezone and ends in another
** My proceed train went from (3)OCST (17)NANC (5)STN (756)KnownPoint  to (3)OCST (20)POLLYCTC (16)SG182 (756)KnownPnt

* Os report the proceed train near the begining of the form
** For instance (3)OCST (17)NANC (5)STN (756)KnownPoint

* Os Report the proceed train near the end of the form (after the timezone change over)
** I OSed the proceed train for at (3)OCST (20)POLLYCTC (16)SG182 (756)KnownPnt

*Expected:*
* The two OS reports should only accept times an hour apart (They should be in different timezones)

*Actual:*
* The OS Report is always in the same timezone regardless of the timezone being OSed.

Note:
Question Log Entry BA:

*Question:*
The Time zone of the OS report is incorrect. It shows the time zone of the proceed train from

*Answer:*

Siemens)
SRS.5 states that the OS report should be in the time zone of the element that the os report occurs on

CN)
The timezone of the OS report should be in the time zone of the location (Must take into account the timezones of the os report and the pt form when compairing the os report time against the pt form completed time)

Select Swt Report and a switch in bilingual French Preferred territory.

RLB

Subject: Flashing race condition
Author: Will Martin
Description:
There is a race condition between T-Flash and the selected info.
The selected info goes from CSB to merp to medi
T-Flash goes from CSB to CIA to Merp to Medi
We currently protect first then set the T-Flash. Because these two actions do not take the same paths, it is possible for the T-Flash to arrive first, then the selected info is set. When the selected info is set the T-Flash gets re-set.

Resolution: Make a new info called flashing and T-Flash on this new info. The T-Flash should never be set by our applications therefore our applications will never re-set the T-Flash accidentally.

Steps:
* Place a form over some limits in the system

Expected:
* All limits for the form are flashing

Actual:
* Not all items in the limits flash

NOTE: This is a very rare race condition that is not easily reproducible.

Subject: Change language on OS Report makes restart action fail
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Add a train to a parking spot in the system
* Place a proceed train from OCST (3), KENN (12), SW1 (6), SWI (703) to OCST (3), MABE (16), STN (2), KnownPnt (756)
* Complete the proceed train
* Select the OS Report Button
* Select the first switch in the form OCST (3), KENN (12), SW1 (6), SWI (703)
* Enter a valid date/time into the form
* Press the change language button
* Once the form shows up in french, select the ok button
* Press the Recommencer (Restart) button

Expected:
* The form goes back to the initial view

Actual
* The form hangs with the status line FR:Waiting for Server Feedback

Subject: PT overlapping a PT to a Whole mile in the same direction allowed longer limits than preceding train
Author: cn customer
Description:
PT issued to a WM. 
Second PT selected from same start limit and went to the same TA as the first trains whole mile.
If I select Validate limits it passes validation and will allow me to issue the second PT with longer limits than the first PT.

If the WM entry and the second PT are not on the same TA then the validation gets rejected.

Cran Sub - PT from Mile 132.3 to Mile 80 which is now in the second TA of the block. We only have two TA's per block now.

New PT from Mile 132.3 to Bochart. 
Select Validate limits and it is allowed.

Alternate - First PT ends at Mile 110 instead of 80.
New PT from Mile 132.3 to Bochart. 
Select Validate limits and it is rejected.

Subject: Wrong hint in OS report status line
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Place a PT
* Select a track for an OS report
* Enter an invalid time in the future
* Enter a location
* Click into the time field
* Enter any text that does not match the time format of the time field.

Expected:
* Status line shows the required date format

Current:
* Status line reads "Entered Time does not match its date format"
* This means that we have to get back to a format that we do not show the user until they click out of then back into the field.

Note:
* When clicking into another field (like addressee) and then back into the time field, the hint will always display the default hint text, not the error

Subject: TOP over Train form with PA is rejecting validation if the letter case is different
Author: cn customer
Description: The check for the Foreman name on the TOP against the Foreman's name on the restriction in the PT or WT form is case sensitive. So if one is entered in lower case and the other is entered in Uppercase it fails validation. This check should not be case sensitive.

Subject: PT showing Main in track field when limits are from switch to switch
Author: cn customer
Description:
Testing the Sussex Sub database.

Noticed that when I selected limits from switch to switch (E Swt Sussex to Mile 38.75 swt then the PT form generated main track.
If instead the limits are a swt to a Known Point it does not generate main track. eg: Limits from W swt Moosehorn to Mile 83.5 did not generate Main track.

Subject: Project WT_Automated_Tests Automatic script failed
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
The test was running script 362_Create_over_PT_with_PA and it failed while cancelling a WT over a PT.
The WT was cancelled, the form closed, then when robot could not find the image of the PT.
Investigation revealed the image did not match due to the switches in Harry moved to normal at some point during the script.
Further investigation found a COM Failover and the elements locked under this PT (limits are from Jessica Eastbound Signal to George KP as End Limit).

The logs are *attached* and also in @bld1cn/home/spsy/Rel4@

Subject: RTCP forms do not show limits on select a form dialog
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place a top over some limits
* Place an RTCP over the same limits
* Select the cancel button on the TLD
* Select a device that both forms overlap and execute
* The select a form dialog comes up

Expected:
* Both TOP and RTCP forms show up and show their start and end limits

Actual:
* Only the TOP shows its start and end limits

Subject: Weather Alert popups on forms are failure dialogs
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps:*
* Put a weather alert into the system either manually (add steps to bug on how to do this) or by using the WAWA simulator
* Place a form over the weather alert

*Expected:*
* The weather alert is a query message, not a failure dialog

*Actual:*
* The weather alert is a failure message

Subject: We can supersede type a form that overlaps a superseded form
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place a TOP from (3)OCST (4)DARL (1)ESW (703)SWI to (3)OCST (6)FIRE (9)WSW (703)SWI (This is the first form)
* Place another TOP/XTOP/WT/PT from (3)OCST (5)ELLA (5)STN (756)KnownPnt to (3)OCST (6)FIRE (9)WSW (703)SWI (This is the second form)
* Begin superseding the first form with the new limits from (3)OCST (4)DARL (1)ESW (703)SWI to (3)OCST (5)ELLA (5)STN (756)KnownPnt
* Abort the supersede operation leaving the first form in superseded state and the superseding form in unacknolaged state
* Attempt to supersede type the second form from (3)OCST (5)ELLA (5)STN (756)KnownPnt to (3)OCST (6)FIRE (9)WSW (703)SWI

Expected:
* A failure dialog comes up

Actual:
* The form comes up allowing you to continue the supersede type operation

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CAUSE: missing java rule

RESOLUTION: added rule against overlapping form in superseded state to the CheckFormSelectionSupersedeOther.java class.

NOTE to TESTER: the resulting failure message that is output is "No valid forms in selection". The message is not the subject of this bug and will be dealt with in another issue/bug.

Subject: Bringing back suspended non-parking spot train causes CSB to throw exception
Author: Will Martin
Description:
*Steps:*

* Create a train in the system.
* Create a PT for this train such that train is moved to a non parking spot location (parking spot id = -1).
* Cancel the PT.
* This will suspend the train.
* Now through SRS simulator, send train summary message (option 2). I did it with deviation value =1 (late train). Note : I think Michael did train edit action here cause his logs indicated tracking id change.


*Actual:*
* Train record sends the message to java app (TR does not send parking spot info here).
* TM checks for Train. It does not have train. TM complaints about ?Train 1000005 has no valid parking spot!? & goes ahead & create train with parking spot id = -1.
* CSB check for parking spot id = -1 & throws exception.

*Expected:*
* The train should appear on the parking spot specified by the train summary message.
* CSB should not throw exception.

*Another Scenario causing same exception:*
#From the SRSSIM Sent Train Approach message to Train Record
Input:1
1.SRS train id:Gilberto
2.Parkingspot name:EBAY
3.Arrival time (HHMMSS):170000

5.Arrival date (YYYYMMDD):20151201
6.Daylight savings (y/n):Y
7.Current Subdivision Id:9002
7.Next Subdivision Id:9005
Sending TRAPP now!

#From Trackline Completed PT
		CN RTC2 Authority Log Begin
Completed: Train Authority No. 2084 (1d at ws01cn)
 1.	No.: 2084, To: ilb
 8.	Proceed from AUSTIN to Mile 40.56 at EBAY JCT
19.1.	Warning â?? You may encounter the following switches lined locked in the reversed position.
	Mile 7.91 BERLIN JCT
19.2.	Mile 40.56 EBAY JCT
20.	Permission â?? the following switches may be lined and locked in reversed position.
	Mile 7.91 BERLIN JCT
26.	Complete 12/01/15 16:30:39, RTC: 1d	Acknowledgements: 1
		CN RTC2 Authority Log End

#First OS report
		CN RTC2 Authority Log Begin
Completed OS Report: 1631 CST      Train ilb at BERLIN (1d at ws01cn)
Rollup: No.: 2084      ilb BERLIN
Comments: 
		CN RTC2 Authority Log End

#Second OS report
		CN RTC2 Authority Log Begin
Completed OS Report: 1636 CST      Train ilb at Mile 7 CAPITOL Sub (1d at ws01cn)
Rollup: No.: 2084      ilb Mile 7 CAPITOL Sub
Comments: 
		CN RTC2 Authority Log End

#From the SRSSIM Send Train Summary messaged to Train Record.
Input:2
1.SRS train id:GILBERTO
2.Location name:EBAY
3.OS time (HHMMSS):1635
Time needs to be in format HHMMSS
