Subject: PT system generated protect against field "Foreman ..." does not change when "Change Language" button is pressed
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps

1.TOP is completed in English on bilingual/English preferred territory.
2.Create a PT over TOP and Execute
- form is displayed, Protect Against field "Foreman ..."
3.Press the Change Language button
- (*actual*)form is displayed in French, but the Protect Against field contents remains in English
- (*expected*)the field contents should change to French text from "Foreman" to "Contrmaitre" 

*Same thing happens if the form is French

Subject: Creating a TOP over PT over PT overlap causes COM Failover
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps

1. create a PT (PT1)
2. create second PT over PT1
3. select TOP button, select device within limits of previously created overlap
4. execute
-  Causes COM failover!

Note:
The steps specified do not cause the problem.

These are the actual steps for reproducing the bugs:
1. Place pt1 with train number 1111
2. Place pt2 with train number 1111
3. Place pt3 with train number 2222 over pt2
4. Place TOP such that the overlaps against pt3 and pt2 start at the exact same location
5. On execution of the TOP should cause COM failover

Subject: TOP Instructions field on BOX 9 disappears after Validate Limits is pressed
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps 

1. open TOP form in created state
2. enter text in BOX 9 instructions field
3. press the Validate Limits on form
-  (actual) the instructions field on BOX 9 disappears
-  (expected) the instructions field should remain visible with entered text
4. press the Change Language button
-  the instructions field is back, but the entered text is deleted
5. Again enter text in BOX 9 instructions field
6. press the Change Language button
-  (actual) the instructions field on BOX 9 disappears
-  (expected) the instructions field should remain visible with entered text

Subject: Box 26 is not visible on an Unacknowledged form
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
steps

1. create a form and leave in Unacknowledged
2. view the form
- (actual) the form displays box 1 and box 9
- (expected) the form should display box 1, box9 and box 26

Subject: The auhtority forms are printing out either "Main" or "Siding" on the "on" field.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps

1. printout a created authority (either PT or TOP) 
-  the printout displays the "on" field from form section 8 with a "Main" or "Siding"
-  while the electronic form does not display anything on the "on" field

Subject: Overview Screens are allowed to shift (alt+arrow key) away while an authority in Create Mode
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. requirement

SRS.923 The system shall not allow any Track Line display to be moved, resized, closed, or panned while an authority is opened on the workstation or the user selects an authority operation from the toolbar together with the first item selection.


h3. precondition

1. authority is created 
2. overview is open

h3. steps

1. view authority
2. press shortcut to shift overview 
-  overview shifts to direction selected *(This should not happen, overview should be locked)* 

1. open authority in Create Mode
2. press shortcut to shift overview 
-  overview shifts to direction selected *(This should not happen, overview should be locked)* 

1. open authority in Cancel Mode
2. press shortcut to shift overview 
-  overview shifts to direction selected *(This should not happen, overview should be locked)*

Subject: COM Failover because the AuthSum allows for a authority in Superseded State to be selected for Completed
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. preconditions

1. an authority exists in Superseded State
2. an authority exists in Unacknowledged State

h3. steps

1. produce a COM cold start
-  stopsos both COMs
-  initsos both COMs
-  wait for system COMs to be complete (hot)
2. Bring up BSD, login as RTC
3. View the Authority Summary
4. Select an authority in Superseded State
-  The AuthSum Complete button is enabled *(button should not be enabled)*
5. Select the Complete button
-  This caused a COM failover

time of occurence wsa 11:47:56 com1ocs was primary

Subject: Authority Summary window is re-opened on top of overview screen after COM Failover
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps

1. From a System that is Complete (HOT) open the Authority Summary on a working screen.
2. Open Overview screens
3. Stop both COMS
4. Init COM1 and after COM1 is Complete Init COM2
-  Once COM1 gets to PC COMPLETE, shortly after the Authority Summary is re-opened on screen 0 over the Overview Screen.


note: entering parachgd jmsgate from primary COM also produces the bug.

Subject: Superceding Form
Author: Will Martin
Description: When superseding a form (TOP or PT) known points are not valid selection items when selecting the superseding limits. The known point items should be valid items for superseding.

Subject: Manual restrictions on PT Form
Author: Will Martin
Description:
* Place a PT Form over a switch.
* Add a manual restriction by selecting a track within the limits of the form
* Edit the addressee of the manual restriction
* Press the modify switch button
* Add a switch permission
* Press the ok button

Expected
* The form comes back with the new switch permission
* The switch permission is logged out to general summary
* The previously added addressee of the protect against is still shown on the form
* The previously  added addressee of the protect against is still editable

Actual
* The form comes back with the new switch permission
* The switch permission is logged out to general summary
* The previously added addressee of the protect against is gone
* The previously added addressee of the protect against is still editable

Subject: Supercede box shows up on PT modify
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup
* Create a PT form with a switch warning
* Supercede said PT form
* Modify PT form
* Cancel switch warning
* Press transmit

Expected
* Only box 27 shows up for read repeat.

Actual
* Box 2 and 27 shows up for read repeat.

Subject: Viewing an unacknowledged authority that is in an overlap is not allowed.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. Steps

1. create authority overlaps and leave at least one of them in Unacknowledged state.
2. From the Track Line select the View button and the limits in the overlap.
- The overlap box is displayed with a list of the authorities in the overlap.
3. select the authority in unacknowledged state 
- The Ok button remain disabled so the authority cannot be viewed.

*note: this also applies to the Cancel function.

Subject: Rule runs on cancel form done
Author: Will Martin
Description: When the done button is pressed on a cancel for operation (both PT and TOP) the rules are run. This rule run should not take place. By the time this rule run occurs the form action is already completed. Take the rule run on done button pressed out of PT Cancel and TOP cancel workflows.

Subject: overlapping form dialog
Author: Will Martin
Description: when selecting a form on item/authority display/trainId and an operation is performed (create top/create pt/modify/view/cance/supercede) when there are more than one forms available a popup comes up to select a form. The current dialog reads "Overlap Box". This dialog must read "Select a Form"

Subject: Static info changes from SDM are not being recognized by the Java applications
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Steps:
1) Initiate a TOP starting with an item that is in English only B2.
2) Verify that the language in the form is English and no Change Language button is shown.
3) Abort the form.
4) Using SDM or mpu, change the language configuration of the item's B2 to be French preferred.
5) Initiate a TOP in the same location with the same start item.
6) Verify that the language in the form is now French and a Change Language button is now shown.

Expected:
* Language is French and change language button is shown.

Additional Functionality:
This also affects simple static infos like CTC Main, OCS Siding, etc. Make sure SDM and mpu works for all static infos that Java is using.

If it is not possible to do. Then we need to devise a way to have the Java applications update after something is changed. (similarly to what we have to do for running force_data_activation).

Subject: Change Language doesn't change System Generated VIA instructions on TOP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Preconditions:
* Logged in as RTC
* Have control of ocstest1 territory

Steps:
1) Initiate a TOP from Polly Station to Nancy Station.
2) Verify the instruction field in box 9 and the rest of the form is in English.
3) Click on the Change Language button
4) Verify the instruction field in box 9 and the rest of the form is in French.

Expected:
* The VIA instructions should be in French along with the rest of the form.

Actual:
* The VIA instructions stayed in English.

Subject: NPE when creating TOP with shortened miles on a single item
Author: Mathias Metzner
Description:
Preconditions: * you are logged in as a dispatcher and control the OCS W Territory * a trackline is open Steps: # select the TOP button on the toolbar # select the FIREWALL Main Track (OCST/FIRE/M1TK/TRA) # shorten the limits from 96 miles to 95 miles # transmit the top # complete the top Expected: * the top is created * no exception is thrown * The mileage is shown correctly left mileage on the left side of the addressee, right mileage on the right side of the addressee. Possible solutions: * When we do not have enough items to reliably get a direction (ie when we have 1 item) We can rely on a method on the AbstractLimitsForm called getFormDirectionAtLastTrack. What Happened: * the top is created * a null pointer exception is thrown in csb when the form is archived More Info: 
FATAL [CommonJmsListener] Exception occured during message handling of message ArchiveFormMessage [clientId=98, form=7] : 
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at ocs.us.core.types.Direction.fromItemConnection(Direction.java:187)
        at ocs.us.core.util.ProcessImageUtils.getStartingDirectionOfLimits(ProcessImageUtils.java:183)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.FormConversionUtils.getAuthorityLimitItems(FormConversionUtils.java:566)
        at ocs.us.cs.bridge.vicos.FormConversionUtils.createAuthorityAndRestrictionLimitItems(FormConversionUtils.java:153)

Subject: selecting train id on create pt
Author: Will Martin
Description:
We can no longer select a trainId when creating a proceed train.

When we have a trackline open and we have territories and we have already placed one PT on the trackline with the train number display that the PT is for visible on the trackline.

Expected:
We select Proceed train
The train Id for the existing PT is selected
Limits for the new PT are selected
Execute
The new PT form shows up with the train Id filled in by the selected train id

Actual
Select Proceed Train
The Train Id for the existing PT is selected
Status bar shows "Combination of Selections is not allowed"

Subject: GenSum becomes useless after a COM Failover
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
GenSum does not update (show new messages) and does not scroll up or down. A status messages is produced when attempting to scroll "NO LIST SELECTED"
Shawn tracked down where this message is coming from pointer sTxLiNoKomp

This bug hasn't been reliably reproduce-able, but the steps are as follows:

h3. preconditions

system is running hot and complete
overview screens open
gensum open
form summary open
Open a TOP form in --Input Mode-- 

h3. steps

Failover the primary COM
Wait for failed COM to become SB COMPLETE
Complete the Form and you'll notice the GenSum does not show new messages.

At this point the Gensum is unresponsive. You can try scrolling up or down and you will get the status message "NO LIST SELECTED"
You could open another Gensum window and see the new messages that the unresponsive GenSum omits to display.

**********************************************

Also Noticed in another failover occurence the Trackline continued to display devices blocked. When I opened another Trackline to verify if the Trackline was dead, somehow this refreshed the Trackline and then the display was correct. I could not reproduce this at all.

h3. preconditions

system is running hot and complete
overview screens open
gensum open
form summary open
TOP form open in --Transmit Mode--

h3. steps

initsos the primary com, wait for runup pc complete and hot
complete the form
cancel the form

h3. expected result

the form is canceled and not displayed blocked on the trackline

h3. actual result

the form is canceled and but continues to display blocked on the trackline

Subject: Provide options/configuration for NOT loading specific ocs-cached fields from OcsCache on COLD STARTUP.
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* We have a way to mark OcsCached fields in the code as "failover only"
* "Failover only" annotated fields are not read on cold startup
* "Failover only" annotated fields are cleared (reset) in the cache on cold startup
* "Failover only" annotated fields are read from the cache after fail-over
* All cached fields that were being cleared on cold-startup with a .clear/.reset call in code are annotated as "failover only"
* The message uuid container is "failover only"

Subject: Make Territory Transfer locking work correctly together with REF
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
* In CTC, cannot do -territory transfer- Change RTC if form is up.
* Cannot do REF functionality (initiate form, view form, etc) if TTR is up after a transfer.
* If TTR form pops up due to someone else's action or a valid case where Territory can be gained outside the normal territory transfer mechanisms, then any open form action can be continued/completed (it's just that initiating an operation is disallowed).
** Can this ever happen?
* Applies to operations from both Track Line & Form Summary.
* Applies to the following forms/authorities:
** TOP
** XTOP
** WT
** PT
** OS Report
** Switch Report
** RTCP
* Questions:
** Does this only apply to specific territory transfer? (e.g., does it need to lock for emergency transfer?)

Show that:
* No new form operation (create/view/modify/delete/supersede) from TLD and FSD can be triggered while a TTR is open due to a territory transfer.
* No -new territory transfer- Change RTC operation can be initiated by the user, if the user has any form open (in any state)
* If a TTR opens (a territory is being assigned from another user) and a form is open, the user is allowed to continue working on the form.
** Check on CTC, whether or not to allow a retransmit on a form that is being viewed at the time of the TTR
** Check on CTC how "532" behaves (whether or not it rejects transfers etc) and make it work the same way.

Note: Also, check on CTC if the system allows a user to transfer his territory to someone else, if the other user has a form open.

CTC behavior:
* ACOP locks MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss for both xids when shift change is requested
* ACOP unlocks MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss for both xids when shift change is accepted/aborted
* TTR locks MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss for xid when automatic TTR is generated
* TTR unlocks MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss for xid when automatic TTR is closed
* AUM does not allow opening/creation of forms when MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss is set for the XID
* AUM locks MSG_LOCK_AuthFormOpen for xid when a form is open
* AUM unlocks MSG_LOCK_AuthFormOpen for xid when form is closed
* AUM unlocks MSG_LOCK_AuthFormOpen for all xids when AUM shuts down
* AUM unlocks MSG_LOCK_AuthFormOpen when starting up (cold startup)
* FORMS can be continued if they are already open (RETRANSMIT, SUPERCEDE, CANCEL, ...) event if MSG_LOCK_TxfrInProgrss is set

Subject: Switches with permissions should be moved to reversed when a Proceed Train is issued
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When issuing (transmitting) a Proceed Train authority that has permissions on switches, those switches get moved to the reverse position.
* If the authority is aborted before completion (and the form does not stay unacknowledged), those switches that were previously normal before being moved should be reverted back to normal position.

Just some notes for future:
* For Work Train, if a switch permission is added, switch warning is added too. If switch permission is removed, warning is also removed (only if the position is normal).

Subject: Put active authorities on the Territory Transfer Report
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
The territory transfer form should show active authorities on the territories that are being transferred.

NOTE: TTR uses the AUMITEMS relation for displaying authorities on the territory transfer report. The AUM wrote to the AUMITEMS relation.

Show that:
* When the TTR screen shows up, show forms that are in UNACKED, COMPLETED, and SUPERSEDED states.
** Use the same format as in CTC (use existing format).
* Only forms that have at least a track + switches in the territory that is being transferred.
* Determine order of authorities in CTC and discuss what order to use.

NOTE: Think about possibly not relying on the relations and have TTR get the data from REF.

Subject: Provide filter options in FSD
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
v3: Section 2.1 e

See SRS/SOW

Show that
* When the FSD is opened, there is no filtering initially
* There is an Options button on the FSD
** The Options button is left aligned.
** When Options button is clicked the filter dialog opens
** When the Options Dialog is open no action can be performed on the FSD until the Options dialog is closed.
** When the Options Dialog is opened after a filter has already been applied, the currently applied filter options are selected (if still available).
* Authorities can be filtered through the dialog by authority type, subdivision and addressee/reason
** Filterable options are generated from the users active forms.
** All filter options are multi-select lists
* On clicking the OK button, the filter dialog closes and all authorities are shown on the FSD that match the filter criteria. All other authorities are hidden.
* On clicking the Cancel button, the filter dialog closes and the previous filter criteria are applied (nothing changes on the FSD)
* Filtering only applies for the FSD instance that the filter was selected for (other FSDs are not affected and re-opening replaces the current FSD with a new unfiltered FSD)
* The current filter is displayed in the title bar in the format "Authority Summary - Filtered by: (comma separated list of currently applied filter options)" (Find and use bi-lingual strings from CTC system.) 
** When no filter is applied the title bar shows "Authority Summary"

* When a form is added/deleted/modified etc.
** The FSD is updated accordingly if the filter criteria matches the form
** If the Option Dialog is open the filter options are updated.

!FSDMockup.png!

Subject: Cleanup paths do not exist in all workflows
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Most every "state" node on a workflow is a user action that the workflow stops and waits for a user action. Every time the workflow stops at one of these states, there is a possibility that the workflow attempts to take a transition which is named "CLEANUP". This transition is taken if the client disconnects at one of these nodes. This CLEANUP transition should go between a state node to an abort path. This path should not include any user interaction (aka, no state nodes) because we would not have taken this path if there was a client to talk to. If such a transition does not exist and a client disconnects due to network problems, womvis, etc REF will explode.

Go through every workflow and verify that there is a cleanup path from every state node to an uninterrupted abort path. If a path does not exist add it with the proper logging, and workflow variable setting in the transition. This includes all view/cancel/modify/supercede/mothership etc workflows. All of them.

If you require clarification of this bug, please talk to Will or Dang.

Subject: Topology connectivity in DB is screwed up in many places.
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Steps:
* With TOP operation, select the combination of every stretch of track b/w known points and/or switches.

Expected:
* Each selection should flash a contiguous set of topology from the start point of selection to the end point of selection.

Actual:
* In many places, such as the CTC "interlocking/crossing," things don't connect appropriately.

Note:
* Please also change signals to known points that are shaped like signals (just local figures).

Subject: TOP can be placed without proper conflict with boxes
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Steps
1) Issue a TOP in an area where whole miles can be entered (but don't enter whole miles for this first TOP).
2) Initiate the creation of another TOP on top of the existing TOP.
3) Change the name of the foreman to match the first TOP's foreman.
4) Change the mileage.
5) Select Validate Limits
6) Now change the name of the foreman to NOT match the first TOP.
7) Click Transmit and complete the form.

Expected
* System should not allow the form to be issued/transmitted since there is no conflict with for the original TOP.

Actual
* System issues form without proper protection against the first TOP.

Proposed Fix:
* Whenever the foreman name is changed, transmit should be disabled, and validate limits needs to be pressed (if all else is valid) so that the system can recalculate protections. CN has agreed to this change.

Subject: Buttons on the french world map do not match up with the English version
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
* Log in as a French user
* Open a world map

*Expected*

Subject: Ensure system generated restrictions (overlaps, switch permissions/warnings, etc) are logged to general summary.
Author: Dang Vang
Description: System generated restrictions (conflict with, afters, protect against, follow behinds, and switch permissions/warnings) should be logged to general summary. Currently they are not. Also, switch permissions/warnings should get logged on user add/remove if not already.

Subject: Known Points should be referred to on Forms using the B2Text only.
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
When issuing forms where the limits end at known points, the limits currently show "ElemText at B2Text."

The expected and correct way is to only show "B2Text" which is the location of the known point. This only applies to known points (not switches).

Make sure it shows up correctly in the following places:
* Authority forms
* CDLS
* General Summary
* Authority Summary
* Print outs
* Anything else you can think of

Subject: Woman Display disturbed after COM Failover
Author: Mathias Metzner
Description:
Prerequisites:
Have two users (the below will refer to these as user1 and user2) logged on into their own MMIs (so two MMIs).
Have a TOP in completed state.

Steps:
1) Have user1 select and execute the existing TOP for view.
2) Have user2 select and execute the existing TOP for view (while user1 still has it up for view).
3) Fail the Coms over.
4) Close the TOPs for both users

Expected:
The flashing of the existing TOP stops after closing the form for each user.

Actual:
For one of the users (random?) the woman display "lags" with the highlighting. All subsequent flashing (selection) for that user on that trackline have that lag.
Closing the Trackline and re-opening it fixes that issue.

Note: this also seems to occur without having the forms open on failover.
Note2: on windows, the trackline window with the lag displays "Display update disturbed !" in the title bar (could not be observed on the virtual machine (xubuntu))

Subject: The Trackline Quick Call-Up stops working
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
PLEASE MONITOR for the following:

Discovered that the Call-Up list did not open sometime in the afternoon. Patch 4 for Release 2 had been installed in the morning. I don't know of the steps if any that caused the Call-Up to not respond, so it can't really be reproduced.
Tried Logging off the BSD and re-logging - still didn't work
Tried closing the BSD and re-launching and logging in - still didn't work
I had Will look into the logs.
Finally brought both COMS down and after restart the Call-Up list started to work.

Executed a few ad-hoc tests and the call-up list continued working.

Subject: Additional PT over PT rules
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Consider PT over PT w/ PA and also case for requiring only one PA on last overlapping PT. Show that: * We can place a PT over an existing one that goes off a switch onto a different path. * -The system generated PA for an existing PT only happens for the very last PT (in the same direction).- * -A PT is not allowed to extend past the limits of ANY existing PT it is overlapping (in same direction) if there are no protect against restrictions on the existing one. It is allowed to extend past if the Protect Against on the existing PT goes to the end of the existing PT.- * -When creating a PT over existing PT that has whole miles (NOTE: need verification w/ CN):- ** -If the proposed end limits are past the end limit of an existing PT in same direction having whole miles on the end limit, and the end limit of that existing PT is within the selected "block," then automatically shorten to the whole miles of that existing end limits, otherwise, if the proposed end limits are past the "block," then reject as we normally would since it is past the end limits.- 
|----|----|----|----|
------->    (existing PT)
  S1   S2   (user selection points)
----------> (selection expansion)
------->    (automatic truncation)
** -If the proposed start limit is before the existing PT's end limit (same direction), and the existing PT has whole miles for the end limit within the selected "block," then automatically shorten to the whole miles of that existing end limit, otherwise, if the proposed start limits are past the "block," then reject.- 
|----|----|----|----|
------->         (existing PT)
       S1   S2   (user selection points)
     ----------> (selection expansion)
        -------> (automatic truncation)
* -The same rules here apply for supersede (all create rules should apply for supersede).- * -When creating a PT over existing PT of same direction that has a PA on the proposed one:- ** -The proposed PT can extend past the PA in either direction as long as the PA covers the overlap with the existing PT in full in that direction.- ** -The proposed limits should be automatically truncated to the limits of the PA on the side that does not fully cover the overlap with the existing PT as long as the proposed limit expansion is within the block of the PA.- * -In the case where the system needs to shorten, system should prompt that it has changed the limits to the user (query).- ** -Aborting the query will abort the authority- NOTE: In this story, a PT form is allowed to overlap a form that takes a different path as the proposed form. We also only protect against the form directly in front of the proposed form.

Subject: Additional rules for TOP over PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that: * When creating a TOP over any existing PT, the systems displays a Continue/Abort message box displaying the addressee of the existing PT and the limits of the overlap. * -When creating a TOP over an existing PT that has a PA for a foreperson, and the name of the foreman for the TOP is not yet known (not pre-selected from the TLD), the system generates a Continue/Abort message box that allows the user to enter the name of the foreman.- * When creating a TOP over existing PT without a PA for the foreman named in the TOP, the system generates the follow-behind box for the TOP for the last PT. ** The train addressee is generated. ** Location and time are to be filled in by RTC and mandatory. *** The Time is validated to be in the 24 hour clock format similar to Call RTC * -In the simple case where we have one overlapping and existing PT with a PA for the foreman named in the proposed TOP:- ** -The system should automatically shorten/truncate the TOP such that its limits are within the PA's limits for any overlapping area.- 
|----|----|----|----|
     >--------->   (our existing PT)
       |RRRRR|     (the protect against on PT)
       S1   S2     (limits selection for TOP)
     |---------|   (expanded limits selection)
       |-----|     (truncated TOP limits if foreman matches addressee of PA)
** -Note, we still allow the TOP to extend past the limits of the PT itself if the PA also goes to the end of the limits of the PT.- 
|----|----|----|----|
     >--------->   (our existing PT)
     |RRRRRRR|     (the protect against on PT)
  S1        S2     (limits selection for TOP)
|--------------|   (expanded limits selection)
|------------|     (truncated TOP limits if foreman matches addressee of PA)

|----|----|----|----|
     >--------->      (our existing PT)
       |RRRRRRR|      (the protect against on PT)
       S1        S2   (limits selection for TOP)
     |--------------| (expanded limits selection)
       |------------| (truncated TOP limits if foreman matches addressee of PA)
** -Also note, we do not truncate past a known point or switch. (stay inside the block). If the selection is outside the block of the PA, then reject.- 
|----|----|----|----|
     >--------->   (our existing PT)
       |RRRRR|     (the protect against on PT)
   S1       S2     (limits selection for TOP)
|--------------|   (expanded limits selection)
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX   (rejected TOP limits if foreman matches addressee of PA)
* -For slightly not so simple cases where we have two overlapping Proceed Trains (both going in the same direction as one another) where both Proceed Trains have PA restrictions against the foreman in the proposed TOP:- ** -The valid limits for truncation is the intersection of the two PA restrictions.- 
|----|----|----|----|
     >----1---->   (our existing PT #1)
       |RRRRR|     (the protect against on PT #1)
>---------2---->   (our existing PT #2)
|RRRRRRRRRRRRRR|   (the protect against on PT #2)
       S1   S2     (limits selection for TOP)
     |---------|   (expanded limits selection)
       |-----|     (truncated TOP limits if foreman matches addressee of PAs)
** -Again, if the truncation would have to shorten to a known point or switch, then reject.- * In the case where we have two overlapping Proceed Trains (both in the same direction as one another), but only the last PT has the PA: ** -The system should truncate the proposed limits to the PA limits as we do before.- ** The system should also generate a follow behind for the first train if it is still overlapping. * In the case where we have two overlapping Proceed Trains (same direction), but only the first PT has the PA: ** The system -should not truncate, but- should just generate the follow behind for the last train, just like it would have if there were no PAs in the first place. * -If the system truncates the limits, then the system should query the user that it has done so.- ** -The user can continue with the form and keep it truncated.- ** -Or the user can select to abort, which should abort the entire form.- * If there are overlapping PTs in two different directions, each has to be considered for a follow-behind. So if both require a follow-behind, then there would be two follow-behind boxes in the proposed TOP. * Utilize the above criteria to extrapolate for cases of more than 2 trains. * If changing limits or foreman name: ** If follow behind is no longer required, it should be removed. ** -We only mark the PAs used if it is part of the intersection of PAs used for calculating overlaps.- * The same rules here apply for supersede (all create rules should apply for supersede). * The new follow behind box is part of: ** CDLS ** General Summary (when system generates it) ** Archive ** Printing ** Read/repeat ** (all the usual stuff, if questions, ask) * For the follow behind to be valid, the limits of the proposed TOP must follow the path (switch positions) of the last train. * Make sure you cannot lengthen whole miles. * Validate limits should regenerate restrictions (follow behind). * -PAs only "activate" ONCE. Meaning, once a TOP is cancelled that a PA applied to, another TOP cannot be created for it. (should apply to all authorities).- ** -It should "activate" when the proposed authority is persisted unacknowledged.- ** -Full PA is used even if TOP does not take up the entire PA.- ** -It is considered "activated" as long as the new authority matches, even if the scenario causes a "follow behind" instead.- -Note: Think about having the user specify the foreman name ahead of time vs entering it in the form and using validate limits...-

Subject: Make form operations doable via selecting on the Addressee/TrainID of that authority
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When selecting view/modify/cancel then selecting an addressee/train id the action is executed as if selecting that form directly (similar to having selected it from authority summary)
** Note that you should not be able to select parking spots for this.
** This means when selecting on a display stack with multiple forms, no form selection popup is shown unless selecting a bordered entry.
* If a display stack entry is selected with a border a dialog pops up allowing user to select which form they wish to operate on.
** Use the usual form dialog selection popup, however, only show the "extra" forms. "Extras" as in all forms other than the ones displayed on the trackline stack excluding the border entry (or all forms not displayed + the bordered entry form).
* We can create a PT by also selecting an existing PT ID and not just parking spot.
* We can add manual PA restrictions in the PT create by selecting the PT IDs.
* General summary logging is shown indicating which form is being operated on (should already be there -- logged by the workflows?).
* Supersede can also be initiated via selecting the addressee/train ID, then the limits.
** The limits selected should then be used for superseding of the selected authority (existing validation should still run and make sure proposed limits are overlapping the existing limits, etc).
** In the case where the entry has "multiple" PTs, do the usual pop-up to select the authority desired.

Subject: Proceed train into yard/border
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* If the end limit of a PT borders non-OCS topology that has a parking spot associated, the train ID appears in the parking spot as well.
* Train IDs should not be automatically filled on OCS items nor in the middle of a PT.
* Train record sees the "manual move" (new location is shown in train record, similar to a standard move train)
* There can only be one parking spot for a train (it can only show up in one parking spot)
** If it is in another parking spot already, it is removed from that other parking spot and placed into the new one.

Subject: Display whole mile values
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* On issue of a TOP or PT (transmit button pressed and passed validation), the mileages show up to the left and/or right of the addressee/train label on the side that contains the whole miles. (If no whole miles entered, no mileages show up).
** Display the left-most mileage on the left side, and the right most mileage on the right side.
* The mileages should show up as close to the train/addressee label as possible:
** Whole miles on the left side of the Train/Addressee label are right justified.
** Whole miles on the right side of the Train/Addressee label are left justified.
* If the train/addressee label goes away, the mileages also go away (cancel, abort before unacknowledged, etc).
* The color of the mileage is yellow.
* For the entry that has a box around it, the mileages for it is shown, not the mileages for the other authorities that are not shown.

Note: Signoff #9306 at the same time.

Subject: Display limits as known point/mile combination
Author: Dang Vang
Description: Sign this off when #9307 is signed off. Verify that whole miles shows up correctly.

Subject: Log Form State Changes with CDLS
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The CDLS format in OCS looks EXACTLY as it does in the CDLS format document.
** Exception is that Call RTC shows up before the Complete box.
* Make sure the "action" is bilingual like the format doc and in the correct casing (upper/lower).
* Also ensure all other bilingual strings show up correctly.
* Verify for each existing form state change that CDLS shows up when it should. Verify against what is in the CDLS format doc + expect CDLS for abort case from create/issue. (Do not remove existing CDLS, only add if not there).
* We have a test testing the actual CDLS string in both french and english (not just verifying against bundles but actual text).

TO ASK CN: Do we need the screen numbers at the end of the workstation name in the CDLS output?

Subject: Cleanup Tools
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This story is currently more for us right now to deal with problems we may be facing with REF/forms. There are currently no requirements on the CN side for this.

Ideas:
* Remove specific non-persisted forms? (should we allow persisted forms being deleted?)
* Clear t-flashing (or decrement CIA state?)
* Clear protections
* Disable form validation for specific form (identify on TLD/FSD?)
* Recover from woman locks

Show that:
* -We can recover from a broken workflow:-
** -The client workflow state can be reset/removed so that it can start a new workflow.-
* We can unlock woman worldmaps manually.
* We can clear t-flashing for chosen items or all items for a particular client. (also think about decrementing for cases where client may need to be tracked more than once per item).
* We can reset pending operation in TM. (and therefore do another operation -- supposedly when the first one fails in some way).
* We can manually force ADS to clear spectrum INFOs related to authority coloring and "re-block" with new form container request. Also take into account addressee/train ids.
* Failovers involving the above works correctly.

Subject: Provide Bilingual Proceed Train
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The proceed train authority shows up in the correct language based on start limit's language configuration similar to TOP.
* We can change the language of a Proceed Train authority in create before transmit is selected.
* We cannot change the language of a Proceed Train authority once it is issued.
* We cannot change the language of a Proceed Train that is being superseded. The same language as the old proceed train authority being superseded is used.
* CDLS shows with correct language as shown in form.
* Printing shows with correct language as shown in form.
* Reject/continue dialogs related to the Proceed Train should still show in the user language, not the form language.

Subject: Flashing is broken on subsequent views when multiple users are viewing the same form
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Prerequisites:
* Have two users (the below will refer to these as user1 and user2) logged on into their own MMIs (so two MMIs).
* Have a TOP in completed state.

Steps:
1) Have user1 select and execute the existing TOP for view.
2) Observe the flashing on user1's screen vs user2's screen.
3) Have user2 select and execute the existing TOP for view (while user1 still has it up for view).
4) Observe the flashing on user1's screen vs user2's screen.

Expected:
* When user2 selects an item for view of the existing TOP, it should flash.
* When user2 executes the view operation, the full limits of the TOP should flash.

Actual:
* There is no flashing in either selection or execution stages for user2.

Subject: Proceed Train using top display stack entry
Author: Will Martin
Description:
* While logged on to a vicos box with usual permissions and all territory
* Username: user
* Place a TOP on the trackline and bring into completed state. 
** The foreperson name shows up in a display stack
* Click on Prcd Trn Button
* Select the foreperson name in the display stack
** TLD status line shows "Combination of Selections is not allowed" (Correct)
* Select the foreperson again
* Click on a track section
** Track that was selected flashes yellow (Incorrect: should show "Combination of Selections is not allowed" because this should still be the first selection)
* Upon execute REF explodes (Incorrect: REF should never know about this execute)

Subject: Supersede is allowed when overlapping only the switch
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Scenario: 
          -- ----- --
|        /           \        |
 ----- ----- ----- ----- -----
A         B           C        D
Steps: 1) Place a TOP from A to B. 2) Do a supersede operation with limits B to C. Expected: * System rejects the operation since there are no overlapping forms on the area. Actual: * System continues with supersede on the existing TOP that was there from A to B.

Subject: Data Activation not working in ADS and likely others
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Steps:
1) Make a change (via BQ) to the ITEMREL relation to increase one of the Addressee ID stack sizes from 1 to 2.
2) Run force_data_activation script
3) Place two TOPs starting on the track that the Authority ID was changed for.
4) Observe the Addressee ID field below the track

Expected:
* There should be no box around the Addressee ID field.

Actual:
* There is a box around the Addressee ID field.

Additional Notes:
It looks like ADS did not participate in Data Activation and thus did not receive the change regarding the ITEMREL update. Either that or ITEMREL is not correctly updating on Data Activation. Please also ensure that other applications on the Java side are participating in Data activation and fix accordingly.

Subject: Retransmit PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:

* When the form is brought up for view, the retransmit button is available.
** Retransmit button is disabled if
*** The authority is not in COMPLETE state.
*** The user does not control any of the tracks/switches in the authority.

* When the retransmit button is pressed
** Retransmit is logged to gensum
** The form shows up in Retransmit Read mode
** Contains all boxes as in the viewed form
** Call RTC box is included if not already included
** Include new instruction regarding retransmission (similar to TOP). Use a new field if there are existing instructions. This should participate in the read/repeat.
** Contains buttons
*** Done (disabled)
*** Repeat (enabled after last field read)
*** Restart (Always enabled)
*** Abort (Always enabled)
*** Paging buttons if required where they normally are

* When Repeat button pressed
** Form is shown in Retransmit Repeat
** Contains buttons
*** Done (enabled after last field is repeated)
*** Repeat (enabled only after last field repeated)
*** Restart (Always enabled)
*** Abort (Always enabled)
*** Paging buttons if required where they normally are
** When last field is repeated
*** The gensum logs that the retransmission is repeated (similar to TOP)

* When Done button is pressed
** Form goes away
** Retransmission done is logged to gen sum
** Retransmission is logged to CDLS
*** includes "retransmission" instructions
*** Should have the retransmission RTC initials/workstation in the heading of CDLS (not the complete section)

* When the abort button is pressed
** Form goes away
** GenSum logs abort of retransmission

* When restart button is pressed
** Form gets reset to beginning of current mode (Read or Repeat)

* Existing counters should be displayed on form
** Note that the retransmit should not update these counters.
* Bilingual form should be retransmitted in the language it was issued in.

Subject: Modify PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* We can initiate a modify PT operation by clicking "Modify" on toolbar and selecting item with form then executing.
* Modifying requires authorization
* Modify is allowed only if the user controls at least one of the items in the form (CIA shouldn't allow selection of non-controlled item)
* User is prompted if more than one form exists on item.
* The form pops up for modification
* No fields except Call RTC fields are editable (time & instructions)
* Check boxes are available for each of the boxes: 14, 15, 16, 19.1, 19.2, 19.3, 19.4, 19.5, 19.6.
* The user can select up to 3 checkboxes/items.
* If the user selects any checkbox, the Call RTC section should not be editable.
* If the user deselects all checkboxes, then the Call RTC section can be edited.
* Once the user changes the Call RTC section, no checkboxes can be selected.
* Once the user restores/resets the call rtc section, then the checkboxes can be checked.
* There should be no checkboxes on items that have already been cancelled previously.
* The items that are cancelled are still visible for viewing / retransmit / etc.
* -There is a button "Cancel" on the bottom of the form to left of "Transmit" that will be enabled when any checkbox is selected.-
* -Transmit button should be disabled until "Cancel" button is clicked.-
* -"Cancel" button becomes disabled after they click it the first time (they cannot re-add new checkboxes/items).-
* -Pressing "Cancel"-
** -removes checkboxes so that user cannot change selection.-
** -Fills in a new Cancel Item box with the data filled in.-
* Transmit button becomes enabled when any item has been selected for cancel item operation.
* As user selects checkboxes for item cancel, the cancel item box is generated accordingly on the fly (and updated/removed accordingly as well on uncheck).
* Read/Repeat happens on the new Cancel Item box when Transmit is pressed. Note: Only the cancel item box is shown for read/repeat.
** Can restart
** Can repeat multiple times as usual
** Keeps track of a counter and displays it in the box same way as before. (NOTE: Each cancel item box has its own counter)
** "Done" button is available when the read/repeat is finished.
* Abort can be done at any point, and will revert the authority back to its original state before the modify. -(Dang to verify w/ CN)-
* If modifying Call RTC section, and it has been edited, the "Done" button is available.
* If "Done" is pressed, the Call RTC section is updated and form display closes.
* If there are already 3 cancel item operations previously on the form, then no checkboxes should appear since they are not allowed to do this more than 3 times.
* The user can only select up to 3 checkboxes/items for cancellation at a time. (So either, color them red when more than 3 is selected, OR prevent more than 3 from being selected).
* Call RTC can be changed as many times as desired.
* CDLS logging
** Completion of modify
* General summary logging
** On initial modify operation
** On transmit
** On repeat
** On completion of modify operation
** On Abort
* User can only select checkbox of Protect Against if the authority the Protect Against is for is not active. (Do not show checkbox in this case). NOTE: For now, do this check for system generated protect against. Manually added protect against will be checked in a later story, but for now allow them to be selected by default.
* Once an item is cancelled, it should be greyed out (text greyed out) when viewed.
* Cancelled items are archived.
* Modify of Call RTC Time/Instructions is also archived.
* Note: -Dang to check w/ CN whether "Cancel" step should be separate to show the cancel item box or just do it all in one "Transmit" step.- The cancel item box should be filled in as each item is selected.
* Note: User is only allowed to either modify Call RTC OR do cancel item in each modify operation, not both (so buttons should be enabled/disabled appropriately).

Subject: Supercede with proceed train
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Evaluate whether it is better to utilize existing Create workflow or utilizing a new workflow as was done for TOP. (to avoid maintenance issues in future where we have to change both workflows...).

Show that:

* Supersede button on TLD and limit selection over an existing PT form generates a Superceded PT Form (Only one supersede button for both TOP and PT).
* If there are more than one Forms on limit selection a dialog allows user to select a form.
* If there are no forms under limit selection a dialog should show "There is no authority on the selected device(s)." Make this message match CTC if it isn't already (for both TOP & PT). Include bilingual as well.
* Proposed form has a new Superceded box (similar to TOP). This box should state "Clearance No." instead of "Authority No." (Ensure this is the case for CDLS too).
* The proposed form is put directly into Created state and follows all state changes of create workflow
* Existing form is put into SUPERCEDED state (right after execute)
* The proposed form is allowed for user to fill out just like in create form
* The system generates all usual restrictions as in the create workflow. (PA, Afters, switch permissions/warnings, etc.)
** Note: system needs to auto populate switch permissions for the proposed form if those switch permissions are on the superseded form and they are within the limits of the proposed form.
* All rules are run as in create
** Note: We should not generate overlaps with the superseded form. Also applies to when doing restriction maximums (should not count the superseded authority). Treat it as if the superseded form did not exist.
* When Abort button is pressed pre un-acked state (user has not transmitted complete time)
** Old form goes back to COMPLETED state
** New form is completely gone from the system
* When Abort button is pressed post un-acked state
** Old form stays SUPERCEDED state
** New form stays in state Unacknowledged
* Once the superceding form is completed (Read/Repeated/Done button clicked)
** the SUPERCEDED form is Archived
** The SUPERCEDED form is removed from the system
* We can continue an un-acked superceding form and complete it. (Just continues the workflow)
* Box 2 shows up when operating (view, modify, cancel, etc) on the completed form that was created in the supersede.
* Box 2 is CDLSd
* Box 2 is archived in AUTHEVENT table (superseded authority number)
* GenSum Logging
** We have the same gen-sum logging as in create abort cases
** We have the same gen-sum logging in all non-abort cases, except an additional log saying "Superceding PT XX directly after Created PT YY Gensum msg
* Flashing/Blocking
** After Execute (and superseded form identified) but before transmit:
*** old form limits are flashing orange. -(Check w/ TOP if this is also flashing, also verify w/ CTC system. Make it work like CTC!)-
*** new limits flash yellow (against whatever is existing).
** After transmit is pressed
*** Old form limits stay flashing orange
*** New form limits (not including old form) show the correct color (green, dark green or purple)
** Old form limits on trackline display do not go away until completion of supercede.
* Rules reject operations over forms that are in progress of being superceded (They are in state SUPERCEDED) -- except view

Notes:
* To ask CN: Can you supercede a PT form to change its direction? Answer: YES

Subject: Database mileage stack displays
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The displays have consolidated Train ID fields
* The displays have consolidated Authority ID fields
* Consolidated means that we combine fields on tracks into one large field to allow for spacing of mileages (so link multiple tracks to a single stack).
* Each "Authority ID" field has a pair of mileage fields, one on the left and one on the right where they fit.
* Each "Train ID" field has a pair of mileage fields, one on the left and one on the right where they fit.
* Train ID fields should be 5 characters.
* Mileage fields should be 4 characters.
* Ensure decision tables are there
* Put mileage fields on a different layer (It should be toggle-able from the trackline display -- hide/show labels).
* Text for Train IDs and Authority IDs are much bigger than the mileages.
* The stack overflow rectangle is on the topmost stack entry.

Subject: Display Addressee for Proceed Train at end of clearance
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The proceed train id shows up in the train id field associated with the last track in the PT limits.
* Stacking shows up as usual when there are more than one PT id.
** The train ID ordering is ordered based on insertion order. (The closest ones to the track should be first ones issued).
* When "Transmit" is pressed for creating a PT, the Train ID shows up in the associated stack if any.
* When more train ids are to be shown than there are train id fields, the last train id shows a border
* -(?What happens on supercede, is the train shown twice in the same field, is it shown on different fields?) Check w/ CTC/CN.- Train ID on Track line shows up twice for an authority in supersede if it ends on the same track as the existing one (One ID for the superseded and one for the new authority when issued).
** -For now, assume ID shows up potentially twice.- It should show for existing form + new form. (PT IDs that are superseding others will show up following normal rules where issued time is used for ordering -- since it is essential a cancel + issue new form).
* If there are multiple PT for the same Train, that Train ID can show up multiple times.
* If there is no associated train ID stack for the last track, then the train ID does not show up.
* On cancelling/removal/abort of forms where the form is removed from the system, the Train ID stack should be "cleaned up" (close the gap for the removed authority, border updated if needed, etc).
* When creating the proceed train via picking the Train ID from a parking spot field, the Train ID is removed from the parking spot field on completion of the authority. -(Dang to verify w/ CN)-
** If the authority is left unacknowledged and the user moves the Train ID to some other parking spot, it should not get deleted upon completion of the authority that was left unacknowledged.

Subject: Update to new version of MQSeries
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The version of Websphere MQ (MQSeries) that is installed by the installation scripts is v8.0.0.1.
* The old version is removed (manually from the installation procedures/provided software)
* Only the client is installed.
* The system still runs up.
* CDLS and NLS logging still works utilizing the CDLS and NLS simulator (you'll probably want to verify that this works before doing the upgrade).
* Update the Software Installation Manual on Sharepoint w/ the new version info if needed.

Link to Websphere MQ Client: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg24037500

Subject: Show time based on local-time of start limit
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* TimeZone configuration in the Database is now on the B2 level -instead of- as well as the existing B1 level.
* We have a few different timezones set for the test topology we have.
* The following uses local time (of the start limit -- or OS location if an OS) for display of time:
** Form Summary
** Forms (+ printing)
** -General Summary-
** Alarms (double check on CTC if this is required)
** Train Record (verify on CTC)
** CDLS
** Archive (verify on CTC)
* The Call RTC Time is entered in local time.
* Daylight Savings Time is observed and displayed correctly by the system.

Note: Storage of time should not be modified, but instead, just store timezone information for display purposes.

Subject: Diagnose Form
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:

* We have a command line utility that can run on the COMs.
* It provides the following (All form fields):
** Shows the in-memory forms index
** Shows the mnesia forms index
** Shows the "in-memory" forms container (make a note that this WILL NOT reflect the true system on SB)
** Shows the "replicated" (in-mnesia) forms container
** Shows the "persisted" forms in memory (PersistencyProvider)
** Shows the actual "persisted" forms in mnesia (PersistencyProvider)
** Has option for running checksum checks on the above. (These should print out results, but do not change/lock forms)
*** This should list form numbers + checksum status (failure/pass).
** Has option for exporting to file with all fields.
** Has option for listing pretty print (like CDLS)
** Has option for running the integrity check. (This can lock the forms)

Subject: Proceed Train - show on trackline display
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The proceed train shows up in green on the trackline after it is issued.
* The proceed train shows up in a darker green on the trackline display if it is overlapping another PT (only for the parts that are overlapping the other PT). Note: utilize AuPTSing and AuPTMult for these.
* The sections that have overlapping PT and TOP are colored purple.
* If the end of the PT is on a siding, then the siding should be colored red. Note: Utilize AuPTinSd for this.

Subject: Print PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When viewing a PT form, there is a print button
* When the print button is pressed, dialog pops up with:
** modality to the viewed form
** printer dropdown containing all printers set up on the MMI.
** number of copies: defaults to 1
** OK/Print button
*** Should only be enabled if a printer is selected AND
*** The number of copies is a number > 0
** Cancel button (always enabled)
* Selecting "OK" on print dialog sends to the printer and prints the selected number of copies
* Selecting "Cancel" aborts and closes the dialog
* The printout has:
** Boxes can be split between pages if they start on a page but will not fit.
** Uses language of the issued form
** All boxes that the viewed form has, but no more
** If a field is empty (e.g., instructions), then provide a blank underline (it should already be doing something like this in the printouts).
** boxes show in the correct/same order as view.
* Printing is logged to general summary
** Just log the form that is being printed

Subject: View PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The user can view by pressing on View button on toolbar, then select the limit item (single item) to view and execute.
* The form can be viewed from the form summary as well.
* If there are more than one form on the selected item for view, then we are prompted for which form to view.
* If there are no forms, then "reject" with an error message. (happens in REF -- should already be working)
* Buttons available in view mode are: Close, Retransmit, and Print. (use the same ordering as in TOP)
* The form shows on view (as usual -- where boxes that are empty do not show, fields that don't have data do not show text field, etc).
* No fields are editable on view.
* Multiple users should be able to view the SAME form (applies to TOP too).
* A form in unacknowledged state can be viewed (but not retransmitted -- which would be disabled)
* General summary logging shows up for the viewing operation (as it does for TOP).
* View an authority while it is being operated on (for modify/completion/etc).
* A form being viewed should be flashing on the display "locally."

Subject: Cancel PT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
- Suspend train with TR if it has no other active authorities and is not on a parking spot.

Show that:
* User can select cancel button from toolbar, select the limit item where the PT is and execute.
* Only authorized users can cancel.
* If there ar

Subject: Arrows for proceed train on TLd:
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* Show track direction (via pointed end of track) for a proceed train authority at the end of the limits (only on the last track)
* We utilize the existing PT direction infos to identify which side(s) of the track to show direction on (Note that both sides can be on if there are overlapping opposing PTs that end on the same track symbol).
* Overlapping PTs even in opposite direction should always have the arrow on the last item (as long as it's a track) in terms of highlighted sections. (Track should have arrow even if switch is last in limits but switch would not be part of the highlighted blocked section -- switches should not have the arrows).

Subject: Delete Trains and integrate w/ Train Record
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* Trains created through the TM client show up in the train record summary display. (Let TRD fill in the data based on the existing TMT update message + make it work)
* On cold startup, trains still exist in train record & TM
* We can delete a train in a parking spot by selecting the "Remove Train" button from the Toolbar and then picking the train from the parking spot and executing.
* If there are multiple trains in that parking spot stack entry selection, then pop up a dialog for selection of which train to actually delete.
* On deletion:
** -If there are PT's still utilizing this train, the train gets only suspended in train record.-
** If there are no usages of this train in PT/WT anywhere else, then the train should be suspended. -retired (note: retire is already in train record but may need api/message handling in trd to do the retire)-.
* Failover of COMs still has the same trains in TM and train record.
* General Summary logging shows up for dialog actions similar to add.

Subject: Move Train (b/w parking spots)
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* We can do a move train operation by:
** 1) selecting the Move train toolbar button
** 2) selecting the Train ID on a parking spot stack
** 3) selecting the target parking spot (square)
** 4) execute
* If there are multiple train IDs in the selected stack entry, then do the usual pop-up to select the train.
* The train is appended to the end of the stack on the target parking spot.
* The train is removed from the source parking spot.
* Figure out what Train Record does w/ the train update for moving and discuss whether that is correct.
* General summary logging occurs for the user actions of moving the train.
* If moving a train ID to the same parking spot it is currently in, it should be moved to the last position in the "stack."

Subject: Prevent trackline displays from closing/changing/moving if form is being operated/viewed.
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* If the user has an REF authority form open, all the Trackline displays should:
** Not be allowed to pan
** Not be allowed to moved
** Not be allowed to resize
** Not be allowed to minimize/maximize
* After the form display is gone from the screen, trackline displays resume their normal operation.

Subject: Proceed Train - Switch warnings and permissions
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Broken out from story #9344

Show that:
* Box 19 is shown when there are switches in the limits
** Switch warnings are populated by the system
** A switch warning is a switch in reverse in the limits
** Reject if there are more than 6 reverse switches.
** User can add switch warnings
** User can remove user added switch warnings

* Box 20 is shown when there are switches in the limits
** User can add switch permissions
** User can remove any switch permissions

* Adding of switches to warnings/permissions is done by a separate dialog that pops up when you click on "Modify Swts"
** Look at appendix J for example.
** Switches should be listed in the order of the limits
** Switches in the permission/warning list should be in the order of the limits.

* CDLS shows the switch warnings/permissions if there are any
* The switch warnings/permissions participate in read/repeat as usual

Subject: Proceed Train - Manual restrictions
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Broken off from story #9344

Show that:
* The user can add additional restrictions during create (before transmit) of a PT
** The steps to do so are:
*** 1) User clicks on the "Add Rest." button
*** 2) Option: Select addressee ID
*** 3) User selects the limits from the TLD
*** 4) Executes
*** 5) System checks that selected limits are within proposed form's limits. Clarification: If the selected limits are outside the start/end "blocks" of the authority's limits, then the restriction should be rejected and not be added to the authority (show rejection as an RTC notification). The "block" is the section of track between two switches/knownpoints. So let's say authority's limits are A to B, if the user selects from A to C, that should be rejected (assuming these letters mean known points).
** Once the user adds a manual restriction, the user cannot do whole miles for box 8.
** The user can do whole miles for the manually added restrictions (including "Validate Limits" button functionality)
** Whole miles are automatically filled in the manual entry for when any of the proposed form's limits are whole miles and the the selected restriction being added extends past the whole miles limits (automatically reduce). In this case, the system should provide an RTC notification that it has done so.
** User can change between "Proceeding" and "Working"
** User can change between "Foreman" and "Train"
** If the user selected the addressee from the trackline display then do not allow text field to be changed.
** On transmit, if the restriction is for a foreman, the system shall insert "Foreman" into the addressee field of the PA.

* The user can remove manually added restrictions
** The manually added restriction has a checkbox by the box label.
** There is a button "Del Rest."
** The button is enabled if one of the boxes is checked.
** Upon pressing the button, the selected boxes are removed by the system.

* The system gensums the user manual add/remove.
* Restrictions should support entering whole miles same as the normal limits.
* If whole miles are being entered, disable add/remove restrictions buttons.

* CDLS output shows up accordingly with the additional or without removed fields

* Remember that restriction limits are to be DISPLAYED in the same direction as the original limits, Even if the user selects in the opposite direction.

* There can be no more than three protect against manual or otherwise allowed on the form.

Subject: Proceed Train System Generated Protect Against (Boxes 14,15,16)
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This story was broken off from #9344

Show that:
* In a creation of a PT form:
** When we have overlapping PT (Same Direction)/WT/TOPs, Boxes 14,15,16 are automatically populated (up to the number of overlapping restrictions).
*** If there are more than 3 restrictions needed, then reject.
*** If there are overlapping TOPs in the limits, then reject.
*** Automatically generated boxes 14,15,16 are not editable.
*** The limits are the determined in the same manner as TOP (cut off the limits at the boundaries of the proposed form).
*** The restrictions are shown in the order in which they would be encountered by the train.
*** The limits of the restrictions are in the same direction as the limits of the proposed Proceed Train.
*** Each authority overlapping has its own box even if the addressee is the same name as another authority (in other words, no combining of restrictions like we did for conflict with in TOP).
** When we don't have any overlapping PT, there are no boxes 14,15,&16.
* The protect against participates in read/repeat
* The protect against show up in CDLS

Subject: Proceed Train Afters (Box 7)
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Story was broken off from #9344

Show that:
* In a creation of a PT form:
** When we have opposing overlapping proceed trains, Box 7 is populated and shown.
*** All opposing trains must be listed.
*** There is a maximum of 3 opposing trains.
*** If more than 3 opposing trains, then reject.
*** Box 7 is not user editable
*** Location field is filled in based on the first item in the limits to overlap the opposing proceed train(s).
** Box 7 is not shown if there are no overlapping opposing PT authortiies.
* Box 7 information is included in CDLS
* Box 7 participates in read/repeat

Subject: Initiate PT with addressee
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* We can start a proceed train by
** 1) selecting the Proceed Train button on the toolbar (replace the PSS, remove Enter Main Track)
** 2) selecting the Train ID (either from a parking spot or from a proceed train stack or addressee stack).
** 3) selecting the limits for the proceed train
** 4) Execute
* The limits expand in the same manner as for TOP
* If the selected train id field has multiple items, then prompt the user to select the correct one (filter out non trains)
* If the selected train id field is empty or not a train, then reject.

* The Proceed Train form pops up after initial validation succeeds:
** Contains the existing boxes that apply to PT and exists in TOP plus add in the new Box 8 for the limits (look at attached form mockup)
** Whole miles works as it does in TOP (#9211)
* Buttons are the same as in TOP
* Button behavior (enabled/disabled) is the same (workflow after transmit button not part of this story)
* We can abort from the create
* CDLS logs are generated similar to TOP (use correct Boxes and words for Proceed Train).
* GenSum logs are generated similar to TOP
* Addressee is not editable
* Multilingual support exists (similar to TOP)

Subject: Complete flow with rules
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Broken out to other stories for new sections of form. This covers only the existing contents of box 8 and the other sections that already existed in TOP.

Show that:
* The rest of the workflow (read/repeat, read/repeat complete, unacknowledged, continue/complete) is hooked up similarly to TOP.
* CDLS shows up where appropriate (follow when TOP logs)
* Form is archived on completion
* General summary logging shows up where appropriate (follow when TOP logs) -- needs new logging constants for PT
* Creation of PT should be allowed to span STK/105 and CTC sections, though the start/end limits must be within OCS and not end at the border of OCS.
* The PT is also allowed to go onto a siding. When the PT ends on a siding, the instructions should state "Take Siding at <location>" given the location of the siding (b2text).

Questions for CN:
* Does the CTC/105 rule apply to tracks only or also switches?
* -How do we actually calculate the location for box 7 (when PT overlap at different points)?-
* -Is it correct to combine restrictions for same addressee?-
* -Confirm w/ CN that whole miles for the proposed form can only be done before adding manual restriction (because it may affect manually added restrictions, in this case what to do about them?)-
** -Related: If proposed form already is using whole miles, and selection of new restrictions is outside of this, how to handle? automatically reduce it? or prompt the user to change limits on form?...Probably do it the same way as limits for form where user has to manually change it (and validate). The system could fill in numbers automatically if desired.-
* -Do we care about selection color of restriction being added? Flashing different color may be complicated...depending on how its done. TFlash is no go...-
* -What does "Train/Foreman" button do? Does it add "Foreman" to the addressee? When? What about the user editing it after "Foreman" is already there?-
* -How does the user actually add addressee?-
* -Do we always show Box 19 even if there are no warnings?-

Subject: Create Train (only on parking spots)
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
'- using TOD
- reuse suspended train

Show that:
* We have some parking spot train ID fields at boundaries (as well as existing locations) on TLD
* We have pseudo track symbols to allow for selection (For train ID fields not at boundary, the train ID field will be on one of the existing tracks).
* The user can select the "New Train" button on the toolbar, and then the pseudo track (or real track in the non-OCS sections).
* On execute, a dialog(can be the TOD display) pops up to allow for creating the new train.
* The train ID can be entered into a field (should be same format as in CTC).
* When the submit/save/ok button is selected, the Train ID shows up in the parking spot. If there are already trains in the parking spot, the train is stacked.
* When there are more trains than can be shown in the parking spot train ID stack, the last train ID has a border.
* The train "catalog" for which parking spots trains are on is synchronized in Mnesia.
* The train catalog is cleared out on cold startup.
* If the train ID already exists, it should show as a validation error and prevent completing the dialog until changed.

Note:
* Check w/ CTC:
** Authorization right
** User type right
** Territory control right

Subject: Navigate between displays using arrow(?) keys
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Navigation moves the displays one to the right or left depending on key pressed

Show that:
* Alt + Right Arrow shifts the overview trackline displays to the left by one and shows new displays on the right (shows more topology on the right).
* Alt + Left Arrow shifts the overview trackline displays to the right by one and shows new displays on the left (shows more topology on the left).
* There is no more shifting happens once the "last" view in the viewset is on the "center" overview screen.
* Flickering should be kept to a minimal and removed entirely if possible. (Open new view into existing overview trackline display instead of having to close and then reopen).

Ask CN:
* Extra story? Should configured overview screens not allow windows to be opened on at all? It currently only works if there's a overview trackline display there...

Subject: Change limits to whole miles
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* In the form create mode before transmit:
** There is a new button called "Validate Limits"
** The start and end limits are editable
** When focus goes into either the start or end limit, and the field has not been edited, it is "cleared" so that the user can enter in a mileage. (It should be considered not having been edited each time a successful validate happens).
** When focus goes into either the start or end limit, but the field was already edited, then it should not clear the field. (Though editing is still allowed).
** When focus is lost, and it was not yet edited (and blank), then the original contents of the last successful validate is filled back in.
** Transmit is disabled if the limits have been edited (or the fields are empty).
** Validate Limits should become enabled if either of the start/end limits are edited and are valid mileages (based on form validation).
** "Valid Mileages" for the start limit are the mileages from the initial start limit to the very next known point or switch in the direction of the limits, but not including the mileage on that known point or switch.
** "Valid mileages" for the end limit are the mileages from the second to last switch or known point in the direction of the limits through to the end point, but not including the mileage of the second to last switch or known point.
** When the user is editing in the start or end limit field (the field has focus), the status line should indicate what the valid mileages are.
** The start/end limits should show the usual red error background for invalid entries.
* The rules are rerun when the user clicks on validate limits.
* The boxes are recalculated when the user clicks on validate limits. (For example, if the overlap box no longer applies because the mileage is outside the overlap, then overlap gets removed).
* If the validate limits fails, the user gets the usual notification (reject/query) AND the form becomes editable again with the state right before the validate limits button being clicked (To be checked w/ CN -- does it go back to initially picked limits? stay as the unvalidated limits? or completely get aborted?).
* If the validate limits succeeds, the form display is updated with the new contents.
** Mileage entries are to include the "Mile" string (Obey bilingual rules, so it should be french if form is french).
** If only the start limit is a mileage entry, then include the subdivision name. (e.g.: "Mile 100 Facebook Sub"
** If both start and end are mileages, then the subdivision name is only in the END limit field.
** If each start/end are in different subs, then each should have the subdivision name.
* After successful validation of limits, the TLD shall show the shortened limits (items that are not within the start/end mileages should not be included -- edges should not count)
* The Authority Summary should show the start and end limits as mileages in the same way as they show up on the form itself.

Ask CN:
* Are there special formatting rules for mileage number formats? decimals? for certain numbers?
** Answer: Formatting for mileages when user entered should simply be the whole mile (there is no decimal). When the item's name itself has the mileage, then keep that formatting as is.

Subject: Add TMS skeleton
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Train Management Server (for holding information about parking spots and their trains).

Show that:
* We have an eclipse project for TMS (server & api)
* We have a jenkins job for TMS
* TMS server starts with the rest of ocs.us (lifecycle etc.)
* We have an eclipse project for the TM Client (could be created from the product TOD client), stripped of unneeded SCM stuff (no schedules, etc).
* We have a jenkins job for the TM Client.
* TM Client starts up with the rest of the java clients.

Subject: Add whole miles into Java process model
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* All TopologyItem objects (known points, switches, tracks) have start and end mile values (after loading). (in Vicos, we already have the mileages -- just need to read them). Keep the mileages in integer form so that we can avoid floating point arithmetic. (Usage of mileages will need to then convert to decimal when required).
* Mileages should participate in data activation.
* The ProcessImageValueItem should also have the mileage (note that the value item still should NOT change as part of data activation).
