Subject: Make form number configurable via properties file
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* There is online configuration for having a minimum and a maximum form number range (configuration is not site specific -- but installation specific).
* On startup and configuration change, the next form that is generated is created with the next available form number within the new range. (note, the sequence should not start over unless the new range is out of bounds of the current number).
* If the max and min are inverted in configuration, then the creation of a new form should give the same message as if no number is available.
* Form numbers do not have 0 padding.

Notes:
* Consider making a online configurable bounded sequence generator. All forms in a system will utilize the same bucket of numbers.
* Questions for CN:
** Does the OS Report and Switch Report have form numbers and do they share from the same bucket as the authorities?

Subject: Send any req. Logging to CDLS
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: Cleanup form/dialog close actions.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Current Functionality:

p(. All open forms in REF are keep track of in a mapping of workflow id to client display instance id. Currently a workflow is a display. If there is a workflow opened it is either in the process of bringing up a form, allowing the user to fill out a form or closing a form, for our purposes when a workflow is opened a form is opened. This gets somewhat butchered when sub workflows are taken into consideration because sub workflows can bring up "forms" or dialogs, but they do not have to. In the main workflows when the workflow end action node is hit one of the workflow listeners is triggered with a "workflowDone" call and the workflow instance id is removed from the "workflow with display instances" entry for that workflow from the map. Similarly in the end sub workflow action handler there is a call to the ui manager that removes any entries for the sub workflow in the "workflow with display instances".

Wanted Functionality:

p(. We want the actual responses from the client to close the workflow on the client context instead of the actual closing of the workflow.

Parent task: Story #9367: Transmit & Complete
Subject: Add rules files for rollup/fulfill
Author: Will Martin
Description:
"POST-MORTEM":

sign-off help:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
the rules are in:
* checkRollupReject.drl 
* checkFulfillReject.drl

didn't name xxxFail like the others because they don't cause the parent OS report form to abort...

Integration tests are in:
* RolluoSubworkflowTest.java
* FulfillSubworkflowTest.java

Unit tests are in:
* CheckRollupRejectTest.java
* CheckFulfillRejectTest.java

Resource strings used by rules include .Rollup. or .Fulfill. in their keys.


general scheme description:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

During execution of the parent os report form workflow, the Rollup or Fullfill subwrkflow is executed for each rollup/fullfill candidate form collected by the parent form workflow. 

The parent workflow's user messages container is passed down to the subworkflow(via inclusion of the CLIENT_MESSAGES workflow variable in the 'variablesToCopy' string given to the StartSubworkflowActionHandler invocation.

Any userMessages created as result of subworkflow rule execution are added to the container and copied back up to the parent workflow as specified by inclusion of CLIENT_MESSAGES in the 'variablesToCopy' string given to the EndSubworkflowHandler that is invoked at the end of the rollup/fullfill sub-workflows; also copied back up to the parent are the rulesPassed and rulesFailed boolean variables.

After the last sub-workflow ends, the parent workflow tests the rulesFailed value in a check_drools_result decision node; if rulesFailed is true, a dialog is opened with all of the userMessages collected during execution of each sub-workflow(otherwise we go on our merry way to the unset_item_falshing node). The only button/choice from the dialog is 'Continue'; once pressed, the user response and message content is sent to the general summary, and then the workflow continues on to the unset_item_flashing node.

Subject: FSD Quick Callup does not always display Views
Author: Mathias Metzner
Description:
Preparation:
* Create a TOP between UNICORN and TIGER in Animal Sub
* Make sure that the View OCS Test 1 is not on any Overview Screen
* Open the FSD and press the All Auth button

Expected:
* the TOP is grayed out
* when selecting the TOP the call up button becomes enabled
* when pressing the call up button, the call up dialog opens
* the call up dialog displays view OCS TEST 1 (Ocst left-to-right: OCS TEST 1)

Actual:
* the TOP is grayed out
* when selecting the TOP the call up button becomes enabled
* when pressing the call up button, the call up dialog opens
* the call up dialog is empty

Subject: Users Chief and Technician can complete unacknowledged authority
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
preconditions:
1. authorities exist in unacknowledged state
2. the workstation does not control any territory

steps:
1. login as Chief or Tech
2. open the Authority Summary
3. select an authority from the list in Completed state.
actual results: The <Modify> button is enabled.
expected results: The <Modify> button remains disabled.
4. select an authority from the list in unacknowledged state.
actual results: The <Complete> button is enabled.
expected results: The <Complete> button remains disabled.
5. select the <Complete> button and Complete the authority form.
actual results: the form is completed.
expected results: the chief or technician should not be able to complete the form.

Subject: Form already open message when no form open
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
This bug is not easily reproducible.
Sometimes after form operations (currently unclear what kind; might be create, supersede etc.; might be form dependent)
the form closes but REF (and woman) thinks that a form is still open.

State as of 6-19-2015:
Added logging of instance ids (we suspect that there is a mismatch of instance id)

Subject: Invalid train location after restart
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:

* Create a PT
* OS that PT at a known point
* Restart the system

Current behavior:

* The location of the train is set to -1

Expected behavior:

* The location of the train is set to the known point

Note:
TRD assumes that all train locations are tracks (it stores the locations as TA3s). Therefore it sends a TA4 with the element always being a Track.
On the java side this location cannot be mapped to a item id and is stored as -1, which will cause subsequent actions on the train to throw exceptions

Subject: OS reports don't find all roll-up/fulfill candidates
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:

* Set a PT (1) from CAPI/BERL/STN/KnownPnt to COMP/APPL/STN/KnownPnt with the switch (CAPI/BRJT/SW1/SWI) being reverse
* Set another PT (2) from CAPI/CVLD/STN/KnownPnt to CAPI/DETR/WSW/SWI for the same train
* OS report mile 7 after selection CAPI/BERL/N1TK - N4TK (Track)

Expected:

* Both PTs are candidates for rollup

Current behavior:

* Only PT1 is shown in the rollup dialog.

Note:

This bug is for 2 different scenarios that are not working correctly when OS reporting multiple PT forms.

1. If a PT spans multiple Subdivisions and the OS report is for a mileage that is in multiple subdivisions, the wrong item might be chosen as the OS location.
2. If a PT is spanning over a reverse switch, other PTs that are only reachable from the path over the normal position of the switch are no valid candidates.

Subject: After FillSDM fill tech_area_points are not filled correctly
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
There should be tech_area_point entries for every b2, regardless if its CTC or OCS.
As a result of not correctly filling tech_area_points, trains do not show up in train record if the location is a b2 that is not in teach_area_points.


If the systems are set up correctly a FillSDM was run when the systems were installed. This means the steps are:

*Steps:*
* Create a train on the trackline
* Open up the train summary

*Expected:*
* The train should appear on the train summary

*Actual:*
* The train does not appear on the train summary

Note:
It seems like some triggers are not set up correctly.

Subject: Missing HeapMigration for trains in TM
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Trains need to be heap-migratable. This includes the train objects and the parking spot positions.

*Steps:*
* Put some trains in the system
* Place some Proceed Trains in the system
* OS Report some of the Proceed trains (The interesting case is where we have a proceed train that has been OSed but the train still shows up in a zwd and a psd)
* Run the heap migrator export
* Look at the exported tm data. This data should include all trains with their locations and parking spots

*Expected:*
* The trains all appear in the tm exported data

* Bring down both COM/RTCs
* Clear the mnesia tables
* Re-Import the data
* Bring the system back up

*Expected:*
* All trains should appear where they were before the heap migration (in zwds and psd)

*Actual:*
* Trains disappear from psd and zwds

Subject: OS Time not in field time
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:

* Create a PT
* OS the PT
* Open the Authority Summary (press All Auth if needed)

Expected:
* The OS time shows in field time

Current:
* The OS time shows in local (server) time 

Note:
* Also make sure that the os time shows up correctly in Train Record etc.

Subject: The cursor for Proceed Trains reads work
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Click on the "Prcd Trn" button

Expected:

* The cursor reads "PRCD"

Current:

* The cursor reads "WORK"

Subject: potential buffer overflow/ out of heap space
Author: Mathias Metzner
Description:
JmsGateRpcListener.java buffers messages regardless of the origin (sender server) of the message.
The receiving server checks for expected messages in the buffer and removes them from the buffer for processing.
Messages that were sent from a different server are never picked up and cause the buffer to grow, causing eventually an out-of-heap-space error.

The solution for this problem is to not buffer the messages that were received from a different server.

This fix is not easily testable without looking at the code (debugging).
A possible way to test this fix is to have a redundant system (2 COMs) running for a long time and to
a) look at the size of the buffer - make sure it's not growing (e.g. with a debugger attached)
b) not have a out-of-heap-space error (which might occur due to other code issues) after a long time of running

Subject: Hide item numbers of some form boxes/fields
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
e) The RTC2.OCS system shall suppress displaying the form ?item numbers? in the created authority.
This should apply only to boxes that can change content. This includes: PAs/ CWs/ Warnings/ Permissions Item numbers should appear once "Transmit" was pressed.

Subject: Change territory type from CTC to OCS
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
In teartext the territory type is set to CTC (which causes the extra selection step in the TTR).
OCS territories should not be CTC.

Note:
It seems like teartext is already configured correctly. It needs to be investigated why the CTC button needs to be pressed during TT.

Subject: Don't allow TOPs in CTC only
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: Requirement SRS.1009 has changed to "The system shall not allow TOP/XTOP limits to be in CTC track only".

Subject: Switch Permission can be given to train over work train
Author: Will Martin
Description:
When a work train is placed that does not have a switch warning for a switch, a switch permission should not be able to be given for that switch.

Setup:
* Place and complete a work train that spans over a switch. Make sure the switch does not have a switch permission/warning.
* Start placing another work train or proceed train over the same switch
* Press the validate limits button
* Select the modify switches button

Expected:
* The form does not allow you to give a switch permission to the switch that does not have a warning on the previous form.

Actual:
* The form allows you to give a switch permission to the switch that does not have a warning on the previous form.

There should also be a drools rule that runs (only on transmit) that makes sure that for each reverse switch in the blocked limits there exists a switch warning on the proposed form.
* NOTE: This bottom section will be addressed by a story #10552 and will not be part of this bug

Subject: Authority Summary default sorting seems random.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
The default sorting is currently configured to be ascending by last edited, so this is wrong.

If the authority summary is open, and you are creating authorities, then the list is updated adding a new entry in the list as it is created.

Once the summary is re-opened the default sorting seems random.

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Separte java apps into own JVMs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Separate each application into their own JVM
** Allows logging of common API into independent application logs
** Allows to restart applications independently (Normally the product has all applications start in one JVM)

* Add wiki page for debug ports and repl ports

Subject: Refactor overlaps
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Physical overlaps VS restrictions
* Different classes for different restrictions

Subject: Clean up unused classes
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Clean up CSB, core, REF, etc.
* Move client specific messages into Client API
* Move messages and classes that are shared between client and server only into client APIs
* Move messages and classes that are in core but actually belong to a single application (handled by only 1 application and sent from applications that have the destination applications API in its manifest) into the appropriate API.

Subject: Prevent distributed system from bouncing after failover
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
If the message that causes a 6001 on COM1 is processed on COM2, the system should not bounce back

We should allow different configurations to 
a) not auto failover on message exceptions
b) mark messages as handled before failover
c) normal failover on exception with reprocessing of message on new PC

Subject: Clean up META INFs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Remove unused imports/exports
* Include projects instead of importing specific packages where possible

Subject: Pull common components from WT & PT into parent class
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: There already exists an AbstractTrainForm that PtForm and WtForm extend form. Make sure all common components of both forms are in the AbstractTrainForm and pull any logic up that is duplicated between the two.

Subject: Handle online activation errors
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Make sure that exceptions during activation don't render the system useless
* For normal activation and forced activation
* On a normal online activation if an error is loaded from the database and an exception is thrown:
** The activation should be stopped.
** The change set should not go out to the other applications, and the other applications should be unlocked
** The system should not fail over
** A failed activation message should go back to vicos.
** A failed activation message should go out to the system summary

* For forced online activation
** The change set should not go out to other applications, and the other applications should be un-locked
** The system should not fail over
** A failed activation message should go out to the system summary

Subject: Create print document for WT & PT commons
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: There are class hierarchies for cdls, presenter, and data model forms for TOP, WT and PT. The printing should be done the same way collecting all shared logic in superclasses of TopDocument, PtDocument and WtDocument where appropriate.

Subject: Refactor drools
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Sanity check rules (form already protected, TTR open etc) in one file
* Take these checks out of all other workflows
* Allow running multiple rule files from workflow
* Build facts for a multiple drools files only once etc.

Subject: Utilize sub-workflows
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Timebox 64h
* Common elements especially complicated elements that are shared between multiple workflows should be pulled out into sub-workflows

Subject: Clean up log codes
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* SANWTXT changes
** Remove unused (tmt, aum) , duplicates (ref) ...
* Java Log Codes
** Remove unused log codes that appear in LogCodes enum in java

We are sending alot more log codes from java than vicos knows what to do with, must find out of these log codes should be added to sanwtxt or removed from java?

Subject: Remove Reports and Hide from Train Summary
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Both buttons (Reports and Hide) should be removed from the Train Summary.
Note: Both, the English and French summary dialog.

Subject: REFTrainSuspendMessage should be sent after REFOsLocationUpdateMessage on completion of the OS report
Author: Bharati Bhalerao
Description:
1. Create a PT form for a Train 1111 (this is the only PT form for the train 1111).
2. Initiate OS report such that the PT is fulfilled.
3. After clicking 'Yes' button to complete the OS report, PT is fulfilled.

Expected:
4. REFOsLocationUpdateMessage is sent first for the Train 1111.
5. REFTrainSuspendMessage is sent after that for the Train 1111.

Actual:
4. REFTrainSuspendMessage is sent first for the Train 1111.
5. REFOsLocationUpdateMessage is sent after that for the Train 1111.
 
NOTE:
The REFOsLocationUpdateMessage can be identified in the REF logs via the following log message:
* DEBUG [SendOsLocationUpdateActionHandler] execute(): sending trainLocationUpdateMessage to TM for OS report...

The REFTrainSuspendMessage can be identified in the REF logs via the following log message:
* DEBUG [SuspendInactiveTrainActionHandler] execute(): sending REFTrainSuspendMessage to TM...

Subject: Overlapping limits do not include items that are not blocked
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This applies to overlaps and protect againsts generated from/applied to PT, TOP and WT. Example: 

   A _______________ B
    /               \
--------------------------
* Place a TOP from switch A to switch B on the main line ** The limits show from switch A to switch B even though only the track/tracks between the switches show blocked * Place a second TOP from switch A to switch B on the main line ** The limits show from switch A to switch B even though only the track/tracks between the switches show blocked * Expected Overlap ** The overlap should show from switch A to switch B even though the switches do not show blocked * Actual Overlap ** The overlap actually shows from mainline track to mainline track (the tracks inside the switches) This also applies to known points (above example but replace the word switch with known point) Note: After this bug is complete make sure we still do not get overlapping limits when we only overlap on a switch or known point Make sure that the rules do not validate the switches that are not blocked (for example if we have 2 tops that end on a switch a PT can start on that switch)

Subject: Allow Change Language before Validate Limits
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
If a form is started in a bilingual subdivision, the Validate Limits button is currently disabled until the form was validated at least once.
The user should be allowed to change the language at any point that the UI validation passes before the transmit button is pressed.
This applies to:
* TOP
* PT
* WT

NOTE:
No superced actions allow change language so we do not need to worry about this.

Subject: A PT over  multiple overlapping WTs only creates 1 PA for the last WT
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: It seems like PTs only create a PA for the last WT.

Subject: Cannot create proceed train using a work train
Author: Will Martin
Description:
The user should be able to create a Proceed train using a work train addressee

Steps:
* Create a Train
* Use the Train to create a Work Train over some limits that have an addressee stack
* Complete the Work Train form.
* Select the Proceed Train Button
* Select the addressee from the Work Train

Expected:
* The system should allow you to select the addressee
* Limits can then be selected 
* The proceed train can then be created.

Actual
* The system does not allow you to select the work train addressee

Subject: Cannot add restriction using a proceed train
Author: Will Martin
Description:
When in add restriction mode for both Proceed Train form creation and Work Train form creation the user should have the ability to create a protect against selecting a proceed train form.

Steps:
* Create 2 trains on parking spots
* Using one of the trains create a new Proceed Train
* Complete this form
* Using the second trian create a Proceed Train or Work Train
* When the form comes up click on validate limits
* Click on Add Restriction button
* Select the original Proceed Train Id.

Expected
* The system allows you to continue to select manual restriction limits
* Upon execute a new work train manual restriction is created using the addressee that was selected.

Actual
* The system does not allow you to select any proceed train addressees.
* If a track or limits are selected within the proposed forms limits a new manual restriction is created without an addressee.

Subject: Cannot add restriction using a parking spot
Author: Will Martin
Description:
When in add restriction mode for both Proceed Train form creation and Work Train form creation the user should have the ability to create a protect against selecting a train from a parking spot.

Steps:
* Create 2 trains on parking spots
* Using one of the trains create a new Proceed Train or Work Train
* When the form comes up click on validate limits
* Click on Add Restriction button
* Select the remaining train in parking spot.

Expected
* The system allows you to continue to select manual restriction limits
* Upon execute a new work train manual restriction is created using the addressee that was selected.

Actual
* The system does not allow you to select any trains from parking spots
* If a track or limits are selected within the proposed forms limits a new manual restriction is created without an addressee.

Subject: Waiting for server feedback on user action
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup
* Create a PT form or WT form that spans some switch(s)
* Press validate limits
* Once the form is valid and box 20 shows up press the Modify Swts button
Expected
* The modify switches dialog comes up
* The status line on the PT or WT form says nothing
Actual
* The modify switches dialog comes up
* The status line on the PT or WT form says "Waiting for Server Feedback..."

Subject: All texts on form (TOP,PT,WT etc) dialogs should be in form language
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: This includes the buttons, the tool-tips and the status line messages

Subject: Fix TOP territory rules
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Rules to fix / make sure that they still work:

* TOPs cannot span (start and end in OCS) CTC, STK or siding
* TOPs cannot be set from OCS into CTC or STK
* TOPs cannot be set from CTC or STK into OCS
* A TOP can end in a siding
* A TOP can start in a siding
* A TOP can be only in CTC
* A TOP cannot be only in STK
* A TOP can be only in siding

Note: A switch that is the start or end of a TOP, but not blocked by the TOP, should not be checked for territory conflicts

Subject: [NewMissed] Allow opening of overview screen quick call-up for selected authority in FSD
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Normally only forms are shown in the FSD that have at least one item currently shown in the overview displays.
Forms can only be operated on if at least one item is shown.
Via the show all button, all forms of all territories the user controls can be toggled.

The quick call up button on the FSD is always enabled, but the view/modify etc. buttons are only enabled for forms with at least one item in the current OV displays.

The quick call dialog (via FSD) shows only the controlled views that contain at least one item of the selected form.

Subject: [FromQuestionLog] Lock trackline display on first selection of an authority operation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When any REF button is selected on the TLD toolbar and the first item is selected on the TLD
** All screens lock (if they are not overview screens already), which means
*** They should not be closable
*** They should not be resizable/moveable
*** They should not be pan-able 
*** They should not be zoom-able
*** They should not be minimizable or maximizable
*** Recall should be disabled
*** Callup should be disabled (input field on the bottom-right)
*** Quick callup should be disabled
*** Alt-left/right should not be working
* When the operation is aborted, timed out or finished
** The screens unlocks(only if non-overview screen) (but are then locked by REF)
* CIA does not unlock the screens if they are already locked by REF and vice versa
* -The cleanup tools has an option to unlock all screens (non overview screens only)-

Note: cleanup tool is not necessary as CIA can recover pretty easily

Subject: Add additional rules to WT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The system does not allow giving permission for a switch if an overlapping work train does not have a warning on the switch (SRS.1177)
* The system does not allow taking a switch reverse (without permission) if an overlapping work train does not have a warning on the switch (SRS.1177)
* The system prevents a WT to start, end or span in STK (SRS.1095, SRS.1096, SRS.1097)
* The system prevents a WT to start, end or span in CTC (SRS.1098, SRS.1099, SRS.1100)
* The system prevents a WT to start, end or span in a siding (SRS.1101, SRS.1102, SRS.940)
* The system prevents a WT to be in STK only (SRS.1017)
* The system prevents a WT to be in CTC only (SRS.1018)
* The system prevents a WT to be in siding only (SRS.1019)
* The system prevents a WT from being issued over more than 3 WTs (SRS.1120)
* -The system prevents a WT from being issued over an XTOP (SRS.176)-
* The system prevents a WT from being issued over a PT that does not have a PA for the proposed WT (SRS.1121)
* -The system prevents a WT from being issued over an RTCP-R (SRS.180)-
* The system generates a PA when creating a WT over a TOP (SRS.175)
* The system generates a PA when creating a WT over another WT (SRS.177)
* The system generates a PA when creating a WT over another WT that has a PA for the proposed WT and parts of the overlap are not protected (SRS.1247)
* The system generates a PA when creating a WT over another WT that has a PA for the proposed WT and all of the overlap is outside of the PA.
* The system generates a PA spanning the entire intersection, when a WT is created over an existing WT that has a manual restriction for the proposed WTs addressee and parts of the overlap are not protected (SRS.1248)
* The system allows a siding to be selected as the start or end, but removes it from the limits (SRS.1079, SRS.1080)
* The system generates a warning, if it generates a permission for a handthrown switch
* The system generates a warning, if a handthrown switch is given permission manually (SRS.1045)
* The system removes the warning for a handthrown switch if the permission is removed and the switch is in normal position (SRS.1046)
* The system prevents a WT to end on the second switch of a reverse switch pair, if both switches are taken reverse (SRS.1174)
* The system prevents a WT to be OS'ed
* The system prevents a switch from being moved into reverse (via switch report), if a WT blocks the switch and has no warning
* The system allows WT limits to extend past the start and/or end limit of an existing train authority (SRS.1243)
* The system allows WT limits to extend past the start and/or end limit of an existing TOP (SRS.1244)
* The system combines PAs for WTs with the same addressee

Subject: [NewMissed] Additional rules for PT
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The system does not allow giving permission for a switch if an overlapping work train does not have a warning on the switch
* The system does not allow taking a switch reverse (without permission) if an overlapping work train does not have a warning on the switch
* The system prevents a switch from being moved into reverse (via switch report), if a PT blocks the switch and has no warning
* The system prevents a PT from being issued over any section where 2 TOPs overlap each other (SRS.887)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued over 4 or more non-overlapping TOPs (SRS.1112)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued over 4 or more WTs (SRS.1113)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued when it needs more than 1 PA for PTs (a PT can only protect 1 other PT with a PA) (SRS.464)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued if it overlaps another PT in the same direction but does not end within the existing PTs limits (SRS.1144)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued over more than 3 opposing PTs (SRS.842)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued over an existing PT that has a PA for the proposed PTs train (SRS.1117)
* The system allows 2 PTs to have After restrictions for each other. (SRS.1118)
* The system generates up to 3 PAs for TOPs / WTs (SRS.1114, SRS.1115)
* The system generates a PA for a PT that overlaps an existing PT in the same direction (SRS.187)
* The systme prevents a PT from being issued if its end limits are past the immediately preceding PTs (in the same direction) end limits (SRS.980)
* The system generates After restrictions for up to 3 opposing PTs (SRS.184)
* The system prevents a PT from being issued if overlapping PTs in opposing direction don't meet at the proposed PTs start limits (SRS.938)
* The system prevents a PT from starting or ending in STK (SRS.1082, SRS.1109)
* The system allows a PT to span STK, if it starts and ends in OCS (SRS.1083)
* The system prevents a PT from starting or ending in CTC (SRS.1084, SRS.1100)
* The system allows a PT to span CTC, if it starts and ends in OCS (SRS.1086)
* The system prevents a PT from being in STK, CTC or siding only (SRS.1016, SRS.1013, SRS.1015)
* The system prevents a PT from spanning a siding (SRS.1087)
* The system allows a PT selection to start in a siding, but should remove the siding from the limits (SRS.931)
** The selection should automatically fill in the needed switch warnings and permissions
* The system allows a PT selection to end in a siding, but the PTs end limits should be the switch leading into the siding (SRS.930, SRS.463)
** The system generates "take siding" instructions for the siding (SRS.459)
** The system shows the siding "red"
** The system validates the siding for overlaps (SRS.463)
** The system considers the PT to be in the siding, if any other form is created in the siding
* If the switch into the siding is OS'ed, the PT is considered for fulfillment (SRS.1238)

Note: This story requires the PT refactoring of how sidings are treated in the limits

Subject: Initiate Supercede w/ Work Train
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
- WT --> WT

Show that:

* Supersede button on TLD and limit selection over an existing WT form generates a Superceded WT Form (Only one supersede button for TOP, PT and WT).
* If there are more than one Forms on limit selection a dialog allows user

Subject: Add support for mileage on TGI
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Scope:
* Mileage
** DB holds known point and percentage 
** TGI draws points based on these two fields to show dots in between known points

Show that:
* If a PT is created or superseded on a mileage (not a KP/Switch), a dot is drawn
** at a percentage between the known-point grid-lines surrounding the mileage

Subject: Retain Switch positions on cold start
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
If no last known switch positions are available (very first initial startup), reverse all switches

Show that:
* Not handthrown switches show always normal
** The path of a handthrown switch during selection can show reverse, but the position should never be set to reverse
* When the system starts up
** If the last known state of the switch is normal, the switch should be set to normal
** If there is no last known state, the switch should be set to reverse

* The switch states are retained through cold start-ups, failovers and heapmigrations
* Remove switches from container that were removed during online activation
* When the system starts up, switches that are not in the process image anymore are removed from the container
* -If a switch was added during online activation, it should default to not-handthrown and be set to normal- (This needs to be part of the CN procedure; the activation of new items needs to be fixed separately)

Note:
It might make sense to only store the normal handthrown switches and to set all others to reverse

Subject: [NewMissed] Show mileages of switches on forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Scope: * All forms when limits are shown * Switch Permissions/warnings For switches that suppose to show mileages (by static info on switches). Text should read "Mile XXX" including subdivision. 
If the Switch field includes a milepost, then the Switch field shall include the text Mile and the
subdivision / spur name.
Show that * There is a static info on the switches, defining whether to use the name (val=0) or the mileage( val=1) * There are some switches configured in the DB to use the mileage rather than the name * If a switch is marked as use-mileage ** The switch shows up on all forms and in all fields as "Mile XXX" + Subdivision. This applies to: *** All forms and all boxes in the forms (Limits, Restrictions, Switch Warnings/Permissions etc) *** The Authority Summary *** All pop-ups that show switches *** All logging (CDLS, GenSum, App logging)

Subject: Put incoming trains on parking spot
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Scope:
* Script that sends train approach message to TR
* Train record forwards message to TM
* TM ignores message if we already know train
* TM creates train on new location if train does not exist

Note: Must look to see if TRD cares if TM re-creates a train already suspended.

Show that:
* There is a script/tool to send train approach messages to Train Record
* If a train approach message is received
** If the train is not known in TR, the train is created in the parking spot of the train approach messages
** If the train is known but suspended, the train is moved to the parking spot of the train approach message
** If the train is known and not suspended, the train approach message is ignored

Subject: Print summarized list of authorities from FSD
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* There is a print button on the Authority Summary
* When the print button is pressed
** The print dialog shows up
** Available printers are shown (just like on printing a single form)
** The amount of printouts can be set, defaulting to 1 (just like on printing a single form)
* When the ok button is pressed on the print dialog
** The authority summary is printed with the forms currently shown in the summary (only the ones that can be seen currently on the summary, including the ones that can be scrolled to)
** The order of the printed forms is the same as on the summary
** The format of the printout should be like in the attached example
* The authority summary printing should NOT print every form separately
* When the summary is printed, it is logged to the GenSum , similar to single form print except that it should not show "form + number", but instead show "authority summary"
* (Optional:) The applied filters should be printed on top of the printout
* The bottom of each page shows the date of the printout

NOTE:
Below is an example of the authority summary printed from the CTC system. The columns were cut off due to a configuration issue, but we can see the printout just shows the contents of each row and column in the authority summary in a tabular format.
!Authority_Summary.png!

Subject: [NewMissed] Show all functionality on FSD
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show all forms of user controlled territory on the FSD (default: only forms that are currently shown on the overview displays) via a "View All" toggle button.

Show that:
* There is a "All Auth" button on the FSD (toggle button)
* There is a "Call Up" button on the FSD
* For non-RTCs the "All Auth" button is disabled
* By default the "Call Up" button is disabled

* If the "All Auth" button is pressed (toggled)
** All authorities that are in the controlled territory are shown
** Authorities currently not visible on any overview screen have a grey font (vs. black on currently visible)

* If an authority is selected that is currently not visible on any overview screen
** The Call Up button is enabled
** The Print button stays enabled (prints the form summary)
** The Close button stays enabled
** The Options button stays enabled
** All operations buttons are disabled

* If the Call Up button is pressed
** The quick call-up display is opened
** The display shows all views that contain at least one item of the selected form

* If a view is selected and ok'ed
** The overview screens change, showing the selected view just like the normal quick-call up selection
** The authority summary updates (to grey out the not visible forms)

* If an authority is selected that is visible on any overview screen
** All buttons are enabled (even the call up)

* If the "All Auth" button is un-pressed (un-toggled)
** The summary only displays the forms currently visible on the overview screens (minus the "filtered out via options" forms)

Subject: Fix OS report CDLS logging
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: CDLS logging of OS reports should show the state before the "OS Report:", e.g. "Aborted OS Report: " or "Completed OS Report: "

Subject: After restriction rule not working
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
|--|--X3-|--|--|--|X1|
    \    /
     |X2|
- Create a PT into a siding (X1 to X2) - Start the creation of another PT from main to where the opposing PT starts (X3 to X1) - Press "Validate limits" Result: Limits are not valid - Shorten the limits of X3 to X1 on the X1 side - Press "Validate limits" Expected result: Limits are not valid Current result: Limits are valid with After restriction Note: The After restriction should only be valid if the proposed PT overlaps all opposing PTs on the proposed start limit. (4/20/15) Findings so far: If the limits are selected as described, the first item of X3 to X1 is actually the switch to the left of X3. The limits of the overlap (since it gets reversed) is not from X2 to X1, but from the switch to the left of X3(and X2) to X1.

Subject: Fix OS report for the case that all forms are deselected in the rollup/fulfill dialog
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
When all forms are deselected from the rollup/fulfill dialog:
* The oldest form (by issued date) should flash up to the selected location
* The OS report should be applied to the oldest form (by issued date) for the selected train on the selected KP/mileage
* CDLS logging and GenSum logging should reflect that the OS report was applied to the oldest form

Subject: User action on query are not logged to GenSum
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
steps:

1.Bring the Authority is in Unacknowledged state, the form is open, now press the Abort button.
2.The query appears, press Yes or No
- The log should appear in GenSum to either selected option

Subject: Fix OS report highlighting on "OK" in rollup/fulfill dialog
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
When the "OK" button is pressed in the rollup/fulfill dialog:
* Only the selected forms should flash / be protected
* All deselected forms should stop flashing / not be protected

Subject: Fix OS report to not allow to enter the mileage of the surrounding KPs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Create a PT from (4)CAPI (1)AUST (6)STN (756)KnownPnt to (4)CAPI (2)BERL (6)STN (756)KnownPnt
* Initiate an OS report on (4)CAPI (1)AUST (1)T1TK (701)TRA
* Enter the mileage "6.10" in the location field

Current Behavior:
* The system allows the entry

Expected Behavior:
* The system does not allow the entry

Note:
When the OS report is initiated by selecting a track, the system currently allows to enter any mileage of the selected block (if the PT spans the entire block).
The system should not allow the user to enter the mileage of the know points on the edge of the block, since they can select the KP itself.
This also applies when the block is enclosed by switches.

Subject: Train location should be moved to PT start location if moved out of a parking spot
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Create a train in a parking spot
* Create a PT for the train from the parking spot

Expected behavior:
* Once the PT is completed, the train location changes to the start item of the PT (Can be mileage, KP and Switch)

Current behavior:
* The trains location does not change

Note:
If the train is in a parking spot, the location should change.
If the train is not in a parking spot, the location should not change.
+Make sure that the location is changed, not the OS location.+

Subject: Unify selection dialogs for train/addressee/parking spot fields
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If a addressee/pt/parking spot field or topology items are selected for a form operation
** If there are no valid addressees / forms for the given operation, an error message is shown
** If there is one addressee / form in the field and it is valid, the operation is executed
** If there are multiple addressees /forms in the field and at least one is valid
*** a selection dialog is shown
*** invalid addressees are grayed out and not selectable
* This should also work for the supersede operation, even if the limit selection invalidates certain forms(the invalidated forms should be greyed out)
* Valid addressees / forms should be listed on top of the list, invalid ones below
* The validation should take into account
** Invalid form state for operation
*** Modify: Only complete
*** Cancel: Only complete
*** View: Unacknowledged, Superseded, Complete
*** Supersede: Only complete
*** Create: Any state
*** Manual Restrictions: Any state
*** OS Report: Only completed
*** Switch Report: Any state
** Invalid form type for operation
*** For PT: PTs, WTs, Parking spots
*** For WT: PTs, WTs, Parking spots
*** For TOP: TOP
*** For Switch Report: TOPs,PTs,WTs,Parking spots
*** For OS Report: PTs
*** For manual restrictions: PTs, WTs, TOPs, Parking spots

* If an addressee was selected for any operation and the form of the selected addressee is cancelled before the new operation is executed and there is no addressee/form left in the selected field, the system should show an error message ("Invalid selection") (and not blow up)

Subject: Manually Added Fields
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Scope
* Removing Switch Warning when user cancels switch permission
* System adds warning for switch when user adds switch permission
* System adds warning when system generates switch permission?

- Switch Warning
- Permission
- Protect Against

Show that:
* The user can add manual restrictions for TOPs and WTs
** The restriction has to be fully contained in the proposed form
* Warnings can be removed if
** The switch position is normal
* Warnings cannot be removed if
** The switch position is reverse
* Permissions can be removed if
** The switch is in normal or reverse position
** If the switch is in reverse position, the removal of the permission will not remove the warning

* The system removes a switch warning when the switch permission for that switch is (manually) removed and the current switch position is normal (WT only)
* The system adds a switch warning to a switch, if the switch is given a switch permission (manually and system generated) (WT only)
* The system allows the RTC to remove a system-generated warning, if the switch is in normal position and the warning was generated due to the permission (WT only)
* The system allows in the modify switch dialog to select more than 6 warnings and 6 permissions, but should disable the ok button until there are no more than 6 of each
** This applies to WTs and PTs
** Make sure that this works also for Crossover switches
* For non-removable warnings (because they are system generated due to the switch being reverse)
** The switch name should not be disabled
** The check box should look "disabled" (distinguishable from the manually checked warnings)
** This applies to WTs and PTs

NOTE:
* The client is not expected to react to process image changes (the switch value item does not change due to PI changes after the form is opened during creation)

Subject: Transmit & Complete
Author: Dang Vang
Description: Sign off with #9373

Subject: Finish Switch Report
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When the Transmit button is pressed:
** The system rejects the switch report, if the switch is not a hand-thrown switch
** The system rejects to report the switch "normal" if an overlapping train authority has the permission to leave the switch reverse (consider the rolled-up limits, not the initial limits)
** The system rejects to report the switch "reverse" if an overlapping train authority does not have a warning on the switch (consider the rolled-up limits, not the initial limits)
** Gensum log transmit button press
* Alternatively, validation can be run on creation, not transmit
* If the validation fails
** the form closes before the validation messages are shown
** the validation result is logged in the application log file
** the protection and the flashing is removed
** the form is removed
* If the validation passes
** Form state changes to issued
** The switch is moved into its new position
** The Transmit button is disabled
** The form goes into the "read" mode (there is no repeat)
** Each field can be read
** Once all fields are read, the "Yes" button gets enabled
* If the "Yes" button is clicked
** The form closes
** Form is set to COMPLETED state and is removed
** The protection and the flashing is removed
** The form is logged to CLDS (see CDLS document for format)
*** Prepend Switch report with state (e.g. Completed Switch Report or Aborted Switch Report)
*** Show date and time of abortion or completion
** The form is logged to GenSum

* If the "No" button is clicked
** If the switch was moved before
*** The switch is moved back to its old position
** The abort is logged to CLDS
** The abort is logged to GenSum
** The protection and flashing are removed
** The form is removed

* Switch position changes are to be logged to the GenSum

This story should sign-off #9374

Subject: [NewMissed] Default action on Addressee ID/ Work Train ID
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Pop-up to show basic information (auth number + start and end limits); Check on CTC.

Show that:
* The operation can be initiated by selecting a foreman or work train addressee field and executing
** Only one addressee field can be selected. No additional topology items can be selected.
* Per authority, the following 2 lines are displayed:
** Auth Type + Auth number + " to " + addressee
** "Between/From " + Start limit + " And/To "+ end limit
* The start and end limit should match whats on the form and authority summary (mileage or location)
* If there are multiple authorities, all authorities are shown in the pop up
** 10 lines can be shown at a time, if more than 10 lines are needed, the scroll bar should show
* There is a "Ok" button on the bottom, that closes the pop-up
* The title should read "Authority Info"
* The pop-up should be in the language of the user
* The pop up is treated as a form view (no other forms can be opened while the pop-up is shown. The pop up won't show if another form is open)
** This means also that the TLD is locked (like the normal view, meaning no panning, zooming etc).
** The dialog should open on the BSD working screen.
* There is no territory check
* Use the AuthView authorization
* Don't allow multiple pop-ups to open (Show message in status line of TLD, look at TM message; Needs to be in language of user)

!information.png!

Subject: Highlight different form types in authority summary
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Scope: 
* In auth. summary, the different form types have a different line background
* Colors are configurable in the config file

Show that:
* There is a configuration to allow colors to be assigned to authority types (applies to TOP/XTOP/WT/PT/RTCP)
* There is a configuration to allow colors to be assigned to a selected form (regardless of type)
* There is a configuration to allow colors to be assigned to a locked form (regardless of type)
* Background and foreground (text) colors can be configured via HEX
* The configuration file has a comment how to use HEX
* The initial colors are:
** TOP: white background, black font
** XTOP: white background, black font
** PT: light grey background, black font
** WT: light grey background, black font
** RTCP: light blue background, black font
** Locked: red background, white font
** Selected: blue background, white font

!auth_summary_ctc.png!

Subject: Modify WT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* We can initiate a modify WT operation by selecting a valid WT from the form summary and click the modify button on the summary.
* We can initiate a modify WT operation by clicking "Modify" on toolbar and selecting item with form or addressee field then executing.
* Modifying requires authorization
* Modify is allowed only if the user controls at least one of the items in the form (CIA shouldn't allow selection of non-controlled item)
* User is prompted if more than one form exists on item.
* The form pops up for modification
* No fields except Call RTC fields are editable (time & instructions)
* Check boxes are available for each of the boxes: 14, 15, 16, 19.1, 19.2, 19.3, 19.4, 19.5, 19.6.
* The user can select up to 3 checkboxes/items.
* If the user selects any checkbox, the Call RTC section should not be editable.
* If the user deselects all checkboxes, then the Call RTC section can be edited.
* Once the user changes the Call RTC section, no checkboxes can be selected.
* Once the user restores/resets the call rtc section, then the checkboxes can be checked.
* There should be no checkboxes on items that have already been cancelled previously.
* The items that are cancelled are still visible for viewing / retransmit / etc.
* Transmit button becomes enabled when any item has been selected for cancel item operation.
* As user selects checkboxes for item cancel, the cancel item box is generated accordingly on the fly (and updated/removed accordingly as well on uncheck).
* Read/Repeat happens on the new Cancel Item box when Transmit is pressed. Note: Only the cancel item box is shown for read/repeat.
** Can restart
** Can repeat multiple times as usual
** Keeps track of a counter and displays it in the box same way as before. (NOTE: Each cancel item box has its own counter)
** "Done" button is available when the read/repeat is finished.
* Abort can be done at any point, and will revert the authority back to its original state before the modify.
* If modifying Call RTC section, and it has been edited, the "Done" button is available.
* If "Done" is pressed, the Call RTC section is updated and form display closes.
* If there are already 3 cancel item operations previously on the form, then no checkboxes should appear since they are not allowed to do this more than 3 times.
* The user can only select up to 3 checkboxes/items for cancellation at a time. (prevent more than 3 from being selected).
* Call RTC can be changed as many times as desired.
* CDLS logging
** Completion of modify
* General summary logging
** On initial modify operation
** On transmit
** On repeat
** On completion of modify operation
** On Abort
* User can only select checkbox of Protect Against if the authority the Protect Against is for is not active. (Do not show checkbox if the protect against is currently in use system or manual).
* Once an item is cancelled, it should be greyed out (text greyed out) when viewed.
* Cancelled items are archived.
* Modify of Call RTC Time/Instructions is also archived.
* Note: The cancel item box should be filled in as each item is selected.
* Note: User is only allowed to either modify Call RTC OR do cancel item in each modify operation, not both (so buttons should be enabled/disabled appropriately).
* A restriction cannot be removed it there is an active authority using the restriction
* On view and print the canceled items boxes should be shown when populated

Subject: Mileage on forms goes away on Initsos
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* The user is logged in and has territory control
* The user places a TOP or PT form from the track line
* The user enters whole miles on the form
* The user completes the form
* The whole miles show up on the track line (if configured)
* The whole miles show up on the form when viewed.
* The user calls initsos on the machine
* The system comes back up
* The user logs back into the machine

Expected:
* The whole miles show up on the track line (if configured)
* The whole miles show up on the form when viewed.

Actual:
* The whole miles do not show up on the track line (configured or not)
* The whole miles do not show up on the form when viewed

NOTE:
* Mileages entered on protect againsts seem to work correctly.

Subject: OS report mileage hint in status line changes
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* Create an OS report on a track that has a mileage
* Select the location field
Result:
- The status line shows the valid mileage range
* Start entering a mileage
Expected result:
- The status line still shows the valid mileage range
Current result:
- The status line shows validation result of mileage
* Clear the mileage
Expected result:
- The status line still shows the valid mileage range
Current result:
- The status line shows "Please enter location"

Note: The mileage field should behave like the mileage fields of TOPs and PTs

Subject: Default values of config file parameters are ignored in some cases
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Pre-Condition:
- FSD_VISIBLE_TA_FILTER in ClientConfigurationParam (REF client) default is set to true
- There are forms in the system (PT, WT or TOP) in the controlled territory that are not visible on the current overview screens and therefore not shown in the Auth Summary

Steps:
- In the config file, set the value FsdVisibleTaFilterEnabled to false and do a parachgd jmsgate
Result:
- No filtering is happening on the auth summary and all forms are visible on it

Steps:
- Remove the "FsdVisibleTaFilterEnabled" entry in the config file and do a parachgd jmsgate
Expected result:
- No forms are visible in the auth summary (because the config value should default to true)

Current result:
- All forms are still visible

Subject: Authorities with no form numbers are shown in the system, Authority Summary
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
h3. steps

1. create PT overlapping existing PT where the limits of the new PT extend past the existing PT (see attachment "limits"), execute
2. The system will reject the form on execution, the system spits out a query dialog (see attachment "errorDialog") *do not press Abort* on the dialog.
3. Open the Authority Summary
- (*actual*) the rejected authority appears on the summary as Created with no assigned number (see attachment "authSum")
- (*expected*) the authority summary should not display the rejected authority.
4. Attemtp to Cancel or View the authority
- (*actual*) the overlap box appears listing an authority with no assigned number (see attachment "overlapBox")
- (*expected*) there should not be an overlap box, since the system rejected the creation of overlap

Example after the validation phase of form was moved until after the form was opened:

Setup:
* User controls all territory.
* Place a PT over a section of track and complete form
* Give up territory
* Take back territory but leave the ttr open
* Place another PT form over the same section of track
* Leave the query box open
* Open an FSD. If one was already open just re-open it through the BSD.

Expected:
* The FSD only shows the first PT form and hides the second PT that does not have a form number

Actual:
* The FSD shows both PTs and leaves the form number blank.

Setup:
* Click Modify, Cancel, View or Supersede button on the TLD while the query is still up
* Click a section of track that overlaps both the completed form and failed form limits.
* Execute

Expected:
* There is no selection dialog because there is only one form in the limits with a form id. (Should act as if only 1 form is in the selection)

Actual:
* There is a selection dialog that shows one form without a form Id and a second form without.

Setup: 
* Close the query dialog and the TTR.
* Lay down and complete a second PT over the first one
* Give up and take territory leaving the TTR open
* Place a 3rd PT over the limits of the first 2
* Leave the query open
* Click View, Modify, Cancel or Supercede button on the TLD
* Select a track that overlaps the original 3 forms
* Execute

Expected:
* A selection dialog shows all forms that have a form id, no forms that do not

Actual:
* A selection dialog shows all forms including the one that does not have a form id

Subject: Retransmit WT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When the form is brought up for view, the retransmit button is available.
** Retransmit button is disabled if
*** The authority is not in COMPLETE state.
*** The user does not control any of the tracks/switches in the authority.

* When the retransmit button is pressed
** Retransmit is logged to gensum
** The form shows up in Retransmit Read mode
** Contains all boxes as in the viewed form
** Call RTC box is included if not already included
** Include new instruction regarding retransmission (like PT). Use a new field if there are existing instructions. This should participate in the read/repeat.
** Contains buttons
*** Done (disabled)
*** Repeat (enabled after last field read)
*** Restart (Always enabled)
*** Abort (Always enabled)
*** Paging buttons if required where they normally are

* When Repeat button pressed
** Form is shown in Retransmit Repeat
** Contains buttons
*** Done (enabled after last field is repeated)
*** Repeat (enabled only after last field repeated)
*** Restart (Always enabled)
*** Abort (Always enabled)
*** Paging buttons if required where they normally are
** When last field is repeated
*** The gensum logs that the retransmission is repeated (like PT)

* When Done button is pressed
** Form goes away
** Retransmission done is logged to gen sum
** Retransmission is logged to CDLS
*** includes "retransmission" instructions
*** Should have the retransmission RTC initials/workstation in the heading of CDLS (not the complete section)

* When the abort button is pressed
** Form goes away
** GenSum logs abort of retransmission

* When restart button is pressed
** Form gets reset to beginning of current mode (Read or Repeat)

* Existing counters should be displayed on form
** Note that the retransmit should not update these counters.
* Bilingual form should be retransmitted in the language it was issued in.

Subject: Cancel WT
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* User can select cancel button from toolbar, select the limit item where the WT is and execute.
* The User can also cancel a WT from the form summary (like PT)
* Only authorized users can cancel.
* If there are multiple forms, prompt the user.
* REF expands the selection to flash the entire limits of the WT.
* The happy path flow is as follows:
** initial read only view
** Once transmit is clicked, RTC initials and cancel time are generated (and authority number + addressee).
** transmit (read/repeat) mode
** repeated
** done
* Log to CDLS the cancelled form
* Log to General Summary the transmit, repeat, and final cancellation (done)
* The abort is logged to general summary
* -The abort is logged to CDLS-
* Rule checks are run for cancellation before the form shows up
** Form should be in completed state
** Form limits should not be protected by anyone else
** No other form is open on the workstation
** The dispatcher controls the selected item used for cancellation
* After cancellation is completed:
** Protection is removed
** Blocking is removed
* Form is archived for playback
* Form is removed when cancelled (from form summary, and it no longer shows up for cancel if you try to cancel on that item).
* The workflow can be aborted at any point
* The cancel box has the extra "To:" field.
* If there are no other parking spots,PT or WT with that train, then have TR suspend it.

Subject: Placing a PT that overlaps a TOP that overlaps another TOP is rejected even if the PT only overlaps one TOP

Description:

Expected result: The PT is not valid
4. Shorten the PT to only overlap one TOP
5. Press Validate Limits
Expected result: The PT is valid
Current result: The PT is invalid

Subject: Transmit & Complete
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This is the 3rd phase (3/3) where the report is read (no repeat) and completed.

Note: Comments need to go to trainrecord too

Show that:
* Once the "ok" button on the roll-up dialog is pressed, the transmit form opens
* The transmit form shows the train id, the location, the time and the date (see mockup).
* The buttons on the form are Yes[disabled], No[Enabled] and Abort[Enabled]
* If the "No" button is clicked, the form is reset to the initial state and the first dialog of the OS report is shown.
* If the "Abort" button is clicked, the form is aborted
** The abort is logged to gensum and cdls
* The "Yes" button stays disabled, until the RTC clicks through the train id field, the location field and the time field.
* When the "Yes" button is clicked
** All forms that were selected to either rollup or fulfill are validated before the action is performed
** All forms that were selected in the rollup dialog as "to be fulfilled" are fulfilled
** All forms that were selected in the rollup dialog as "to be rolled-up" are rolled up to the location/mileage that was entered
** The protection/flashing of all forms goes away
** The os report form is sent to cdls
* When a form is fulfilled
** The state changes to fulfill
** It is logged to GenSum and CDLS
** The form is removed and archived
** The form is not shown anymore on the TLD
* When a form is rolled up
** The limits of the form and restrictions remain the same (DO NOT CHANGE)
** On the TLD, only the items that were not rolled up, are displayed as part of the PT / blocked
** The parts of a PT that were rolled up should not be considered for overlaps
** Restrictions on a PT are handled the same way (don't consider the part that was rolled up as overlaps)
** It is logged to GenSum
* The OS location of forms that were rolled up shows on the Authority Summary as the start limit (ONLY in the summary)
* The OS time shows up on the Authority Summary
* The OS report is sent to TR (use existing train update message)
** The OS report is valid in a way that it is forwarded to SRS

!osreport_read.png!

Subject: [NewMissed] Additional rules for TOP
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that: * A TOP cannot span CTC * A TOP cannot span STK/105 * A TOP cannot span a siding * A TOPs limits cannot be in multiple types of territories at the same time ** Cannot mix and match CTC/OCS/105 items in limits * A TOPs limits can start or end in sidings * A TOP is not allowed in subdivision track only * A TOP is allowed in interlocking (CTC) only * A TOP is allowed in Sidings only * A TOP is allowed if only the start limit is controlled * The start and end can be located in different subdivisions * -If the TOP limits are KP and are adjacent to subdivision tracks, the tracks should be included in the validation- (Currently not do-able) * A TOP is not allowed to have more than two conflicting with restrictions * No conflicting with is generated if the overlapping TOP is for the same foreman as the proposed TOPs foreman * -A TOP is not allowed over a XTOP- * A TOP is not allowed over a WT that does not have a PA for the TOP * A TOP is not allowed if it needs more than one Follow Behind per direction * A TOP cannot be outside or extend past a PTs PA (in any direction) if that leaves an overlap with the PT that is not protected * when multiple PT authorities overlap each other fully within the proposed TOP limits, generate a follow behind restriction for only the last train per direction that does not have a protect against for the proposed foreman. * A TOP is not allowed if its limits diverge from the last PT path it needs to follow but can converge * A TOP is not allowed to extend past the end limit of a PT * -A query is generated when the TOP overlaps a RTCP (P & R)- Examples: * Multiple follow behinds in same direction: 
 |------TOP-----|
 --------PT------> 1
   ------PT------> 2
If PT 2 is placed first, then PT 1, TOP will follow behind PT 1 (this is fine)
If PT 1 is placed first, then PT 2, TOP will have to follow behind PT 1 then PT 2 (this is invalid)
* Diverging vs. Converging 
     /-----B-----\
    /             \
A----------C------------D
|---------TOP---------->|

* If a PT is placed from A to B, the proposed TOP cannot be placed. The path of the TOP
  diverges from the path of the TOP (This is invalid)
* If a PT is placed from B to D, the proposed TOP can be placed. The path of the TOP is
  not diverging, but is converging. (This is valid)
* This also applies when the PT opposes the TOP. Diverging and converging is always seen
  from the perspective of the TOP, so in the valid case of PT from B to D. If the TOP was
  placed from D to A, the PT form would diverge from the TOP and turn into the invalid case.
NOTE: * Check for CTC in question log

Initiate WT
Select WT button, train id (PT, WT or PK-spot), limit selection and execution, brings up the forms and work-limits box should be filled in.

Subject: Rules/Validation/Extra Fields for WT Completion
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
System generated fields and rules
- P/A
- Warnings/Permission

Show that:
* On click of the validate limits button the following validations are ran
** Reject WT over PT if PT does not have a PA for the WT
** System generates PA for overlapping TOP
** System generates PA for overlapping WT without PA
** System generates up to 3 PAs, rejects if more are needed
** PA boxes are ordered in the order of the limit selection, WT first then TOPs
** System rejects a WT to span over sidings / include sidings
** Reject if start limit is not in territory controlled by RTC
** System rejects a WT to start or end in an 105
** System rejects a WT in only sidings and stks/105
** System rejects a WT to start or end in CTC (main, switch, siding)
** System allows a WT to overlap overlapping TOPs
** The normal rules are ran (protection, max 6 switch warnings/permission)

* PAs cannot be used more than once at any given time (like PT)
* Switch warnings are generated for switches that currently in reverse
* Switch permissions are generated for switches taken in reverse (limits over the reverse branch)

* a TOP cannot be placed over a WT unless the WT has a PA for the TOP
* a TOP CANNOT follow behind a WT

Subject: [Missed] Shared Territories
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
In DETEAREA, items are assignable to more than one territory (techarea1 - 3).

It might be that the only change to do is to allow one item to be in multiple territories on the Java side.

Includes REF operations, TM operations (and maybe more)

Show that:
* There are devices in the DB that are configured to be in multiple tech areas
* An item that is in multiple tech areas can be controlled by each RTC that controls at least one of the areas.
* If one RTC protects the "shared" item, the other cannot protect it

Dispatcher A controls territory one, Dispatcher B controls territory two. Shared territory items/parking spots below are configured for territories one and two.

* A shared territory topology item allows forms to be placed by multiple dispatchers
** Topology items are configured to be in multiple territories.
** Dispatcher A  can place a form (TOP for example) on the shared territory item.
** Dispatcher B can supercede the form on the shared territory item.

* A shared territory parking spot allows trains to be inserted, moved, removed by multiple dispatchers
** Parking spot items are configured to be in multiple territories.
** Dispatcher A can Add, Move, Remove a train on the shared territory parking spot.
** Dispatcher B can Add, Move, Remove the same train on the shared territory parking spot.

Subject: Add support for Crossover switches
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Crossovers can be configured via ITEMREL
* There are a couple of crossover switches in the test DB
* The system does not allow to give a permission for a switch if the switch is part of a crossover and one of the switches in not in the limits
* The system automatically includes the partner switch in a crossover when adding permission for one switch (if both switches are in form limits)
** Both crossover switches are listed separately in the warning/permissions dialog
** When one is checked, the other is automatically checked and vice versa
** Application logging should log that switch was automatically checked/un-checked.

* The system does not allow to give a permission for a switch if a permission cannot be placed on the partner
* The system does generate a switch permission for a switch, if the partner crossover switch is not in the limits
* System fails validation if switch has permission and switches crossover partner is not part of the blocked limits on the form.
* System fails validation if switch has permission and the switches crossover partner is in the limits but does not have a switch permission.

Additional information:
The RTC2.OCS system shall require the position of each switch in a crossover to be reported separately, and reporting one switch in a crossover has no effect on the position of the other switch.
--> One partner can be normal, while the other is reverse

Subject: Random OcsCache exception "Unable to write to Cache"

4/9/2015: There were two problems: 1. The message uuid container filling up, due to incorrect cleanup 2. Java apps not able to write to cache. No 1. was fixed with R2 Patch2, No 2. is still being investigated. 7/2/2015: This problem has not happened with R4

Subject: Superseded PT form comes back after COM cold start
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:

Subject: Use up Protect Against
Author: Dang Vang
Description:

Ask CN:
* Can we have multiple authorities at the same time for one protect against? (Two TOPs on separate parts of the P/A).

Show that:
* Any PA can only be used once
* A PA cannot be used by multiple forms
* If a protected form is being superseded then the superseding form can reuse any PAs that the superseded form used.

Subject: Add support to OS report for hundreds of a mile
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* In the OS report, the user can enter miles in a decimal format for up to a hundreds of a mile
* The entry is still validated to be within the selected block and is not outside of the PT that is being OS'ed
* On the roll-up dialog, the correct decimal mileage shows up
* The flashing of the form is truncated on the first "ok" button click to the entered mileage
* An OS report can be created on a block that does not span a whole mile (e.g. 50.2 to 50.9)

Subject: Validation
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This story applies to the initial OS Report dialog


Show That:
* The following client side validations exist with their own unique validation messages shown on the status line:
** The client will not allow a time to be entered that is before the complete time of the PT form being OSed.
** The client will not allow a time to be entered that is before yesterday.
** The client will not allow a time to be entered that is in the future.
* RULE: After initial selection check that protected items (all items of the PT-to-be-OS'ed) are not protected by anyone else.
* RULE: Usual checks (access rights, locks, ...)
* RULE: Don't allow OS'ing of a form that is not completed.
* On rule failure:
** show failure messages to user and abort form 
* On query rule match (shown in workflow):
** Show query dialog to display the query rule result
** On click on the yes button the roll up dialog should come up (if possible)
** On click on the no button the OS form should abort.

Subject: [NewMissed] Logging of switches being added/removed for SW permissions and warnings
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
To GenSum:
Switches being moved due to permissions (during creation on transmit; If aborted after, during creation, sw move back).

To Log file:
User picking/unpicking from switch warning/permission dialog.

Show that:
* Switches that are being moved due to permissions are logged in the GenSum
** The logging should happen during creation on transmit
* Switches that are being moved back when the creation is aborted are logged to the GenSum
* If the user checks or unchecks any warning or permission in the warning/permission dialog, it is logged to the REF client log file

TTRM, Train Graph, Playback, Alarm2, Alarm3
