Subject: [NewMissed] Refactor TOP form creation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:

* When TOP limits have been selected and executed, the form opens without any REF validation, except for territory, other forms open, authorization and ttr pending/open
* No overlapping limits are generated (this includes conflicting with, follow behind)
* The transmit button is disabled when the form opens
* The transmit button stays disabled until validate limits has been selected
* When Validate Limits is clicked and the limits are not valid, a user message shows the reason, but the form is not closed automatically
* When validation fails, the data on the form does not get reset but shows whatever was shown before validation
* When validation fails, the user can enter the limits to the last valid limits or if there were no valid limits yet, to the initial limits (mileages can be shorten but not lengthen once valid)
* When the addressee or the limits are modified, the Validate Limits button is enabled and the Transmit button is disabled
* When validation passes, overlapping limits (conflicting with, follow behind) boxes are generated.
* Make sure that the TTR Lock and TXFR Locks do not prevent the form from being finished after the form has been opened.

Subject: [NewMissed] Remove capability to add manual PAs on PTs for PTs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* During PT form creation, the user is not able to add a "manual" PA for another PT
** This includes a form cleanup to remove the "proceed" and "working" buttons
* Train ids (proceed trains and parking spots) cannot be selected as part of the "add restriction" selection
* If no authority id field is selected, the restriction type should default to working foreman.

Subject: [NewMissed] Refactor PT form creation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:

* When limits and addressee have been selected for a PT and executed, the form opens without any REF validation, except for territory, other forms open, authorization and ttr pending/open
* No overlapping limits are generated (this includes Opposing Trains, Protect Against).
* No switch warnings or permissions will be generated.
* The transmit button is disabled when the form opens
* The transmit button stays disabled until valid limits have been selected
* Initially, the Switch Warnings/Permissions - Box is not visible, until the Validate Limits is successful
* When Validate Limits is clicked and the limits are not valid, a user message shows the reason, but the form is not closed automatically
* When validation fails, the data on the form does not get reset but shows whatever was shown before validation
* When validation fails, the user can enter the limits to the last valid limits or if there were no valid limits yet, to the initial limits (mileages can be shorten but not lengthen once valid)
* When validation passes, overlapping limits are generated (this includes Opposing Trains, Protect Against).
* When validation passes for the first time, switch warnings/permissions will be put on the form and displayed to the user.
* When validation passes subsequent times, switch warnings/permissions are removed for switches that are not within the limits anymore.
* When the limits are modified (before a manual restriction was added), the Validate Limits button is enabled and the Transmit button is disabled
* When a manual restriction is added, the limits of the PT cannot be modified
* When the limits of a manual restriction are modified, the Transmit button is disabled and the Validate Limits button is enabled
* Make sure that the TTR Lock and TXFR Locks do not prevent the form from being finished after the form has been opened.

Subject: Inititate OS report
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
- Train
- +/- known Pt.
- FSD

Show that:
* A OS report can be initiated by clicking the OS-Report TLD button and selecting a track, switch or known point.
* Optionally, a train id from the proceed train field can be selected before the track/switch

Subject: Display Rollups
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This is the 2nd phase (2/3).
All previous PTs within the subdivision are shown and automatically selected for fulfill (can be de-selected, might need to be restricted; verify with CN).

Look at mockup. Only selection and comments are editable.

Show That:
* When OK is pressed on the initial OS Report, the initial OS Report is replaced by the roll up dialog shown below.
* Ok is logged to the general summary as "User Continued OS Report"
* The flashing trackline items are adjusted to reflect any whole miles that were previously entered on the initial OS Report form
* The addressee, date/time, location are populated with the initial OS Report data
* The addressee, date/time, location fields are not editable.
* Track release and fulfilled sections are populated as follows:
** All PT forms behind and including the entered OS location (regardless if there are empty track sections between PT forms or branch switches)
*** Note: We search behind the selected mileage.
**  PT forms are topologically ordered (closest forms first, issued time for tie-breaker)
** Only completed forms are shown
** Only PT forms in the subdivision the OS report is placed in are shown
** Only PT forms that are controlled by dispatcher are shown
** Only PT forms in the same direction are shown
** Only PT forms that are not currently being worked on are shown (Forms with no items that are currently protected, not including OS reports initial protection).
** Only PT forms that have a complete time before the OS report time are shown
** If PT form ends before or on the OS location, the PT form is available to be fulfilled
** If OS location is within PT form, the PT form is available to be rolled up
** All forms on roll up dialog are initially selected
** PTs to Fulfill are in the format:
*** Fulfill #{FormId} {addressee}  From {start limit} to {end limit}
** PTs to Roll up are in the format:
*** Track Release #{FormId} {addressee}  From {start limit} to {end limit}
** When a check box is selected/deselected this action is logged in the ref client log file.


* Forms that are validated are logged into the REF log file, including the validation result (to be able to see why a form was not listed in the dialog)
* Flash all items on forms displayed (initially selected) on the roll up dialog behind the OS report location
* Protect all items on the forms displayed (initially checked in the list) on the roll up dialog
* A comments field is visible on the form that holds up to 144 characters
* The comments field is editable and is optional
* There are three buttons on the roll up dialog
** Ok Button
*** should do nothing
** Abort Button
*** Should abort form and unflash/unprotect anything flashed or protected as a result of OS Report
*** Should log abort to the general summary "User Aborted OS Report"
** Restart button
*** Should unflash/unprotect all items on the trackline except the initial ref flash/unprotected items
*** Should bring the form up in its initial state on the first dialog
*** Should log Restart to the general summary "User Restarted OS Report"

* Keep the form look and feel consistent to other forms (e.g. white background, black fonts in table, don't display time in datefield etc.)
!osReport.png!

NOTE:
* Make sure that crawling works with decimal whole miles

Subject: Clean up OS Report
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
This story applies to the initial OS Report dialog Show That: * On initial selection of initial OS Report when form comes up ** Items are flashed that are on or behind the initial selection for the current form being OSed ** All items on the form that is being OSed are protected ** General Summary logs OS Report Created * On abort button clicked on initial OS Report dialog ** General Summary logs OS Report Aborted ** Items on PT form that are protected as a result of OS Report are un-protected ** Items on PT form that are flashing as a result of OS Report are un-flashed. Example: If track 2 is selected, tracks 1 and 2 will be highlighted(flashing), tracks 1 2 and 3 will be protected. 
0                        0
   1    2    3    4    5
 ---- ---- ---- ---- ----
    100  110  120  130
--------------> PT Form

Subject: Trains are no longer persisted on java TM server
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:

* On failover all parking spots stay filled with train data.
** This means that if a train is copied/routed into a parking spot from a PT then the PT is rolled up, after failover the system still shows the train in the parking spots as well as on the pt form location

* On cold startup the system currently requests the trains from train record. Train record will not have the train on the parking spot after the above scenario. This means that all trains will no longer appear on the parking spots when the system comes up.

* The system will still have to be able to match trains to forms based on the srs id in train record.

NOTES:
* The train catalog in tm is marked with failover only annotation.
* All forms will hold the SRS id instead of the unique train id.
** The unique train id will no longer be persisted in the train catalog, therefore we must rely on the srs id and persist the srs id on the form.

* WT uses PA

Parent task: Story #10099: [NewMissed] Setup web playback
Subject: -make spectrum's soins/soinsc processes work under Solaris 10 (to fix recording of general summary and alarm messages)-
Author: Jim Kelliher
Description:
UPDATE: CN doesn't care about MESSAGES table, so this was not needed(doesn't work on their yard system either) they rely on their NLS suystem logs)



old UPDATE: for time being added a logic to insert fake messages into the table on web2, plus a button to trigger it from JobMonitor...this to be able to continue making story progress in other areas where playback needs attention...

general problem is that Oracle 64bit libs were/are being linked to soins/soinc; I changed src/build/NEEDS/Oracle.need and OracleStatic.need to force linking with the libs in ../11.2.0/32bitlib - after checking that the users of the libs were compiled as 32 bit ELF exe's; but this breaks the nightly build...for ImTrdInterface, linker complains about lib.2.so conflicting with lib.1.so ; others likely would have failed as well if the build hadn't borked out there)...

we can either bang on the library link issues until everyone is happy about the 32bitlib's, or we can compile the spectrum executables(or perhaps some subset) as 64 bit; if doing all of them it likely will mean work on protocol code(per Goran), and who knows what else(IMHO customers will not be happy getting a 64 bit OS upgrade and the old apps still running as 32) - jim

currently these spectrum processes fail to logon to oracle and bail out, causing no general summary or alarm messages to be written to the hfd1 SID's MESSAGES table, from which playback extracts the event messages it displays; this is also preventing playback from initializing and starting up properly, since the lack of records in the MESSAGES table causes one of the main queries in playback to trigger a "no data available" condition

Subject: Workstation will timeout after the lan is dissconnected for a period of time.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Placeholder. Currently we have discussed the possibility of slamming the client shut after a period of time as well as the possibility of not buffering any user actions on the work station. Our understanding at this point is as follows:

* The buffering of mouse clicks is an artifact of the X server using TCP to communicate between the client and server and seems to be out of our hands if we use the workstations X server (the internet agrees)
* The client only slams shut after the network cable is plugged back in (it looks like spectrum is timing out and slamming the clients shut).

Option 1:
* We write an application/integrate into an existing application running on the workstation to slam the x windows shut after we cannot talk to the mmi anymore
** The complication with this is what do we do if the connection is slammed shut on the workstation side but not on the vicos side. will the clients still be alive while the workstation is dead?
** How do we detect when the x server is 'frozen' is a ping good enough? can an x connection die for any other reason other than all communication going away. what is a port is blocked?

Option 2:
* We get spectrum to slam the client shut sooner (it looks like it is setup to die within 2 min. we would like to get this down to 1 min) and see if the customer is fine with the client not dying until the network is restored or the user interferes.

CN has agreed that the current behavior of the workstation is acceptable as outlined by clarification log entry D

Subject: Note icons are not showing up in trackline display.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Test run: 1941.
Step 16-18: After created new note on a switch, Type some text in the field, then click the execute icon.

Expected result: A note icon appears next to the station name in the trackline display

Actual result: no note icon appears on display.

================================================

Step 30-31: create another note on a same switch

Expected result: On the trackline display the icon changes to indicate multiple notes associated with that station

Actual result: no note icons appears on display.
================================================
Same problem on steps 49, 51, 55.

Subject: Train summary is not updated with existing train IDs.
Author: Michael Gurevich
Description:
Train summary fields are not updated with new train IDs. 

Started 12.2.  There were over 20 train IDs in the list. 
I "retire" almost all trains from the list, except 3 that were not showing up on the map. 
Then I created about 10 new train IDs.  They are showing up on the map on parking  spots.  Then I created some PT and WT trains from them,  and then deleted them from the map.  The train summary did not update. 
Now I am trying to create new trains with IDs that were deleted, the system says "train can not be created because ID already exist", but they are not showing up in train summary. 
Also - 3 trains that I could not delete from Train summary, are not showing up on the map. 
(Tried to move the to different parking spots from edit train form, the trains still dont show up on new place, and train summary is not updated with new information).

See log files:  TM log file, CS bridge log file (latest one), messages log file.

Subject: Limits are protected after workstation disconnect
Author: Alex Plotkin
Description:
Steps:

* Create an Authority with limit A-B
* Transmit, Complete form
* Do not read the time to the field
* Disconnect workstation from MMI by womvis-q or INITSOS MMI
* Reconnect the workstation

Expected:

* -Form to be removed-
* Form is not removed
* Limits A-B no longer are protected

Actual:

* Form is removed
* Limits A-B are still protected

Subject: Update log4j to support changing debug levels

Description:

* The current log files all still work
** A log file for each java application 
** A JMS log file for each java application
** An activeMQ log file
** A Jms Gate log file

* The log4j jars in exlib are upgraded to version 2.4.1

* All ocs.us applications use the upgraded version of the log4j configuration file

Subject: COM Failover, REFser 6001 null
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Log files are in adm1ocs:/tmp/Bug-11430_Rel-173008_1511171414_Packet.tar


The stability test was running on 4 workstations on the adm1ocs system.

MESSAGES LOG:
@Nov 17 12:30:56 com2ocs mcs   : [ID 117509 user.warning] emergency message received: Nov 17 12:30:56 com2ocs REFSer: [ID 914765 user.alert] 6001 null   30:56.78@

COM1OCS REF.LOG
@2015-11-17 12:30:56,753 FATAL [CommonJmsListener] Exception occured during message handling of message ProcessImagePropertiesUpdateMessage [updates=6]
java.lang.ClassCastException@
...
2015-11-17 12:30:58,344 DEBUG [ControlSystemInterface] handleMessage(): Handling 6 ProcessImageItem Updates.
2015-11-17 12:30:58,345 FATAL [CommonJmsListener] Exception occured during message handling of message ProcessImagePropertiesUpdateMessage [updates=6]
java.lang.ClassCastEXception: ocs.us.ref.api.form.RtcpForm cannot be cast to ocs.us.ref.api.form.AbstractProcessImageItemsForm
	at ocs.us.ref.workflow.WorkflowProcessor.isItemInFormBeingViewed(WorkflowProcessor.java:898)
	at ocs.us.ref.workflow.WorkflowProcessor.includesItemInFormBeingViewed(WorkflowProcessor.java:864)

---------------------------------------
CAUSE: code error - the WorkflowProcessor isItemInFormBeingViewed() method tried to cast an RtcpForm to an AbstractProcessImageItems form.

RESOLUTION: changed method to cast input forms to IProcessImageItemsForm so that it will work on forms other than movement authorities.

Subject: The Authority Summary does not completely refresh on Call Up.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*preconditions:*
1.need at least one authority in each view.

*steps:*
1.open overview that shows one of the authorities.
2.open authority summary, to view the authorities on the currently viewed overview.
3.in authority summary select the "All Auth" button.
4.select one of the listed authorities that is greyed out.
5.select eh Call Up button.
6.from the Call Up list select the view available and then the Ok button.

*Expected:* 
1.The overview displays the authority
2.Authority summary is updated, the selected authority is no longer greyed out, and the operation buttons are enabled.
*Actual:* 
1.The overview displays the authority
2.Authority summary is updated, the selected authority is no longer greyed out, and the operation buttons not enabled.
3.I have to select another authority for the buttons to become enabled.

Subject: [Change Request] Add remove form to tech tool script
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Forms can be removed via the tech tool script (not the ref-diagnostics) by form number
* Before a form is removed
** The script prints the form with the number from the persistency provider and the forms container
* After the form is printed the user can re-enter the form number to delete the form
* If a different form number is entered, the script terminates.
* Form deletion from the script means:
** Removing the form index from the integrity monitor
** Removing the form from all containers including
*** forms container
*** persistency provider
*** mnesia
*** aumitems
** Sending a close to the clients that have the form open
** Remove the workflow that belongs to the form number
** The removal is logged to Tech GenSum 
** Setting the cancel date [See note]
** Archiving the form [See note]
** Logging to CDLS [See note]

Note:
* Check on CTC the exact form deletion behavior (does it set RTC initials etc) 

update:
-about CTC behavior, see notes and ammended task descriptions for related tasks;CTC does not send to playback or cdls, just sets state to ABORTED and sets aborted timestamp; REF now sets state to VOIDED and sets canceled timestamp) - jim

SEE WIKI FOR LATEST USAGE INSTRUCITONS/BEHAVIOR - jim

Subject: Use NTP for time syncrhonization
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: Make forms open right under the BaSiDi
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Forms open initially under the BaSiDi (not centered anymore)
** This can be achieved by having a configurable offset
* When forms resize (on validate limits etc), the position of the form does not change

Note:
* This story should also take care of preventing forms to jump to different positions

Subject: [NewMissed] Workstations should connect automatically to designated MMI on start-up
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* There is a configuration file on the workstation that holds the mapping between workstations and their default MMI.
** Note this must be one file that CN can put all work station configurations in
* When the user logs in into the workstation (e.g. after reboot)
** the workstation tries to connect to the default MMI in the configuration file.
** If the MMI is not active (PC complete), the script terminates. No dialog or further attempts are necessary.
** If the workstation determines that the default MMI is active (PC complete) the workstation logs into this MMI (brings up the BSD skipping the xtchooser selection screen)

* This configuration file is to be distributed using the NISS tool much like the host file.

NOTE:

The file should be something like

workstationHostName1=MMI1
workstationHostName2=MMI4

This is not a strict format or anything, just to make sure its clear that this configuration file will hold all workstations and their respective MMI. There is nothing that disallows an MMI from being used more than once. The Cadillac version wouldn't allow the workstation to be used more than once but we have no requirements for this.

Subject: Customize right click menu on workstation
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Note this is not about writing a tool to configure right click menus on the workstation. This is about configuring right click menus for the existing two users on the workstations spsy and spus Show That: * The right click menu on the workstation can be modified using xml configuration files * Different users can have different right click menus * All changes are to be reflected on a running workstation as well as the workstation distribution in SVN located in branch CN_OCS2/WORKSTATION ** Note this menu is primarily for when the user right clicks on the desktop * There is an XTChooser option ** When this option is chosen, the workstation finds the active com in its domain, using the host file, and runs the xtchooser command on it ** The XTChooser window pops up and allows the user to select an mmi to log into * There is a new option called XConnect ** XConnect will perform the same action as the automatic workstation login listed in story #11046 * All options on the right click menus function (don't just add empty labels to the right click menus) * The options per user should be as follows: 
* Spsy
** Spectrum
*** XConnect
*** XTChooser
** Terminals
*** XTerm
** Tools
*** Clock
** Screenshot
** Reboot
** Shutdown

* Spus
** Spectrum
*** XConnect
*** XTChooser
** Tools
*** Clock
** Logout
Note the indentation. XTerm is in a submenu called Terminals. Clock is in a submenu called Tools NOTE: check out the file /etc/xdg/openbox/menu.xml on the workstation. This is the global right click menu file. There is an analogous file for each user. In SVN: * The global right click menu.xml is in the following dir: ** svn://usmtkw002/branches/CN_RTC2_OCS/WORKSTATION/openbox/etc/xdg/openbox * The spus right click menu.xml is in the following dir: ** svn://usmtkw002/branches/CN_RTC2_OCS/WORKSTATION/home/spus/.config/openbox

Subject: Shell timeout should be configured to 10 min
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Log onto the work station
* Open a shell
* Wait for the shell to log out

Expected:
* The shell should wait 10 minutes before closing

Actual:
* The shell only waits 2 minutes before closing

Subject: Form checksum not exported to XML
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Create a TOP
* Export the mnesia cache (with heapmigrator export)
* STOPSOS the system
* Clear the mnesia DB
* Copy the export.xml file to import.xml
* INITSOS the system

Expected:
* The system starts up and the form is not locked

Current:
* The system locks the form once PC complete

Note:
The checksum value is not exported into the file. This means that the form will either not start up because the value is initiated to null or it will start up
with a 0 checksum, which will cause the form to get locked.

Subject: Duplicate logging when creating a switch report
Author: Will Martin
Description:
cause: jbpm workflow setup error: node-enter and node-leave xml 'blocks' containing directives to log to the application log were placed outside of all other nodes; this apparently is interpreted by jbpm to log the entry and exits to/from each node in the workflow. problem was that some of the nodes also included the directives, plus some other things(so could not just leave the 'global' directives and clean up the other nodes).

resolution: removed the 'global' node-enter/leave blocks from the workflow processdefinition.xml file.

Setup:
* Place a switch report in the system
* Look at the ref log

Expected:
* All node enter and node leave are only logged once

Actual:
* Many of the node enter and node leave logging is duplicated
 for example:
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeEnterActionHandler] Enter node :check_no_open_forms
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeEnterActionHandler] Enter node :check_no_open_forms
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeLeaveActionHandler] Leaving node :check_no_open_forms
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeLeaveActionHandler] Leaving node :check_no_open_forms
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeEnterActionHandler] Enter node :run_rules
2015-09-14 16:47:07,716 DEBUG [LogNodeEnterActionHandler] Enter node :run_rules
...

2015-09-14 16:47:07,748 DEBUG [LogNodeLeaveActionHandler] Leaving node :run_rules
2015-09-14 16:47:07,748 DEBUG [LogNodeLeaveActionHandler] Leaving node :run_rules

There are many more in the log files than listed above

Subject: Suspended trains come back after INITSOS
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place a train in the system
* Place a PT out of the parkingspot that is NOT adjacent to another parking spot
* Fulfill the PT
* The train shows suspended in the train summary
* The train no longer shows up in the TTR
* INITSOS the machine

Expected:
* The train shows suspended in the train summary
* The train no longer shows up in the TTR

Actual:
* The train does not show suspended in the train summary
* The train shows up in the TTR

Subject: Train approach message should unsuspend trains
Author: Will Martin
Description:
against story #9310

Steps:
* Add a train to the trackline
* Remove the train from the trackline
* The train should now show as suspended on the train record
* Send a train approach message from the SRS simulator

Expected:
* The train is moved to the parking spot that the train approach message said it should go to
* The train shows up on the track line on that parking spot
* The train is no longer suspended

Actual:
* The train is not moved to the parking spot that the train approach message said it should go to
* The train does not show up on the track line on that parking spot
* The train is still suspended

Subject: Train record shows duplicate values in OS Reports section
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place multiple PTs on the trackline
* Os report the proceed trains (except the first PT).

Expected:
* No matter how many proceed train forms are involved the each OS report will only generate one entry on the train record display (OS section)
* Any train suspends will generate an additional entry on the train record display (OS section).

Actual:
* There are many duplicate entries on the train record display (OS section).

Subject: [Change Request] Second name of foreman should show up on the trackline display
Author: Will Martin
Description:
QL:336, QL:426

Show That:
* When a TOP is placed in the system
** If only one name is given, this name is shown on the track line
** If there are more than two names given, the first name is shown on the track line
** If two names are given (for instance first and last name) the last name is shown on the track line
* Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed

QL:426 If two names are given as a TOPs addressee we will use the second (last) name to show on the TLD. If more than 2 names are given, we are planning on using the last name given? Or should we take all contents of the addressee field starting with the second name?

A: If there are not two names in the addressee show the first name. If there are two names, show the second name

Subject: [NewMissed] Rule names of failed rules are logged in the application log

Subject: Allow selection of intermediate, start and end KPs for form operations

Description:
Show that:
* The start KP, end KP or intermediate KPs of a form can be used for the following form operations:
** View
** Modify

** TOP,XTOP,Wrk Trn, Prcd Trn, RTC Blok, Supced, Sup Type, Cancel, Mod, View, OS Reprt, Swt Rprt, New Trd, Move Trn, Rmv Trd, Info, Print, Note

* The Tech BaSiDi contains:

* Admin:

* Chief:

NOTE: Do not actually delete buttons from the BSD. Drag the buttons that should not show up off of the BSD view.

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Log unacknowledged cancel state to CDLS
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The state change to unacknowledged cancel is logged to CDLS
* When the cancellation is aborted after the form went to the unack_cancel state, the abort cancel is logged to CDLS
* When the cancellation is completed after the form went to the unack_cancel state, the complete cancel is logged to CDLS

Subject: Don't allow supersedes to result in new After restrictions
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a PT is superseded, the new PT is rejected if it has an After restriction that the original PT did not have
** New here means that there is either an After for a new train or an After at a new location

Subject: [NewMissed] Add unacknowledged cancel state
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When the transmit button is clicked during a TOP/XTOP,PT,WT cancel operation
** The state changes to UNACKNOWLEDGED_CANCEL
* When the cancellation is aborted
** The state changes to it's previous state (COMPLETED)
* When the cancellation is completed
** The state changes to CANCELLED
* State changes are shown on the authority summary, in the GenSum and the authority selection pop-up

Note:
* Logging to CDLS is a separate story

Subject: Handle TRD train data on cold start
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* On cold startup
** When TRD is not responding, TM does not go PC complete
** On the train GI
*** trains that don't exist in TRD are removed from TM
*** trains that exist in TRD are merged in a way that the location is taken from TRD and the parking spot from TM

* When the ADM comes up, all messages in the train update buffer are sent to the ADM

Subject: Add new switch handling for data activation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When switches are added during activation
** non hand-throw switches are initialized to normal
** hand-throw switches are initialized to reverse

* On cold start
** pc-init initializes all switches to reverse
** -REF- +ADS+ initializes non hand throw switches to normal
** -REF- +ADS+ initializes hand throw switches that were previously reported normal to normal, all other reverse
* On failover
** all switches retain their positions

Subject: Allow toggling of a/b/go trains on the TGI
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* A/Z series trains can be toggled on and off on the TGI
* Go trains can be toggled on and off on the TGI

Subject: [NewMissed] Show element text of switches in track field on switch-only forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If a form is created on only switches, the track field shows the element text of the switches
** The track field should still only show data that it would show on track-forms (e.g. for PTs only if it contains north/south/nord/sud etc)
* If a restriction is created on only switches, the track field shows the element text of the switches

Subject: Create PT from train id should insert spaces into addressee
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When creating a PT from a parking spot, the addressee should have spaces between SRS id, Lead engine initials and id
** e.g. 234 CNOC 5678, 234 CN 1111 etc
* Same applies to manual restriction creation

Subject: [NewMissed] Cleanup drools failure/query messages
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Failure/Query messages show item names where applicable
* Failure/Query messages show form types and numbers where applicable
* Failure/Query messages show reasons(first N characters)/addressee/train names where applicable

Subject: RTCP form limits are losing their start location
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Steps:
* User controls only OCS W territory.
* Select the RTCP button on the TLD
* Select limits on the trackline from (3)OCST (3)CLEV (6)SW3 (703)SWI to (5)COMP (10)HOTM (13)WSW (703)SWI
* Execute
* Fill out the form
* Change the start limit mileage (Now the form should start in a territory you do not control)
* Click the validate limits button
* A popup shows up saying that the start item is not in controlled territory
* Press OK
* Clear out the start mileage of the limit
* The text reverts back to what it originally is when the field loses focus
* Press validate limits

Expected:
* The form comes back valid and allows you to place

Actual:
* A popup shows up saying that the start item is not in controlled territory

NOTE:
It looks like the validation rules are running on the old form limits that failed on the previous rule run instead of the new form limits.

Subject: Trackline should lock on first item selection on RTCP forms
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* On the track line click on the RTC Blok button
* Select a track, switch, or known point as the first selection of the RTCP
* Attempt to scroll on the trackline

Expected:
* The track line cannot be scrolled, moved, minimized, etc.

Actual:
* The track line can be scrolled, moved, minimized, closed

Subject: Subdivision field should update when PT form is OSed
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Steps:
* Place a new train in the system
* Place a PT that spans multiple subdivisions on the trackline
** (4)Capi (2)BERL (5)STN (756)KnownPnt to (5)Comp (1)Appl (5)STN (756)KnownPnt
* Open the Form Summary Display
* If the authority does not display (due to screen configuration) press the All Authority button
* The subdivision column of the placed form should show CAPITOL
* OS report the PT in the COMPANY subdivision
** (5)COMP (3)BJCT (4)N4TK (701)TRA entering a mileage like 1

Expected:
* The subdivision column of the placed form shows COMPANY

Actual:
* The subdivision column of the placed form shows CAPITOL

Subject: Times on the RTCP form are not formatted in the timezone of the form.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Steps:
* In an area with a timezone that is different than the timezone of the spectrum machine.
* Place a TOP form on a section of track
* Note the complete time of the form
* Cancel the TOP form
* Place an RTCP form on a track section
* View the RTCP form
* Compare the placed at time with the time that was noted on the TOP.

Expected:
* These two times should be close to each other. (within the same hour to prove that we are using the correct timezone)

Actual:
* These two values are an hour apart. The form is not shown in the timezone of the form.

Subject: Manual protect against is allowed to take different path than form
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup

* Begin placing a Proceed train or work train from Clevland to Edinburgh along the main line
* Validate the form
* Press Add Restriction
* Select limits for the new restriction that start on the path of the form, go up into the siding in detroit then come back down to the path of the original form (the manual overlap should overlap the proposed form in both the start and end of the restriction)

Expected

* The manual restriction is not created and a query message should pop up

Actual

* The manual restriction is created

Subject: TrainLoc is not synchronized on failover.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Log on to a distributed machine with territory
* Place a train in a parking spot
* Using BQ on the active com look at the TrainLoc relation and see that the train exists
* Using BQ on the passive com look at the TrainLoc relation and see that the train does not exist
* Failover the box
* Use BQ to look at TrainLoc to see if the train exists on the new primary com

Expected:
* The train exists

Actual:
* The train does not exist

Subject: Manual protect againsts and switch report do not construct addressees correctly
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Put 2 trains in the system with lead engine information
* Begin to place a proceed train over some limits with one of the trains
* Add a manual restriction to the form using the other train (from the parking spot)

Expected:
* The addressee is filled with a the train information including the SRS Id and lead engine information

Actual:
* The tracking ID is used for the addressee


Setup:
* Have a train in a parking spot
* Create a switch report by selecting the train in the parking spot

Expected:
* The addressee is filled with a the train information including the SRS Id and lead engine information

Actual:
* The tracking ID is used for the addressee

Subject: WTs don't move trains out of parking spots in TR
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Place a train on a parking spot
* Open train record, the train should be listed and with PK status
* Place and complete a work train out of the parking spot that does NOT end adjacent to a parking spot
* Refresh train record

Expected:
* The train still shows up in train record
* The train does not have the PK status next to it
* The trains location is updated to reflect that the train moved to the start item of the work train

Actual:
* The train still shows up in train record
* The train still has the PK status next to it
* The train location is not updated to reflect that the train moved to the start item of the work train

Subject: RTCP forms do not work with default action
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place an RTCP form over some limits so the reason shows up in the addressee.
* Click on the addressee/reason on the trackline
* Execute

Expected:
* The authority information dialog comes up listing the reason and limits
** The whole reason is shown
** The first item on the first limit is shown as the start limit of the form
** The last item of the last limit is shown as the end limit of the form

Actual:
* A completely empty authority information dialog comes up.


Example of form in CTC:
!authinfo.png!

Note: Confirmed with CN that they want to see the first item of the first limit and the end item of the last limit (like CTC).

Subject: Switch report should query user when a non-valid addressee is selected.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Put a TOP/XTOP/PT/WT form in the system
* Make the form locked
* Select the switch report icon on the TLD toolbar
* Select the addressee of the locked form
* Select a switch
* Execute

Expected:
* A pop up shows telling the user that there were no valid forms in selection

Actual:
* No popup or form comes up.

Subject: After failover system fails over again when creating a new train
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Steps: * Log into a distributed system as a dispatcher * Initsos the standby com * After the coms are hot again, failover to the standby com * Place a train in the system Expected: * The user is able to place a train in the system Actual: * The user cannot place a trian and the system fails over again

Subject: [NewMissed] GoTrains should not auto-retire
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When go-trains get suspended, they do not retire automatically

Note:
* Trains in OCS should never auto retire. Check for occurrences of autoretire Y in trd and change it to N

Subject: [Change Request] Protect STK if is adjacent to the form that is being operated on
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* STKs are protected on create and supersede, when forms are adjacent to the STK (start/end on the KP adjacent)
* Remove the protection from the STK, if limits are shortened away from the KP
* Protection is applied to all protecting form operations.
* If the proposed form is adjacent to an already protected STK, the form is rejected
* Refactor the "adjacent STK" rules to use the protected STK item (see Note)

Note:
* This story needs to refactor the logic of finding adjacent STKs. Currently it checks that the forms are adjacent (e.g. the proposed TOP and the existing RTCP). What this story will need to do is to check that the proposed TOP limits contain the additionally protected STK track and to check that track for RTCPs.

Subject: Archive every form event to Oracle required by TGI and display correctly
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* All forms (TOPs/XTOPs, WTs, PTs and RTCPs) show correctly on the TGI
* All forms open correctly in the authority view
* There is no visible difference of RTCP-Ps and -Rs
* The authority view shows per limit one segment with the correct start and end limit 
* RTCPs have multiple segments, one per limit
* The authority view shows all restrictions, permissions and warnings in extra sections
* The SRS train id is shown at the start of the PT line and every time that a PT re-enters the subdivision

The following will be determined later:
* Labels on the X-Axis should show B3's
* Switches that are not marked as show-mile and that are in the same b2 are shown as a double line with the b2 over the lines (see picture)

Subject: Move CDLS for abort handling of authorities
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If a form number is assigned and the form is aborted manually or by the system (client disconnect, transmit rule fail, exception) , the abort is sent to CDLS

Note:
Applies to: TOP,WT,PT,RTCP

* Not all of the cleanup paths require CDLS logging. This is why CDLS logging is done on the transitions to the abort

* In the end all transitions cleanup or abort to abort end nodes in workflows should not CDLS log.
* In the abort path of the workflow (can be in the sub workflow) there should be a conditional that says, no matter why the form failed, if the form has a form number a CDLS log is generated. If the form does not have a form number, a CDLS log is not generated.

Subject: Change stacks to be configurable via IDUGG files
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Note:
* CN wants the configuration to be done via idugg
** the size of the stack should be a static info (one per type)
** whether or not a track has stacks is linked via B3

Show that:
* Parking spots, Addressee fields and train id fields can be configured via IDUGG
* When the PI is loaded, the initial catalog is created, based on the B3 linkage of tracks
** if a track has on the b3 an ADT, it has an addressee field
** if a track has on the b3 a ZWD, it has a train id field
** if a track has on the b3 a PSD, it has a parking spot field
* Stack sizes are configured via IDUGG as static infos (one per typ)
* On info changes that affect the stack sizes, the stacks are updated
* On start-up (PC), all stacks are reset before they are filled
* On activation, the stacks are recalculated and resent, if needed
* Change database manual

Subject: Change ItemRel to be TA rather than norm-element and nimset
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The bq file for itemrel contains the TA names
* The new bq file can be ran in and fills itemrel correctly
* Crossover switches are working correctly
* Crossovers in Planets are marked as crossovers

Subject: Periodic Integrity Check on Passive REF (from cache)
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show That:
* There is an option in the ref diagnostic script to run a integrity check on the passive COM
** The option should not run the diagnostics if the COM that the script is ran on is not passive and/or down (SB complete)
* If a form gets corrupted on the passive com there is a periodic integrity monitor that runs and will identify the corrupt form
* The script is run every 10 min
* When a form is logged as corrupt on the standby COM, the form is locked when the system fails over and the standby COM goes PC complete
QL:392
* If a form is corrupt or missing on the passive com:
** A message identifying the corrupt form is written to the tech summary [optional]
** A message identifying the corrupt or missing form is written to the console log of the active COM

Note:
* CN agreed that this can be done via a script and a cron job

Subject: [Change Request] New Train Dialog should validate train id length
Author: Will Martin
Description:
QL:413

Show That:
* When creating a new train
** If the train ID field has less than 4 chars in it
*** A status line or pop-up (whatever is easier) is shown that says when button pressed save "Train Id must be at least 4 characters."
** If the train ID field has 4 or more chars in it the form can be saved if the rest of the validation passes.

Subject: Send Train OS's to SRS
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* Os reports on KPs and Switches are forwarded to SRS
* Os reports that are not on KPs and Switches are not forwarded to SRS

Subject: Remove pop-up boxes on new train abort
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a manual train creation is aborted in the new train dialog there is no "train id required" error pop-up

Note:
This applies to all train creation dialogs (En,Fr)

Subject: Fix sorting of restrictions
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Restrictions are sorted
** First by occurrence (topologically)
** Then by Type (PT,then WT, then TOP)
** Then by issue date if restriction is not combined or by addressee if restriction is combined (Conflicting withs or PA of WTs for WTs)

Subject: Investigate Active MQ slow downs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Things to do:
* Install / Create tools to check content of advisory topics
* Analyse Active MQ behavior / memory consumption etc.
* Verify / Update ActiveMQ config file
* Update to newer ActiveMQ version (pick version based on bugs / change log of version)
* Document actions taken, things to do / look out for etc.

Subject: [Change Request] OS Report should not allow hundredths of a mile.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* The user can no longer enter decimal milage on the OS Report Form.
* The milage on the OS report form works the same way as whole miles on other forms.
* The user cannot OS report a block that does not contain a whole mile
* The status line hint shows only the valid whole mile range in the OS report
* If a mileage is entered into the OS report, all PTs that are rolled up by this OS report show the new mileage as their start mileage on the TLD
* CLDS logging does not show .00 if the user entered mileage

QL:360 Are os report mileages need on the TLD? If so, how should it work?
Follow up: So tracks that don't cross a whole mile cannot be selected for OS reports?

A:The desired behavior is: Only allow whole mileage in OS reports. If mileage is entered, show mileage on TLD. If KP/Switch was selected, don't show mileage.

Subject: Verify heap migration functionality
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The following AC apply to TOPs/XTOPs, RTCPs, WTs and PTs
* Forms can be export via the heap migration script while the system is up or down
* Forms can be re-imported from XML only if the system is down
* Forms that have not been modified are not locked when the system is started
* Forms that have been modified lock when the system is started
* The system starts up after heap-migration and goes PC complete
* The system starts up, even if the underlying form classes have been modified between when they were exported and re-imported (to some extend)

* There is documentation about heap migration, including
** Where it is
** How it is used
** When it should be used

Subject: [NewMissed] Make weather alert pop up for when authority is executed for creation and weather alert exists in territory
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Weather alert (from wawa) is territory wide.

Might only involve enabling it in CIA for forms.

Show that:
* When a weather alert exists
** If any items of the form are in a subdivision and within the mileage of active warning or If a form is adjacent to an STK, which has an active warning
*** A query pops up on validate limits
*** The query shows the warning text (wwarn)
*** No query shows up on execute (CIA), transmit, place etc.

Note: Check for wawa simulator

Subject: Show start/end limits on RTCP form validation results
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Currently validation errors/queries are identified on the RTCP forms based on row numbers. We must show the start and end limits to identify limits that failed validation errors instead.

Show That:
* When  an RTCP form is created and the initial validate limits fails, or limits fail validation after limits are added:
** The row number of the limit that failed is no longer shown
** The start and end limits of the limit that failed validation are shown in the popup

Subject: after COM INITSOS forms are not displayed on Form Summary Display
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
preconditions:
1. overview screens are open
2. territory controlled
3. form summary open

steps
1. stopsos coms
2. initsos coms

actual result: 
* no forms are displayed on form summary

expected result: 
* forms should reappear on form summary

Subject: Locked forms do not block operations on overlapping forms
Author: Will Martin
Description:
h2. Forms can be cancelled and modified:

Setup:
* Place a TOP over some limits
* Place a TOP that overlaps the first TOP
* Lock the first TOP
* Attempt to modify or cancel the second TOP

Expected:
* The form cannot be modified or cancelled because it overlaps a locked form

Actual:
* The form can be modified or cancelled

h2. Forms can be rolled up/fulfilled

Setup:
* Place a Top
* Place a PT over the Top
* Place a second PT within the same subdivision, same addressee, same direction after the first PT
* Lock the Top
* Attempt to roll up the second PT

Expected:
* The first PT is not shown as a form that will be fulfilled or rolled up by the os report because it overlaps a locked form

Actual:
* The first PT is shown as a form that will be fulfilled or rolled up by the os report

Subject: Switch positions are drawn incorrectly when placing forms
Author: Nicholas Tolrud
Description:
Currently when we protect items in the system we protect them in the direction of the form. This changes the global figures in the middle of the switches to show normal or reverse based on which direction the form is taking the switch, not based on what position the switch is actual in. The global figures at the center of each switch must always show what position the switch is regardless of what forms are currently protecting/blocking the switches.


Setup:
* When a switch is in normal
** Place any form (TOP, XTOP, WT, PT, RTCP) over the reverse of the switch
* When a switch is in reverse
** Place any form (TOP, XTOP, WT, PT, RTCP) over the normal of the switch

Expected:
* After transmit the global figure at the center of the switch shows the position of the switch

Actual:
* After transmit the global figure at the center of the switch shows the position that the switch would be in if it was in the direction of the form

Subject: SwitchReport does not log addressee to CDLS
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
The addressee should be a part of the switch report cdls logging on both the complete and abort cases: a) Setup: * Execute and complete a switch report with a manually entered addressee Expected: * The CDLS logging contains the addressee Actual: * The CDLS logging does not contain the addressee b) Setup: * Execute and complete a switch report with a selected addressee Expected: * The CDLS logging contains the addressee Actual: * The CDLS logging does not contain the addressee c) Setup: * Execute and abort a switch report with a manually entered addressee Expected: * The CDLS logging contains the addressee Actual: * The CDLS logging does not contain the addressee d) Setup: * Execute and abort a switch report with a selected addressee Expected: * The CDLS logging contains the addressee Actual: * The CDLS logging does not contain the addressee Note: 
Switch Report - States: Completed, Aborted.

	CN RTC2 Authority Log Begin 
Switch Report: 09/17/14 10:20:00 10:20 412 CN 8801 Sdg E Swt MAYMOUNT   NORMAL
         CN RTC2 Authority Log End

Switch Report - States: Complété à, Abandonné.

	CN RTC2 Authority Log Begin 
Rapport d?aiguillage: 09/17/14 10:20:00 10:20   412 CN 8801 Aig E Voie évit MAYMOUNT   NORMAL
         CN RTC2 Authority Log End

* Place a train on parking spot in Austin
** (4)CAPI (1)AUST (7)TS01 (701)TRA
* Place a proceed train from Austin to Berlin
** (4)CAPI (1)AUST (6)STN (756)KnownPnt to (4)CAPI (2)BERL (5)STN (756)KnownPnt
* Place an RTPC at clevland
** (4)CAPI (4)CVLD (5)STN (756)KnownPnt

* A dialog pops up that says "Insufficient devices in the limits
