Subject: When superseding a PT only active permissions should be copied
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a PT is superseded, only switches with active permissions (blocked by the PT, not rolled up yet) are copied to the new PT
* When a PT is superseded into a WT, using supersede type, only switches with active permissions (blocked by the PT, not rolled up yet) are copied to the new WT

Subject: Suspension of Train in Train Record
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When a train is deleted from the parking spot, don't suspend the train 
** if it has an active form

* When a train is deleted from the parking spot, suspend the train
** if the train has no active form

* Make sure that the train is not suspended if the addressee is changed and the train is deleted from the parking spot

Subject: [Change Request] New info to disallow TOPs on Sidings
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* An info is present in the database that can be used to prevent TOPs from being placed on a siding.
* When the info is false, all previous siding rules apply to TOPS (TOPs can start/end/exist completely in a siding)
* When the info is set on a siding track
** A TOP cannot be placed within the siding
** A TOP cannot start or end on the siding

QL:428 We are putting a static info in the database to disallow TOPs from being placed in a siding. This info would not allow a TOP to start/end, or be contained within a siding track. Is this correct?

A: This will be a new info to not allow TOPS or XTOPs to be placed on a siding in any way (start, end, exist in)

Subject: [Change Request] Display switches in authority path position, not current position
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If a form takes a switch normal
** the normal path of the switch shows "blocked" (green,blue etc.)
** the reverse leg is shown light grey (to indicate that the switch is in reverse position), if the switch is in reverse
* If a form takes a switch reverse
** the reverse path of the switch shows "blocked"
** the normal leg is shown light grey (to indicate that the switch is in normal position), if the switch is in normal
* Switches that are at the end of the limits and the branch of the switch connects to an item in the limits (eg crossover switches) will be blocked along the reverse path
* Switches that are part of limits that were selected to determine the position of the end switch (eg when the user selects a siding track and the system automatically truncates it) are blocked based on the selection.
* Switches at the end of authorities where the desired position of the switch cannot be determined will be colored along the position of the switch.
* There are infos on switches for all forms that have distinct coloring for every part of the switch (tongue, normal, reverse)
* Overlapping forms show correctly on switches (as shown in OCS_2.doc)

Examples of switch colorings can be found in the CN RTC2 OCS files section in the switches in OCS_2.doc document

Subject: Show comments entered in OS Report or Train Record in TGI
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* There is a section on the TGI auth dialog called comments
* The section is shown on PTs and WTs
* All comments (entered in OS report or directly in TRD) belonging to the train id are shown in the comments section

Subject: Remove direction fields from the train record form
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Preconditions:
* Put a train into the system
* Put a PT form down
* Os Report the form

Show That:
* When the train record is opened for a train:
** The direction column is not shown on the location table
** The direction column is not shown on the os report table

Note:
* This applies to En/Fr, Chief, Tech etc.

Subject: Default action on Parking Spots
Author: Will Martin
Description:
QL:411

Show That:
* If a Parking spot id field is selected and executed (no button selected)
** The status line shows all data that is also shown on the PT id field, except
*** No OS information is shown
* "Scrolling" through the id field is identical to the PT id field scrolling (e.g. 1 of 3 SRS 12345678 ENG CNOC1234 L=4)

Subject: [NewMissed] Add ShowMile capability to Known Points
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* There is a ShowMile info on known points
* There are KPs in the DB configured as ShowMile
* If the KP is marked as ShowMile, it shows the mileage and the sub/spur (B1-Text), e.g. Mile 15.3 Something Sub
** The mileage shows on all form displays, printing etc.
** TGI x axis shows KPs correctly when shown as mile
** When known points are shown in via instructions.
Note:
* The KP ShowMile behavior is identical to the Switch ShowMile behavior

Subject: Via Instructions should not generate instructions for end limit known points
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Currently the via instruction is generated for known points that are marked with the via instructions info if the known point is the start limit item, end limit item, or an intermedeate known point. The Question Log 365 states that the via instructions based on known points should only be generated for intermediate or start limit known points. No via instructions should be generated as a result of the end item.

Show That:
* When generating a TOP, XTOP, PT, or WT:
** If the form starts on a known point with the via instructions info set, instructions are generated
** If there is a known point in the middle of the limits on the form with the via instructions static info set, instructions are generated
** If the form ends on a known point with the via instructions info set, instructions are not generated

Subject: The "Please Acknowleged Query" dialogs currently have an "Abort" button and this should be "Ok" button.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Steps
1. in Trackline select the "View" button
2. select a track that is not under any authority and execute
Actual Result
1. a Please ack query dialog comes up, with an "Abort" button
Expected Result
1. a Please ack query dialog comes up, with an "Ok" button

Subject: Limit the number of characters allowed in each and every editable form text field
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
* Look at SRS
* Limiting addressee, instructions, reason (RTCP), track
* Follow behind location?

SRS.914
The system shall allow up to 20 characters to be entered into an addressee field on an authority form. This includes foreman and train addressees.

SRS.915
The system shall allow up to 75 characters to be entered into an instructions field on an authority form. This includes instructions fields in the Call RTC box, work limits box, and proceed limits box.

SRS.917
The system shall allow up to 120 characters to be entered into the track field of a user added Protect Against.
[CA7APX.58]


Current CTC values:

* TOP/XTOP
** Foreman - 20 characters
** Limit Track - 120 characters
** Limit Instructions - 70 characters
** Call RTC Time - 5 characters
** Call RTC Instructions - 70 characters
* Work Train
** Limit Instructions - 70 characters
** Protect Against Addressee - 20 characters
** Protect Against Track - 120 characters
** Call RTC Time - 5 characters
** Call RTC Instructions - 70 characters
* Pass Stop _(not used in ocs)_
** 3 Track - 40 characters
** 3 Switches - 60 characters
** 3 Instructions - 160 characters
** Call RTC Time - 5 characters
** Call RTC Instructions - 70 characters
* Enter Main Track _(not used in ocs)_
** Addressee - 20 characters
** 17 Authorized to Enter - 40 characters
** 17 Track - 60 characters
** Call RTC Time - 5 characters
** Call RTC Instructions - 70 characters

* RTCP
** Reason - 120 characters (verify on CTC)

Show that:
* All input fields on all forms have a max character restriction
* The max character restrictions follows the numbers above
* All allowed characters are archived correctly
* If the current size of the input field is not big enough, the field should be changed to multi-line
* Words are wrapped into the next line, if they don't fit in the previous line (if the char limit is not reached).
* If a word cannot be wrapped, the word is character wrapped

Note:
* If the character limits described here are higher than what the oracle tables allow (or messages), ask Will,Jim or Peter whether to lower the character limit or increase the table/message etc.

Subject: RTCP forms show mileage on multiple limits.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Steps:
* Control all territories
* Begin placing an RTCP form over (3)OCST (4)DAR (2)M1TK (701)TRA
* Fill out the reason
* Press Add Limits Button
* Select limits on (3)OCST (10)JESS (2)M1TK (701)TRA
* Put a mileage on the start limit of the first limit
* Press the validate limits button
* Press the Place Button

Expected:
* The limits are colored light blue
* The reason shows up under both limits
* The mileage only shows up under the first limit

Actual:
* The limits are colored light blue
* The reason shows up under both limits
* The mileage shows up under both limits

Subject: Switch Report does not include Control Point name
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
Setup:
* select switch report function and select switch execute
* form is open 

Expected 
* form is filled out with correct switch B2 Text and B3 Text

Actual:
* form is filled out with B3 Text only

Subject: Differentiate between RTCP P and R in all summary and listings
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* RTCPs are listed as either in RTCP-R or RTCP-P in
** Authority summary
** Authority info form
** Selection dialog
** GenSum
** App logging
** Printing
** Notifications
** CDLS
** Archive

Subject: Show Restrictions on the TGI Authority View
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* There are two new authrestriction types, one for switch warnings and one for switch permissions in the archive
* When switch warnings are archived they are archived as the new switch warning type
* When switch permissions are archived they are archived as the new switch permission type
** Switch warnings and permissions are no longer archived as unknown restrictions

* The following applies to the TGIs authority view for work trains and proceed trains:
** There is a new section under the protect against section that shows the switch warnings (not the switch permissions)
** The switches will be shown as B1Text B2Text B3Text. Note this is text not name
** The new section looks as follows:

|Switch Warnings|Canceled At|
|B1Text B2Text B3Text|      |
|B1Text B2Text B3Text|Date  |

* Check out how the following look in the TGI authority view
** Conflicting withs
-** After Restrictions-
** Protect Againsts
*** PT on PT
*** PT on TOP
*** PT on WT
*** WT on WT
*** WT on TOP

* Follow Behinds and After restrictions are filter out from the authority view
-** Follow Behinds-

Subject: Fix territory transfer report
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The TTR contains the list of active trains (not suspended or retired) of the transferred territories
* The TTR contains all active authorities of the transferred territories
** RTCP forms show all limits, even limits of the form that are not affected by the territory transfer
** PTs start limits reflect the last OS reported location (like the authority summary)
* Weather alerts of the transferred territories show correctly in the TTR
* Don't allow to transfer territory before REF is fully ignited

NOTE:
RTCP forms do not show up at all right now in the TTR

Subject: Provide Bilingual RTCP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The form is in the language of the first item of the original limits of the form
* The form is multi lingual if the first item of the original limits are multi-lingual
* If the form is multi-lingual
** The RTCP form shows the change language button which can be used to toggle the language of the form

* If the form is not multi-lingual
** The RTCP form does not show the change language button.

* The language of the form, or multi-linguality of the form are not changed as a result of adding, removing or shortening limits.

* If the form is invalid (components on the view have a red background), the change language button is disabled (if shown)
** When all data is entered on the form (all view components are valid), the change language button is enabled (if shown)

* Logging, archiving etc. is in the form language
* Queries, Pop-ups etc. are in the user language
* Superseding the form retains the original language and does not allow changing

Subject: [NoChangeRequest] Train Record ? Extend TRNAPP to include subdivision
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Message format:
S2TR 00:50:06 TRNAPP,S7055101,-,BISSELL,040000,MT,Y,20150602,W,0503,0593

Show that:
* The messages into trap (from SRS) contains two additional fields (two subdivision ids at the end of the TRNAPP message, first is current, second is next)
* We have parking spots in the test DB that have the same name
* The train is inserted in the correct parking spot, based on the parking spot name, direction and both subdivision
* -The edit train dialog displays parking spots with the same name and differentiates them by subs)-
* The SRS simulator is extended to support the additional subs

Note:
* There is a tool that generates the SQL queries to fill the parking spot tables; This tool either has to be modified or deleted. 
* There is also a .dat file (partly generated by the tool) that needs to be modified (either manually or via the tool)

Subject: [Change Request] Form operations should be protected until form completion.
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show That:

*When creating a new form*

* When a form is created protection and flashing is laid down over the limits of the form
* When form is shortened, the flashing and protection is updated to reflect the new limits of the form
* After transmit
** Flashing is removed
** Protection stays on the items

* When the form goes to unacked state:
** Protection is removed from the items

* On Abort
** Protection is removed from all items of form
** All flashing that is currently over the limits of the form is removed.

-*On completion of an existing form*-

* -When the user attempts to complete an unacknowledged form from the form summary display.-
** -All limits of the form are flashed-
** -All limits of the form are protected-

** -On any abort-
*** -All protection is removed-
*** -All flashing is removed-

** -On completion of the form-
*** -All protection is removed-
*** -All flashing is removed-

Note: Not completion, but until form is unacked

Subject: Add start item validation on validate limits
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* While a form is created/superseded
* When validate limits is pressed if the start limit of the form is outside of the users controlled territory
** A validation failure is shown
** This can be produced by starting a form on a known point that borders 2 territories and the form is shortened into a territory that is not controlled by the dispatcher.
** This rule should be applied to TOP, XTOP, WT, PT, and all limits of RTCP

NOTE:
* This rule must be run on create and validate, not on transmit, verify the form validate case with tests.

Subject: Archive RTCPs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When an RTCP is placed in the system, the form shows up in the oracle tables
* When an RTCP is canceled from the system, the form shows up in the oracle tables
* When an RTCP is superseded, both old and new forms show up in the oracle tables
* When an RTCP is placed in the system the RTCP shows up in the TGI
* When an RTCP is canceled, the forms end time stops advancing on the TGI.
* Archived RTCPs have either the state issued (when completed) or cancelled (when cancelled or superseded).

Note: Limits are archived in AUTHSEGMENTs. Each limit that spans multiple subs needs to be split into multiple segments (one segment per sub)

Subject: Don't allow forms over limits that contain forms in superseded state
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* No forms can be placed over forms in superseded state
* No forms overlapping the form in superseded state can be operated on, except for they can be viewed and the superseding form can be completed
** This includes rolling up/fulfilling forms that were not initially selected in the OS report.

Note:
* This includes all forms, including switch and os reports

Subject: Printing the TGI
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* When the user is viewing forms and or trains on the TGI there is a print button on the TGI
* When the user presses the print button the print preview comes up and the system print dialog comes up
* When the user hits OK on the print dialog the TGI prints
* On the printout
** All trains/forms that are on the TGI print
** The printout prints what is shown on the TGI at the zoom level that the TGI is currently showing.

Subject: Add find mouse functionality to workstation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a key-combination on the keyboard is pressed
** A big icon shows in the middle of the BSD screen (if known) -for 2 seconds- (in place of the normal mouse cursor)
** [Optional] Move mouse icon to middle of the screen 
* The script responsible has to be installed with the workstation install
* Update the installation manual if needed
* Update the user manual if needed

Note: 
* Check key configuration on CTC system

Subject: Don't allow multiple PAs for the same foreman on the same authority
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* One form can only have one PA for the same foreman
** This includes manual restrictions and system generated restrictions
** TOP over TOPs still combines restrictions (CW) for the same foreman

Subject: Match created train w/ existing SRS ID/train record
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When a new train is created via the New Train dialog
** If a train with the entered SRS id exist and it is suspended, the train is unsuspended and moved to the new location
** If a train with the entered SRS id exist and is not suspended, the train creation is rejected (with popup)

Subject: Customize TGI Proceed Train Authority details display
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show That:

* When a PT line on the TGI is clicked, authority details are shown in a pop-up (similar to other authority displays on the TGI in CTC). Use RTC2 CTC user manual
* This form should show the limits as B1Name, B2Name, B3Name
* +The Start time should be the completed time of the PT form+
* +If the form is canceled the cancel time should show on the end time+
* +If the form is superceded the completed time of the superseding form should show on the end time+
* +If the form is fulfilled the OS time should show on the end time+

Example of authority report for TOP
!authReport.png!

After the fact:

QL:419 When we click on a PT form from the TGI we get the authority contents dialog. We were planning on just showing what limits of the original PT form. An OS report will not change these values. Is this correct?

A: Yes, Showing the original limits is correct

Subject: Train form create uses SRS id + Lead Engine initials + Lead Engine number
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a PT or WT is created and a train from the Parking spot is selected
** The addressee is generated, based on the 2nd,3rd and 4th SRS id characters + Lead Engine initials + Lead Engine number (e.g. 234CNOC1234)
* The Lead Engine Initials and Lead Engine Number are optional.
** If one or both of them do not exist they are left off of the addressee.
* When PTs/WTs are created from the PT/WT id fields, the addressee is copied from the original form

* +When the SRS id has less than 4 chars, do not pull the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th char. Use the entire SRS id+

Subject: Add handling of mileages on TGI authority view.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
QL:394, QL:407, QL:425

The following pertains to the authority reports as viewed from the TGI (TOP, XTOP, PT, WT, RTCP)

Show That:

* When a form is created over limits that do not include mileage entries.
** The start and end limits show up in the segment section of the train graph authority form
** The format is B1Name/B2Name/B3Name
*** -This should instead say B1Text/B2Text/B3Text-

* When a form is created that has mileage entered as the start limit, end limit, or both:
** The start limit, end limit, or both display the B1 name and the mileage of the limit.
** The format is B1Name/mileage

* When a form is created that has manual restrictions that do not have mileages in the limits:
** The start and end limits show up in the protect against section of the train graph authority form
** The format is B1Name B2Name B3Name
*** -This should instead say B1Text B2Text B3Text-

* When a form is created that has manual restrictions that has mileage entered as the start limit, end limit or both:
** The start limit, end limit, or both display the B1 name and the mileage of the limit.
** The format is B1Name mileage

Subject: Allow superseding forms addressees to be editable
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Applies to TOP, XTOP, WT, and PT
* When a valid form is superseded it shows up with a pre-populated addressee (addressee of form that is being superseded)
* The addressee field is editable
* When the form is validated and transmitted it uses the addressee that is in the field for validation
* The correct addressee shows in all loggings (GenSum, CDLS) and in the archive

Subject: Allow TOPs over and adjacent to RTCP-Rs
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Placing TOPs/XTOPs adjacent to STKs that have an RTCP-R results in a query (not a failure)
* Placing TOPs/XTOPs over RTCP-R results in a query (not a failure)
* Train forms that overlap RTCP-Rs or are adjacent to STKs with RTCP-Rs should be rejected 
* Train forms that overlap RTCP-Ps or are adjacent to STKs with RTCP-Ps should query

Subject: TGI should show retired trains
Author: Will Martin
Description:
QL:414

Show That:
* The TGI can always be opened
* Any subdivision can be viewed at anytime
* When there is only retired trains
** The PT forms for the retired trains can still be viewed
** PTs are still drawn the same whether they are for active or retired trains

Subject: Authority summary shows all subdivisions if form spans multiple
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Create a form that spans multiple subdivisions

Current behavior:
* The authority summary shows all subdivisions

Expected behavior:
* The summary shows the subdivision of the start item

Subject: REF diagnostic tool prints entire script if wrong parameters were enterd
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The ref-diagnostic script does not print it's content if the options are not used correctly (meaning, fix the script)
* If wrong/incomplete parameters are passed in, the script prints the help

Note:
This is the in /param/tsbase/ocs.us/scripts/ref-forms-check.sh

Subject: TOPs that follow behind a PT should not be considered diverging on end switch
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Steps:
* Create (and complete) a PT from (3)OCST (11)JESS2 (12)SG651 (756)KnownPnt to (3)OCST (10)JESS (7)SIDING (701)TRA
* Try creating a TOP overlapping the PT (by selecting (3)OCST (11)JESS2 (1)A3T (701)TRA)

Current behavior:
* The TOP is rejected because it is considered diverging from the path of the PT

Expected behavior:
* The TOP is allowed

Note:
* The end switches should not be considered for the divergence check
* Currently the entire logic of this drools rule is in java. This bug should refactor that logic to be in drools.

Subject: Flashing is not removed from switches after OS Report
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Setup:
* Put a train in the system.
* Place a PT from OCST (3) KENN (12) SW1 (6) SWI (703) to OCST (3) ABE (16) STN (2) KnownPnt (19)
* OS report the PT at OCST (3) AUR (13) ESW (1) SWI (703)
* Click on the switch report button
* Click on an item eg. OCST (3) HARR (8) ESW (1) SWI (703)
* Hit the escape key

Expected:
* Only the switch reported switch flashed when selected
* Flashing disappeared from the trackline after Escape was pressed.

Actual:
* All OSed switches flashed as well as switch reported switch
* After escape was pressed the switch reported switch flashing was removed and 3 OSed switches are still flashing

Subject: PT limits into siding goes to the far switch
Author: Will Martin
Description:
A Proceed Train that is routed into a siding should show the switch that enters the siding as the exit limit of the form. Currently the exit switch to the siding (far switch) is shown as the exit limit to the form.

Setup:
* Put a train on a parking spot so it is selectable from the track line display
* Select the proceed trian button
* Select the train from the track line
* Select the start limit for the form OCST (3) JESS2 (11) A3T (1) TRA (701)
* Select the exit limit for the form OCST (3) JESS (10) SIDING (7) TRA (701)
* Execute
* The form comes up showing the exit limit of the form as "Siding West Switch at JESSICA"
* Press the validate limits button

Expected:
* The form continues to show the exit limit as "Siding West Switch at JESSICA"

Actual:
* The form shows exit limit as "Siding East Switch at JESSICA"

Setup:
* Complete the form
* Perform an OS Report anywhere from the entrance switch to the exit switch of the siding

Expected:
* The form is a candidate for fulfill

Actual:
* The form is a candidate for rollup on all siding items except for the exit switch of the siding (far switch)

Subject: Supersede of an authority entirely outside my controlled territory is allowed.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
*preconditions*
1. completed authority exists outside my controlled territory

*steps*
1. select supersede fucntion
2. select start limit in my controlled territory
3. select end limit to overlap non-controlled authority and end in non-controlled territory
4. execute
*expected result*: the request should be rejected
*actual result*: the form is displayed in supersede mode, the system allows you to continue the function.

Notes:
The failure result reads: Form is not in controlled territory
The rule is run on supersede, create, and validate limits. This is analogous to #10572

Subject: Superseding forms should re-use manual protect againsts that were used on the previous forms.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Bug against #10032

*Work Train over Proceed Train*
Setup:
* Place a Proceed Train over some limits with a manual protect against for a Work Train
* Place a Work Train over the limits encompassed by the manual protect against on the Proceed Train
* Supersede the Work Train in a way that the new limits are encompassed by the manual protect against on the Proceed Train

Expected:
* The Superseding Work Train uses the protect against that was previously used by the Superseded Work Train.

Actual:
* A validation error is thrown stating "Cannot overlap a PT that does not have an available matching manual protect against"

*TOP over Proceed Train*
Setup:
* Place a Proceed Train over some limits with a manual protect against for a TOP
* Place a TOP over the limits encompassed by the manual protect against on the Proceed Train
* Supersede the TOP in a way that the new limits are encompassed by the manual protect against on the Proceed Train

Expected:
* The Superseding TOP uses the protect against that was previously used by the Superseded TOP.

Actual:
* A validation error is thrown stating "Limits must use the available protect against on authority XX"

*Work Train over Work Train*
Setup:
* Place the first Work Train over some limits with a manual protect against for second Work Train
* Place the second Work Train over the limits encompassed by the manual protect against on the first Work Train
* Supersede the second Work Train in a way that the new limits are encompassed by the manual protect against on the first Work Train

Expected:
* The Superseding Work Train uses the protect against that was previously used by the Superseded Work Train.

Actual:
* The superseding Work Train generates a new protect against for the first work train


*TOP over Work Train*
Setup:
* Place a Work Train over some limits with a manual protect against for a TOP
* Place a TOP over the limits encompassed by the manual protect against on the Work Train
* Supersede the TOP in a way that the new limits are encompassed by the manual protect against on the Work Train

Expected:
* The Superseding TOP uses the protect against that was previously used by the Superseded TOP.

Actual:
* A validation error is thrown stating "Cannot overlap a WT that does not have an available matching manual protect against"

Subject: Change language on authority forms wears off after validate limits.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
This bug shows itself on the TOP, PT, and WT forms.
Setup:
* Place a TOP, PT, or WT form on the trackline in a bi-lingual territory
* Make the form ui state valid (For PT/WT skip this step, for TOP fill in an addressee)
* Press the change language button
* When the form comes back in another language, press the validate limits button

Expected:
* The form comes back after being validated and displays in the language it was in immediately before the validate limits button was pressed.

Actual:
* The form comes back after being validated and displays in the original language that was shown before the change language button was pressed.

Subject: [NewMissed] Add supersede between PT/WT and TOP/XTOP
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
There a supersede other button that allows the following supersedes:

PT<->WT
TOP<->XTOP

Show that:
* There is a Supersede Other button (Sup Type and FR:Sup Type)
** French button will be changed in the database by CN later
* A supersede other operation can be initiated by selecting the Sup Oth button and valid limits
* The supersede other selection is identical to the normal supersede operation, except for the different button
* The supersede logging is identical to the normal supersede, except for that the CIA logging (GenSum) says supersede other
* The abort of the supersede other is identical to the normal supersede 
* The completion of the supersede other is identical to the normal supersede
* If a PT is selected for a supersede other operation, the new form that supersedes the PT form is a WT form
* If a WT is selected for a supersede other operation, the new form that supersedes the WT form is a PT form
* If a TOP is selected for a supersede other operation, the new form that supersedes the TOP form is a XTOP form
* If a XTOP is selected for a supersede other operation, the new form that supersedes the XTOP form is a TOP form
* On validate limits, the supersede rules for the new form type is ran
* If a form is selected for supersede other, that does not support it (RTCPs), an error dialog shows
* -The addressee / train is prepopulated but can be modified-

Subject: [NewMissed] Default action on PT Train ID
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show train data + OS in status line (currently done in CIA w/o OS).
Might need to be done in ADS/REF etc.

Format:
X of Y SRS XXXXX ENG Init#### OS=Loc T=Time L=Length
E.g.:
1 of 3 SRS 12345678 ENG CNOC1234 OS=Jess T=16:30 L=4
or SRS 12345678 (If engine initials etc. is not known)

Show that:
* If a PT id field is selected and executed (no button selected)
** the following train data is shown
*** SRS id, lead engine initials and id, last os location, os time and train length
*** the data is displayed in the TLD status line
* If the selected PT field contains multiple trains
** the train information is prepended with X of Y, X being the current train and Y the amount of trains in the field
** X increases with every execution until Y is reached, meaning that information of the next train in the stack entry is shown
** The index of the "current viewed train" is not modified, if a train is added to that field or removed from the field
*** Examples: current 2 of 3, a train is deleted, next execution will show 1 of 2.
*** Examples: current 2 of 4, a train is deleted, next execution will show 3 of 3.
* The "index" (x) is reset when a different field is selected
* This status line shows up on the statusbar of all track lines.
Note: Check time format and check location

Subject: Supercede
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
- Retain Devices/limits
- Allow adding/removing of limits
- Allow new reason

Show that:
* RTCPs can be superseded via the normal supersede button
* During the RTCP supersede init, -a reason or- a device or a reason and a device can be selected, bef

Subject: [NoChangeRequest] Add handling for GO trains
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Place GO trains automatically into parking spots based 
   on GO trains loaded
--- Trains are placed a configurable amount of time before 
      they are scheduled

Schedule loading scripts are in /home/s/sys/trd (e.g. Load_Weekday_Schedule)

Sho

Subject: Draw dots for PTs at subdivision boundaries
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* -Proceed trains are archived in segments-
* Only legitimate OS reports (OS reports shown before this story was completed) are shown on train record
* If the PT goes through the subdivision without starting or ending in the subdivision:
** There is a start dot at the time of the OS Report when the PT enters a subdivision
** There is an end dot at the time of the OS Report when the PT exits the subdivision
** Both dots are connected by a line
** No dots are connected if the dots belong to different segments
** This should work when
*** There are no OS reports in the subdivision and the PT form is OSed in a later subdivision
*** If a proceed train goes into a subdivision, out of the subdivision, then re-enters the subdivision

Subject: Don't allow any forms over locked forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
When a form is locked, no other form should be allowed to be placed overlapping the locked form.
(The only exceptions are RTCPs).

Show that:
* TOPs, XTOPs, PTs, WTs cannot be placed over locked forms (checked on validate and transmit)
* TOPs, XTOPs, PTs and WTs cannot be superseded if the old or the new limits overlap a locked form
* The failure messages contain that the form cannot overlap the locked form, even for XTOP over TOP/PT/WT etc.
* Switch positions cannot be reported on switches that have locked forms
* OS reports cannot roll-up/fulfill locked forms

Subject: Cancel
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* RTCPs can be cancelled from the authority summary and the TLD, if any item of any limit is controlled by the workstation
* When the form opens for cancel
** the cancel box is generated and shown
** all limits belonging to the RTCP are flashing and are protected
* On Cancel
** -The form is archived-
** +When the form is canceled REF sends the Archive Message out, The actual archive part will be done in #10765+
** The cancellation is logged to GenSum and CDLS
** All limits stop flashing, are unprotected and unblocked
** Form is removed from the system and will no longer show up in the FSD
* When the cancellation is aborted
** All limits stop flashing and are unprotected

QL:432 On the RTCP form when should the removed at date be generated? When the user views the last screen in the remove form workflow? Or after the user hits the remove button.

A: It is fine to fill in the removed at date when the form shows up for removal.

Subject: View
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* RTCPs can be viewed from the TLD and the Authority Summary
* While being viewed, all limits belonging to that RTC flash locally
* The RTCP that is being viewed contains the "placed at and rtc initials" box in addition to the boxes that are visible during create/supersede
** !rtcp_placed_at_box.png!
* Viewing logs to GenSum
* Viewing can be aborted
* Printing is not expected to be working with this story
* Locked RTCPs can be unlocked from viewing (if the user has the correct access right; Chiefs, Techs and Admins)
* RTCPs are not allowed to be retransmitted (there is no Retransmit button )

Subject: Print RTCP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When viewing an RTCP form, there is a print button
* When the print button is pressed, dialog pops up with:
** modality to the viewed form
** printer dropdown containing all printers set up on the MMI.
** number of copies: defaults to 1
** OK/Print button
*** Should only be enabled if a printer is selected AND
*** The number of copies is a number > 0
** Cancel button (always enabled)
* Selecting "OK" on print dialog sends to the printer and prints the selected number of copies
* Selecting "Cancel" aborts and closes the dialog
* The printout has:
** Boxes can be split between pages if they start on a page but will not fit.
** Uses language of the issued form
** All boxes that the viewed form has, but no more
** All fields are underlined (it should already be doing something like this in the printouts).
** boxes show in the correct/same order as view.
* Printing is logged to general summary
** Just log the form that is being printed

QL:383
* The permissive/restrictive label is printed on its own line in place of the permissive/restrictive toggle.
* Limits are printed out on their own lines on the form (not as a table)
* No empty rows in the table are printed (the printout can grow and shrink depending on how many limits are on the RTCP form)

Subject: Validate limits button should be mandatory after change restriction type.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:

* Place a Proceed train or Work train on the track line
* Click on the validate limits button
* Click on the add restriction button
* Add the manual restriction to the form
* Change the restriction type
* Click on validate limits (after filling in the addressee if necessary)
* The form should now show the on field correctly
* Change the type of restriction again (the on field is incorrect for the state)

(Note on a main line a train manual restriction will not show the on field, on forman restrictions the on field will show)

Expected:

* You have to validate limits again to correct the manual restrictions view state before transmitting the form

Actual

* You can transmit the form before seeing what the form will look like on transmit.

Subject: [NewMissed] Fix data activation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Static infos that have changed
- Infos that belong to a newly added item

Find out whether static info changes are in transact or propagated via messages.
Force activation might need to retrigger a GI.

Show that:
* When static infos are changed

Subject: Cancel items repeatcount is not archived
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Create a PT or WT form with items that can be canceled on modify.
* Modify the form and cancel one or more of the items
* Read/Repeat the cancel items section

Expected:
* The oracle table in webora named AUTHEVENTS shows the number of times the canceled item was repeated.

Actual:
* The oracle table in webora named AUTHEVENTS shows 0 as the number of times the canceled item was repeated.

Subject: RTCP Add limits should not run all validation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If limits are added and the selection is executed
** If only a non-track was selected, the validation fails 
** If any of the extended items is already protected, the validation fails 

* If one of the two add-validations fails
** A failure dialog shows the failure text
** The limits are not added

* If the limits were added
** The Validate limits button is enabled 
** The place button is disabled

* On validate limits, if any of the limit validations fails
* The message identifies the failed limits by row number (e.g (Row 1) CTC in limits)

Subject: [NewMissed] Retransmit should not be allowed if someone else is doing a non-view operation on the current form
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
When the user clicks retransmit, the system needs to check whether another user is performing another operation on the same form and reject the retransmit operation if necessary.
This also means that during retransmission, no one else can perform any non-view operation on that form.

Show that:
* On retransmit, the following rules are ran
** Check if the form is protected by someone else
** Check all of the sanity check rules
* If the rule fails and the failure dialog is acknowledged, the user is taken back to the form.
* While a form is retransmitted, it is protected and flashing "globally"
* On retransmit, if the form was deleted by someone else, a dialog informs the RTC that the form is not active anymore and it closes after the dialog is ack'ed

Subject: Display RTCPs in authority summary
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* RTCPs show up in the authority summary
* Each limit is shown in a separate line
* Each line of an RTCP has all data (authority number etc)
* During sorting, limits belonging to the same RTCP can be split up
* All limits belonging to an RTCP are shown even if the workstation only controls one item of one limit
* All limits belonging to an RTCP are shown even if only one item of one limit is visible on the overview screens
* If one limit of an RTCP matches the filter criteria, all limits are shown (e.g. if sub a is selected and the RTCP has limits in sub a,b,c, all limits show)

Subject: Refactor clean-up transitions
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* All workflow exception handling of all forms is done by the same handler
* Delete forms in created state
* Forms in issued state or later are not removed on failure
* Protections and flashing is removed on failure
* If we are waiting for user selection on the TLD (add restriction, add limits), CIA is cleaned up
* Blocking is not removed on failure
* Forms in issued state or later are locked on failure
* An system alarm is raised on failure
* If the form was cleaned up on failure before issued, forms can be created over the same location

Subject: Change the rule failure dialog button to say "ok"
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* If any form validation fails, the form button reads "ok"
* The logging to gensum reads "Ok: " followed by the rule failures
* The title of a failure dialog reads "Failure" (consider language)

Subject: Display first 5 chars of RTCP under devices & limits
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When an RTCP is placed, the first 5 characters (SRS.831) are shown in the first addressee field  of each limit (SRS.1357)
* The RTCPs shown on the TLD (all limits)
** RTCP-Rs are shown blue, like TOPs
** RTCP-Ps are shown cyan
** RTCPs overlapping trains are shown purple
** RTCPs overlapping TOP are shown blue
** RTCP-P overlapping  RTCP-P are shown cyan
** RTCP-P overlapping RTCP-R are shown blue
** RTCP-R overlapping  RTCP-R are shown blue

Subject: Validation on "Place"
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* When the user clicks the "Place" button
** All Validate Limits failure validation is run (no query validation)
* If the validation fails
** The failure dialog is shown and the form is aborted/removed 
** The completion is logged to CDLS and GenSum
** The flashing/protection is removed

* If the validation passes
** The form is set to complete state
** The completion is logged to CDLS and GenSum
*** CDLS contains the placed at and initials box
** The flashing/protection is removed

Note: With this story, there is no "blocking" shown

Subject: Extend form validation if limits are adjacent to Rule105/STK
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
RTCPs are allowed on Rule105/STK

This includes the query handling for all other forms, if the other forms start/end adjacent to the STK.

Show that:
* If a form (TOP,XTOP,PT,WT) is adjacent to Rule105/STK (starts/ends on KP next to STK)
** If there is an RTCP (R or P) in the Rule105/STK, the validation should result in query (P) or failure (R)

Subject: Allow read / repeat via "tabbing" (keyboard)
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Once the first field on a page is clicked into during read or repeat
** The tab key can be pressed to continue/finish the read/repeat
** Holding down the tab key does not tab through all fields (key has to be release in between fields)
** Disabled/Invisible fields are skipped
* Once the last active/visible field is tabbed into, additional tabbing does nothing
* Restarting a read or repeat requires the first field to be clicked again, before tabbing is accepted

Subject: Overlap box displaying rolled up PT forms
Author: Alex Plotkin
Description:
Created PT1 form from A to D 
Rolled up to point C
Created new PT2 form from A to C
Open OS report at point B get overlap box which is listed PT2 and PT1 in gray.
OS report should not list rolled up parts of the PT limits.

Subject: Switch Report does not follow usual workflow
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Log into the system and open a trackline display
* Place a Switch Report on a switch that you control without pre-selecting an addressee

Expected:
* The form comes up with fields invalid
* The invalid fields must be filled in to enable the change language button
* If the form is valid then becomes invalid, the change language button is disabled

Actual:
* The change language button is always enabled.

Subject: [NewMissed] Setup web playback
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The oracle scripts that replicate the tables from trd, hfd (messages) and web1 into web2 run
* -There are no alarm list 2 and 3 buttons- there are no general summary and alarm list checkboxes/displays; per CN, no need for soins/soinsc, so no event messages
* All selections and forms are shown correctly in playback
* All trains show correctly
* -The solaris 10 update problems are fixed- per CN, no need for soins/soinsc
** The database time is set to UTC
** The log-in trigger is installed and sets the session timezone correctly
* Even without kedi events PBK works
* After online activation (that contains tld changes), PBK shows the new tld layout

Note:
This story should also clean up the PBK db (remove unused views etc).

Subject: Validation for XTOP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* XTOP territory type rules are identical to the TOP territory rules
* PTs, WTs, TOPs and XTOPs cannot overlap an XTOP

Subject: [NewMissed] Generate instructions for taking a particular path when there are alternative paths
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
S--1A---2A--------3A---E
    \    \        / 
     \    \      /
      \    \    /
     --1B--2B--3B--
Show that: * There is a static info on KPs that generates via instructions ** The via instruction says "via XXX Sub/Spur" * If there are multiple ways between the start limit and the end limit ** The via instruction is generated and lists the switches/crossovers that are taken reverse, combining both switches of a pair to one crossover entry, cutting of the A/B (E.g. if the authority goes from S to E over 2A,2B,3B,3A the instruction reads "via Crossover 2, Crossover 3") ** Don't combine switches if they are in different subdivisions or have different mileages ** Use the switch name or mileage of switch, just like in limits ** There is a static info on switches that disables the via instruction generation on that switch (in crossover cases both switches will have static info set) (E.g. if 3A and 3B have the info set the instruction reads "via Crossover 2") * The order of instructions is: 1. Crossovers/Switches, 2. KPs, 3.take siding * The system rejects if the instructions do not fit into the instructions field * Do not include the end switches in the via instructions. Note: Instructions are generated for crossovers and non-crossovers

Subject: [NoChangeRequest] Supply authorities to Train Record
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Authority tie into Train Record
--- Integration of REF with TR
----- Synchronizing forms with TR on ADM (in case that the ADM 
          goes down)

Show that:
* TOPs, WTs show up on the TGI as boxes
** The form box start at the KP/Switch or mile

Subject: XTOP display addition
Author: Dang Vang
Description: - New box ("This form authorizes exclusive...")

Subject: Rules & Validation
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* An RTCP cannot span CTC
* An RTCP can span STK
* An RTCP cannot span a siding
* An RTCP cannot be in OCS and CTC
* An RTCP cannot be in OCS and STK
* An RTCP can be in OCS and in siding
* An RTCP can be in CTC only
* An RTCP can be in STK only
* An RTCP can be in Siding only
* An RTCP can have up to 10 limits

* A query is displayed on "Validate Limits" when an RTCP (P or R) is overlapping any other form
* No query is displayed on Transmit/Place

* A PT cannot be placed over an RTCP-R
* A WT cannot be placed over an RTCP-R
* A query is displayed on "Validate Limits" when a PT is overlapping an RTCP-P
* A query is displayed on "Validate Limits" when a WT is overlapping an RTCP-P
* When creating a TOP over an RTCP (P or R) a query is shown (on Validate Limits only)
* When creating an X-TOP over an RTCP (P or R) a query is shown (on Validate Limits only)

* The query dialog
** shows all query conditions
** has one button: ok
** shows in the user language
* On ok
** the query dialog closes and the user is taken back to the form
** the gensum shows "OK: " followed by the query messages

* If validation results in any failure conditions
** The pop-up dialog shows only the failure conditions (no query)
** The title of the pop-up reads Failure (en and fr)
** On "ok", the user is taken back to the form
* If validation results in only query conditions
** The pop-up dialog shows only the query conditions
** The title of the pop-up reads Query (en and fr)
** On "ok", the user is taken back to the form

* query conditions, even if acknowledged, pop-up during the next Validate Limits if they still apply

Subject: Add/Remove Limits
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The Add limits button is enabled as long as there are less than 10 limits in the RTCP
* When the add limits button is pressed
** The forms status line reads "Waiting for user input" (in the correct language)
** The user can select limits on the track line display and confirm the selection with right-click
* If only one device was selected
** If the device is a track, the limits expand (like during normal limit selection) and the limits flash and are protected
** If the device is a KP/Switch, a pop-up shows up, reading "insufficient devices in selection" (or whatever the pop-up currently reads when only a KP is selected for form creation)
* If the device selection was valid, the limits are added to the form
* If new limits are added
** the Validate Limits button gets enabled (but if this story is done first, no validation needs to take place on click; otherwise the validation is ran)
** The start and end mileage can be altered if there is a valid mileage range available (like with start/end limits of other forms)
* After any form change (new limits, mileage change) the validate limits button gets enabled
* The UI state has to be valid, before new limits can be added or validate limits can be pressed

* If limits are selected in the limits-table (single select)
** the Remove Limits button gets enabled if the selected limits are not the last limits on the form
** the Remove Limits button stays disabled if the selected limits are the last limits on the form

* Once the Remove Limits button is pressed 
** the selected limits are removed from the form 
** the items on the TLD that belonged to the removed limits stop flashing and are not protected, unless they are part of other limits of the form

* When limits are added/removed the general summary reflects the user action (no gensum logging on mileage change)
* Adding/removing/modifying mileages should be reflected in the application logging
* When the RTCP is aborted, all limits of the form are logged to CDLS in addition to the existing CDLS'ed data

Subject: Shortening Limits into different controlpoint/subdivision
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* When a form is shortened via whole miles during creation
** The timezone of the form is changed if needed
** The language of the form is changed if needed
** The subdivision of the form is changed if needed
** The change language button appears/disappears if needed

Subject: Fill out form
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The form can be toggled between permissive and restrictive
* The reason is mandatory and needs to be valid (not only spaces)
* When the type changes from permissive to restrictive or vice versa
** the "Validate Limits" button gets enabled
** the "Place" button gets disabled (if it was enabled before)

Subject: [NewMissed] Show spurs on limits fields as mileages and spur name
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* B1s can be configured as subdivisions or spurs
* There are some B1s configured as spurs in the test DB
* When a B1 is configured as a spur, mileage fields should read Mile XXX Animal Spur (rather than Mile XXX Animal Sub)

Subject: Color PT addressee according to performance of the train
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* If a train has no SRS service plan data, the PT id is shown green
* If a train is 30 or more minutes early (<-30), the PT id shows blue
* If a train is 30 minutes early or up to 5 minutes late (>=-30 && <5) , the PT id shows green
* If a train is between 5 to 60 minutes late (>=5 && <60) , the PT id shows yellow
* If a train is 60 minutes or more late (>=60), the PT id shows red
* The times can be configured via a properties file and can be activated via parachgd
* Only accepted train record changes cause the delay/color change
* Consist changes do not send a 0 performance
Note:
srssim already contains option 2, which sends the train summary message.
This message contains the performance and lateness. 

Consist changes should not even send a train performance message.

Subject: Initiate XTOP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* There is an XTOP button on the TLD
* As part of the XTOP limit selection an addressee can be selected
* If the addressee was selected as part of the limit selection, it cannot be modified
* The XTOP form looks identical to the TOP form, except
** The title reads XTOP
** Box 6 is shown, containing one non-editable text field reading "THIS AUTHORITY AUTHORIZES EXCLUSIVE OCCUPANCY" (CETTE AUTORISATION EST UN POV EXCLUSIF)
** Printing, Viewing, Gensum, Authority summary, CDLS, App logging, Archive, Dialogs (Selection dialogs etc) show XTOP
** Printing, Viewing, CDLS, App logging, read/reap, archive include Box 6

After the fact:
* This story also includes being able to view, modify, cancel, retransmit, and supercede an XTOP
* Also includes being able to select an XTOP for add limits on WT and PT forms as well as selecting an addressee to create a TOP or an XTOP

Subject: Remove rule run on "Done"
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* No rules are ran after the "Transmit validation" with the exception of the "continue" rules that are run when the form is to be continued.

Note:
Rules are currently ran on Transmit and on Done. Rule runes on done should be removed.

This story should fix the rules (drools rules checkPtCreateFailed and checkWtCreateFailed) that checks that reverse switches have a warning.
Currently it also checks that the permission is false, which should be removed after the rule runs on complete were removed.

Subject: Copy Train from Authority to a parking spot
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* The move button can be used to copy a train from a PT id field or a WT id field into a parking spot
* If the train is copied and it is currently in a different parking spot, it is removed from the old parking spot first
* The train stays in the PT/WT id field
* If there are no trains a popup dialog shows error to user
* If a addressee/PT stack has more than one form
** If there are many forms and at least one is a train a selection dialog pops up allowing the user to select a train
** Only trains are shown in the selection dialog

Subject: Superceded form is not protected
Author: Will Martin
Description:
When superceding a form, the original form limits may not be protected. We are currently only protecting the limits of the proposed form on the supercede action. We must also protect the old form or superseded form limits. 
-A- --- -B- --- -C- --- -D-
Setup: * Place a Top, Wt or Pt from A to C and complete it. * Supercede the first Top, Wt or Pt from B to D Expected: * All limits from A to D are protected Actual: * Only the limits from B to D are protected

Subject: Switch Report Reporting field is editable after Transmit, also after Reading of the field.
Author: Gilberto Lomeli
Description:
steps
1. open a Switch Report form (switch is selected without selecting an ID)
2. Enter a Reporter to the Reporting Field
3. Press the Transmit button.
4. Edit the Reporting field
Actual Result: The field is editable.
Expected Result: The field is not editable.
5. Read the fields until the <Yes> button becomes enabled.
6. Edit the Reporting field
Actual Result: The field is editable.
Expected Result: The field is not editable.

Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description: * The form summary display is currently a Dialog with all logic contained in the view. This should be changed to Model View Presenter to fit with most of our other dialogs.

Subject: Whole Mile
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* Once a limit is in the limit-table
** The start and end limits can be change to whole miles (just like for any other form)
** The status line shows the valid mileage range (just like on other forms)
** Invalid or empty fields are shown with a red background (just like other start/end limits)
** Once the UI is valid after modification, the Validate Limits button is enabled (but clicking on it does not do anything)
** If an empty field loses focus, the last valid value (from the server) is restored
** If an invalid field loses focus, it stays invalid and keeps the invalid data

Subject: Refactor hiding of fields on forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* The current way we make text fields on REF forms go away when they are empty is a hack and inconsistent with the way we hide and show boxes if we determine no data is present on the box. This should be cleaned up and done in a cleaner way.

* Including correct whitespace trimming

Subject: Initiate RTCP
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Show that:
* There is one RTCP button on the TLD toolbar
* After the button was pressed, limits can be selected (just like for any other form)
* After limits were selected, the action can be executed via a right-click 
* On execute 
** the limits expand to the next surrounding KPs/Switches (if KPs were not already selected) and are protected
** the RTCP form opens (see mockup)
* When the form opens
** The authority number is filled
** The permissive radio button is selected (default)
** The selected limits are visible in the limits-table
** The reason text is empty
** The supersede box, the placed at box and the removed box are not visible
* There are the following buttons (on the bottom) disabled
** Validate Limits 
** Add Limits
** Remove Limts 
** Place
* The following button is enabled
** Abort
* Add GenSum logging for the cases create and abort
* Add CDLS logging for the case aborted
* On abort
** The form goes away
** The selection and protection goes away

h3. Example from mockup below:
!rtcp.png!

Subject: Replicate OS report to TrainGraph DB table
Author: Dang Vang
Description:
Scope:
* Rollup
* Fulfill
* OS Report comments

OS Reports should be written into whatever OS Graph/Train Graph is using for depicting points on the train graph. Note this may require data model changes... (OS locations are specific to a PT).

Show that:
* Every OS report coming from REF shows up in the OS location table of the train record
* Every OS location change shows as a dot on the TGI
* Every PT or WT for the train shows in the Authority section of the train record
* Location changes that are triggered not by OS reports (creations, moving out of parking spots, between parking spots) show up in the location table (upper table of train record), NOT in OS location table
* When a PT is fulfilled, a dot is drawn at the end location of that PT
* All dots belonging to the PT (Start, OS location changes, Fulfill) are connected
* Comments from the OS report are applied to the train record of the PTs addressee
* Dots of multiple PTs for the same train are not connected
* Times show up in the field time of the control point
NOTE: per Peter, it is OK for the top section of the train record form to show the Last RTC Update time in the time of the box that the RTC added the PT form; the middle section of the form which includes the OS report times are in the field time of the OS location

Subject: [Missed] Play alarm sounds on workstation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Gong & Ton events need to be forwarded to the workstation and played on the workstation

Show that:
* When an alarm event occurs, the alarm sound associated with that alarm level (OCS only level 1) plays on the workstation that controls the affected device
* The application rmtom is not running (and removed from the system)
* Messages that were sent to rmtom are not forwarded to rmtom but to our java apps (WFA)


After the fact:

Silence functionality

* When the silence button is pressed on the BSD the gong stops on the workstation that pressed the button
* A silenced alarm will start playing again when:
** The event that triggered the alarm re-occurs
** The RTC logs out and logs back in again
** The RTC uses change RTC to log in as a different user
** The RTC takes or loses territory but still controls the territory that the alarm pertains to

Territory Conditions

* When territory is gained that currently has an alarm playing the gong starts playing on the work station.
* When territory is lost that currently has an alarm playing the gong stops playing on the work station.

Log on Log off conditions:
* If there is a gong playing in territory that you control
** When the work station front end dies, the gong stops playing
** When the work station front end starts up again and re-connects, the gong sound starts playing again
** When the work station logs out, the gong stops playing
** When the work station logs on, the gong starts playing again.

Subject: [Missed] Provide a way to prevent RTCs to start form operations
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
In CTC, form operations check the TTR locks before allowing to initiate a new form operation.
In OCS the java apps rely on messages. 
There is also a tool called "easy" that helps locking.

Show that:
* There is a script that allows sending a message to Java to disallow new form operations from being initiated
* The tool easy uses the same message to disallow new form operations to be initiated
* The script and the tool both also support to re-allow form operations (don't add any new buttons to easy)
* -Disallowing and allowing can be done for a specific XId or for all XId (at least in the script; easy should not be extended)-
* Additionally to the message to java, the script and the tool should also write into the lock relation
* The lock used is different from the ttr lock and ttrx lock (use lock MESSAGE_LOCK_AuthNotReady)
* There is a rule in the generic create drools file that checks that lock on create

Subject: Add clean-up transitions and handling to forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
* On exceptions, use "abort" transition
* If an exception is thrown in an action handler in a workflow the workflow should bail out using the abort pathways appropriate for the failed workflow node for example if protection has already been laid down, the protection should be picked back up. If the limits are flashing they should be un-flashed. If the form is in issued state, the form should go away. If the complete time has been read out, the form should stay and allow the user to continue it from the FSD.
* Add guidance on exception handling for future workflow edits to the wiki.

Subject: Add Unlock functionality for locked forms
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:

* There is a "Activate" button on the form
** The activate button is only visible for user classes that are allowed to activate a locked form
** The activate button is disabled when the form is not locked
** The buttons tool tip reads "Activate locked form"
* Only Chiefs, Technicians and Admins can activate forms
* The user has to view the form before he can activate a locked form
* When the Activate button is clicked
** The locked form unlocks and closes
** The general summary shows which user unlocked which form
* When a locked form gets activated (unlocked), the unlocked state gets persisted

Current:

Note: the text fields/panes are normal JTextPanes, which have no border by default. The ValidatingJTextPane (or a child) should be used instead.

Subject: OS Report allows addressee selection then execute
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* Place a TOP or PT form on the trackline and complete it so the addressee shows up.
* Click on the OS report button
* Select the addressee of form (do not select a topology item)
* Execute

Expected:
* CIA does not accept the selection as valid/complete and will not forward the execution to REF

Actual:
* CIA sees the execution as valid/complete and forwards the incomplete selection to REF. Do not pass GO do not collect 200 dollars go straight to the REF logs to see your new stack trace.

NOTE:
This may be a CIAACT thing or a CIA code thing. not sure where this knowledge is.

Subject: Entries in fields should character wrap
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:

Current result:
- The new letters are not shown on the screen

Notes:
1. The box is currently growing, which it should NOT
2. Both, the wrapping and not growing should apply to all input boxes.

Subject: Lose data from Mnesia when start the old SB as PC
Author: Sean Breid
Description:

* Create an authority. Let's call it Auth1
* Shutdown COM2 (SB Comm)
* Create another authority. Lets call it Auth2
* Shutdown COM1 (PC Comm)
* Run COM2 up as PC Comm

Actual:
* Only Auth1 is displayed on the trackline and is in the form summary

Subject: [HOLD][NewMissed] Add scripts to disconnect and re-connect mnesia nodes
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Mnesia nodes can be disconnected per script
* Mnesia nodes can be reconnected per script
* There is a wiki entry with a how-to

Note:
* The scenario to be covered with this story is:
** Export the heap
** Shut down the SB
** Disconnect the SB
** Clear mneasia on the SB (should not clear the PC mnesia)
** Import the exported data on the SB
** Run up the SB
** Fail over
** The new PC has the previously reimported data
** Shut down the new SB
** Clear mneasia on the new SB
** Reconnect the nodes
** Run up the new SB
** Fail over
** The new PC has all forms etc.

Subject: Investigate what changes are possible to upgrade the system using failover
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show that:

* There is a wiki page that describes what kinds of changes are possible using fail over only vs what kinds of changes need a cold startup:

* Check for example:
** Add a field to a form
** Remove a field from a form
** Change a field on a form
** Beans
** Messages
** Workflows
** Rules/Adapters
** C structure involving C2J Mapping

Subject: Clean up Missing parameters
Author: Will Martin
Description:
There are a few missing properties in the properties files that are used for parachgd. At the end of this bug there should be no missing parameters. There are a lot of todos in our code that say we do not use parameters. It would be nice if these parameters could be deleted from the system completely.

* Clean up the unused parameters
* Add all missing parameters

Setup:
* Do a parachgd jmsgate on a running system
* If this bug is done before #11004 look at the console log
* If this bug is done after #11004 look at the general summary or system summary.

Expected:
* There is no indication that log codes are missing or unknown.

Actual:
* The console log spits out apro errors that the system is trying to log out missing parameters and unknown parameters.
* After bug #11004, the system will gensum or system sum that parameters are unknown or missing.

Subject: Requirements
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Unclear Requirements


h2. Needs Elaboration

|_.Number|_.Text|_.Status|
|SRS.641 | The system shall provide the same interface to NLS as in RTC2.CTC.||
|SRS.643 | The system shall provide the existing RTC2 Warning Information System functionality.||
|SRS.644 | The system shall interface with the Warning Information System through NLS.||
|SRS.645 | The system shall store Warning Information in the ODB.||
|SRS.646 | The system shall display icons on the Track Line display to represent warning conditions for HotBox and WILD.||
|SRS.647 | The system shall log Warning Information System status.||
|SRS.648 | The system shall reset Track Line icon displays and warning conditions once the condition is normalled.||


h2. Problem Req.

|_.Number|_.Text|_.Problem|_.Status|
|SRS.702 | System Security | needs to be changed once you guys figure out what scripts are usable/applicable||
|SRS.691 | The system shall allow for workstations to be monitored via coma or SNMP. | Should reflect what the system actually does using COMA and the functionalities that we have provided in COMA||
|SRS.1392 | The system shall protect all items in the form during any form operation other than view.| This has many use cases||
|SRS.1241 | The system shall not display the zeros after the decimal point, if a field contains a mileage ending with .00 | Should be linked to QL entries 126, 279, 446||
| SRS.6  | The system shall display the trian graph in the local time of the control points assigned timezone| Duplicated by SRS.716 ||
|SRS.1412 | The system shall not add text "Via 'Subdivision' Sub" to the instructions field when only the proposed end limit item is a specially marked known point. | Can this be cleaned up so it makes some sense? ||
|SRS.1318|The system shall change the language of the form if the limits are shortened in a way that the previously selected language is not valid anymore.| This completely contradicts how RTCP forms are suppose to work|Must Re-word to exclude RTCP|
|QL233 | This ql entry states that Siemens is implementing new edit train and new train dialogs | Do we ever state that we are backing out of this part of the upgrade? ||
|SRS.850|The system shall provide the capability to pick a known point from the Track Line as part of the selection when requesting an OS Report.| This requirement mentions known points but not switches. There are specific requirements for the topology element known point. We should never talk about the conceptual known point ie known points and switches. We should always specify both switches and known points.||
|SRS.574|The system shall consider an OS mileage or location at or beyond the To limit of a PT authority to be valid to fulfill that PT authority.|What does beyond mean?| |

h2. Outstanding Issues

What other performance requirements do we have?
* Number of forms in an hour (peak throughput)
* Average number of forms in the system (constant load)
* Number of trains per hour (peak throughput)
* Number of trains in the system (constant load)

* Do we have any requirements that dictate that a form cannot be shorted passed a "block" or passed a known point or switch?

* The requirements regarding copy train and move train are all actually talking about move train. This is confusing to both CN and Siemens
* The requirements regarding All Auth and View All are all actually talking about the All Auth button on the Authority Summary
* We should make a distinction in our requirements between blocking items, protecting items, and locking items. It may make sense to just never say "protection" seeing as this means 2 different things to development and customer.

Subject: [HOLD] Initsos can be aborted and the system says it is PC complete
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Setup:
* On a running system
* Run INITSOS on a system
* Abort the initsos by pressing ctrl C

Expected:
* The logs and terminal show the INITSOS was not executed correctly returning an exit code of 3
* When ssa is used to check the state of the system the system shows it is down

Actual:
* The logs and terminal show the INITSOS was not executed correctly returning an exit code of 3
* When ssa is used to check the state of the system the system shows it is PC complete

Subject: Incorporate validation steps that are in csbridge into oracle validation step
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* When topology connections are connected incorrectly and the process image loader would throw exceptions when reading these relations
** SDM tells you if the job fails
** On or before the validate step of data activation errors are caught and writes the errors into the messages/reports locations
* The data import step of IDDUG files verifies that neighboring items are properly connected to each item that has it as a neighbor
** Tracks and known points have no more than one left and one right connection
** Switches have no more than one normal, one reverse, one tongue connection.
** Each connection has one corresponding back connection.

NOTE:
* Should walk through all loaders and include validations for all explicit exception throwing errors


We are considering this authored for now until an investigation is held to determine what validation steps we want to include.

Subject: Parking spot editor
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* The parking spot editor has two new fields per entry.
* The new fields -are drop downs.- +are editable, but can be pre-populated using a popup+
* The new fields allow the user to pick any of the B1Names on the system
* The new fields only show actual subDiv (block type) b1 names
* When a B1Name is selected and the user commits the changes to the database the change is reflected on the parking spots table in trd1
** The correct B1 is written into the table

Description:

* When webarch removes a file on the ADM it does not come back to life.

NOTE:

* When the system is installed after init_spectrum both the COMS and ADMs have a real /home/web folder.
* When the system is running these folders are all synchronized by peso.

Subject: Port JWDog over to mmi
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Port JWDog over to the mmi this will require:
* A separate config file for jwdog to only monitor the active MQ process.
* JWDog to be one of the mandatory processes running on the MMI

Show That:
* JWDOG starts and loads the MMI config file
* JWDOG starts on the same run phase as it would on the COMs
* The MMI will restart if ActiveMQ did not start (The machine will not go PC complete without activeMQ)
* JWDOG sends life signs to mcs without OCS.US running on the MMI
* When ActiveMQ is killed on the MMI the MMI goes down.
* JWDOG is in the updasos config file so it gets pushed to the MMI

Subject: [New Missed] Remove Messages from Train Record Buffer
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* When a message is in the train record buffer that causes an exception in CSBridge
* The system will not fail over
* The message is removed from TM's or REF's buffer (whoever send the message)
* informative ERROR level logging indicates the message was bad and thrown away as well as the stack trace.

NOTE:
We believe this is just a try catch around the message handling to send the ack to REF/TM and re-throw the exception.

Subject: [Change Requests] Tracklines on working screens should not lock
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Question Log Entry BM:

*Question:*
1/6/2016
Currently the track lines on the working screens cannot be minimized, moved, closed, panned, etc. when a form is opened. This was done to fulfill the requirement SRS. 923. This makes it so if a track line is brought to the front things can get stuck behind the track line. The only way to get things from behind the track line back to the front is alt tab if the user knows that something has been pushed to the background. Is this what we want?

1/25/2016
Can we also allow re-transmit from the working screens so we can allow all functionalities from the form view from the working screens and disallow all other form operations?

2/3/2016
1) When we say we should not restrict track lines on working screens, to us this means the user can open, close, move, minimize, resize, replace these track lines. 

2) How should track lines opened using the BSD on overview screens behave?

*Answer:*
1/6/2016
No, Track lines on the working screens should not lock. Track lines on the working screens should also not allow any form operations other than view and unlock.

1/27/2016
We should not restrict operations on the working screen track lines. 

Only track lines on the overview screens should lock

2/3/2016
1) This is correct

2) If the track line is brought up using the quick callup as an overview screen, the track line is locked. If the track line is brought up using the BSD OCS button on the BSD we should not lock it, even if a form is opened. This includes track lines that are opened from the BSD on working screens as well as track lines that are brought up on overview screens using the OCS button on the BSD

*Show That:*
* When a form is opened/operated on, all overview track lines are locked
* When a form is opened/operated on, all non overview track lines are not locked
