Subject: Log files do not distingush between Form ID and Form Number.
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Currently it is very confusing to look at our log files. They show form number and form id, however, they do not distinguish between the two.

Show That:

* log files should always show form number and explicitly state "form number="
** Applies to all form objects, overlap objects, restrictions
* Add logging around restriction building
* Where applicable log workflow id, client id, addressee
* When an application rejects a data activation the failures should be of log level ERROR. 

NOTE:
This is a time boxed story. The data activation logging must be done, however, do as much cleanup as possible in the time given.

Subject: [Change Request] Make all proceed train ids 6 characters
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* All proceed train ids will support 6 chars on the display. 
* These 6 chars will include 5 chars of tracking id as well as the direction of the proceed train form. 
* This will *NOT* apply to parking spots or ATDs (display stacks underneath the track line)

Subject: [Change Request] REF Validation Errors
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:

If a device is selected that has a single form and the form is invalid:

    * A validation message appears describing what validation failed

If a device is selected that has multiple forms and some of the forms are invalid:

    * A dialog comes up allowing you to select a form, the invalid forms are grayed out.
    * The grayed out forms are selectable.
    * If an invalid form is selected, the OK button enables allowing the user to click on the button. When the button is clicked a validation popup comes up describing what is wrong

    * If a valid form is selected, the OK button enables allowing the user to continue the operation on the selected form.

If a device is selected that has multiple forms and all of them are invalid:

    * No form selection dialog appears
    * One dialog shows all validation messages for all forms
    * All validation messages are pre-pended with the form number that the validation message pertains to

All validation messages go to the general summary when the user acknowledges them.

Subject: Move Form Summary Operation Validation to REF Client
Author: Sean Breid
Description:

* When a form summary item is selected the form summary operation, rules are run and update the form summary buttons.
* When a form is stored for a form that is currently selected on the form summary, rules are run and update the form summary buttons.
* -When a form is stored and it overlaps a form that is currently selected on the form summary, rules are run and update the form summary buttons.-
* The rules are not run in any other cases

Subject: [NewMissed] Support Canadian Multilingual Standard (CMS) keyboard map on workstation
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* The CMS keyboard map is supported on the workstation

From email (RTC2 CTC):
The CMS layout is not supported by Sun Microsystems and as such, no matching keymap table is available from the OEM for Solaris 8. The CMS layout is depicted [in the attachment].

In order to make all characters from the CMS keyboard available in the RTC2 system, a standard keymap table was modified and renamed; thus creating a new (custom) keymap table for CN to use with the CMS keyboards. The new keymap table has been named as follows: US6CanFrCMS.kt.Z
 
Naming convention:
US6 -> Original file based on US6 standard (Standard en_US mapping table for USB)
CanFr -> Canadian French (supported language/characters)
CMS -> Canadian Multilingual Standard (keyboard layout)
.kt.Z -> .kt (standard extension for keymap tables), .Z (compressed)
 
Installation procedure:
On the MMI:
1. Uncompress the tar file.
2. cdm, STOPSOS
3. Extract tar file on to: /usr/openwin/share/etc/keytables/
4. Log in as root (su)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The strategy outlined above was not taken because the CN_OCS system is using redhat/linux
workstations(no BSD displays direct from the MMI); support for the Canadian Multilingual keyboard is included with the linux installs.

The situation is further complicated by story #11526, for which the current solution - to stop the number-lock from interfering with oracle field tabbing - involves disabling the number lock key; to do that we provide a custom keymapping that is run in by openbox autostart at login time - based on whether the workstation is setup as a french or english workstation (looks first on the value of SPECLANG(not normally set on non-spectrum workstations, and then on the value of environment variable LANG)

for more information, see:
https://redmine/projects/cn-rtc2-ocs/wiki/Workstation_Keyboard

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Clean up workstation install spacificly the firewall and package requrements we need
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Workstation WS02CN has been updated many times with little changes and tweaks to get it to work correctly. These changes have not been incorporated into the workstation installation.

Show That:
* The packages that are on ws02cn that are needed for the functionality of the workstation are incorporated into the workstation installation.
** This includes things like rdist for niss and other non-core functionalities

* The firewall exceptions that are setup on ws02cn are setup during the installation
** This includes all firewall exceptions needed for rdist, coma, logging in remotely ect.

Subject: Web boxes should be put on the nightly build
Author: Will Martin
Description:
Show That:
* There is a job in jenkins to build web1ocs and web2ocs every night.
* This job actually runs correctly with the nightly build
* All oracle tables are cleared
** This means new sids we have encountered like web2 are cleared every night just like the web1 sid.
** This applies to all machines that these sids exist on.

* After the nightly build changes to web1 are reflected on web2.

Subject: [NewMissed] Allow workstations to be monitored via coma or SNMP
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Show that:
* Workstations can be monitored/controlled from coma
** Workstations can be remotely disconnected
** Workstations can be remotely connected (to an MMI)
** Workstations can be remotely rebooted
** Workstations can be monitored(Show connected workstations and to what mmi it is connected to)
*** Look at sb message broadcasted by acop for this.

NOTE:
This will require the workstations to be bound to a spectrum system. Using the host file for this is fine. The workstation will show up in coma and SPV if the workstation is in the host file with a CID, XID, and on the same domain as the spectrum machine. Special handling will need to be added to show the workstations status correctly as well as to give commands to the work station to control it.

Subject: Form view changes form jumps to upper left corner
Author: Sean Breid
Description:
Steps:

* Create PT with switch warnings and permissions
* Open it for view
* Repeatedly page up and down

Expected:

* The form always snaps to underneath the BSD

Actual:
 
* Once in a while the form jumps to the upper-right-hand corner

Subject: [NewMissed] Determine appropiate DB sizing for relations
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Determine and change. Don't reduce. This is Spectrum and Oracle.

Based on CNs expected spectrum DB.

Show that:
* Relations are sized in a way that there is a 50% buffer (meaning that the CNOCS DB only uses around 75%)
* Same applies to Oracle tables (if they are setup to have record restrictions)

Must find out how big the oracle tables should be, or should we just let them grow to the size of the disk.

Must find out how big the new relations should be

Is there a requirement here?

Subject: OS report on PTs in and out of siding causes exception
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
The problem happens when two PTs for the same train are created, one leading into a siding, one leading out of the same siding. This bug covers multiple problems: * There should not be a selection dialog when Os'ing the switch leading out of the siding showing the PT leading into the siding (steps 1-3) * The PT leading into the siding should be a fulfill candidate, not a track-release candidate (step 4) * There should not be a PT if all items were roll-ed up (steps 5 - 7) *Steps:* * 1. Create a PT (1) for train A from OCST KENN SW1 SWI to OCST LAUR SIDING TRA * 2. Create a PT (2) for train A From OCST LAUR SIDING TRA to OCST MABE STDN KnownPnt * 3. Create an OS report on OCST LAUR ESW SWI *Expected:* * A OS report is created for PT 2 *Actual:* * A selection dialog opens, showing PT 1 greyed out and PT 2 as valid *Steps:* * 4. Select PT 2 and continue the OS report *Expected:* * In the roll-up dialog, PT 1 shows as a fulfill candidate and PT 2 shows as a roll-up candidate *Actual:* * Both PT 1 and PT 2 show as roll-up candidates *Steps:* * 5. Complete the OS report *Expected:* * The train id in the siding disappears *Actual:* * The train id in the siding stays *Steps:* * 6. Initiate a PT from OCST GEOR STN KnownPnt to OCST HARR SIDING TRA * 7. Click the validate limits button *Expected:* * The PT is validated correctly *Actual:* * The form closes and an exception is thrown

Subject: General Summary Logging From Workflow
Author: Will Martin
Description: All query dialogs should say Yes/No or Abort. However, what is general summary logged does not match this. All dialogs should be logged based on what the text of the pressed button actually was.

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Don't allow forms to be created for trains that have SRS changes pending
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Don?t allow forms for trains to be created for trains that 
   have SRS changes pending 
- Does not apply to supersede

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Validate train id for train authorities
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Check and ensure that initials + numbers of lead engine 
   are filled in on train record otherwise reject authority 
   creation
(train must have valid initials and numbers to be valid for train authorities)

Subject: Enforce specific monitor usage
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Import Authority and Train data
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Provide Import of authority and train data from ASCII file
-- Script can be run when the system is stop-sosed
-- Overrides persisted forms and trains in Mnesia so that the system can 
     start with imported forms and trains

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Maintain FSD User Preferences
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Prerequisite: #10111

- Maintain User Preferences in Authority Summary for 
   Sorting based on User 
- Moves with User to other Workstations
- Preference to survive User log out too

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Maintain FSD User Preferences for single session
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Maintain User Preferences in Authority Summary for 
   Sorting during a single user session
--- If user logs out, the sorting preference is reset

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Export Authority and Train data
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Provide Export of authority data and train data to an ASCII file
-- Script that exports the persisted forms and trains into files
-- Existing files in export folder are removed before export
-- Script can be run periodically (CN to set up cron etc).

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Setup application logging
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Five categories will be setup.  They are Error, Warn, Info, 
   Debug, and Trace.
- Error, Warn, and Info will be visible to CN.  Debug and Trace 
   will be mainly used by Siemens.
- What will go into each category was established in the 
    work

Subject: Workstation Status
Author: Dang Vang
Description: #NAME?

Subject: Provide Linux installation package
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: Check for OCS clearance present before allowing CTC request into OCS territory.
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: [ChangeRequest] Add form comparison tool (PC and SB)
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
- Provide comparison utility for authorities data between 
   two COM servers for Forms Container and Forms 
   Persistency Container. 
- Will provide script.  CN to setup periodic cron.
- Ability to run manually.  
- Allow for comparisons upto three

Subject: Extend CTC-OCS interface to exchange train ID field information.
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: Check signal block present before requesting Signal from CTC system.
Author: Dang Vang
Description: v2: CTC rules are check in the CTC system, but the blocked status should already be checked in the OCS system before sending request to CTC.

Subject: Integrate Spectrum environment via Xserver on Linux
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: Audio on Workstation
Author: Dang Vang

Subject: [ChangeRequest] REF PI info output
Author: Peter Zwolinski
Description:
Utility
- inspect info states of REF  
- Provide script that will output the current state of a 
   specified TA in REF
